Meta_title: CBI arrests ASI for taking Rs 25,000 bribe at Manimajra police station
Meta_desc: CHANDIGARH: The CBI on Wednesday arrested assistant sub-inspector (ASI) Balkar Singh for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 25,000 from an accused in an...
Title: Manimajra: Cbi Arrests Asi For Taking ₹25k Bribe At Manimajra Police Stn
Article: CHANDIGARH: The CBI on Wednesday arrested assistant sub-inspector (ASI) Balkar Singh for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 25,000 from an accused in an abetment to suicide case at the Manimajra police stationGurpreet Singh , a resident of Manimajra, alleged the ASI was demanding a bribe of Rs 50,000 to clear his name from the case in which he was arrested in December last year. He was currently out on bail.The ASI called him with Rs 25,000. Gurpreet filed a complaint with the CBI. A trap was laid near the police station. As the accused accepted the bribe amount, CBI sleuths nabbed him.The Manimajra police had booked Gurpreet Singh around 11 months after a woman, Preet of Darshani Bagh, Manimajra, allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself from a ceiling fan in Manimajra on January 21, 2022. Police had recovered a suicide note in which the woman had alleged Gurpreet Singh was in a relationship with her despite being married. When she came to know about his marital status, he allegedly refused to accept her.Police had sent the suicide note to CFSL for matching the handwriting of the victim. After receiving the report and taking legal opinion, police had registered a case under Section 306 (abetment to suicide) of the IPC against Gurpreet.
Summary:
He was currently out on bail.The ASI called him with Rs 25,000.
Gurpreet filed a complaint with the CBI.
As the accused accepted the bribe amount, CBI sleuths nabbed him.The Manimajra police had booked Gurpreet Singh around 11 months after a woman, Preet of Darshani Bagh, Manimajra, allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself from a ceiling fan in Manimajra on January 21, 2022.
Police had recovered a suicide note in which the woman had alleged Gurpreet Singh was in a relationship with her despite being married.
After receiving the report and taking legal opinion, police had registered a case under Section 306 (abetment to suicide) of the IPC against Gurpreet.

Meta_title: Zelenskyy: Ukraine intercepted plans to destroy Moldova
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Moldova: Zelenskyy: Ukraine intercepted plans to destroy Moldova
Article: BRUSSELS: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday that his country has intercepted plans by Russian secret services to destroy Moldova . Speaking to European Union leaders in Brussels, Zelenskyy said he recently told Moldovan President Maia Sandu about the alleged scheme."I have informed her that we have intercepted the plan of the destruction of Moldova by the Russian intelligence," Zelenskyy said through a translator.Zelenskyy said the documents showed "who, when and how" the plan would "break the democracy of Moldova and establish control over Moldova."Zelenskyy said the plan was very similar to the one devised by Russia to take over Ukraine. He added that he did not know whether Moscow ultimately ordered the plan to be carried out.Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov charged last week that the West was considering turning Moldova into "another Ukraine."He alleged that the West backed the 2020 election of the pro-Western Sandu, claiming that she is eager to take the country into NATO, merge Moldova with Romania and "practically is ready for anything."In December, Moldova's national intelligence agency warned that Russia could launch a new offensive this year with the aim of creating a land corridor through southern Ukraine to Moldova's Moscow-backed breakaway region of Transnistria.Transnistria broke away after a 1992 civil war but is not recognized by most countries.It extends roughly 400 kilometers (250 miles) from the eastern bank of the Dniester River to the country's border with Ukraine. Russia has about 1,500 troops nominally as "peacekeepers" in the breakaway region.
Summary:
BRUSSELS: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday that his country has intercepted plans by Russian secret services to destroy Moldova .
Speaking to European Union leaders in Brussels, Zelenskyy said he recently told Moldovan President Maia Sandu about the alleged scheme.
"I have informed her that we have intercepted the plan of the destruction of Moldova by the Russian intelligence," Zelenskyy said through a translator.Zelenskyy said the documents showed "who, when and how" the plan would "break the democracy of Moldova and establish control over Moldova.
"Zelenskyy said the plan was very similar to the one devised by Russia to take over Ukraine.
He added that he did not know whether Moscow ultimately ordered the plan to be carried out.Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov charged last week that the West was considering turning Moldova into "another Ukraine.

Meta_title: Presidency University students plan fundraiser concert for Moheen's Bapi-da in Kolkata
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Moheen: Presidency University students plan fundraiser concert for Moheen's Bapi-da in Kolkata
Article: KOLKATA: Students of Presidency University have decided to organise a fundraiser concert to help Bapi-da, co-founder of Moheener Ghoraguli, who is undergoing treatment for lung cancer at SSKM Hospital. The concert scheduled on February 18 at the Presidency greens will have performances by Anindya Chattopadhyay, Upal Sengupta , Rupankar Bagchi , Sidhu, Borno Anonyo, Moheen Ekhon O Bondhura , and others.Tapas Das , also known as Bapi-da, is one of the last surviving members of Bengal's first band Moheener Ghoraguli, formed in 1975 by Gautam Chattopadhyay. Barishan Ray, a UG student of English, said Bapi-da has performed with his new band Moheen Ekhon O Bondhura several times on Presidency campus. The last show was in 2022.Anwesha Dey, another UG English student, said, "We have grown up hearing songs of Moheen, so listening to him was an emotional experience. It was heartbreaking to know he is suffering from cancer."While UG economic student Atri Deb Chowdhury felt that songs of Moheener Ghoraguli are an inseparable part of Presidency life, UG history student Apalak Bhattacharya said the concert will celebrate Bapi-da and Moheener Ghoraguli. "We hope people who have grown up hearing their songs will donate for Bapi-da," said Bhattacharya.Das's wife Sutapa Ghosh , also the manager of Mohin Ekhon O Bondhura, is touched by the love from students. "We have no problem taking help from the students," she said. She is also thankful to the state for bearing the expenses of Das's treatment. TOI tried to contact dean of students Arun Maiti, but he did not respond.
Summary:
KOLKATA: Students of Presidency University have decided to organise a fundraiser concert to help Bapi-da, co-founder of Moheener Ghoraguli, who is undergoing treatment for lung cancer at SSKM Hospital.
Barishan Ray, a UG student of English, said Bapi-da has performed with his new band Moheen Ekhon O Bondhura several times on Presidency campus.
The last show was in 2022.Anwesha Dey, another UG English student, said, "We have grown up hearing songs of Moheen, so listening to him was an emotional experience.
"While UG economic student Atri Deb Chowdhury felt that songs of Moheener Ghoraguli are an inseparable part of Presidency life, UG history student Apalak Bhattacharya said the concert will celebrate Bapi-da and Moheener Ghoraguli.
TOI tried to contact dean of students Arun Maiti, but he did not respond.

Meta_title: Indian enters Pakistan to complete his journey on foot to Saudi Arabia for Hajj
Meta_desc: ... who had filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court on behalf of Shihab, and Bhagat Singh Memorial Foundation Pakistan chairman Imtiaz Rashid Qureshi.
Title: Hajj: Indian enters Pakistan to complete his journey on foot to Saudi Arabia for Hajj
Article: LAHORE: An Indian national, who was earlier denied a visa by a Pakistani court, entered the country on Tuesday to complete his marathon journey on foot to Saudi Arabia to perform Hajj .Shihab Bhai , 29, arrived in Pakistan via the Wagah border and was welcomed by Sarwar Taj , who had filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court on behalf of Shihab, and Bhagat Singh Memorial Foundation Pakistan chairman Imtiaz Rashid Qureshi .Qureshi told PTI that Shihab was very happy to get the visa to continue his journey to Mecca."He has brought a message of love, friendship and brotherhood," Qureshi said, adding he wanted to organise an event in Shihab's honour on the premises of Lahore High Court but could not do so because of security issues.Shihab, who hails from Kerala, embarked on a 3,000-km journey on foot in October last year from his home state to the Wagah border where he was stopped by Pakistan's immigration authorities as he did not have a visa."Shihab pleaded before the immigration authorities that he was going to perform Hajj on foot and had already travelled 3,000 kms and should be allowed to enter the country on humanitarian grounds. He wanted a transit visa to reach Saudi Arabia via Iran," a Federal Investigation Agency official had said.Hajj is an annual Islamic pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, considered the holiest city for Muslims.Taj, a resident of Lahore, filed a petition in the Lahore High Court (LHC) requesting that Shihab be granted a transit visa to allow him to travel to Saudi Arabia.He argued that just like the Pakistan government issues visas to Sikh pilgrims from India to take part in the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak and on other occasions, it should also grant a visa to Shihab.The LHC dismissed his petition, observing that the "petitioner was not related to the Indian citizen, nor did he hold his power of attorney to approach the court."Taj later challenged the decision in the Supreme Court of Pakistan.
Summary:
LAHORE: An Indian national, who was earlier denied a visa by a Pakistani court, entered the country on Tuesday to complete his marathon journey on foot to Saudi Arabia to perform Hajj .Shihab Bhai , 29, arrived in Pakistan via the Wagah border and was welcomed by Sarwar Taj , who had filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court on behalf of Shihab, and Bhagat Singh Memorial Foundation Pakistan chairman Imtiaz Rashid Qureshi .Qureshi told PTI that Shihab was very happy to get the visa to continue his journey to Mecca.
"He has brought a message of love, friendship and brotherhood," Qureshi said, adding he wanted to organise an event in Shihab's honour on the premises of Lahore High Court but could not do so because of security issues.Shihab, who hails from Kerala, embarked on a 3,000-km journey on foot in October last year from his home state to the Wagah border where he was stopped by Pakistan's immigration authorities as he did not have a visa.
"Shihab pleaded before the immigration authorities that he was going to perform Hajj on foot and had already travelled 3,000 kms and should be allowed to enter the country on humanitarian grounds.
He wanted a transit visa to reach Saudi Arabia via Iran," a Federal Investigation Agency official had said.Hajj is an annual Islamic pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, considered the holiest city for Muslims.Taj, a resident of Lahore, filed a petition in the Lahore High Court (LHC) requesting that Shihab be granted a transit visa to allow him to travel to Saudi Arabia.He argued that just like the Pakistan government issues visas to Sikh pilgrims from India to take part in the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak and on other occasions, it should also grant a visa to Shihab.The LHC dismissed his petition, observing that the "petitioner was not related to the Indian citizen, nor did he hold his power of attorney to approach the court.
"Taj later challenged the decision in the Supreme Court of Pakistan.

Meta_title: Doctor found dead, stuffed in drawer at Betalbatim
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Doctor found dead, stuffed in drawer at Betalbatim
Article: Colva: A 27-year-old doctor, working in a hospital at Nuvem, was found dead in the apartment he was staying in at Betalbatim, on Wednesday.The victim, Dr Nishant Bharat, was a native of Bihar, the police said.The body was recovered by Colva police. It was found stuffed inside a drawer. Since his legs were bound, police suspect it to be case of murder that occurred a day prior.An alarm was raised when the doctor did not turn up for his duties at the hospital. His co-workers could not get in touch with him as all phone calls went answered. The police were informed immediately after which they swung into action.Police told TOI that the victim had employed a male person to help him with household chores. Further investigations are in progress.
Summary:

Meta_title: In Chennai, Rs 50 fine for peeing in public
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks...
Title: In Chennai, Rs 50 fine for peeing in public
Article: CHENNAI: The next time you get the urge to urinate and decide to go in a public place, you could be fined 50. Greater Chennai Corporation commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi a few days ago instructed officials to enforce the rule strictly to keep the city clean and hygienic.The commissioner said they would also create awareness. "It will be coupled with maintenance of toilets. We will have the urinals clean and ensure people use them. If people urinate around toilets, they will be fined," he said. The offending individual would be given a challan with name, detail of violation and fine amount. Sanitary inspectors have been told to carry out regular inspections across the city. "Sanitary inspectors and conservancy inspectors will levy the fines," the commissioner said.The corporation has multiple provisions to fine residents under the Chennai City Municipal Corporation Act, 1919, which prohibits individuals from sullying public places by any means causing an health hazard.Residents want clean and hygienic toilets. V Sandhya of Anna Nagar said open-urination was rampant in the area. "50 is a small amount. Still, irrespective of amount, enforcement is the key."Sathish Galley of OMR said, " GCC should ensure toilets are maintained well. Only then mindset of the user will change."Sridhar Venkatraman of Mylapore said most delivery personnel have no access to toilets and urinate in the open. "Collecting fine is reasonable after they think through the problems, find the root causes, implement solutions and then start regulating it."
Summary:
CHENNAI: The next time you get the urge to urinate and decide to go in a public place, you could be fined 50.
Greater Chennai Corporation commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi a few days ago instructed officials to enforce the rule strictly to keep the city clean and hygienic.The commissioner said they would also create awareness.
Sanitary inspectors have been told to carry out regular inspections across the city.

"Collecting fine is reasonable after they think through the problems, find the root causes, implement solutions and then start regulating it."

Meta_title: Those in custody must be allowed to appear for lekhpal exam: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami
Meta_desc: Those in custody must be allowed to appear for lekhpal exam: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court...
Title: Those in custody must be allowed to appear for lekhpal exam: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami
Article: DEHRADUN: After a delegation of the Uttarakhand state unemployed association and other representatives of the ongoing protest against unfair exam practices in the state met chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami and said some of the protesters taken into police custody on Thursday could miss are meant to appear for the Lekhpal exam on Sunday, the CM asked DGP Ashok Kumar to make sure the candidates appear in the exam on Sunday.Dhami said, "Our government has acted tough in all matters which have come to the fore. As a result, people involved in wrong practices have been placed behind the bars. We have initiated stringent measures and it has helped in bringing out the wrongdoings. We have fulfilled our commitment of coming up with stringent laws with strict provisions against those resorting to illegal means in the recruitment exams." The delegation that met the CM said because of a few corrupt people, several hard-working aspirants were getting deprived.Governor Lt. Gen Gurmit Singh (Retd) gave his approval for the Uttarakhand Competitive Examination (Measures for Prevention and Prevention of Unfair Means in Recruitment) Ordinance 2023 on Friday.After Thursday's protest and violence, the Uttarakhand government had approved the ordinance and sent it to the governor for his consent. The ordinance has provisions for imprisonment up to life term and Rs 10 crore penalty.
Summary:
DEHRADUN: After a delegation of the Uttarakhand state unemployed association and other representatives of the ongoing protest against unfair exam practices in the state met chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami and said some of the protesters taken into police custody on Thursday could miss are meant to appear for the Lekhpal exam on Sunday, the CM asked DGP Ashok Kumar to make sure the candidates appear in the exam on Sunday.Dhami said, "Our government has acted tough in all matters which have come to the fore.
As a result, people involved in wrong practices have been placed behind the bars.
We have initiated stringent measures and it has helped in bringing out the wrongdoings.
We have fulfilled our commitment of coming up with stringent laws with strict provisions against those resorting to illegal means in the recruitment exams."
The ordinance has provisions for imprisonment up to life term and Rs 10 crore penalty.

Meta_title: 'Bhagat Singh Koshyari's return to Uttarakhand will add another power centre'
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Singh Koshyari: 'Bhagat Singh Koshyari's return to Uttarakhand will add another power centre'
Article: DEHRADUN: Bhagat Singh Koshyari , who has stepped down as the governor of Maharashtra after completing almost three-and-a-half years of tenure, is all set to return to Uttarakhand Even before the octogenarian politician's arrival in the state, speculations are on about the possible impact of 'Bhagat da' (as popularly called by party workers) return in the politics of Uttarakhand - of which he has been the most dominant force since the state was carved out of UP in 2000."His return will create one more power centre in BJP and Uttarakhand. He has been a 24x7 career politician before he was made governor in September 2019. In fact, he was still pulling strings in Uttarakhand politics despite being away," said SMA Kazmi, political expert.Kazmi added that being an accessible politician and popular Rajput leader from Kumaon, Koshyari is liked by party's grass root workers who will again make a beeline outside his house which is going to cause jitters among other party leaders. =
Summary:
DEHRADUN: Bhagat Singh Koshyari , who has stepped down as the governor of Maharashtra after completing almost three-and-a-half years of tenure, is all set to return to Uttarakhand Even before the octogenarian politician's arrival in the state, speculations are on about the possible impact of 'Bhagat da' (as popularly called by party workers) return in the politics of Uttarakhand - of which he has been the most dominant force since the state was carved out of UP in 2000.
"His return will create one more power centre in BJP and Uttarakhand.
He has been a 24x7 career politician before he was made governor in September 2019.
In fact, he was still pulling strings in Uttarakhand politics despite being away," said SMA Kazmi, political expert.Kazmi added that being an accessible politician and popular Rajput leader from Kumaon, Koshyari is liked by party's grass root workers who will again make a beeline outside his house which is going to cause jitters among other party leaders.

Meta_title: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu gets serious patient from remote Pangi valley airlifted for tr
Meta_desc: The patient who had received serious throat injury in an accident needed immediate specialised treatment. SHIMLA: Himchal Pradesh chief minister Sukhvinder...
Title: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu gets serious patient from remote Pangi valley airlifted for treatment
Article: SHIMLA: Himchal Pradesh chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has once again stepped in to save a precious life by providing his chopper so that a patient under medical emergency could be airlifted in time for treatment.This time Sukhu got a serious patient airlifted from the Killar town of Pangi valley in Chamba district, in his official chopper by cancelling his scheduled tour. Few days back in a similar gesture he had airlifted a serious patient from remote Mayar valley of Lahaul-Spiti district.The patient who had received serious throat injury in an accident needed immediate specialised treatment as specialist doctors are not there in Killar so doctors after giving him primary treatment referred to outside the valley on which the family members requested the government to make arrangements to airlift him through the chopper on which he was shifted from Killar to government medical college at Tanda in Kangra district.The patient is being attended as per the reports received from the doctors.CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has directed the hospital authorities to treat the patient free of cost and provide him every possible assistance.He said that the government mulls to strengthen the health facilities in the far off and tribal regions of the state. He said that adequate doctors will be posted in such areas, so that the people living in hard and tribal regions could get adequate medical attention with the best facilities.In a video message, Pritam Lal, the brother of the patient, has thanked the chief minister whom he termed as 'saviour' for their family for saving the life of his brother. Recently, the chief minister had provided his official chopper to airlift a seriously ill patient from Chhaling village of Mayar valley in Lahaul-Spiti district.Sukhu has been in the limelight for his compassion towards the needy and destitute since he has assumed the office of the chief minister.After taking oath, he went straight to an orphanage to enquire the wellbeing of the inmates and immediately took a decision that the State government will constitute chief minister's Sukh Ashraya Sahayata Kosh with an outlay of Rs 101 crore so that the facility of higher education could be provided to needy children and destitute women.Later he also announced, to provide Rs 500 as festive allowance to the students.
Summary:

Few days back in a similar gesture he had airlifted a serious patient from remote Mayar valley of Lahaul-Spiti district.The patient who had received serious throat injury in an accident needed immediate specialised treatment as specialist doctors are not there in Killar so doctors after giving him primary treatment referred to outside the valley on which the family members requested the government to make arrangements to airlift him through the chopper on which he was shifted from Killar to government medical college at Tanda in Kangra district.The patient is being attended as per the reports received from the doctors.CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has directed the hospital authorities to treat the patient free of cost and provide him every possible assistance.He said that the government mulls to strengthen the health facilities in the far off and tribal regions of the state.
He said that adequate doctors will be posted in such areas, so that the people living in hard and tribal regions could get adequate medical attention with the best facilities.In a video message, Pritam Lal, the brother of the patient, has thanked the chief minister whom he termed as 'saviour' for their family for saving the life of his brother.
Recently, the chief minister had provided his official chopper to airlift a seriously ill patient from Chhaling village of Mayar valley in Lahaul-Spiti district.Sukhu has been in the limelight for his compassion towards the needy and destitute since he has assumed the office of the chief minister.After taking oath, he went straight to an orphanage to enquire the wellbeing of the inmates and immediately took a decision that the State government will constitute chief minister's Sukh Ashraya Sahayata Kosh with an outlay of Rs 101 crore so that the facility of higher education could be provided to needy children and destitute women.Later he also announced, to provide Rs 500 as festive allowance to the students.

Meta_title: Reluctant trainee to race-walking qualifier for Paris Olympics clocking 1:19.55, Akshdeep Singh, 23, has come a long way
Meta_desc: As a kid growing up in Kahne Ke Village in Barnala district of Punjab, Akshdeep Singh often practiced running around the two-acre farm owned by his father...
Title: Reluctant trainee to race-walking qualifier for Paris Olympics clocking 1:19.55, Akshdeep Singh, 23, has come a long way
Article:
As a kid growing up in Kahne Ke Village in Barnala district of Punjab, Akshdeep Singh often practiced running around the two-acre farm owned by his father Gurjant Singh to pursue his dream of getting enrolled in the Indian Army from the recruitment drives at Bathinda.

Singh became a race-walker in subsequent seasons and joined Indian Navy last year under the sports quota. On Tuesday, the 23-year-old became one of two Indian athletes, alongwith Priyanka Goswami, to bag the first qualifying berths for Paris Olympics with a new national record of one hour and 19.55 minutes in the men’s 20 km race walk event at the Tenth Indian Open Race Walking Championship at Ranchi.

“My father owns a two-acre farm in our village and my aim was to get enrolled in the army as a soldier and support my family. Seeing the elder village youth train for the recruitment drives, I spent my time running around the farm and later at the nearby stadium in an effort to prepare myself for the coming years. After making the national record today, I told my father about qualifying for the Paris Olympics and the first thing he asked me was, “Paise da arrangement karna hai tan das di (if you want money then tell me),” shared Singh while speaking with The Indian Express.

Priyanka Goswami secured her spots while Akshdeep Singh set a national record and also qualified for both the events. Day 2 promises more actionWatch it live on AFI's Youtube and Facebook channels. pic.twitter.com/hbRiP0saDF — Athletics Federation of India (@afiindia) February 14, 2023

Singh’s interest in running grew with village youths passing his home in the morning to train in the fields or along the road to the nearby town of Barnala. The youngster would train for 800m races at the village apart from undertaking the 30-minute bus journey to the Baba Kehar Singh Stadium in Barnala. It was the transfer of his initial coach Jaspreet Singh that led to the Punjab youngster going to Patiala to train as an athlete. With his coach suggesting he train under former race walk national champion and coach Gurdev Singh, the youngster faced the dilemma of training as a runner or race walker.

“Kadhi kise nu eh khed karde dekhya hi nahi si (I had never watched any one competing in a race walk ever). When coach Gurdev Singh told me to train as a race walker in 2016, I did not even train with full effort for a month or so. I was fascinated by races and could not imagine myself walking,” remembers Singh.

Gurdev Singh, who has coached the likes of KT Irfan, who finished tenth in the London Olympics, was impressed by Singh’s natural walking action and persisted with training the youngster in race walk. While the veteran coach made Singh train for one-hour training sessions initially, the training sessions increased as well as his trainee’s willingness to continue in the discipline. “When I made Akshdeep give the race walk trials, I was impressed by the balance of his heel kick. For close to two months, he did not show his willingness but when he met some of the seniors and other athletes in the camp, his interest grew. His posture was good for race walking but we had to gradually work on the placement of knee and heel on the track as his muscles were trained for running. Slowly we made him run on the road and would increase the distance to 30-40 kms during one training session,” says Gurdev.

Singh won a silver medal in the U-18 Junior Nationals in Vijayawada with a timing of 43.35 minutes within an year of training and followed the medal with a silver in All India Inter-university the same year. In 2018, Singh clocked his first sub 43-minute timing of 42.36 minutes and won the bronze in 10km race walk in the Junior Federation Cup at Coimbatore. The youngster missed his chance to compete in Junior Asian Championship but made a new junior national record of 44.791 in 10 Km race walk event in Ranchi the same year.

Race Walking National Championships Update☑️ 🇮🇳 Race Walkers Akshdeep Singh & @Priyanka_Goswam win National Race Walking Championships and in the process also qualify for 2023 World Ch’ps & 2024 Olympics 🏃‍♀️ Congratulations on your achievements rockstars! Keep rocking🥳👏🏻 pic.twitter.com/B23kWWDeLg — SAI Media (@Media_SAI) February 14, 2023

In 2019, the youngster suffered a knee injury which kept him out for ten months, which also meant that he missed the World University Games in Italy. “The first race walk shoe I bought was for Rs 4500 and the shoes would break after 2-3 months. My father and mother would save whatever money they could and my coaches and seniors too helped me. When I broke the new junior national record, I had my passport made. Injury de karan passport bina kise vise di stamp toh reh gaya (Due to injury, my chance to get a visa stamp on passport remained unfulfilled,)” says Singh.

A Khelo India Scholarship kept his training needs fulfilled to some extent and the youngster competed in his first senior competition in 2020 where he gave his personal best 20 km race walk timing of one hour and 26.12 minutes to finish 11th in Eighth Indian Open Race Walking Competition in Ranchi days before Covid-19 lockdown.

Advertisement

The last two years have seen him making a new Khelo India University games record as well a bronze medal in National Games and a silver in Open Nationals in Bengaluru. Singh has also been training under Russian coach Tatyana Sibileva at Bengaluru. At the last Asian Games, the men’s 20 km race walk title went at the timing of one hour and 22.04 minutes and Singh believes that he can win a medal despite Chinese runners being in familiar territory.

Committing fewest fouls

“Race walking is all about committing less fouls and getting the technique perfect. Coach Tatyana has made us focus on hip and knee exercises and posture to make contact with the track as straight and maintain contact with track during all the times. She has made us train for long steps and a fast heel kick to make the heel balance. During my time at the village in lockdown, I also saw videos of world leader Perseus Karlstrom of Sweden, 2012 Olympic champion Chen Ding and 2016 Olympic champion Wang Zhen of China to observe their technique,” said Singh, who now works as a petty officer with the Indian Navy.

As for his village, Singh knows how the village will celebrate his feat of qualifying for the Paris Olympics. “My village is very proud of me and racewalking. Whenever there is a kabaddi mela at the village or nearby villages, they invite me to demonstrate race walking in the field so that more and more kids know about the sport. Jad sari duniya de samne chal kaiya fer pind de samne chalan di ki sharam (When I have walked in front of the world, why should I hesitate in walking in front of village kids),” says Singh.
Summary:
“Kadhi kise nu eh khed karde dekhya hi nahi si (I had never watched any one competing in a race walk ever).
“When I made Akshdeep give the race walk trials, I was impressed by the balance of his heel kick.
Race Walking National Championships Update☑️ 🇮🇳 Race Walkers Akshdeep Singh & @Priyanka_Goswam win National Race Walking Championships and in the process also qualify for 2023 World Ch’ps & 2024 Olympics 🏃‍♀️ Congratulations on your achievements rockstars!
“The first race walk shoe I bought was for Rs 4500 and the shoes would break after 2-3 months.
As for his village, Singh knows how the village will celebrate his feat of qualifying for the Paris Olympics.

Meta_title: US recovers sensor parts from downed Chinese balloon: Military
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... Singh Badal DeathSame Sex MarriagePM Modi in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath...
Title: Chinese Spy Balloon: US recovers sensor parts from downed Chinese balloon says Military
Article: WASHINGTON: The United States has recovered important sensor and electronics parts from a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon it shot down earlier this month, the US military said on Monday."Crews have been able to recover significant debris from the site, including all of the priority sensor and electronics pieces identified as well as large sections of the structure," the US Northern Command said in a statement.China insists the balloon, which spent several days flying over North America, was an errant weather observation aircraft with no military purpose, but the United States says it was a sophisticated high-altitude spying vehicle that is part of a program with global reach.A US F-22 Raptor fighter jet shot it down off the coast of South Carolina on February 4, and teams have since been working to recover the debris for analysis.American warplanes have downed three other objects since then -- one near Alaska, another over Canada and a third over Lake Huron -- but authorities have not identified their origin or purpose.
Summary:
WASHINGTON: The United States has recovered important sensor and electronics parts from a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon it shot down earlier this month, the US military said on Monday.
"Crews have been able to recover significant debris from the site, including all of the priority sensor and electronics pieces identified as well as large sections of the structure," the US Northern Command said in a statement.China insists the balloon, which spent several days flying over North America, was an errant weather observation aircraft with no military purpose, but the United States says it was a sophisticated high-altitude spying vehicle that is part of a program with global reach.A US F-22 Raptor fighter jet shot it down off the coast of South Carolina on February 4, and teams have since been working to recover the debris for analysis.American warplanes have downed three other objects since then -- one near Alaska, another over Canada and a third over Lake Huron -- but authorities have not identified their origin or purpose.

Meta_title: Took some time to understand what coach wanted from us: Bipin Singh
Meta_desc: Took some time to understand what coach wanted from us: Bipin Singh ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi...
Title: Took some time to understand what coach wanted from us: Bipin Singh
Article:
Panaji:

Mumbai City FC have taken a great leap this season.From fifth last season to champions now, it has been quite a transformation for Des Buckingham’s side. They conceded 31 goals last season and just 18 so far in the Indian Super League ( ISL ), despite introducing only one new foreign defender -- Royston Griffiths – to the starting lineup. Six of the goals, interestingly, came from their first game against Hyderabad FC (3-3) at home and the last one against FC Goa (5-3) at Fatorda.While defence has seen the biggest change, the goals from Indian wingers can hardly be ignored.Wingers Bipin Singh and Lallianzuala Chhangte have collectively been involved in 23 of Mumbai City FC’s 53 goals this season. While Chhangte has notched up ten goals and six assists to remain the top Indian goalscorer, Bipin has six goals and two assists in his bag.So how did Mumbai become unstoppable?“When the coach took charge, he spoke to us individually, but maybe (his plans) it did not immediately register with the players,” Bipin said on Monday. “In the second season, with the coach giving us the confidence (to perform), everyone understood what the coach wanted, what his game plan is. We can see the results on the field.”Bipin was an important player during Sergio Lobera’s time at the club and continues to set the wing on fire with his speed and ability to score important goals. He has scored 18 goals in the last three seasons and nine assists, quite a turnaround in fortunes for someone who had just four goals in his first three seasons in the top tier of Indian football.“Before joining Mumbai, I spent a year at ATK, having moved there from the I-League. This is my fifth year in Mumbai, it’s like home. My dream was to win the (ISL) trophy once. Three years after I joined, we won the Shield and Trophy. That felt great. To become champions again is a wonderful feeling,” said Bipin.
Summary:
Panaji:Mumbai City FC have taken a great leap this season.From fifth last season to champions now, it has been quite a transformation for Des Buckingham’s side.
They conceded 31 goals last season and just 18 so far in the Indian Super League ( ISL ), despite introducing only one new foreign defender -- Royston Griffiths – to the starting lineup.
“In the second season, with the coach giving us the confidence (to perform), everyone understood what the coach wanted, what his game plan is.
Three years after I joined, we won the Shield and Trophy.
To become champions again is a wonderful feeling,” said Bipin.

Meta_title: Iranian journalist released on bail week after arrest
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Iranian journalist released on bail week after arrest
Article: TEHRAN: Iranian authorities have released journalist Elnaz Mohammadi from the Hammihan newspaper on bail one week after her arrest, media reported Sunday, but her sister, also a reporter, remains in custody.Elnaz was detained after going to the prosecutor’s office “for an explanation”, but has since been “released from Evin prison on bail”, the reformist daily Hammihan reported. Her sister Elahe was arrested on September 29 after reporting for Hammihan from the funeral of Mahsa Amini’s funeral,and remains in custody.Iran has witnessed nationwide protests since the September 16 death in custody of Amini, a 22-year-old ethnic Kurd, who had been arrested for an alleged breach of strict dress rules for women. Elahe was charged with “propaganda against the system and conspiracy to act against national security”. Thousands of Iranians, including public figures, journalists and lawyers have been arrested. Ten of the journalists arrested over the protests are still in custody, Tehran Journalists Association said.
Summary:
TEHRAN: Iranian authorities have released journalist Elnaz Mohammadi from the Hammihan newspaper on bail one week after her arrest, media reported Sunday, but her sister, also a reporter, remains in custody.Elnaz was detained after going to the prosecutor’s office “for an explanation”, but has since been “released from Evin prison on bail”, the reformist daily Hammihan reported.
Her sister Elahe was arrested on September 29 after reporting for Hammihan from the funeral of Mahsa Amini’s funeral,and remains in custody.Iran has witnessed nationwide protests since the September 16 death in custody of Amini, a 22-year-old ethnic Kurd, who had been arrested for an alleged breach of strict dress rules for women.
Elahe was charged with “propaganda against the system and conspiracy to act against national security”.
Thousands of Iranians, including public figures, journalists and lawyers have been arrested.
Ten of the journalists arrested over the protests are still in custody, Tehran Journalists Association said.

Meta_title: Ahmedabad businessman returns from quake-ravaged Turkey
Meta_desc: 53-year-old Singh, who has textile business interests in Turkey, Indonesia and Thailand, said that he got up to drink a glass of water, "when the whole building...
Title: Turkey: Ahmedabad businessman returns from quake-ravaged Turkey
Article: AHMEDABAD: An Ahmedabad-based businessman, Rakesh Singh , who returned to the city with his family, recounted the devastating earthquake in Turkey , terming the scenes after the quake as "horrific and scary".53-year-old Singh, who has textile business interests in Turkey, Indonesia and Thailand , said that he got up to drink a glass of water, "when the whole building began shaking like a pendulum". Singh was with his wife and son on the second floor of an apartment in Gaziantep city , which bore the brunt of the first quake which hit the region at 4.17am on February 6."I woke up to drink a glass of water and just then, the building started shaking violently. We rushed out without even waiting to take our phones. The weather outside was chilly with rain and snow falling. People were wailing and desperately looking for their loved ones," he recounted on Sunday.Singh said that he later got his phone and passports of family members from the building and called his colleagues, who are also from different cities of Gujarat . "Thankfully they all were also safe," he said. Singh, who returned with his family to Ahmedabad on Saturday morning, said that the situation in turkey is still very grim with people having to wait for more than two days in queues for petrol.Having business interests in Turkey, Singh visits Turkey often and spends about a month there. This time, he had taken his wife and son along, as it snows in that country at around this time of the year. Gaziantep is a major centre for carpet manufacturing and export, he said.
Summary:
Singh was with his wife and son on the second floor of an apartment in Gaziantep city , which bore the brunt of the first quake which hit the region at 4.17am on February 6.
"I woke up to drink a glass of water and just then, the building started shaking violently.
Singh, who returned with his family to Ahmedabad on Saturday morning, said that the situation in turkey is still very grim with people having to wait for more than two days in queues for petrol.Having business interests in Turkey, Singh visits Turkey often and spends about a month there.

Gaziantep is a major centre for carpet manufacturing and export, he said.

Meta_title: Telangana CM KCR slams PM Modi, mocks $3.1 trillion economy claim
Meta_desc: Telangana CM KCR slams PM Modi, mocks $3.1 trillion economy claim ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi...
Title: KCR: Telangana CM slams PM Modi, mocks $3.1 trillion economy claim
Article:
01:06 Why did Centre not allow Pfizer to enter the Indian market: KCR

HYDERABAD: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao called PM Narendra Modi the "most ineffective PM" in the nation's history and termed the NDA as "No Data Available" government in his most scathing attack against the BJP-led Centre and the PM in a two-hour speech in the assembly Sunday.KCR said former PM Manmohan Singh excelled in his performance, but lacked the ecosystem to flaunt his achievements like his successor Modi.In a pointed counter to Modi's remarks that India will always remember the decade preceding 2014 as the "lost decade" and the decade of 2030 will be known as "India's decade", KCR gathered ammunition from the book - Lost Decade (2008-18) - and quoted from its pages to attack the PM.During a debate on the money appropriation bill in the assembly, he claimed Manmohan Singh managed the country's debt-to-GDP ratio better than Modi. "Singh brought down the ratio by 10%, but it rose by 5% during PM Modi 's tenure. The poor man did not boast, but Modi and his followers are full of praise for themselves," he said.He also mocked the $3.1 trillion economy claimed by the NDA government, saying this was not an actual indicator of development."What matters is the money with the people. India ranks poorly on the per capita income parameter. We are ranked 138th, far behind nations like Bangladesh and Bhutan," he said.
Summary:
"Singh brought down the ratio by 10%, but it rose by 5% during PM Modi 's tenure.
The poor man did not boast, but Modi and his followers are full of praise for themselves," he said.He also mocked the $3.1 trillion economy claimed by the NDA government, saying this was not an actual indicator of development.
"What matters is the money with the people.
India ranks poorly on the per capita income parameter.
We are ranked 138th, far behind nations like Bangladesh and Bhutan," he said.

Meta_title: Apple Maps privacy bug: Why iPhone users don't need to worry
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... Singh Badal DeathSame Sex MarriagePM Modi in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath...
Title: Apple: Apple Maps privacy bug: Why iPhone users don't need to worry
Article:
How iPhone users were not at risk

What Apple had to say

A recently reported Apple Maps bug was reportedly allowing apps to collect user location data without permission. Several apps could have exploited this privacy bug to their advantage. According to a report by 9to5Mac, a Brazilian food delivery app named iFood accessed a user’s location data in iOS 16.2 even after the user denied all location access to the app. The Cupertino-based tech giant started rolling out to the general public last month. Among other new features, the latest iOS version also included a list of security updates.The Apple Maps privacy bug that allowed an app to “bypass Privacy preferences” was also addressed by one of these fixes. The report also claims that the company has clarified that iPhone users “were never at risk” due to this security flaw. The company also denied the report regarding the Brazillian food delivery app accessing user locations without permission in iOS 16.2.As per the report, Apple has explained that the Maps vulnerability that was patched “could only be exploited from unsandboxed apps on macOS .” Moreover, the company added the fix to all of Apple’s software updates including iOS and iPadOS , tvOS, and watchOS. This was done by the company as the codebase is shared by all these operating systems.Apple has also claimed that “the suggestion that this vulnerability could have allowed apps to circumvent user controls on iPhone is false.” The company also concluded that the app was not circumventing user controls through any mechanism.” The Apple Maps security flaw was first discovered by an anonymous researcher.In a statement to 9to5Mac, Apple said, “At Apple, we firmly believe users should choose when to share their data and with whom. Last week we issued an advisory for a privacy vulnerability that could only be exploited from unsandboxed apps on macOS. The codebase that we fixed is shared by iOS and iPadOS, tvOS, and watchOS, so the fix and advisory was propagated to those operating systems as well, despite the fact that they were never at risk. The suggestion that this vulnerability could have allowed apps to circumvent user controls on iPhone is false.A report also incorrectly suggested an iOS app was exploiting this or another vulnerability to bypass user control over location data. Our follow up investigation concluded that the app was not circumventing user controls through any mechanism.”
Summary:
How iPhone users were not at riskWhat Apple had to sayA recently reported Apple Maps bug was reportedly allowing apps to collect user location data without permission.
Several apps could have exploited this privacy bug to their advantage.
Among other new features, the latest iOS version also included a list of security updates.The Apple Maps privacy bug that allowed an app to “bypass Privacy preferences” was also addressed by one of these fixes.
The report also claims that the company has clarified that iPhone users “were never at risk” due to this security flaw.
Last week we issued an advisory for a privacy vulnerability that could only be exploited from unsandboxed apps on macOS.

Meta_title: Interpretation of law must keep pace with the changing needs of society: Supreme Court
Meta_desc: ... Covid News Live: India reports 6600 Fresh Covid cases · Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan, Supreme Court asks Delhi police...
Title: Interpretation of law must keep pace with the changing needs of society: Supreme Court
Article: NEW DELHI: Holding that the court’s interpretation of the Constitution must be in tune with the changing times and some of its earlier interpretations are no longer valid, the Supreme Court has said that excommunication or ostracisation of a person in society is against constitutional ethos as it will result in his “civil death” and decided to re-examine its six-decade old verdict permitting a religious community to excommunicate its dissidents.A five-judge bench of Justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul , Sanjiv Khanna, Abhay S Oka, Vikram Nath and J K Maheshwari said the apex court’s 1962 judgment protecting the rights of the Bohra community to excommunicate its members required reconsideration. It said much water has flown after that decision and the court at that time did not examine that Article 26(b), which talks about the right to manage its own affairs in matters of religion, is also subject to morality.“For example, the narrow interpretation given to Article 21 in the ‘A K Gopalan era’ is no longer valid. The concept of freedom has undergone changes. In the 21st Century, society looks completely different from what it looked in the last century. We see a change in the socio-cultural ethos of society. Thus, the interpretation of law must keep pace with changing needs of society,” Justice Oka said.The court did not agree with the earlier Constitution bench verdict and said the issue needed to be decided by a larger bench. It held that excommunication or ostracisation is anathema to the concepts of liberty and equality and against anti-discriminatory ethos which forms a part of constitutional morality.“Even assuming that the excommunication of members of the Dawoodi Bohra community is always made on religious grounds, the effect and consequences thereof, on the person excommunicated needs to be considered in the context of justiciable constitutional rights.It said a person who is excommunicated by the community will not be entitled to use the community’s common property and its burial/cremation grounds. “In a sense, such a person will virtually become untouchable. In a given case, it will result in his civil death,” the court said.
Summary:
In the 21st Century, society looks completely different from what it looked in the last century.
We see a change in the socio-cultural ethos of society.
Thus, the interpretation of law must keep pace with changing needs of society,” Justice Oka said.The court did not agree with the earlier Constitution bench verdict and said the issue needed to be decided by a larger bench.
“In a sense, such a person will virtually become untouchable.
In a given case, it will result in his civil death,” the court said.

Meta_title: Three killed, 20 injured in suicide attack in Pakistan
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Three killed, 20 injured in suicide attack in Pakistan
Article: PESHAWAR: At least three soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in a suicide attack on a vehicle of the security forces in Pakistan 's restive northwestern region on Saturday, police said. The incident happened in the country's North Waziristan tribal district when the suicide bomber riding a tri-wheeler laden with bomb hit the vehicle of security forces that was escorting employees of a petroleum company."The suicide bomber riding a tri wheeler hit vehicle of the security forces on duty with MPCL Petroleum Company in Khajori Chowk in North Waziristan tribal district bordering Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed and 20 others injured," a senior police official said.The employees of petroleum company were on their way back to their rest place under tight security after duty hours when the bomber ambushed one of the force's vehicle escorting them.The MPCL Company is engaged in exploration of oil in the area.
Summary:
PESHAWAR: At least three soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in a suicide attack on a vehicle of the security forces in Pakistan 's restive northwestern region on Saturday, police said.
The incident happened in the country's North Waziristan tribal district when the suicide bomber riding a tri-wheeler laden with bomb hit the vehicle of security forces that was escorting employees of a petroleum company.
"The suicide bomber riding a tri wheeler hit vehicle of the security forces on duty with MPCL Petroleum Company in Khajori Chowk in North Waziristan tribal district bordering Afghanistan.
Three soldiers were killed and 20 others injured," a senior police official said.The employees of petroleum company were on their way back to their rest place under tight security after duty hours when the bomber ambushed one of the force's vehicle escorting them.The MPCL Company is engaged in exploration of oil in the area.

Meta_title: Justice NK Singh appointed as Chief Justice of J&K, Ladakh ...
Meta_desc: Justice Nongmeikapam Kotiswar Singh, judge of the Gauhati High Court has been appointed as Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh.
Title: Justice NK Singh appointed as Chief Justice of J&K, Ladakh High Court
Article:
Post by RK Online Desk on Sunday, February 12, 2023

Justice Nongmeikapam Kotiswar Singh, judge of the Gauhati High Court has been appointed as Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh.

According to an order, “In exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 217 of the Constitution of India, the President is pleased to appoint Shri Justice Nongmeikapam Kotiswar Singh, Judge of the Gauhati High Court to be Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh, with effect from the date he assumes charge of his office."
Summary:
Post by RK Online Desk on Sunday, February 12, 2023Justice Nongmeikapam Kotiswar Singh, judge of the Gauhati High Court has been appointed as Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh.
According to an order, “In exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 217 of the Constitution of India, the President is pleased to appoint Shri Justice Nongmeikapam Kotiswar Singh, Judge of the Gauhati High Court to be Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh, with effect from the date he assumes charge of his office."

Meta_title: Eye on civic polls: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis to inaugurate projects wort
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleOperation KaveriKarnataka Election...
Title: Eye on civic polls: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis to inaugurate projects worth Rs 105.6 crore in Kalyan, Ulhasnagar
Article: KALYAN: Maharashtra chief minister Eknath Shinde and deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis will visit Kalyan and Ulhasnagar in Maharashtra’s Thane district on Wednesday to inaugurate development works worth Rs 105.6 crore.Political observers believe the visit is crucial — especially for Shinde — as along with the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation , elections to the Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation and Ulhasnagar Municipal Corporation are due, with both the leaders having stressed strengthening the alliance in the region.Allotments of 397 houses and 119 commercial shops under Basic Services for Urban Poor scheme in Kalyan city, inauguration of beautified Bhagva talao (Kala Talao) and naming it as Prabhodhankar Thackeray Sarovar, inauguration of two sewage treatment centers and distribution of grants and goods to the beneficiaries of various schemes are scheduled.Shinde is visiting Ulhasnagar for the first time after becoming chief minister.Recently, the issue of authorisation of unauthorised buildings in Ulhasnagar city, which has been pending for many years, was taken up by him.In Ulhasnagar, the CM will inaugurate vehicles of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan (22.72 crores), charging stations for electric vehicles (53.87 lakhs) and sewerage center at Khadegolvali (12.42 crores) area.Along with this, a computer system for the disabled and a dog sterilization center will also be inaugurated.Kalyan and Ulhasnagar township that come under Thane district are Shinde strongholds: in both towns, most of the corporators of Shiv Sena have joined the Shinde faction.Shinde's son Dr Shrikant Shinde, who is Lok Sabha MP from Kalyan, has been bringing major projects to the region.
Summary: KALYAN: Maharashtra chief minister Eknath Shinde and deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis will visit Kalyan and Ulhasnagar in Maharashtra’s Thane district on Wednesday to inaugurate development works worth Rs 105.6 crore.Political observers believe the visit is crucial — especially for Shinde — as along with the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation , elections to the Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation and Ulhasnagar Municipal Corporation are due, with both the leaders having stressed strengthening the alliance in the region.Allotments of 397 houses and 119 commercial shops under Basic Services for Urban Poor scheme in Kalyan city, inauguration of beautified Bhagva talao (Kala Talao) and naming it as Prabhodhankar Thackeray Sarovar, inauguration of two sewage treatment centers and distribution of grants and goods to the beneficiaries of various schemes are scheduled.Shinde is visiting Ulhasnagar for the first time after becoming chief minister.Recently, the issue of authorisation of unauthorised buildings in Ulhasnagar city, which has been pending for many years, was taken up by him.In Ulhasnagar, the CM will inaugurate vehicles of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan (22.72 crores), charging stations for electric vehicles (53.87 lakhs) and sewerage center at Khadegolvali (12.42 crores) area.Along with this, a computer system for the disabled and a dog sterilization center will also be inaugurated.Kalyan and Ulhasnagar township that come under Thane district are Shinde strongholds: in both towns, most of the corporators of Shiv Sena have joined the Shinde faction.Shinde's son Dr Shrikant Shinde, who is Lok Sabha MP from Kalyan, has been bringing major projects to the region.

Meta_title: Shraddha Walkar murder case: Aaftab Poonawala seeks chargesheet in folders, certificates
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... MarriagePM Modi in KeralaSania MirzaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleIPL Slow...
Title: Shraddha Walkar murder case: Aaftab Poonawala seeks chargesheet in folders, certificates
Article: NEW DELHI: Aaftab Poonawala , accused of killing his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, has moved two applications before court seeking supply of the chargesheet and video footage and his education certificate.One of the applications stated that Aaftab had a copy of the chargesheet, but didn’t have writing materials like a pen, pencil or a notebook. “He wants to assist his counsel so he urgently needs the pencil, pen as well as a notebook,” it said. Aaftab also sought his certificates as he wants to pursue higher studies. His lawyer requested the court to pass an order directing the investigating officer to hand over all educational certificates.In another application before the Saket courts, it was submitted that on the last date of hearing on February 7, the applicant was supplied with a soft copy of the chargesheet on a pen drive. “The pen drive is overloaded, and is not supported by any advanced computer, and the video footage are very mismanaged,” the plea said. The court was requested to pass an order directing the investigating officer to supply the soft copy in a folder-wise manner and the footage on another pen drive.
Summary:
NEW DELHI: Aaftab Poonawala , accused of killing his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, has moved two applications before court seeking supply of the chargesheet and video footage and his education certificate.One of the applications stated that Aaftab had a copy of the chargesheet, but didn’t have writing materials like a pen, pencil or a notebook.
“He wants to assist his counsel so he urgently needs the pencil, pen as well as a notebook,” it said.
Aaftab also sought his certificates as he wants to pursue higher studies.
“The pen drive is overloaded, and is not supported by any advanced computer, and the video footage are very mismanaged,” the plea said.
The court was requested to pass an order directing the investigating officer to supply the soft copy in a folder-wise manner and the footage on another pen drive.

Meta_title: Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal dares Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann over Rs 40,000-crore inve
Meta_desc: JALANDHAR: Launching a vitriolic attack on the Punjab government over claims that it had attracted an investment of Rs 40,000 crore besides giving jobs to...
Title: Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal dares Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann over Rs 40,000-crore investment, 2.5 lakh jobs claim
Article:
02:29 “Punjab missing from budget”: CM Bhagwant Mann

01:03 Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann visits Bombay Stock Exchange for ceremonial ringing of the bell

JALANDHAR: Launching a vitriolic attack on the Punjab government over claims that it had attracted an investment of Rs 40 ,000 crore besides giving jobs to 2.5 lakh youths, Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal on Wednesday dared Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to "give names of 500 youth to whom jobs had been given" by the claimed investment.“The CM is lying as no investment has come into the state. In fact, the industry is moving out to Uttar Pradesh and other States. The chief minister should list the addresses of new industries which have been set up in the state," Badal said."If the figure of 2.5 lakh jobs was to be believed, it meant that 20 jobs had been given in each village in the state. This is an outright lie. I challenge the chief minister to give names of 500 youths who have been given jobs with the claimed investment,” he said while interacting with media at Adampur ahead of the Jalandhar parliamentary bypoll.Criticising theg CM for asserting that the state governor could not ask him any questions because he was “selected” and not “elected”, Sukhbir said that (at the same time) the CM was allowing AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal to run the affairs of Punjab.He questioned the CM if Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia had been elected from Punjab that they were interfering in Punjab affairs as Sisodia framed the excise policy of the state.“Even Raghav Chadha, who has not been directly elected by Punjabis, is deciding on all civil and police postings,” Sukhbir said.Holding the CM responsible for the “constitutional crisis” in Punjab, the SAD leader said that the CM was refusing to answer governor's questions pertaining to corruption and illegal decisions.“After the government blocked queries from political parties and even RTI applications on certain issues, the parties approached the governor after which he asked the CM, " he said.Maintaining that the SAD had always been a votary of federalism and was against central interference in the affairs of states, Sukhbir said, “However, many of the issues raised by the governor pertain to corruption and the AAP government should not shy away from coming clean on these issues of public welfare.”He also said that the SAD had approached governor Banwari Lal Purohit requesting him to make AAP accountable for all advertisements issued by the government outside Punjab in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat prior to the assembly elections there to recover the entire public money.
Summary:
02:29 “Punjab missing from budget”: CM Bhagwant Mann01:03 Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann visits Bombay Stock Exchange for ceremonial ringing of the bellJALANDHAR: Launching a vitriolic attack on the Punjab government over claims that it had attracted an investment of Rs 40 ,000 crore besides giving jobs to 2.5 lakh youths, Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal on Wednesday dared Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to "give names of 500 youth to whom jobs had been given" by the claimed investment.“The CM is lying as no investment has come into the state.
In fact, the industry is moving out to Uttar Pradesh and other States.
The chief minister should list the addresses of new industries which have been set up in the state," Badal said.
"If the figure of 2.5 lakh jobs was to be believed, it meant that 20 jobs had been given in each village in the state.
This is an outright lie.

Meta_title: J&K AAP chairman quits over its ‘disconnect’ with public issues, returns to Panthers Party
Meta_desc: 'Very sad and shameful': Political leaders slam BJP after wrestlers claim... brij bhushan sharan singh bjp · UP urban body polls: On BJP's campaign trail, a...
Title: J&K AAP chairman quits over its ‘disconnect’ with public issues, returns to Panthers Party
Article:
Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Harsh Dev Singh on Thursday quit the party and returned to the J&K National Panthers Party (JKNPP), which he had quit in May last year, a few days before the death of its founder and his uncle Bhim Singh.

Announcing his decision to strengthen the JKNPP in a video statement, Singh, who was the chairman of the AAP’s J&K Coordination Committee, said he has consulted his former JKNPP colleagues and decided to work towards reviving it. “Our ancestors had sacrificed a lot for this party,” he said, adding that its revival would be in the interest of the people.

Singh said he decided to leave the AAP as no one in the party was raising their voice over rising public problems on key issues like power, water, schools, ration and pension. Besides, the BJP was bringing new laws every day and foisting them on the people, whose lands were being snatched and houses demolished, he charged.

With old age pensions stopped and new guidelines made for widow’s pension in J&K, he claimed that new orders were being issued daily by the administration to harass the common man over the issuance of Aadhaar cards, new formats of Income Tax and domicile certificates, etc. He added that no political party was raising their voice against the BJP as all of them, barring the Panthers Party, have some “vested interests”. He went on to say that he has taken up the project of reviving the Panthers Party at the behest of the people as the JKNPP “is their only voice in the region”.

Singh, who had been elected MLA on the Panthers Party’s ticket from Ramnagar constituency in Udhampur district for three consecutive terms from 1996, had joined the AAP in May 2022, following on the defection of former JKNPP MLAs, Yash Pal Kundal and Balwant Singh Mankotia, to the

Arvind Kejriwal-led party. Like Singh, Kundal was also a former minister in the Mufti Mohammad Sayeed-led PDP-Congress coalition government, formed in 2002.

Singh and Mankotia are cousins. While Kundal is still with the AAP, Mankotia has switched to the BJP.

Advertisement

Amit Kapoor, a senior J&K AAP leader, who claimed he had brought Harsh Dev Singh into the party, alleged that the latter had resigned after the AAP high command had declined to grant him Rs 12 lakh per month to run the party’s affairs in the Union Territory. He added that Singh had raised the demand for money through one of his “gurney (supporters)” at the AAP meeting in Delhi on January 23. Kapoor added that Singh had unsuccessfully tried to convince the party leadership to scrap the existing AAP team and make him the party’s J&K chief. Singh was not available for comments on these allegations.

The JKNPP, recognised by the Election Commission, was founded by Bhim Singh in 1982 as a splinter outfit of the Indian National Congress. Bhim died on May 31, 2022, following which the party saw an exodus of senior leaders from its fold.

Bhim Singh had been elected MLA twice from Chenani – on a Congress ticket in 1977, and again in 1983 (at a time when elections were held in J&K every 6 years). He was later nominated to the Legislative Council too, during the Mufti Sayeed-led coalition government. He had also contested the 1997 Lok Sabha by-election from Udhampur, in which, despite leading by 30,000 votes at the end of counting, was declared to have lost in a repoll. The result was overturned by the J&K High Court after Singh challenged the decision.

Advertisement

After Bhim Singh’s death, the JKNPP split into two groups, one headed by P K Ganjoo, the other by Vilakshan Singh, his another nephew. Both factions have now filed their claims for recognition before the EC.

Vilakshan Singh said their efforts to bring back those who had left the party have yielded results, with the return of Harsh Dev Singh expected to boost the party further. Meanwhile, Hakikat Singh, general secretary of the Ganjoo-led faction, said theirs was a “duly elected group by the party’s working committee”.
Summary:
Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Harsh Dev Singh on Thursday quit the party and returned to the J&K National Panthers Party (JKNPP), which he had quit in May last year, a few days before the death of its founder and his uncle Bhim Singh.
Singh said he decided to leave the AAP as no one in the party was raising their voice over rising public problems on key issues like power, water, schools, ration and pension.
He added that no political party was raising their voice against the BJP as all of them, barring the Panthers Party, have some “vested interests”.
Kapoor added that Singh had unsuccessfully tried to convince the party leadership to scrap the existing AAP team and make him the party’s J&K chief.
The JKNPP, recognised by the Election Commission, was founded by Bhim Singh in 1982 as a splinter outfit of the Indian National Congress.
