Title: Tax not paid on certain remittances by BBC group entities, survey unearthed crucial evidence: Income-Tax Dept
Article:
Feb 18, 2023, 01:24AM IST

Source: TOI.in

A day after its survey at BBC offices in India ended, the Income-Tax department released a statement. The statement accuses BBC group entities of showing lower income/profits. It also claimed that crucial evidences were unearthed during the survey at the BBC offices in Delhi and Mumbai. The department also accused the media firm of using dilatory tactics during the tax survey.
Summary:
Feb 18, 2023, 01:24AM ISTSource: TOI.inA day after its survey at BBC offices in India ended, the Income-Tax department released a statement.
The statement accuses BBC group entities of showing lower income/profits.
It also claimed that crucial evidences were unearthed during the survey at the BBC offices in Delhi and Mumbai.
The department also accused the media firm of using dilatory tactics during the tax survey.

Meta_title: Jawan beaten to death by DMK councillor, sons and relatives in TN’s Krishnagiri district
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleIPL Slow Over Rate PenaltyOperation...
Title: Jawan beaten to death by DMK councillor, sons and relatives in TN’s Krishnagiri district
Article: KRISHNAGIRI: An Army jawan was beaten to death by a DMK councillor , his sons and relatives near Pochampally in Krishnagiri district of Tamil Nadu . The incident took place on February 8, and the jawan died on Tuesday night while undergoing treatment in a hospital in Hosur. On Wednesday, police arrested nine people, including the councillor, in connection with the murder.The deceased jawan has been identified as M Prabhu, 28, of Nagojanahalli.According to the Nagarasampatty police, Prabhu and his elder brother, M Prabhakaran, 30, who is also working in the Army, came to their native village on leave.On February 28, Prabhakaran's wife, Priya, 25, was washing her clothes at a public drinking water tap. R Chinnasamy, 50, who is a councillor (ward 1) in Nagojanahalli town panchayat, chided Priya for washing the clothes at the drinking water tap. "A verbal duel erupted between Priya and Chinnasamy," said a constable at the Nagarasampatty police station. Prabhakaran and his brother also joined the verbal duel supporting Priya. Villagers pacified both sides.Later, Chinnasamy went to the two jawans' house along with eight people -- his sons Rajapandi, 30, Guru Suriyamoorthy, 26, and Gunanithi, 23, and relatives Manikandan, 32, Mathaiyan, 60, Pulipandi, 24, Vediappan, 55, Kaliappan, 40 -- and attacked them with iron rods."Prabhu sustained head injuries," the constable said. Prabhakaran also suffered injuries.The family members admitted Prabhu to a private hospital in Hosur. "Prabhu succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday night," he added.Based on the complaint lodged by Prabhakaran, the Nagarasampatty police registered a case and arrested Chinnasamy and eight others.Suriyamoorthy, one of the arrested accused, is an armed reserve police constable working in Chennai.
Summary:
KRISHNAGIRI: An Army jawan was beaten to death by a DMK councillor , his sons and relatives near Pochampally in Krishnagiri district of Tamil Nadu .
The incident took place on February 8, and the jawan died on Tuesday night while undergoing treatment in a hospital in Hosur.
R Chinnasamy, 50, who is a councillor (ward 1) in Nagojanahalli town panchayat, chided Priya for washing the clothes at the drinking water tap.
"A verbal duel erupted between Priya and Chinnasamy," said a constable at the Nagarasampatty police station.
Prabhakaran also suffered injuries.The family members admitted Prabhu to a private hospital in Hosur.

Meta_title: Isis affiliate calls Pakistan 'Cancer in the name of Islam'
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Isis affiliate calls Pakistan 'Cancer in the name of Islam'
Article: NEW DELHI: Pakistan is no stranger to being berated on global platforms.The Islamic nation's doublespeaks and dubious track records- including on security matters, harbouring terrorists and nuclear proliferation- have in the past earned it epithets like "international migraine," "pathological liar," and more.Now, it has been called "A cancer state in the name of Islam"- not by a western diplomat, but an Islamic terrorist organisation.The Islamic State – Khorasan Province (ISKP), a regional affiliate of the dreaded Isis, has trained its guns on Pakistan’s religious scholars as well as its system of governance. In its ‘Khorasan Ghag’ magazine, ISKP has claimed that Pakistan is run by "an establishment which follows instructions from the United States."To buttress the claim, it cited the example of Imran Khan's ascension to, and ousting from power. It said Khan was brought into power through rigging and removed after he visited Russia. It added that Pakistan army chief Gen Asim Munir's recent visit to US was to "take orders."It has vowed to continue working against the Pakistani state and keep up its own agenda of jihad against "US agents."The magazine also dedicated substantial space to a recent confrontation between pakistani scholar Mufti Taqi Usmani, a proponent of so called "Islamic banking," and the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan's (TTP) Mufti Noor Wali.Usmani had slammed Wali and TTP for acting against the Pakistani state.Pakistan is a sanctuary for numerous Islamic militant organisations with overlapping and conflicting ideologies, allegiances and complicated inter-relations.The ISKP sprang out of dissenting Afghan Taliban, TTP and al-Qaida cadres in the Af-Pak region around 2015-15. It was also joined by some defectors from JuD, LeT and other extremist groups with presence in Pakistan. It has received support from the Islamic State’s core leadership in Iraq and Syria since its founding. It has been active in Afghanistan, Pakistan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan, and has claimed responsibility for several high-profile attacks.The ISKP, just like the TTP, targets the Pakistani state and its interests. It also tries to delegitimize the Afghan Taliban and undermine the latter's claims of restoring peace in Afghanistan.
Summary:
In its ‘Khorasan Ghag’ magazine, ISKP has claimed that Pakistan is run by "an establishment which follows instructions from the United States.
It added that Pakistan army chief Gen Asim Munir's recent visit to US was to "take orders.
"It has vowed to continue working against the Pakistani state and keep up its own agenda of jihad against "US agents.
It was also joined by some defectors from JuD, LeT and other extremist groups with presence in Pakistan.
It has been active in Afghanistan, Pakistan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan, and has claimed responsibility for several high-profile attacks.The ISKP, just like the TTP, targets the Pakistani state and its interests.

Meta_title: New policy will discourage drinking: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR...
Title: Singh Chouhan: Cm: New Policy Will Discourage Drinking
Article: BHOPAL: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Monday that it has been their endeavour to bring an excise policy which “discourages drinking”. I as CM had decided that no new liquor shops would be opened.Earlier, each time a new excise policy was declared, 150-300 new liquor shops would be proposed but we decided not to open new shops and the number of liquor shops in the state is static, he said.
Summary:
BHOPAL: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Monday that it has been their endeavour to bring an excise policy which “discourages drinking”.
I as CM had decided that no new liquor shops would be opened.Earlier, each time a new excise policy was declared, 150-300 new liquor shops would be proposed but we decided not to open new shops and the number of liquor shops in the state is static, he said.

Meta_title: RJD MLA Sudhaker Singh takes a dig at Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, posts a letter on farmers' issue
Meta_desc: PATNA: RJD MLA Sudhaker Singh, whose insolence had cost him his cabinet berth, on Saturday shot off an angry letter to chief minister Nitish Kumar alleging...
Title: RJD MLA Sudhaker Singh takes a dig at Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, posts a letter on farmers' issue
Article: PATNA: RJD MLA Sudhaker Singh , whose insolence had cost him his cabinet berth, on Saturday shot off an angry letter to chief minister Nitish Kumar alleging that the veteran leader had "lost trust of the people".The legislator, on whom the party had recently slapped a show-cause notice but stopped short of taking disciplinary action, shared his letter, running into three pages, on social media.The first-term MLA appeared to have taken to heart the CM's assertion the day before that his outbursts over farmers' woes in Bihar betrayed ignorance of the government's achievements in agriculture, a portfolio he had held for barely a couple of months.Singh, whose father Jagadanand Singh is the RJD's state president and a confidant of party supremo Lalu Prasad, signed off, tauntingly, as an "MLA with zero knowledge".In his lengthy note, Singh sought to rubbish the longest-serving CM's claims of agricultural growth, adding: "You seem to have developed a fondness for living in delusions. It may not affect your health but it is bad for the people."Singh, who was asked to resign as minister by deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav, son and heir apparent of Lalu, after he repeatedly attacked the government, twisted the knife in the penultimate para of his letter. "I agree with just one averment of yours that the people are supreme (janata maalik hai)", said Singh, referring to a stock-in-trade phrase used by the veteran JD(U) leader."Do choose any constituency that suits you in the next elections. The people will show you that they, indeed, are supreme and you have lost their trust," added the MLA.JD(U) chief spokesperson and MLC Neeraj Kumar came out with an angry video message as a riposte, which he shared on Twitter tagging the RJD MLA, his party, his father besides the deputy CM.Referring to a case pending against a rice mill owned by the MLA, which the BJP had flagged to oppose his induction into the state cabinet, Neeraj said, "You have been an accused in a case of 420 (cheating). The way you reeled out statistics to buttress your misleading points shows that you have become a 420 in your mind as well".Meanwhile, state BJP spokesman Nikhil Anand said, "In 2021, when we were alliance partners of JD(U), our MLC Tunnaji Pandey was suspended for speaking against Nitish ji. But today, the RJD is allowing Singh to have his way, The CM is looking helpless."
Summary:
It may not affect your health but it is bad for the people.
"Singh, who was asked to resign as minister by deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav, son and heir apparent of Lalu, after he repeatedly attacked the government, twisted the knife in the penultimate para of his letter.
"I agree with just one averment of yours that the people are supreme (janata maalik hai)", said Singh, referring to a stock-in-trade phrase used by the veteran JD(U) leader.
"Do choose any constituency that suits you in the next elections.
But today, the RJD is allowing Singh to have his way, The CM is looking helpless."

Meta_title: 2 injured in road rage, 11 booked in Ludhiana
Meta_desc: 2 injured in road rage, 11 booked in Ludhiana ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death...
Title: 2 injured in road rage, 11 booked in Ludhiana
Article: LUDHIANA: Two brothers landed in a hospital with serious injuries after becoming victims of a road rage in the city. Though the incident occurred on February 18, division number 6 police on Tuesday registered a case against a man and his accomplices for a murder bid.The victims - Ranjeet Singh and his brother Mandeep Singh of Janta Nagar - and the accused - Parminder Singh Sunny, Jatinder Singh Honey, Bawa of Janta Nagar and their eight unidentified accomplices - lived in the same locality, but didn't have any rivalry.The FIR was registered on the complaint of Kamaljeet Singh, brother of the victims.Kamaljeet alleged that he along with his brother Ranjeet Singh was returning home from their plant in Dhandari in their BMW around 9pm on February 18, when a Hyundai Verna car started honking from behind near Bhagwan chowk. As the man behind the wheels used abusive language against them, they stopped the car to confront the man for his behaviour."The accused alighted from the car and indulged in a verbal spat with them. Soon, the accused called his accomplices to the spot. I also called my brother Mandeep and friend Jagdeep Singh of Jaimal Road. Parminder hit Ranjeet in his head repeatedly after which Ranjeet fell unconscious. Other accused attacked Mandeep with iron rods before fleeing," Kamaljeet said. Inspector Satwant Singh, SHO, division number 6 police station, said police are conducting raids to arrest the accused.
Summary:
LUDHIANA: Two brothers landed in a hospital with serious injuries after becoming victims of a road rage in the city.
As the man behind the wheels used abusive language against them, they stopped the car to confront the man for his behaviour.
I also called my brother Mandeep and friend Jagdeep Singh of Jaimal Road.
Other accused attacked Mandeep with iron rods before fleeing," Kamaljeet said.
Inspector Satwant Singh, SHO, division number 6 police station, said police are conducting raids to arrest the accused.

Meta_title: Gautam Navlakha was in touch with man arrested by FBI in 2011 for receiving funds from Pakistan: NIA
Meta_desc: ... Covid News Live: India reports 9,629 Fresh Covid cases · Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan, Supreme Court asks Delhi police...
Title: Nia: Gautam Navlakha was in touch with man arrested by FBI in 2011 for receiving funds from Pakistan: NIA
Article: MUMBAI: Gautam Navlakha , Delhi-based activist arrested and accused of Maoist links in 2018 Elgar Parishad case, “was in touch with Ghulam Nabi Fai ’’ who the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had arrested in the US in July 2011 for accepting funds from ISI and Pakistan government, said the National Investigation Agency ( NIA ) opposing his bail application before the Bombay high court in the case under the special anti-terror law-- the Unlawful Activities (prevention) Act (UAPA).A July 19, 2011, release issued by the US Department of Justice stated, Fai is accused of a decades-long scheme with one purpose – to hide Pakistan’s involvement behind his efforts to influence the U.S. government’s position on Kashmir,” said U.S. Attorney MacBride . “His handlers in Pakistan allegedly funneled millions through the Kashmir Center to contribute to U.S. elected officials, fund high-profile conferences, and pay for other efforts that promoted the Kashmiri cause to decision-makers in Washington.” It said "Fai serves as the director of the Kashmiri American Council (KAC)".The NIA said Navlakha, 70, "is trying to portray his criminal activities as work for human rights’’ when he “actively involved in commission of offences he is charged with.’’The affidavit by NIA filed on Monday said during investigation it was established that Navlakha “visited USA thrice to address ‘Kashmiri American Council (KAC)conference organized by Ghulam Nabi Fai.’’ “It is established that Navlakha was introduced to a Pakistani ISI General for his recruitment by Ghulam Nabi Fai on the direction of Inter Services Intelligence (ISI), showing his nexus and complicity with …Fai and Pakistan ISI,’’ said the affidavit filed by NIA submitted before HC through its counsel Sandesh Patil .The NIA sought time and Navlakha’s plea for bail, filed last year, was adjourned by the HC bench of Justices AS Gadkari and P D Naik , to next Monday. Navlakha, who has worked on fact finding missions and written articles, is presently under house arrest, following orders of the Supreme Court which permitted his plea last November on grounds of his ill health.Navlakha had written and submitted letters on behalf of Fai, the Judge of the US court trying Fai’s case, for clemency, said the NIA. The agency said scrutiny of documents seized from Navlakha shows they are related to CPI (Maoist) strategy, party formation, “critical secret communication with underground senior leaders of the Party which establishes his deep involvement the activities of CPI (Maoist) party.’’A search of co-accused professor Hany Babu’s premises revealed the code names given to CPI (Maoist ) cadre, said the NIA which had filed its additional charge sheet against Navlakha and others, on October 9, 2020 invoking offences inkling waging war, sedition and terror-offences under UAPA.The NIA cited and referred to various letters recovered from Navlakha and his co-accused to oppose his bail plea and to argue that it has “sufficient material evidence on record to substantiate the charges against him’’ which he is trying to “trivialise’’.The NIA said in April 2010 one letter addressed to him and two others about their visit to Dandkarnya (DK), an advancing guerrilla zone of revolutionary movement by CPI (Maoist). A letter from the laptop of co-accused Surendra Gadling to Navlakha regarding a programme at Hyderabad arranged by co-accused Varavara Rao (presently on medical bail).The NIA said CPI (Maoist) members who are in a fact finding team have a well known practice of giving a negative report on lawful ‘anti-naxal operations’ to gain sympathy from general public and to create “hatred against lawfully established government.’’
Summary:
MUMBAI: Gautam Navlakha , Delhi-based activist arrested and accused of Maoist links in 2018 Elgar Parishad case, “was in touch with Ghulam Nabi Fai ’’ who the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had arrested in the US in July 2011 for accepting funds from ISI and Pakistan government, said the National Investigation Agency ( NIA ) opposing his bail application before the Bombay high court in the case under the special anti-terror law-- the Unlawful Activities (prevention) Act (UAPA).A July 19, 2011, release issued by the US Department of Justice stated, Fai is accused of a decades-long scheme with one purpose – to hide Pakistan’s involvement behind his efforts to influence the U.S. government’s position on Kashmir,” said U.S. Attorney MacBride .
“His handlers in Pakistan allegedly funneled millions through the Kashmir Center to contribute to U.S. elected officials, fund high-profile conferences, and pay for other efforts that promoted the Kashmiri cause to decision-makers in Washington.” It said "Fai serves as the director of the Kashmiri American Council (KAC)".The NIA said Navlakha, 70, "is trying to portray his criminal activities as work for human rights’’ when he “actively involved in commission of offences he is charged with.’’The affidavit by NIA filed on Monday said during investigation it was established that Navlakha “visited USA thrice to address ‘Kashmiri American Council (KAC)conference organized by Ghulam Nabi Fai.’’ “It is established that Navlakha was introduced to a Pakistani ISI General for his recruitment by Ghulam Nabi Fai on the direction of Inter Services Intelligence (ISI), showing his nexus and complicity with …Fai and Pakistan ISI,’’ said the affidavit filed by NIA submitted before HC through its counsel Sandesh Patil .The NIA sought time and Navlakha’s plea for bail, filed last year, was adjourned by the HC bench of Justices AS Gadkari and P D Naik , to next Monday.
Navlakha, who has worked on fact finding missions and written articles, is presently under house arrest, following orders of the Supreme Court which permitted his plea last November on grounds of his ill health.Navlakha had written and submitted letters on behalf of Fai, the Judge of the US court trying Fai’s case, for clemency, said the NIA.
The agency said scrutiny of documents seized from Navlakha shows they are related to CPI (Maoist) strategy, party formation, “critical secret communication with underground senior leaders of the Party which establishes his deep involvement the activities of CPI (Maoist) party.’’A search of co-accused professor Hany Babu’s premises revealed the code names given to CPI (Maoist ) cadre, said the NIA which had filed its additional charge sheet against Navlakha and others, on October 9, 2020 invoking offences inkling waging war, sedition and terror-offences under UAPA.The NIA cited and referred to various letters recovered from Navlakha and his co-accused to oppose his bail plea and to argue that it has “sufficient material evidence on record to substantiate the charges against him’’ which he is trying to “trivialise’’.The NIA said in April 2010 one letter addressed to him and two others about their visit to Dandkarnya (DK), an advancing guerrilla zone of revolutionary movement by CPI (Maoist).
A letter from the laptop of co-accused Surendra Gadling to Navlakha regarding a programme at Hyderabad arranged by co-accused Varavara Rao (presently on medical bail).The NIA said CPI (Maoist) members who are in a fact finding team have a well known practice of giving a negative report on lawful ‘anti-naxal operations’ to gain sympathy from general public and to create “hatred against lawfully established government.’’

Meta_title: Toshakhana case: Anti-graft body summons Imran
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Toshakhana case: Anti-graft body summons Imran
Article: ISLAMABAD: Pakistan's anti-corruption watchdog on Tuesday summoned former PM Imran Khan to appear before it on March 9 in connection with the Toshakhana scam related to purchase of gifts from the state depository by him. The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) summoned the PTI chief hours after the watchdog's chairman, Aftab Sultan, resigned from his post after reportedly refusing "to toe the government's line". Sultan, according to media reports, was asked to do certain things that were unacceptable to him.The NAB's inquiry proceedings revealed that Imran retained some state gifts presented to him by various foreign dignitaries during his tenure as prime minister. These included five Rolex wrist watches, one iPhone , pairs of cufflinks, two rings, an unstitched suit and a pen.The watchdog asked him to appear before the combined investigation team at its Islamabad office and record his statement. The NAB had opened an inquiry against Imran after the election commission disqualified him in October last year in the Toshakhana reference, declaring him "dishonest and untrustworthy" for making "false statement and incorrect declaration" before the poll body in the statement of assets and liabilities filed by him for 2020-21.
Summary:
ISLAMABAD: Pakistan's anti-corruption watchdog on Tuesday summoned former PM Imran Khan to appear before it on March 9 in connection with the Toshakhana scam related to purchase of gifts from the state depository by him.
The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) summoned the PTI chief hours after the watchdog's chairman, Aftab Sultan, resigned from his post after reportedly refusing "to toe the government's line".
Sultan, according to media reports, was asked to do certain things that were unacceptable to him.The NAB's inquiry proceedings revealed that Imran retained some state gifts presented to him by various foreign dignitaries during his tenure as prime minister.
These included five Rolex wrist watches, one iPhone , pairs of cufflinks, two rings, an unstitched suit and a pen.The watchdog asked him to appear before the combined investigation team at its Islamabad office and record his statement.
The NAB had opened an inquiry against Imran after the election commission disqualified him in October last year in the Toshakhana reference, declaring him "dishonest and untrustworthy" for making "false statement and incorrect declaration" before the poll body in the statement of assets and liabilities filed by him for 2020-21.

Meta_title: Pakistan's current account deficit shrinks 90% in Jan: State Bank of Pakistan
Meta_desc: Pakistan's current account deficit shrinks 90% in Jan: State Bank of Pakistan ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police.
Title: Pakistan: Pakistan's current account deficit shrinks 90% in Jan: State Bank of Pakistan
Article: ISLAMABAD: The State Bank of Pakistan ( SBP ) said the country's current account deficit shrank by 90 per cent in January from the same month last year as the government continued with its strategy to restrict imports to evade an external payment crisis.Pakistan's current account deficit fell to $0.24 billion in January from $2.47 billion in the same month of the previous year, recording a 90.3 per cent decrease, Xinhua news agency reported citing SBP data.On a month-on-month basis, the current account deficit went down from $0.29 billion in December 2022, showing a 17 per cent decrease, according to the data.Cumulatively, the current account deficit stood at $3.80 billion in July-January of the current fiscal year 2023, compared with $11.56 billion in the same period of the fiscal year 2022, the central bank added.
Summary: ISLAMABAD: The State Bank of Pakistan ( SBP ) said the country's current account deficit shrank by 90 per cent in January from the same month last year as the government continued with its strategy to restrict imports to evade an external payment crisis.Pakistan's current account deficit fell to $0.24 billion in January from $2.47 billion in the same month of the previous year, recording a 90.3 per cent decrease, Xinhua news agency reported citing SBP data.On a month-on-month basis, the current account deficit went down from $0.29 billion in December 2022, showing a 17 per cent decrease, according to the data.Cumulatively, the current account deficit stood at $3.80 billion in July-January of the current fiscal year 2023, compared with $11.56 billion in the same period of the fiscal year 2022, the central bank added.

Meta_title: Prelude to Kumbh: Over 9 crore took holy dip this Magh Mela
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Magh Mela: Prelude to Kumbh: Over 9 crore took holy dip this Magh Mela
Article: LUCKNOW: In a record of sorts, as many as nine crore devotees visited the Sangam during the 44-day Magh Mela this year, a government spokesperson said on Sunday."The state government had decided to organize this year's Magh Mela, the biggest annual religious and cultural gathering of faith on the banks of Sangam, as a rehearsal for Prayagraj Mahakumbh 2025," the spokesperson added.To make this event grand, the government had allocated the biggest budget for any Magh Mela till date, he said, adding that CM Yogi Adityanath personally monitored the event.Magh Mela police in-charge and SP, Rajeev Narayan Mishra , said more than nine crore devotees took a dip during Magh Mela."This is the largest number of devotees recorded so far in Magh Mela which is a record of sorts. In 2021-22, 4.3 crore devotees had attended the Magh Mela. Many experiments, security and cleanliness arrangements were made by the state government," he said. Officials said that huge crowd also gave boost to business.According to the state president of the Confederation of All India Traders (CAT), Mahendra Goyal, there has been a trade of about Rs 156 crore in this year's Magh Mela. Apart from this, due to the Magh Mela of Prayagraj, the business situation has strengthened in the areas around the pilgrimage sites like Varanasi, Ayodhya and Vindhyachal.Goyal said that over 2 lakh people got temporary employment during Magh Mela, which was a big achievement.
Summary:
LUCKNOW: In a record of sorts, as many as nine crore devotees visited the Sangam during the 44-day Magh Mela this year, a government spokesperson said on Sunday.
"This is the largest number of devotees recorded so far in Magh Mela which is a record of sorts.
In 2021-22, 4.3 crore devotees had attended the Magh Mela.
Officials said that huge crowd also gave boost to business.According to the state president of the Confederation of All India Traders (CAT), Mahendra Goyal, there has been a trade of about Rs 156 crore in this year's Magh Mela.
Apart from this, due to the Magh Mela of Prayagraj, the business situation has strengthened in the areas around the pilgrimage sites like Varanasi, Ayodhya and Vindhyachal.Goyal said that over 2 lakh people got temporary employment during Magh Mela, which was a big achievement.

Meta_title: China diplomat says Russia ties 'rock solid'; Xi may visit Moscow
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Russia: China diplomat says Russia ties 'rock solid'; Xi may visit Moscow
Article: MOSCOW: China's top diplomat told one of President Putin 's closest allies on Tuesday that Beijing's relationship with Moscow was "rock solid". China's "no limits" partnership with Russia has come under scrutiny in the West after the US said it was concerned that Beijing might be considering supplying weapons to Russia a year since the invasion of Ukraine.At a meeting in Moscow, Wang Yi told Nikolai Patrushev, secretary of Russia's powerful Security Council, that he looked forward to discussions about security. "Chinese-Russian relations are mature in character: they are rock solid and will withstand any test in a changing international situation," Wang told "Comrade" Patrushev through a Russian interpreter in remarks aired on state television. Wang said Russia and China should work out new joint steps to ensure the security of both countries, without elaborating.Patrushev, who is close to Putin, told "Comrade" Wang that Beijing was a top priority for Russian foreign policy and that the two countries must stick together against the West. "In the context of a campaign that is being waged by the collective West to contain both Russia and China, the further deepening of Russian-Chinese cooperation in the international arena is of particular importance," RIA cited Patrushev.Meanwhile, Chinese President Xi Jinping is preparing to visit Moscow for a summit with Putin in the coming months, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the plan. Preparations for the trip are at an early stage and the timing has not been finalised, the WSJ said, adding that Xi could visit in April or early May, when Russia celebrates its WWII victory.
Summary:
MOSCOW: China's top diplomat told one of President Putin 's closest allies on Tuesday that Beijing's relationship with Moscow was "rock solid".
China's "no limits" partnership with Russia has come under scrutiny in the West after the US said it was concerned that Beijing might be considering supplying weapons to Russia a year since the invasion of Ukraine.At a meeting in Moscow, Wang Yi told Nikolai Patrushev, secretary of Russia's powerful Security Council, that he looked forward to discussions about security.
"Chinese-Russian relations are mature in character: they are rock solid and will withstand any test in a changing international situation," Wang told "Comrade" Patrushev through a Russian interpreter in remarks aired on state television.
Wang said Russia and China should work out new joint steps to ensure the security of both countries, without elaborating.Patrushev, who is close to Putin, told "Comrade" Wang that Beijing was a top priority for Russian foreign policy and that the two countries must stick together against the West.
Preparations for the trip are at an early stage and the timing has not been finalised, the WSJ said, adding that Xi could visit in April or early May, when Russia celebrates its WWII victory.

Meta_title: Three teenage girls and gunman dead in Texas shooting
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleOperation KaveriKarnataka Election...
Title: Three teenage girls and gunman dead in Texas shooting
Article: GALENA PARK: Authorities say three teenage girls, including one who was pregnant, were fatally shot by man who also sexually assaulted a 12-year-old girl who later escaped then fatally shot himself.No names have been released.The killings occurred at the home of the gunman 's girlfriend in the Houston suburb of Galena Park at about 10:30 p.m. Saturday.The girls who were killed were 19, 14 and 13, according to Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez.The 38-year-old man then attacked the 12-year-old and then told her to run out of the house, Gonzalez said. She grabbed a 1-year-old baby girl and fled.“She ran out of the residence without any clothing” to the home of a neighbor, who called Galena Park police.“When she ran out she managed to think about it, thankfully, and was able to grab the 1-year-old and ran away,” Gonzalez said.Both girls were hospitalized for treatment of injuries that were not life-threatening, according to a statement from Galena Park police. The investigation has been turned over to the sheriff's department.Authorities did not immediately return messages to The Associated Press for additional comment on Sunday.Gonzalez said the man’s girlfriend was the mother of the 12-year-old and the 19-year-old. The older victim was the mother of the baby and was pregnant. The sheriff said the girlfriend was not at home at the time of the shootings.The sheriff said authorities were working to determine the relationships of the other two teenagers who were shot but described them as family members.Gonzalez offered no suspected motive for the shooting , saying it “makes no sense, it's all tragic.”The U.S. has seen a deadly start to 2023, including six mass killings in a three-week period in January, according to an Associated Press/USA Today database. It defines a mass killing as four or more people dead, not including the perpetrator.Six people were killed in a mass shooting Friday in Mississippi and there have been a number of mass shootings in which fewer people were slain, such as Monday’s shooting at Michigan State University in which three people were killed and five were wounded.
Summary:
GALENA PARK: Authorities say three teenage girls, including one who was pregnant, were fatally shot by man who also sexually assaulted a 12-year-old girl who later escaped then fatally shot himself.No names have been released.The killings occurred at the home of the gunman 's girlfriend in the Houston suburb of Galena Park at about 10:30 p.m. Saturday.The girls who were killed were 19, 14 and 13, according to Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez.The 38-year-old man then attacked the 12-year-old and then told her to run out of the house, Gonzalez said.
She grabbed a 1-year-old baby girl and fled.“She ran out of the residence without any clothing” to the home of a neighbor, who called Galena Park police.“When she ran out she managed to think about it, thankfully, and was able to grab the 1-year-old and ran away,” Gonzalez said.Both girls were hospitalized for treatment of injuries that were not life-threatening, according to a statement from Galena Park police.
The investigation has been turned over to the sheriff's department.Authorities did not immediately return messages to The Associated Press for additional comment on Sunday.Gonzalez said the man’s girlfriend was the mother of the 12-year-old and the 19-year-old.
The older victim was the mother of the baby and was pregnant.
It defines a mass killing as four or more people dead, not including the perpetrator.Six people were killed in a mass shooting Friday in Mississippi and there have been a number of mass shootings in which fewer people were slain, such as Monday’s shooting at Michigan State University in which three people were killed and five were wounded.

Meta_title: Pakistan police identify TTP terrorists involved in Karachi Police chief's office attack
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleIndia China LACAmritpal SinghKedarnath...
Title: Pakistan police identify TTP terrorists involved in Karachi Police chief's office attack
Article: PESHAWAR: Heavily-armed Pakistani Taliban militants who carried out an audacious attack on the office of the Karachi Police chief have been identified as residents of two tribal districts in northwest Pakistan bordering Afghanistan, police said on Sunday.The incident took place at 7.10 pm local time on Friday, during which Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) terrorists stormed the five-storey Karachi Police Office (KPO) building situated in the country's most populous city.The outlawed Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack in a statement issued by its spokesperson Mohammad Khurasani.In the hours-long operation between the Pakistan police commandos and paramilitary soldiers, three TTP terrorists were killed and four others, including three security personnel, also lost their lives.According to police, terrorists Zala Noor and Kifayatullah were identified as residents of north Waziristan and Lakki Marwat districts respectively.Both terrorists conducted complete recce of the location for a month before the attack. They wanted to target the Additional IG office in the police office, they said.Police conducted a raid at the house of alleged terrorist Kifayatullah in his village Wanda Ameer in Lakki Marwat district on Saturday and interrogated his family members.Kifataullah (in his 20s) had fled from home five months ago and since then the family were not aware of his whereabouts.The family members said they came to know about Kifayatullah's presence in Pakistan after the Karachi blast as they were expecting him in Afghanistan.Police sources said Kifayatullah was a trained terrorist and had a history of frequent visits to Afghanistan.He fought in the Afghan war from the Taliban side and had affiliation with TTP's Tipu Gul group, they said.Pakistan's law-enforcement agencies and the Sindh government will conduct a “security audit” into the serious security lapses that led to the attack.Security officials agreed the attack had raised several questions and a ‘proper exercise' was needed that included a ‘security audit', according to a media report said on Saturday.
Summary:
PESHAWAR: Heavily-armed Pakistani Taliban militants who carried out an audacious attack on the office of the Karachi Police chief have been identified as residents of two tribal districts in northwest Pakistan bordering Afghanistan, police said on Sunday.The incident took place at 7.10 pm local time on Friday, during which Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) terrorists stormed the five-storey Karachi Police Office (KPO) building situated in the country's most populous city.The outlawed Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack in a statement issued by its spokesperson Mohammad Khurasani.In the hours-long operation between the Pakistan police commandos and paramilitary soldiers, three TTP terrorists were killed and four others, including three security personnel, also lost their lives.According to police, terrorists Zala Noor and Kifayatullah were identified as residents of north Waziristan and Lakki Marwat districts respectively.Both terrorists conducted complete recce of the location for a month before the attack.
They wanted to target the Additional IG office in the police office, they said.Police conducted a raid at the house of alleged terrorist Kifayatullah in his village Wanda Ameer in Lakki Marwat district on Saturday and interrogated his family members.Kifataullah (in his 20s) had fled from home five months ago and since then the family were not aware of his whereabouts.The family members said they came to know about Kifayatullah's presence in Pakistan after the Karachi blast as they were expecting him in Afghanistan.Police sources said Kifayatullah was a trained terrorist and had a history of frequent visits to Afghanistan.He fought in the Afghan war from the Taliban side and had affiliation with TTP's Tipu Gul group, they said.Pakistan's law-enforcement agencies and the Sindh government will conduct a “security audit” into the serious security lapses that led to the attack.Security officials agreed the attack had raised several questions and a ‘proper exercise' was needed that included a ‘security audit', according to a media report said on Saturday.

Meta_title: How Taliban plan to use former foreign military bases in Afghanistan
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... Singh Badal DeathSame Sex MarriagePM Modi in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath...
Title: Taliban: How Taliban plan to use former foreign military bases in Afghanistan
Article:
(With inputs from agencies)

Afghanistan: Taliban plans to turn former foreign military bases into SEZs

NEW DELHI: The Taliban regime in Afghanistan is planning to convert former foreign military bases into special economic zones to promote economic activities Acting deputy prime minister for economic affairs Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar said on Sunday that the ministry of industry and commerce will take control of the military bases of foreign forces "with the intention of converting them into special economic zones".Under a pilot plan, foreign military bases in the capital Kabul and in northern Balkh province will be converted into economic zones, according to a report by Reuters.In December last year, the acting commerce minister had said he was was working on a plan for former American and Nato military bases.Afghanistan's economy has been struggling ever since the Taliban took over in 2021 as foreign troops withdrew after 20 years of war.Aid agencies have warned there is an impending humanitarian crisis as the takeover sparked a cut in development funding, freezing of foreign-held central bank assets and sanctions on the banking sector.The Taliban administration's decision to curtail the rights of women has further isolated the country from the international stage. Its move to bar women from working in NGOs exacerbated the problem as most aid agencies suspended operations in the crisis-hit nation.The Taliban have said they are focused on boosting economic self-sufficiency through trade and investment. Some foreign investors, however, have expressed concerns over a series of attacks, including at a hotel popular with Chinese businessmen, claimed by the Islamic State .The World Bank though has noted that exports rose and the Taliban administration managed to keep revenues largely steady in 2022.
Summary:
(With inputs from agencies)Afghanistan: Taliban plans to turn former foreign military bases into SEZsNEW DELHI: The Taliban regime in Afghanistan is planning to convert former foreign military bases into special economic zones to promote economic activities Acting deputy prime minister for economic affairs Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar said on Sunday that the ministry of industry and commerce will take control of the military bases of foreign forces "with the intention of converting them into special economic zones".Under a pilot plan, foreign military bases in the capital Kabul and in northern Balkh province will be converted into economic zones, according to a report by Reuters.In December last year, the acting commerce minister had said he was was working on a plan for former American and Nato military bases.Afghanistan's economy has been struggling ever since the Taliban took over in 2021 as foreign troops withdrew after 20 years of war.Aid agencies have warned there is an impending humanitarian crisis as the takeover sparked a cut in development funding, freezing of foreign-held central bank assets and sanctions on the banking sector.The Taliban administration's decision to curtail the rights of women has further isolated the country from the international stage.
Its move to bar women from working in NGOs exacerbated the problem as most aid agencies suspended operations in the crisis-hit nation.The Taliban have said they are focused on boosting economic self-sufficiency through trade and investment.
Some foreign investors, however, have expressed concerns over a series of attacks, including at a hotel popular with Chinese businessmen, claimed by the Islamic State .The World Bank though has noted that exports rose and the Taliban administration managed to keep revenues largely steady in 2022.

Meta_title: Asian indoor medallist triple jumper Praveen Chithravel overcomes field & cold to land on podium
Meta_desc: Late-night chaos at Jantar Mantar as protesting wrestlers claim police ma... Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence. Probing allegations against Brij...
Title: Asian indoor medallist triple jumper Praveen Chithravel overcomes field & cold to land on podium
Article:
From training at the warm and cosy IIS facilities in Bellary, Karnataka to competing in Nur Sultan, Kazakhstan at the Asian Indoor Championships itself was half the battle won for triple jumper Praveen Chithravel. Chithravel returned with a silver, his first major international medal, with a best effort of 16.98m less than a fortnight ago.

The 21-year-old, who has spent most of his life in Southern India, admits he has an aversion to cold weather. It was no less than a nightmare for him to land in Nur Sultan when the minimum temperature was dipping below -24* C.

“Forget training outside, it was so cold out there that you couldn’t even walk a few hundred metres out there,” says Chithravel, who is still in the middle of his off-season training. The Tamil Nadu athlete didn’t even have the luxury of time to get himself acclimatised to the massive difference in weather – landing from 30* C to -25* C.

“Forget training outside, it was so cold out there that you couldn’t even walk a few hundred metres out there,” says Chithravel, who is still in the middle of his off-season training. “Forget training outside, it was so cold out there that you couldn’t even walk a few hundred metres out there,” says Chithravel, who is still in the middle of his off-season training.

A couple of years ago, a younger Chithravel would have given up hopes of doing well at the first sight of Nur Sultan’s unforgiving weather. But, in his own words, he’s a different person now. “That’s the difference between a normal athlete and a professional athlete. Everything has changed, I have changed. I have realised how minute the difference between winning and losing is,” he says.

At Nur Sultan, Chithravel landed on the day of his competition, which turned out to be a blessing in disguise. His team cracked the code with a very simple approach: stay indoors. “From the airport to the hotel, from the hotel bus to the indoor stadium. I tried my best to not expose myself to the weather outside,” says Chithravel, who was holed up in his hotel room for hours before the competition. Whenever he lands in a new city for a competition, he likes to venture out and explore the surroundings, but couldn’t take that risk in Kazakhstan.

“My foreign training stints have taught me to think and work like a professional. I have observed how disciplined and focused top athletes are. I asked myself why I have come here. The answer was, to compete. So I was clear that I wasn’t going to step out until my competition gets over,” says Chithravel.

He made up for his time indoors post his meet, evident by his snow-filled Instagram reels.

Advertisement

Chithravel has been training under two-time world championship medallist Cuban Yoandri Betanzos for almost a year now at JSW’s IIS facilities in Bellary. Chithravel has been training under two-time world championship medallist Cuban Yoandri Betanzos for almost a year now at JSW’s IIS facilities in Bellary.

Steady progress

Chithravel has been training under two-time world championship medallist Cuban Yoandri Betanzos for almost a year at JSW’s IIS facilities in Bellary. Betanzos’ power-first approach seems to be working well for Chithravel, who has added zing to his technique since the Cuban’s arrival.

“My training has improved immensely. He focuses both on power and technique. He corrected the way I was lifting my feet during jumps and that has helped me add more explosiveness,” says Chithravel. Despite the silver medal, Chithravel feels he is a work in progress and nowhere close to realising his true potential. “It’s been just a year with coach Betanzos and there are plenty of things to improve in my jump,” he says.

Advertisement

The Asian indoor silver has come as a balm for Chithravel, who missed the bronze at the 2022 Commonwealth Games by just 3cms. If he had won a medal at Birmingham, it would have been a podium sweep for India with Eldhose Paul and Aboobacker winning gold and silver respectively.

“I was obviously shattered that I missed the medal by such a small margin. It wasn’t that 3cm that bothered me but my technique and approach. If I had landed the jump the way I had trained, those three centimetres wouldn’t have mattered. That day, I realised how important every single aspect of your jump is,” he says.

Chithravel has been on the circuit for a while and his outgoing nature has made him popular among athletes. He admits that he was a little too casual during his early days as an athlete. “It is not just the training but everything. I used to sleep at around 12 earlier but now I am off to bed at 10. I have limited my social media use and never miss training,” he says.

But the biggest and toughest change, as per the youngster, has been controlling his diet. Chithravel loves his seafood with a generous amount of spice. “At IIS, we get fish but it’s bland. However, that’s the best for my body. Oh, then there’s biryani, crabs, prawns (lists out a complete menu)… But now I have to keep a check on my eating habits. I am a professional now.”
Summary:
From training at the warm and cosy IIS facilities in Bellary, Karnataka to competing in Nur Sultan, Kazakhstan at the Asian Indoor Championships itself was half the battle won for triple jumper Praveen Chithravel.
At Nur Sultan, Chithravel landed on the day of his competition, which turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
I tried my best to not expose myself to the weather outside,” says Chithravel, who was holed up in his hotel room for hours before the competition.
Chithravel has been training under two-time world championship medallist Cuban Yoandri Betanzos for almost a year now at JSW’s IIS facilities in Bellary.
Despite the silver medal, Chithravel feels he is a work in progress and nowhere close to realising his true potential.

Meta_title: PVL: Ahmedabad Defenders crush Chennai Blitz
Meta_desc: Wrestlers' protest politically motivated: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh · Badminton Asia Championships: Satwik-Chirag pair create history by entering final.
Title: PVL: Ahmedabad Defenders crush Chennai Blitz
Article:
Hyderabad: Ahmedabad Defenders picked up their third win in a row in the second season of the Prime Volleyball League after beating the Chennai Blitz 15-11, 15-13, 15-10, 15-9, 15-12 at the Gachibowli Indoor Stadium in Hyderabad on Sunday.

Nandagopal Subramaniyam was named the Player of the Match for his eye-catching performance.

Chennai Blitz took charge with Akhin leading the middle with his spirited attacks. But middle blocker LM Manoj levelled the playing field for Ahmedabad Defenders with ferocious blocks. Danial Moatazedi's hard spikes gave Chennai no breathing room.

As the game became a battle of the middle, Akhin's role became crucial for the Blitz. Chennai's strategy to switch Jobin Varghese to the left side helped Blitz but Manoj and Nandagopal kept Ahmedabad ahead with consistent blocks. With spike errors from Angamuthu and Santhosh, Ahmedabad Defenders started leaking points.

Moyo and Renato constantly started switching directions, giving Blitz an opening. Buta perfectly-executed combo move between skipper Muthusamy Appavu and Angamuthu shut down Chennai's rebellion and the Defenders took control of the proceedings.

Muthusamy kept delivering the ball to his attackers in the middle, despite getting in awkward positions, at times. Danial's towering presence only added to Chennai's worries Akhin kept trying to create an impact from the middle for Chennai but found little support and Ahmedabad closed down the game within straight sets.

With the opportunity to climb to the top position with a 5-0 win, the Defenders went all in. Nandagopal kept getting better and Chennai found no replies to his powerful serves, and Ahmedabad completed the clean sweep win to get 3 points from the match.

Kolkata Thunderbolts will be up against Mumbai Meteors and Ahmedabad Defenders will be up against Calicut Heroes on Monday.
Summary:
Chennai Blitz took charge with Akhin leading the middle with his spirited attacks.
But middle blocker LM Manoj levelled the playing field for Ahmedabad Defenders with ferocious blocks.
Chennai's strategy to switch Jobin Varghese to the left side helped Blitz but Manoj and Nandagopal kept Ahmedabad ahead with consistent blocks.
With spike errors from Angamuthu and Santhosh, Ahmedabad Defenders started leaking points.
Kolkata Thunderbolts will be up against Mumbai Meteors and Ahmedabad Defenders will be up against Calicut Heroes on Monday.

Meta_title: CBI submits to court how agents mopped up ₹10cr from SSC aspirants
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: CBI submits to court how agents mopped up ₹10cr from SSC aspirants
Article: Kolkata: Three agents, arrested by CBI in connection to the SSC cash-for-job scam, collected Rs 10 crore from aspiring candidates, the CBI told the court on Monday. The three accused Shahid Imam, Ali Imam and Kaushik Ghosh pleaded to record their statements under 164 CrPC.The CBI on Monday produced Shahid, Ali, Kaushik and Abdul Khalek at the special CBI court in Kolkata. Shahid was sent to judicial custody a day after he was arrested. The judge sent the others to judicial custody till March 2.Present at the court of judge Arpan Chatterjee, the CBI submitted that Shahid, Ali and Kaushik were operating in connivance with Prasanna Roy. Prasanna, who was already arrested by CBI, allegedly used to take money from Chandan Mandal, alias Ranjan and hand over the amount to “influential persons” in the network, CBI said.The CBI so far has found that Ali mopped up Rs 6.7 crore, Shahid collected Rs 1.4 crore and Kaushik collected Rs 1.9 crore from aspiring candidates.During searches, officials retrieved a laptop and a mobile phone. These gadgets might also help to dig deeper into the network of agents and sub-agents, the CBI said.Tapas Mandal, who was also taken to the court on Monday alleged that he had demanded Rs 19.5 crore from Kuntal Ghosh that he had collected from the market. “It is not Rs 50 lakh. I demanded Rs 19.5 crore from him. I have not taken any money. I demanded money from him (Kuntal). I demanded the money Kuntal was paid. I have been turned into an accused because I have accused several persons in the case,” he said before being taken to the court.The judge on Monday asked the CBI why they are not taking S P Sinha in police custody for further interrogation when many of the accused persons were being linked directly to him.“Are you trying to prepare paneer-butter masala without paneer?” the judge observed. The CBI said that they are at a crucial juncture of the investigation.The judge on Monday sent Tapas, Kuntal and Niladri to CBI custody till February 23. While coming out of the court Kuntal said that his allegations proved to be true after CBI made recent arrests.Another CBI team questioned Shyamal Sen, an alleged collection agent of Tapas, at his Baruipara residence on Monday. The investigating agency has also got some more names – Hriday Saha and Prabhakar Jana – who allegedly used to work for Tapas.Arrested actor and producer Sk Shahid also told the investigating agency that he would make a magisterial statement on how the proceeds of the ill-gotten money school recruitments made their way to the entertainment and film industry.
Summary:
Kolkata: Three agents, arrested by CBI in connection to the SSC cash-for-job scam, collected Rs 10 crore from aspiring candidates, the CBI told the court on Monday.
The three accused Shahid Imam, Ali Imam and Kaushik Ghosh pleaded to record their statements under 164 CrPC.The CBI on Monday produced Shahid, Ali, Kaushik and Abdul Khalek at the special CBI court in Kolkata.
I demanded Rs 19.5 crore from him.
I demanded the money Kuntal was paid.
While coming out of the court Kuntal said that his allegations proved to be true after CBI made recent arrests.Another CBI team questioned Shyamal Sen, an alleged collection agent of Tapas, at his Baruipara residence on Monday.

Meta_title: Gujarat RERA posts vacant, 150 projects in limbo
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Gujrera: Gujrera Posts Vacant, 150 Projects In Limbo
Article: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat Real Estate Regulatory Authority ( GujRERA ) has not had two of the mandatory three members appointed for a month and a half now. Due to this, no new projects have received RERA registration numbers.According to sources in the body, there are 150-odd new project files awaiting approval, apart from over 250 complaints pending with the authority.Real estate developers are demanding that the state government appoint the RERA chairman and two members, even on an in-charge basis, so that regular functioning of the authority can continue.According to sources, the post of GujRERA chairman has been vacant since November 2022, when Amarjit Singh retired. After that, RERA member D P Joshi also retired, so the authority currently has only one member. According to the rules, only the chairman and two RERA members can approve projects.CREDAI Ahmedabad president Tejas Joshi said, “No new project has been given a RERA registration number since mid-January because the authority does not have the full committee. We demand that the project approval process be started as soon as possible.”Sources said some 150 projects have completed all necessary processes but are still without registration numbers and are thus unable to open bookings. This could potentially have serious financial implications for such developers.
Summary:
AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat Real Estate Regulatory Authority ( GujRERA ) has not had two of the mandatory three members appointed for a month and a half now.
After that, RERA member D P Joshi also retired, so the authority currently has only one member.
According to the rules, only the chairman and two RERA members can approve projects.CREDAI Ahmedabad president Tejas Joshi said, “No new project has been given a RERA registration number since mid-January because the authority does not have the full committee.
We demand that the project approval process be started as soon as possible.”Sources said some 150 projects have completed all necessary processes but are still without registration numbers and are thus unable to open bookings.
This could potentially have serious financial implications for such developers.

Meta_title: SUV driver failed to control steering on flyover’s curve
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: SUV driver failed to control steering on flyover’s curve
Article: Lucknow: Three gym trainers were killed and one injured after the SUV they were riding flipped and fell from a 30-foott high flyover in Lucknow in the early hours of Sunday.A 40-second CCTV footage of the accident got viral on social media which shows the speeding SUV collapsing from the flyover.Around 12.45 am, when they reached the middle of Polytechnic flyover cruising around 120 km/hour, Amit Kumar who was on the steering failed to control the vehicle on the sudden sharp-horizontal curve of the flyover, making the ill-fated SUV ram into the cement concrete barrier and within seconds crash-landing on the Munshipuliya road, causing a loud thud, and bringing the thin traffic to a grinding halt, said the police.The police received the first call in the control room about the accident from the injured victim Harsh Shukla. “He said that they had fallen off the Polytechnic flyover. In the meantime, the passers-by had also stopped and began informing the police control room,” said Bharat Pathak , sub-inspector, Polytechnic police outpost.“A police team immediately rushed to the spot and with the help of locals, including passers-by, pulled out bodies of the four occupants from the mangled pieces of the SUV by using gas-cutters and rushed all the four to RML institute of medical sciences. However, the doctors Amit, Priyanshu, and Raj brought dead and referred Harsh to KGMU trauma centre,” said Pathak.Shubham Shukla , elder brother of victim Priyanshu, was shell-shocked to know about the death of his younger brother. “I earn a livelihood as a driver and had taken my parents to an event on Saturday night. I got a call from Priyanshu last night that he would be late in reaching home,” he said. Shubham further added that all the four were like a family and closely knit. “They have been together for the last six years,” he said. Similar sentiments were conveyed by parents of two other victims, Amit and Raj.Younger brother of Harsh, Prem said that his brother is still battling for life at KGMU. “My father Ajay Shukla is caretaker of a resort in Nainital” he said.
Summary:
“He said that they had fallen off the Polytechnic flyover.
However, the doctors Amit, Priyanshu, and Raj brought dead and referred Harsh to KGMU trauma centre,” said Pathak.Shubham Shukla , elder brother of victim Priyanshu, was shell-shocked to know about the death of his younger brother.
“I earn a livelihood as a driver and had taken my parents to an event on Saturday night.
I got a call from Priyanshu last night that he would be late in reaching home,” he said.
Similar sentiments were conveyed by parents of two other victims, Amit and Raj.Younger brother of Harsh, Prem said that his brother is still battling for life at KGMU.

Meta_title: Neglected by Kerala government, long jumper Sreeshankar joins RBI | Sports News | Onmanorama
Meta_desc: Wrestlers' protest politically motivated: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh · Badminton Asia Championships: Satwik-Chirag pair create history by entering final.
Title: Neglected by Kerala government, long jumper Sreeshankar joins RBI
Article:
Kottayam: Long jumper M Sreeshankar, who did the country proud by clinching silver at the Commonwealth Games last year, has been appointed as an assistant manager at the Thiruvananthapuram branch office of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on the basis of his sporting credentials.

He decided to accept the employment offer from the RBI after the Kerala government made him wait for years for a job under the sports quota.

The 23-year-old Palakkad-based athlete, who became the first Indian male long jumper to qualify for the World Athletics Championships finals in July, 2022, joined duty on Monday.

Apart from Sreeshankar, Malayali footballer Ashique Kuruniyan, cricketers Shubman Gill, Ishan Kishan, and Smriti Mandhana have also secured a job with the RBI under the sports quota after proving their mettle in their chosen discipline.

The current national record holder with a jump of 8.36 metres, Sreeshnkar had applied for a state government job in 2021. As he had secured a rank in BSc Mathematics from the Calicut University, he was eligible for a top post in the state government service.

However, as there had been no response from the authorities concerned, he approached the RBI for a job. While the state government sat on his application for over a year, the RBI authorities completed the formalities quickly and issued the appointment order last week. The state government has also not fulfilled the promise of providing jobs to Commonwealth Games medal winners from the state.

"As the World Athletics Championship and the Asian Games are scheduled to take place this year, a job of permanent nature and the security it offers would boost my confidence and help me do well," said Sreeshankar.

Sreeshankar, who has been winning medals for Kerala at national championships since 2014, wants to represent the state in the future as well.
Summary:
He decided to accept the employment offer from the RBI after the Kerala government made him wait for years for a job under the sports quota.
The 23-year-old Palakkad-based athlete, who became the first Indian male long jumper to qualify for the World Athletics Championships finals in July, 2022, joined duty on Monday.
The current national record holder with a jump of 8.36 metres, Sreeshnkar had applied for a state government job in 2021.
However, as there had been no response from the authorities concerned, he approached the RBI for a job.
Sreeshankar, who has been winning medals for Kerala at national championships since 2014, wants to represent the state in the future as well.

Meta_title: Indian wrestlers vs WFI: Oversight Committee given two-week extension to submit report
Meta_desc: The biggest allegation among them was that Wrestling Federation of India chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh had abused his position and sexually harassed women...
Title: Indian wrestlers vs WFI: Oversight Committee given two-week extension to submit report
Article:
New Delhi: The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports (MYAS) has given an extension of two weeks to the Oversight Committee for Wrestling to submit its report regarding the complaints of India’s top wrestlers like Tokyo Olympic bronze medalist Bajrang Punia, world championships medalist Vinesh Phogat and Rio Olympics bronze medalist Sakshee Malikkh.

The wrestlers had gone on a dharna at Jantar Mantar in the national capital in January this year, protesting against a plethora of issues. The biggest allegation among them was that Wrestling Federation of India chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh had abused his position and sexually harassed women wrestlers. There were other claims as well, like financial misappropriation on the part of the WFI and its office bearers.

A release from the MYAS on Thursday stated that the Oversight Committee had requested for a two-week extension. The committee includes Olympic medal winners like Mary Kom and Yogeshwar Dutt besides former shuttler Trupti Murgunde and wrestler-turned-politician Babita Phogat. Radhica Sreeman, who is the former Executive Director of TEAMS at Sports Authority of India, and Crd (Retd) Rajesh Rajagopalan, who is the former CEO of Target Olympic Podium Scheme, are also members of the six-person committee.

The extension means that the Oversight Committee will also be in charge of day-to-day affairs of WFI for two more weeks at least.
Summary:
The wrestlers had gone on a dharna at Jantar Mantar in the national capital in January this year, protesting against a plethora of issues.
There were other claims as well, like financial misappropriation on the part of the WFI and its office bearers.
A release from the MYAS on Thursday stated that the Oversight Committee had requested for a two-week extension.
The committee includes Olympic medal winners like Mary Kom and Yogeshwar Dutt besides former shuttler Trupti Murgunde and wrestler-turned-politician Babita Phogat.
The extension means that the Oversight Committee will also be in charge of day-to-day affairs of WFI for two more weeks at least.

Meta_title: Vinesh Phogat accuses ‘sportsperson member’ of Wrestling Oversight Committee of leaking information

Title: Vinesh Phogat accuses ‘sportsperson member’ of Wrestling Oversight Committee of leaking information
Article:
World Championships medal-winning wrestler Vinesh Phogat on Sunday accused an unnamed member of the Wrestling Oversight Committee of “leaking contents” of the complaints made by the nation’s top wrestlers against the Wrestling Federation of India’s chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh and the WFI. She urged the government to remove the member, whom she did not name. She did however identify the person as a ‘sportsperson member’ of the committee.

“Being a sportsperson it is extremely disheartening to see a fellow sportsperson of the Oversight Committee has behaved so recklessly. Their attitude towards women is evident from such behaviour,” she said in a statement posted on Twitter.

Requirement of action against a member of oversight committee for leaking sensitive information to the press. @ianuragthakur pic.twitter.com/cUPDDUXhaf — Vinesh Phogat (@Phogat_Vinesh) February 26, 2023

https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

She added that the member has been “acting against the interest of women from Day One” and said she was sure that Sharan Singh was “finding support” from the member.

“The lack of empathy and insensitivity displayed by this sportsperson was shocking during the proceedings of the committee,” she further said.

While requesting that action be taken against the member, she went to add: “All this has placed great mistrust towards the committee proceedings. I’m feeling let down at not just weak but also strategic attempts of this committee member towards what should have been a fair and just investigation.”

How can a woman expect to find justice if such highly sensitive and confidential proceedings are leaked by such esteemed member of a committee. @ianuragthakur https://t.co/kzZTqdMWbx — Sakshee Malikkh (@SakshiMalik) February 26, 2023

https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

The six-member oversight committee is chaired by Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Mary Kom. London Olympics bronze-medal winning wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt and wrestler Babita Phogat, who is Bajrang’s sister-in-law and a cousin of Vinesh, are also in the Oversight Committee. Former badminton player Trupti Murgunde is the last former athlete to be part of the committee. The other two members are Radhica Sreeman, former executive director (teams) of the Sports Authority of India and Rajesh Rajagopalan, the former-CEO of the Target Olympic Podium Scheme.

India’s top wrestlers like Bajrang Punia, Vinesh, Sakshi Malik and Sarita Mor had gone on a dharna in January to protest against WFI and Sharan Singh, who they accused of sexually harassing women wrestlers.

It is shameful how a sportsperson member of the Oversight Committee has been allegedly leaking contents of the complaint of sexual harassment. I request that strict action should be taken against the member and they should be immediately from the committee@ianuragthakur https://t.co/0R9PZgNeRb — sarita mor 🇮🇳 (@saritamor3) February 26, 2023

https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

Advertisement

In response, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports had set up a five-member Oversight Committee to look into the allegations. Upon the wrestlers’ insistence, Babita was added as the sixth member of the committee. The committee was recently given a two-week extension to come up with the report.
Summary:
She did however identify the person as a ‘sportsperson member’ of the committee.
“Being a sportsperson it is extremely disheartening to see a fellow sportsperson of the Oversight Committee has behaved so recklessly.
Requirement of action against a member of oversight committee for leaking sensitive information to the press.
@ianuragthakur https://t.co/kzZTqdMWbx — Sakshee Malikkh (@SakshiMalik) February 26, 2023https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.jsThe six-member oversight committee is chaired by Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Mary Kom.
It is shameful how a sportsperson member of the Oversight Committee has been allegedly leaking contents of the complaint of sexual harassment.
