Meta_title: Hurting religious sentiments: Notice to Punjab on Dera chief’s plea against FIR
Meta_desc: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab and Haryana high court has issued notice to the Punjab government on a plea filed by Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh...
Title: Fir: Hurting Religious Sentiments: Notice To Pb On Dera Chief’s Plea Against Fir
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab and Haryana high court has issued notice to the Punjab government on a plea filed by Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh seeking cancellation of FIRs registered against him for hurting religious sentiments. Jalandhar police had booked him for his alleged objectionable comments on Guru Ravidas and Sant Kabir.“It is submitted that part of the sermon delivered in 2016 has been uploaded on a YouTube channel in February 2023 which depicts the discourse given by the petitioner in a completely wrong context. Obviously, the content... is malicious and thus, the FIR deserves to be quashed,” Justice Sudhir Mittal observed while recording the dera chief’s contention.The matter has now been adjourned for May 30 for further hearing.The HC has also sought a reply from Jassi Talan, president, Sri Guru Ravidas Tiger Force Punjab, Talhan Patara, Jalandhar (Rural) Punjab, who was a complainant in this case.The dera chief has sought directions for quashing the FIR dated March 7 registered at police station Patara, Jalandhar (Rural) under Section 295 (hurting of religious sentiments) as the same has been filed with ulterior motives and based on concealment and manipulation of facts. It has been stated that the FIR amounts to an abuse of the process of law as the facts alleged do not constitute an offence under Section 295A IPC.Jitender Khurana, one of the counsels for the petitioners, stated that the satsang was organized in 2016. There had been no complaint from any person in the past seven years. Some persons with vested interests picked up a small portion of the satsang and uploaded the same on a YouTube channel as alleged in the FIR.The petitioner or the dera has no concern with the YouTube channel as alleged. Even the petitioner or the dera has not uploaded any video whatsoever alleged in the FIR on YouTube channel in February 2023. The mobile number through which the alleged video has been uploaded does not belong to the petitioner or the dera, the HC was informed.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Punjab and Haryana high court has issued notice to the Punjab government on a plea filed by Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh seeking cancellation of FIRs registered against him for hurting religious sentiments.
There had been no complaint from any person in the past seven years.
Some persons with vested interests picked up a small portion of the satsang and uploaded the same on a YouTube channel as alleged in the FIR.The petitioner or the dera has no concern with the YouTube channel as alleged.
Even the petitioner or the dera has not uploaded any video whatsoever alleged in the FIR on YouTube channel in February 2023.
The mobile number through which the alleged video has been uploaded does not belong to the petitioner or the dera, the HC was informed.

Meta_title: Punjabi University students ban entry of AAP leaders, seek grant promise
Meta_desc: ... Punjabi University, Prof Arvind had earlier claimed to have held a meeting with Punjab finance minister Harpal Singh Cheema, principal secretary to CM,...
Title: Students Ban Entry Of Aap Leaders, Seek Grant Promise
Article: PATIALA: Seeking written assurance from the government on providing requisite grants to Punjabi University , the protesting students on Friday said they would intensify their stir and start agitation within classrooms.The protesting students and faculty members have got support from various farm and labour unions. They also took out a protest march inside the campus.We would continue the agitation till the government assures in writing to provide the adequate grant to the university, which has been facing a financial crisis, said the students.The students have also put up posters near the protest site with crossed pictures of AAP leaders, including chief minister Bhagwant Mann . The posters also read ban on entry of AAP leaders in the university till assurance of grants by the government.Three days ago, the students in a symbolic protest had begged for funds.Vice-chancellor, Punjabi University, Prof Arvind had earlier claimed to have held a meeting with Punjab finance minister Harpal Singh Cheema , principal secretary to CM, principal secretary (finance) and principal secretary (higher education) in Chandigarh on Monday.He had claimed that the state government, as per university’s demand, had assured him of providing a grant of Rs 30 crore per month to the institution. However, the students want a written assurance from the government.The government should have revised the university grants announced in the budget. They announced only Rs 164-crore grant for Punjabi University, whereas the institution had sought Rs 360 crore to run the operations for the financial year 2023-24. The state-run university was also facing Rs 150-crore liabilities, said the students.
Summary:
PATIALA: Seeking written assurance from the government on providing requisite grants to Punjabi University , the protesting students on Friday said they would intensify their stir and start agitation within classrooms.The protesting students and faculty members have got support from various farm and labour unions.
They also took out a protest march inside the campus.We would continue the agitation till the government assures in writing to provide the adequate grant to the university, which has been facing a financial crisis, said the students.The students have also put up posters near the protest site with crossed pictures of AAP leaders, including chief minister Bhagwant Mann .
However, the students want a written assurance from the government.The government should have revised the university grants announced in the budget.
They announced only Rs 164-crore grant for Punjabi University, whereas the institution had sought Rs 360 crore to run the operations for the financial year 2023-24.
The state-run university was also facing Rs 150-crore liabilities, said the students.

Meta_title: Ajit Pawar hits out at BJP MLC's 'Nirma powder' remarks in Maharashtra legislative council
Meta_desc: Patil had spoken in the context of Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Subhash Desai's son Bhushan joining the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena. It had earlier been alleged that...
Title: Ajit Pawar hits out at BJP MLC's 'Nirma powder' remarks in Maharashtra legislative council
Article: MUMBAI: Leader of Opposition Ajit Pawar raised strong objection to BJP MLC Ramesh Patil 's remarks in the state legislative council on Thursday that any leader who joined the BJP would emerge clean because they had Nirma washing powder which came from Gujarat.Patil had spoken in the context of Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Subhash Desai 's son Bhushan joining the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena. It had earlier been alleged that Bhushan faced charges of profiting from the sale of MIDC plots .Speaking in the state legislative council, Patil had said, "People are saying Bhushan Desai joined the BJP because there is a Rs 400-crore file against him. He has come here to seek justice. We have Nirma washing powder which comes from Gujarat. The people who come to us become clean."Pawar said, "The common man is watching all these statements. The other day a BJP leader said he sleeps peacefully at night because he is now in the BJP. What kind of impression are you creating?"Pawar also took a dig at BJP MLA Atul Bhatkalkar who had accused Bhushan Desai of corruption just three months ago."You had accused him of a Rs 3,000-crore scam in the conversion of MIDC land to residential land. Now he has joined the Eknath Shinde camp and you are not saying anything. He has suddenly become clean," said the senior NCP leader.Bhushan Desai joined the Shiv Sena last week. His entry was a major embarrassment for the Shiv Sena (UBT) because his father Subhash Desai, the former industries minister, is close to Uddhav Thackeray.
Summary:
It had earlier been alleged that Bhushan faced charges of profiting from the sale of MIDC plots .Speaking in the state legislative council, Patil had said, "People are saying Bhushan Desai joined the BJP because there is a Rs 400-crore file against him.
The other day a BJP leader said he sleeps peacefully at night because he is now in the BJP.
"Pawar also took a dig at BJP MLA Atul Bhatkalkar who had accused Bhushan Desai of corruption just three months ago.
He has suddenly become clean," said the senior NCP leader.Bhushan Desai joined the Shiv Sena last week.
His entry was a major embarrassment for the Shiv Sena (UBT) because his father Subhash Desai, the former industries minister, is close to Uddhav Thackeray.

Meta_title: Two delivery executives thrashed over not having loose change in Delhi's Rajouri Garden
Meta_desc: According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when...
Title: Two delivery executives thrashed over not having loose change in Delhi's Rajouri Garden
Article:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Two delivery executives of the online grocery firm Blinkit were allegedly beaten up by some people in west Delhi 's Rajouri Garden over not having loose change, police said on Saturday.The incident happened on Friday, they said.According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when they went to deliver a grocery order at his house.Singh, in his statement, alleged that he went to Tarun Suri's house to deliver an order worth Rs 1,655. Suri started misbehaving with them over not having a change of money, Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghandhyam Bansal said.Following this, three to four people thrashed the delivery executives, the DCP said."We have issued necessary support and cooperation to the authorities to aid their investigation. The safety and well-being of our delivery partners is of utmost importance to us. We have taken immediate action to provide healthcare support and loss of pay for the affected delivery partner to ensure they have all they need to prioritise their recovery," a Blinkit spokesperson said.A case under sections 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage reli-gious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or reli-gious beliefs), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (Punishment for wrongful restraint), 427 (Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) and 34 (common intension) of the IPC was registered and an investigation was taken up, police said.The accused persons have also levelled allegations against the delivery agents of misbehaving with the women present in the house, they added.
Summary:
(With PTI inputs)NEW DELHI: Two delivery executives of the online grocery firm Blinkit were allegedly beaten up by some people in west Delhi 's Rajouri Garden over not having loose change, police said on Saturday.The incident happened on Friday, they said.According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when they went to deliver a grocery order at his house.Singh, in his statement, alleged that he went to Tarun Suri's house to deliver an order worth Rs 1,655.
Suri started misbehaving with them over not having a change of money, Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghandhyam Bansal said.Following this, three to four people thrashed the delivery executives, the DCP said.
"We have issued necessary support and cooperation to the authorities to aid their investigation.
The safety and well-being of our delivery partners is of utmost importance to us.
We have taken immediate action to provide healthcare support and loss of pay for the affected delivery partner to ensure they have all they need to prioritise their recovery," a Blinkit spokesperson said.A case under sections 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage reli-gious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or reli-gious beliefs), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (Punishment for wrongful restraint), 427 (Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) and 34 (common intension) of the IPC was registered and an investigation was taken up, police said.The accused persons have also levelled allegations against the delivery agents of misbehaving with the women present in the house, they added.

Meta_title: Haryana budget: Sandeep Singh enters, opposition exits
Meta_desc: CHANDIGARH: Heated arguments between opposition and incumbent party MLAs, which led to a walkout by the opposition, marked Friday's proceedings of Haryana's...
Title: Sandeep: Sandeep Enters, Opposition Exits
Article:
CM Manohar Lal Khattar

CHANDIGARH: Heated arguments between opposition and incumbent party MLAs, which led to a walkout by the opposition, marked Friday’s proceedings of Haryana’s budget session.The state’s budget session resumed after 21 days on Friday.The first walkout was by Congress MLAs led by leader of opposition (LoP) Bhupinder Hooda after minister of state (MoS) Sandeep Singh, who is accused of sexual harassment by a woman coach, entered the House. Congress MLAs, while objecting to his presence, sought his ouster from the assembly. Hooda and other MLAs had an argument with BJP MLAs which intensified when CM Manohar Lal Khattar and speaker Gian Chand Gupta tried to defend Sandeep.All this began with deputy leader of opposition Aftab Ahmed asking the speaker if he had allowed Sandeep to enter the House or had given him the clean chit. As arguments proceeded and speaker Gupta tried to divert the issue, Hooda himself sought a statement from Sandeep on whether he had surrendered the department by choice or was stripped off it. After this, Gupta claimed that the cabinet portfolio allocation was the prerogative of CM only.Geeta Bhukkal, the Congress’s Jhajjar MLA,then accused Gupta of shielding Sandeep. This led to arguments between Gupta and Congress MLAs.Gupta even said that allegations were often levelled against people, but could not be proved in many cases. “In case members have any issue related to any member, they may give it in writing,” he said. Khattar, who too was present in the house, asked Gupta to expunge the discussions on this issue from proceedings of the day. Congress MLAs took exception to this and staged a walkout.Sandeep had skipped all sittings ahead of presentation of budget while attributing poor health.The second walkout was after arguments erupted between Abhay Singh Chautala and Gupta on the issue of former’s question on the issue of farmers debt. In fact, Chautala claimed to have asked the details about debt taken by farmers from all banks. Cooperative minister Banwari Lal, however, provided details of loans taken from just cooperative or Haryana government banks. As Abhay got aggressive, the speaker tried to correct him and defended Yadav. This too led to arguments. Hooda joined the debate too. Later, Khattar defended Lal by saying that since the question was addressed to him, hence he could only reply about cooperative banks.Even as the issue was yet to die down, Abhay posed three more queries. With Khattar saying that the query needed time for departments to reply and speaker saying that the departments concerned and ministers will given written reply to him in 15 days, Abhay got upset and he walked out.
Summary:
As arguments proceeded and speaker Gupta tried to divert the issue, Hooda himself sought a statement from Sandeep on whether he had surrendered the department by choice or was stripped off it.
After this, Gupta claimed that the cabinet portfolio allocation was the prerogative of CM only.Geeta Bhukkal, the Congress’s Jhajjar MLA,then accused Gupta of shielding Sandeep.
This led to arguments between Gupta and Congress MLAs.Gupta even said that allegations were often levelled against people, but could not be proved in many cases.
“In case members have any issue related to any member, they may give it in writing,” he said.
Khattar, who too was present in the house, asked Gupta to expunge the discussions on this issue from proceedings of the day.

Meta_title: Himachal Pradesh to be made green energy state by March, 2026: CM
Meta_desc: SHIMLA: Having given the slogan of “Vyavastha Parivartan” (system change), chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu in his maiden budget speech majorly focused...
Title: Himachal Pradesh to be made green energy state by March, 2026: CM
Article: SHIMLA: Having given the slogan of “Vyavastha Parivartan” (system change), chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu in his maiden budget speech majorly focused on making Himachal Pradesh a green energy state by March 31, 2026.He said that his government will take effective steps by taking measures for the exploitation of solar energy, in addition to hydropower to meet this objective. He said that a target of starting new solar energy projects with a capacity of 500 MW has been set in 2023-24. He also announced plans to develop 5 green corridors for the electric vehicles in the state.The chief minister said that with an objective to make Himachal Pradesh a Green State, his government has also decided that Himachal Pradesh will be developed as a ‘Model State for Electric Vehicles’. He said that use of electric vehicles will be encouraged in a phased manner to reduce carbon emissions, with the collaboration of private and public sectors.He said that a subsidy of Rs 25,000 each would be provided to 20,000 meritorious girl students above the age of 18 years studying in government institutions to purchase ‘electric scooty’. This will not only encourage girl students to pursue higher education but will also help to develop Himachal Pradesh as a ‘Green State, he added.He said that In the first National and State Highways including Parwanoo – Nalagarh – Una – Hamirpur–Dehra – Amb – Mubarakpur – Sansarpur Terrace – Nurpur; Paonta – Nahan – Solan – Shimla; Parwanoo – Solan – Shimla – Rampur – Peo –Pooh – Tabo – Kaza – Losar; Shimla–Bilaspur–Hamirpur – Kangra – Nurpur – Banikhet – Chamba; Mandi – Jogindernagar – Palampur –Dharamshala – Kangra – Pathankot and Kiratpur – Bilaspur –Mandi – Kullu – Manali –Keylong – Zingzingbar will be developed as Green Corridor for electric vehicles.He said that the government will develop a public transport system with the help of electric vehicles in the coming years as this will substantially reduce dependence on fossil fuels. For this, he announced that the private bus operators will be given a subsidy of 50 percent with the maximum limit of Rs 50 lakh for purchase of e-buses. He said that the private truck operators will be given a subsidy of 50 percent with the maximum limit of Rs 50 lakh for purchase of e-trucks.He said that his government's efforts will be to reduce air, sound and all other types of pollution in order to develop Himachal Pradesh as 'Green State'. For this, emphasis will be on replacing maximum diesel buses of the Himachal Road Transport Corporation with e-buses in the coming years. Himachal Road Transport Corporation is plying 75 e-buses and 50 e-taxis currently in the State. He announced to replace 1,500 diesel buses of HRTC with electric buses in a phased manner and expenditure of Rs 1,000 crore is proposed for the purpose. In the first phase, a new e-bus Depot will be set up in Nadaun and Shimla (local) Depot will be converted into e-bus Depot in a phased manner.
Summary:
He said that a target of starting new solar energy projects with a capacity of 500 MW has been set in 2023-24.
He also announced plans to develop 5 green corridors for the electric vehicles in the state.The chief minister said that with an objective to make Himachal Pradesh a Green State, his government has also decided that Himachal Pradesh will be developed as a ‘Model State for Electric Vehicles’.
For this, he announced that the private bus operators will be given a subsidy of 50 percent with the maximum limit of Rs 50 lakh for purchase of e-buses.
For this, emphasis will be on replacing maximum diesel buses of the Himachal Road Transport Corporation with e-buses in the coming years.
Himachal Road Transport Corporation is plying 75 e-buses and 50 e-taxis currently in the State.

Meta_title: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Internet services suspended in Punjab
Meta_desc: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Internet services suspended in Punjab ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi...
Title: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Internet services suspended in Punjab
Article: JALANDHAR: All mobile internet, SMS, and dongle services have been suspended in Punjab till Sunday as a massive manhunt is under way to arrest Waris Punjab De head, Amritpal Singh .So far, a total of 78 people have been arrested and several have been detained in connection with the crackdown launched against the chief of suspected pro-Khalistan outfit 'Waris Punjab De', Amritpal Singh and his aides, Punjab Police said on Saturday, adding that the Khalistan sympathiser was still on the run.The Punjab chief secretary issued an order based on a request from the Punjab DGP, who stated that "certain sections" posed a threat to public order and were inciting violence.The order also noted that "these sections" frequently used social media platforms to disseminate inflammatory messages that served to incite mobs, agitators, and demonstrators as well as to mobilize their own manpower and resources for their "anti-national" activities.Amritpal Singh was being chased by police at noon in the Shahkot neighbourhood of Jalandhar, and by the time he arrived in Mehatpur, his associates had already spread the word and made calls to the area.The chase he was involved in was broadcasted live, including footage from inside his own vehicle. However, internet access in the state was quickly disabled.
Summary:
JALANDHAR: All mobile internet, SMS, and dongle services have been suspended in Punjab till Sunday as a massive manhunt is under way to arrest Waris Punjab De head, Amritpal Singh .So far, a total of 78 people have been arrested and several have been detained in connection with the crackdown launched against the chief of suspected pro-Khalistan outfit 'Waris Punjab De', Amritpal Singh and his aides, Punjab Police said on Saturday, adding that the Khalistan sympathiser was still on the run.The Punjab chief secretary issued an order based on a request from the Punjab DGP, who stated that "certain sections" posed a threat to public order and were inciting violence.The order also noted that "these sections" frequently used social media platforms to disseminate inflammatory messages that served to incite mobs, agitators, and demonstrators as well as to mobilize their own manpower and resources for their "anti-national" activities.Amritpal Singh was being chased by police at noon in the Shahkot neighbourhood of Jalandhar, and by the time he arrived in Mehatpur, his associates had already spread the word and made calls to the area.The chase he was involved in was broadcasted live, including footage from inside his own vehicle.
However, internet access in the state was quickly disabled.

Meta_title: Punjabi University students ban entry of AAP leaders, seek grant promise
Meta_desc: ... Punjabi University, Prof Arvind had earlier claimed to have held a meeting with Punjab finance minister Harpal Singh Cheema, principal secretary to CM,...
Title: Students Ban Entry Of Aap Leaders, Seek Grant Promise
Article: PATIALA: Seeking written assurance from the government on providing requisite grants to Punjabi University , the protesting students on Friday said they would intensify their stir and start agitation within classrooms.The protesting students and faculty members have got support from various farm and labour unions. They also took out a protest march inside the campus.We would continue the agitation till the government assures in writing to provide the adequate grant to the university, which has been facing a financial crisis, said the students.The students have also put up posters near the protest site with crossed pictures of AAP leaders, including chief minister Bhagwant Mann . The posters also read ban on entry of AAP leaders in the university till assurance of grants by the government.Three days ago, the students in a symbolic protest had begged for funds.Vice-chancellor, Punjabi University, Prof Arvind had earlier claimed to have held a meeting with Punjab finance minister Harpal Singh Cheema , principal secretary to CM, principal secretary (finance) and principal secretary (higher education) in Chandigarh on Monday.He had claimed that the state government, as per university’s demand, had assured him of providing a grant of Rs 30 crore per month to the institution. However, the students want a written assurance from the government.The government should have revised the university grants announced in the budget. They announced only Rs 164-crore grant for Punjabi University, whereas the institution had sought Rs 360 crore to run the operations for the financial year 2023-24. The state-run university was also facing Rs 150-crore liabilities, said the students.
Summary:
PATIALA: Seeking written assurance from the government on providing requisite grants to Punjabi University , the protesting students on Friday said they would intensify their stir and start agitation within classrooms.The protesting students and faculty members have got support from various farm and labour unions.
They also took out a protest march inside the campus.We would continue the agitation till the government assures in writing to provide the adequate grant to the university, which has been facing a financial crisis, said the students.The students have also put up posters near the protest site with crossed pictures of AAP leaders, including chief minister Bhagwant Mann .
However, the students want a written assurance from the government.The government should have revised the university grants announced in the budget.
They announced only Rs 164-crore grant for Punjabi University, whereas the institution had sought Rs 360 crore to run the operations for the financial year 2023-24.
The state-run university was also facing Rs 150-crore liabilities, said the students.

Meta_title: Ajit Pawar hits out at BJP MLC's 'Nirma powder' remarks in Maharashtra legislative council
Meta_desc: Patil had spoken in the context of Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Subhash Desai's son Bhushan joining the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena. It had earlier been alleged that...
Title: Ajit Pawar hits out at BJP MLC's 'Nirma powder' remarks in Maharashtra legislative council
Article: MUMBAI: Leader of Opposition Ajit Pawar raised strong objection to BJP MLC Ramesh Patil 's remarks in the state legislative council on Thursday that any leader who joined the BJP would emerge clean because they had Nirma washing powder which came from Gujarat.Patil had spoken in the context of Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Subhash Desai 's son Bhushan joining the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena. It had earlier been alleged that Bhushan faced charges of profiting from the sale of MIDC plots .Speaking in the state legislative council, Patil had said, "People are saying Bhushan Desai joined the BJP because there is a Rs 400-crore file against him. He has come here to seek justice. We have Nirma washing powder which comes from Gujarat. The people who come to us become clean."Pawar said, "The common man is watching all these statements. The other day a BJP leader said he sleeps peacefully at night because he is now in the BJP. What kind of impression are you creating?"Pawar also took a dig at BJP MLA Atul Bhatkalkar who had accused Bhushan Desai of corruption just three months ago."You had accused him of a Rs 3,000-crore scam in the conversion of MIDC land to residential land. Now he has joined the Eknath Shinde camp and you are not saying anything. He has suddenly become clean," said the senior NCP leader.Bhushan Desai joined the Shiv Sena last week. His entry was a major embarrassment for the Shiv Sena (UBT) because his father Subhash Desai, the former industries minister, is close to Uddhav Thackeray.
Summary:
It had earlier been alleged that Bhushan faced charges of profiting from the sale of MIDC plots .Speaking in the state legislative council, Patil had said, "People are saying Bhushan Desai joined the BJP because there is a Rs 400-crore file against him.
The other day a BJP leader said he sleeps peacefully at night because he is now in the BJP.
"Pawar also took a dig at BJP MLA Atul Bhatkalkar who had accused Bhushan Desai of corruption just three months ago.
He has suddenly become clean," said the senior NCP leader.Bhushan Desai joined the Shiv Sena last week.
His entry was a major embarrassment for the Shiv Sena (UBT) because his father Subhash Desai, the former industries minister, is close to Uddhav Thackeray.

Meta_title: Two delivery executives thrashed over not having loose change in Delhi's Rajouri Garden
Meta_desc: According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when...
Title: Two delivery executives thrashed over not having loose change in Delhi's Rajouri Garden
Article:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Two delivery executives of the online grocery firm Blinkit were allegedly beaten up by some people in west Delhi 's Rajouri Garden over not having loose change, police said on Saturday.The incident happened on Friday, they said.According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when they went to deliver a grocery order at his house.Singh, in his statement, alleged that he went to Tarun Suri's house to deliver an order worth Rs 1,655. Suri started misbehaving with them over not having a change of money, Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghandhyam Bansal said.Following this, three to four people thrashed the delivery executives, the DCP said."We have issued necessary support and cooperation to the authorities to aid their investigation. The safety and well-being of our delivery partners is of utmost importance to us. We have taken immediate action to provide healthcare support and loss of pay for the affected delivery partner to ensure they have all they need to prioritise their recovery," a Blinkit spokesperson said.A case under sections 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage reli-gious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or reli-gious beliefs), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (Punishment for wrongful restraint), 427 (Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) and 34 (common intension) of the IPC was registered and an investigation was taken up, police said.The accused persons have also levelled allegations against the delivery agents of misbehaving with the women present in the house, they added.
Summary:
(With PTI inputs)NEW DELHI: Two delivery executives of the online grocery firm Blinkit were allegedly beaten up by some people in west Delhi 's Rajouri Garden over not having loose change, police said on Saturday.The incident happened on Friday, they said.According to the police, the two delivery agents -- Aman and Gurpal Singh -- of online grocery store Blinkit were physically assaulted by a customer when they went to deliver a grocery order at his house.Singh, in his statement, alleged that he went to Tarun Suri's house to deliver an order worth Rs 1,655.
Suri started misbehaving with them over not having a change of money, Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghandhyam Bansal said.Following this, three to four people thrashed the delivery executives, the DCP said.
"We have issued necessary support and cooperation to the authorities to aid their investigation.
The safety and well-being of our delivery partners is of utmost importance to us.
We have taken immediate action to provide healthcare support and loss of pay for the affected delivery partner to ensure they have all they need to prioritise their recovery," a Blinkit spokesperson said.A case under sections 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage reli-gious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or reli-gious beliefs), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (Punishment for wrongful restraint), 427 (Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) and 34 (common intension) of the IPC was registered and an investigation was taken up, police said.The accused persons have also levelled allegations against the delivery agents of misbehaving with the women present in the house, they added.

Meta_title: Uttarakhand: New education schemes focus skill building
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks...
Title: Uttarakhand: New education schemes focus skill building
Article: GAIRSAIN: Several new projects included in the state budget of Uttarakhand government for financial year 2023-24 focus on encouraging education, supporting meritorious students and skill development.Under the Mukhya Mantri Pratibha Protsahan Yojana , a provision of Rs 11 crore has been kept in the budget to provide scholarships to students. Under the Utkrisht Cluster Vidyalaya, Rs 51 crore has been allocated.Under the PM Shri project of the new education policy, the state has kept a provision of Rs 92.7 crore.For scholarship to students for higher education, the government has reserved a fund of Rs 10 crore. Also, Rs 2 crore has been allocated for creation of Research and Development Cell in the higher education department. To promote new concepts, skills and industrial ideas, the government has made a provision of Rs 7.11 crore.Speaking about some more projects, finance minister Prem Chand Aggarwal said, "Similarly, we have kept a Rs 5 crore provision under the state scholarship scheme, Rs 15 crore for giving cycles to meritorious girl students, Rs 25.62 crore for scholarship for SC students above class X, Rs 11.69 crore for scholarship scheme for SC students for Class IX and X. Besides, we have been running many schemes, which aim to promote education among SCs, STs and rural pockets."
Summary:

Under the Utkrisht Cluster Vidyalaya, Rs 51 crore has been allocated.Under the PM Shri project of the new education policy, the state has kept a provision of Rs 92.7 crore.For scholarship to students for higher education, the government has reserved a fund of Rs 10 crore.

Meta_title: Govt takes Supreme Court seriously, sensitive to infrastructural demands: CJI Chandrachud
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi...
Title: Cji: Govt takes Supreme Court seriously, sensitive to infrastructural demands: CJI Chandrachud
Article: NEW DELHI: CJI DY Chandrachud on Friday said that the Union government takes the Supreme Court very seriously and has acceded to its Rs 7,000 crore demand for e-courts project and judicial infrastructural needs without cutting even a single rupee even as other departments suffered cuts in budgetary allocations.“The government takes the SC very seriously. We made a detailed project report on Rs 7,000 crore budgetary estimate for e-courts and judicial infrastructural needs. The government sanctioned the entire amount and didn’t cut a single rupee from what we demanded. Other departments suffered budgetary cuts,” said the CJI, who was heading the bench comprising Justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul and PS Narasimha. His remark came during a hearing on a petition filed by SC Bar Association seeking a direction to the Union government for considering a proposal for acquisition of land and buildings in SC’s vicinity to create chamber space for thousands of advocates.When SCBA president Vikas Singh raised the acute need of chambers for its members, many of whom are waiting for it for decades, similar claims were made by SC Advocates on Record Association (SCAoRA), women advocates and Bar Council of India, creating a cacophony.“Lawyers are part of the institution. If the SC passes judicial orders, it will give rise to a disquiet that judicial powers are being used to further its own interest. Trust the court to take up lawyers’ needs with the government on administrative side,” the bench said. The CJI said, “We can’t bulldoze the government with our administrative needs. The tradition is to engage on administrative side. We will engage with the government about the infrastructure needs of advocates.”
Summary:
We made a detailed project report on Rs 7,000 crore budgetary estimate for e-courts and judicial infrastructural needs.
Other departments suffered budgetary cuts,” said the CJI, who was heading the bench comprising Justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul and PS Narasimha.
If the SC passes judicial orders, it will give rise to a disquiet that judicial powers are being used to further its own interest.
Trust the court to take up lawyers’ needs with the government on administrative side,” the bench said.
The CJI said, “We can’t bulldoze the government with our administrative needs.

Meta_title: Pre-dawn shooting at Ohio nightclub leaves 2 dead, 4 wounded
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Ohio: Pre-dawn shooting at Ohio nightclub leaves 2 dead, 4 wounded
Article: COLUMBUS: A predawn shooting at a Columbus night club left two people dead and four wounded, Ohio authorities said.Officers responded shortly after 5 a.m. Saturday to an after-hours club called Tha Plug on the city's south side, emergency dispatchers said. One person died at the scene and another was dropped off at Nationwide Children's Hospital and was later pronounced dead, dispatchers said.Two other victims were taken to OhioHealth Grant Medical Center and two more to the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center , authorities said. There was no immediate word on their conditions.The ages of the victims and other details weren't immediately available. No arrests have been reported.
Summary:
COLUMBUS: A predawn shooting at a Columbus night club left two people dead and four wounded, Ohio authorities said.Officers responded shortly after 5 a.m. Saturday to an after-hours club called Tha Plug on the city's south side, emergency dispatchers said.
One person died at the scene and another was dropped off at Nationwide Children's Hospital and was later pronounced dead, dispatchers said.Two other victims were taken to OhioHealth Grant Medical Center and two more to the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center , authorities said.
There was no immediate word on their conditions.The ages of the victims and other details weren't immediately available.
No arrests have been reported.

Title: CBI arrests police head constable for accepting bribe in Kathua
Article: JAMMU: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Saturday arrested a head constable posted at Women Police Station Kathua red handed while taking Rs 3,000 bribe from a complainant, an official said."The arrested head constable has been identified Mushtaq Ahmed presently posted at Women's Police Station in Kathua. A complaint was lodged with CBI Jammu and Kashmir wing alleging therein that accused demanded Rs 5,000 for a favour in a case registered at Women's Police station Kathua, said officials quoting the complainant. It was further stated that the amount was negotiated at Rs 3,000," an officer said.Following the compliant, a case was registered in this regard, the official said, adding, "a trap was laid and the accused was caught red handed while demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs 3,000," the official added.They added that the accused was arrested on the spot with bribe money and will be produced in court for further action.
Summary:

A complaint was lodged with CBI Jammu and Kashmir wing alleging therein that accused demanded Rs 5,000 for a favour in a case registered at Women's Police station Kathua, said officials quoting the complainant.
It was further stated that the amount was negotiated at Rs 3,000," an officer said.Following the compliant, a case was registered in this regard, the official said, adding, "a trap was laid and the accused was caught red handed while demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs 3,000," the official added.They added that the accused was arrested on the spot with bribe money and will be produced in court for further action.

Meta_title: Probe paid parking fraud, penalise guilty: Adviser to MC
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR...
Title: Probe paid parking fraud, penalise guilty: Adviser to MC
Article:
Spl panel meet today

CHANDIGARH: As the defaulting amount of over Rs 6 crore by former paid parking contractor and fake bank guarantee of Rs 1.60 crore have rattled the municipal corporation, UT adviser Dharam Pal has asked the civic body to probe the matter in detail and penalise the guilty.“It is a matter of grave concern that such a huge amount of government money has been cheated. I have asked the municipal commissioner for a detailed and thorough investigation and strict action against the guilty. It is very significant to identify the lapses. Such things cannot be ignored at any level and not repeated,” Pal told TOI.The Chandigarh Police are probing the fake bank guarantee case and have arrested one accused. The parking matter remained the centre of discussion during the recent held monthly general house meeting of the MC. Besides, opposition municipal councillors, councillors of BJP too spoke on the issue. The members of the house had even asked for files related to the matterFinally, a meeting of the special committee of municipal councillors constituted in the general house of the MC by the mayor will be held on Friday. A notice for the meeting issued on Thursday said, “The meeting will discuss the issue regarding submitting of fake bank guarantee by Pashchatya Entertainment Private Limited on account of allotment of paid parking.”
Summary:
I have asked the municipal commissioner for a detailed and thorough investigation and strict action against the guilty.
Such things cannot be ignored at any level and not repeated,” Pal told TOI.The Chandigarh Police are probing the fake bank guarantee case and have arrested one accused.
The parking matter remained the centre of discussion during the recent held monthly general house meeting of the MC.
Besides, opposition municipal councillors, councillors of BJP too spoke on the issue.
A notice for the meeting issued on Thursday said, “The meeting will discuss the issue regarding submitting of fake bank guarantee by Pashchatya Entertainment Private Limited on account of allotment of paid parking.”

Meta_title: Class 9 student stages own kidnapping in UP's Sitapur to buy an iPhone
Meta_desc: The boy had used his friend's phone to make a ransom call demanding Rs 5 lakh from his father. Sitapur kotwali SHO TP Singh said that the boy studies in a...
Title: Class 9 student stages own kidnapping in UP's Sitapur to buy an iPhone
Article: LUCKNOW: A student of class 9 staged his own kidnapping in Sitapur to buy an iPhone with the ransom that he planned to collect from his father. He took the step after his father, who owns a small garment store, expressed his inability to buy him the phone.The minor, however, ran out of luck once police started investigations into the case and traced his location to his friend's house. The boy had used his friend's phone to make a ransom call demanding Rs 5 lakh from his father.Sitapur kotwali SHO TP Singh said that the boy studies in a government school and lives with his father as his mother had died when he was just one."When the student did not return home after school on Wednesday, his father and other relatives started a manhunt. Later, around 8.30 pm, they got a ransom call on WhatsApp for Rs 5 lakh. The amount had to be delivered at Khairabad near a mosque," said Singh.After the father informed the police, cops, cyber and SOG teams of the district got on the case."We assured the complainant about his son's rescue and a team in civvies was attached with him while he was collecting the amount for the safe release of his son," said the SHO.By 11 pm, the police had zeroed in on the location of the mobile phone used for the ransom call. When the mobile phone owner, a footwear shop owner, was questioned, it came to fore that the phone was used by his son, who was also a student of class 9."A woman police officer was asked to confront the class 9 student who spilled the beans. Later, another team traced the missing child from his house," said the SHO.The boy was handed over to his father after counselling.
Summary:
LUCKNOW: A student of class 9 staged his own kidnapping in Sitapur to buy an iPhone with the ransom that he planned to collect from his father.
"When the student did not return home after school on Wednesday, his father and other relatives started a manhunt.
When the mobile phone owner, a footwear shop owner, was questioned, it came to fore that the phone was used by his son, who was also a student of class 9.
"A woman police officer was asked to confront the class 9 student who spilled the beans.
Later, another team traced the missing child from his house," said the SHO.The boy was handed over to his father after counselling.

Meta_title: Vehicle in former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's convoy meets with accident
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... MarriagePM Modi in KeralaSania MirzaBrij BhushanKedarnath TempleIPL Slow...
Title: Vehicle in former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's convoy meets with accident
Article: NEW DELHI: A vehicle in former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's convoy met with an accident on Saturday while heading to Islamabad in connection with a hearing of the Toshakhana case A local court in Islamabad is set to resume hearing of the Toshakhana case against Imran Khan, who avoided arrest despite a protracted effort by law enforcement personnel to apprehend him for skipping multiple previous hearings.Taking to Twitter, Khan said: "It is now clear that, despite my having gotten bail in all my cases, the PDM govt intends to arrest me."Imran reiterated that the government's plan to arrest is part of the 'London plan' to finish all cases against the country's former premier Nawaz Sharif.Meanwhile, according to Reuters, Imran has formed a committee to lead the party in case he is arrested.Khan, the 70-year-old chief of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party, is scheduled to appear before the court of Additional District and Sessions Judge (ADSJ) Zafar Iqbal to attend proceedings on the complaint filed by the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) for allegedly concealing details of gifts in his assets declarations.Accompanied by a convoy of his party workers, the PTI chief departed from his residence in Zaman Park, Lahore, and is en route to Islamabad.Stringent security measures have been put in place outside the judicial complex in Islamabad's G-11, where Imran is expected to arrive.A large contingent of police has been deployed to the area to provide security for Khan, who survived an assassination attempt in November last year.(With agency inputs)
Summary:
NEW DELHI: A vehicle in former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's convoy met with an accident on Saturday while heading to Islamabad in connection with a hearing of the Toshakhana case A local court in Islamabad is set to resume hearing of the Toshakhana case against Imran Khan, who avoided arrest despite a protracted effort by law enforcement personnel to apprehend him for skipping multiple previous hearings.Taking to Twitter, Khan said: "It is now clear that, despite my having gotten bail in all my cases, the PDM govt intends to arrest me.
"Imran reiterated that the government's plan to arrest is part of the 'London plan' to finish all cases against the country's former premier Nawaz Sharif.Meanwhile, according to Reuters, Imran has formed a committee to lead the party in case he is arrested.Khan, the 70-year-old chief of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party, is scheduled to appear before the court of Additional District and Sessions Judge (ADSJ) Zafar Iqbal to attend proceedings on the complaint filed by the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) for allegedly concealing details of gifts in his assets declarations.Accompanied by a convoy of his party workers, the PTI chief departed from his residence in Zaman Park, Lahore, and is en route to Islamabad.Stringent security measures have been put in place outside the judicial complex in Islamabad's G-11, where Imran is expected to arrive.A large contingent of police has been deployed to the area to provide security for Khan, who survived an assassination attempt in November last year.
(With agency inputs)

Meta_title: Joshimath: 19 houses with cracks sealed
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... 10th Result 2023Same Sex MarriagePM Modi in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath...
Title: Joshimath: 19 houses with cracks sealed
Article: DEHRADUN: The Chamoli district administration has sealed 19 houses in "sinking town" Joshimath over the last week. These structures had earlier been declared "unsafe" and "dangerous" by a team of the Central Building Research Institute ( CBRI ). Six more buildings are in the process of being sealed. District magistrate Himanshu Khuranna told TOI, "After receiving a request for settlement money, we conducted a survey of the houses to ascertain their valuation before disbursing the compensation. We have a dedicated staff of engineers who are engaged in the valuation of the affected houses."Till March 17, a total 21 families in Joshimath have been given a sum of Rs 5.12 crore as final rehabilitation package under the rehabilitation and resettlement policy passed by the state cabinet last month, according to the district administration.As per a condition laid out in the Joshimath rehabilitation policy passed by the cabinet, the houses are sealed only after owners voluntarily apply for the final compensation and enter into an agreement with the administration to hand over ownership of the properties to the government. Joshimath SDM Kumkum Joshi said that so far, 27 families have approached the administration to have their homes sealed and applied for compensation. These include the families that have already received compensation.The numbers are likely to increase in the days to come, an official said. Notably, residents in Joshimath have been protesting against the government's "unclear" rehabilitation policy. Around 300 families living in shelter homes in the town, who have had to move out of spacious homes into cramped spaces, said they don't know for how long they'll be here. Residents have also questioned how businesses that were closed down will be compensated and what will happen to the livestock left behind. The government is working on building alternative prefabricated structures at Pipalkoti and other nearby areas, and has offered to pay the rent for the first few months to the displaced residents who wish to move to other accommodations. In the recently-announced budget, the state government earmarked Rs 1,000 crore for relief and rehabilitation operations in Joshimath and other land-subsidence areas in the state.
Summary:
DEHRADUN: The Chamoli district administration has sealed 19 houses in "sinking town" Joshimath over the last week.
We have a dedicated staff of engineers who are engaged in the valuation of the affected houses.
Joshimath SDM Kumkum Joshi said that so far, 27 families have approached the administration to have their homes sealed and applied for compensation.
Notably, residents in Joshimath have been protesting against the government's "unclear" rehabilitation policy.
In the recently-announced budget, the state government earmarked Rs 1,000 crore for relief and rehabilitation operations in Joshimath and other land-subsidence areas in the state.

Meta_title: 30 passengers from Colombo mistakenly dropped off at domestic arrivals of Bengaluru airport
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: 30 passengers from Colombo mistakenly dropped off at domestic arrivals of Bengaluru airport
Article: BENGALURU: In a significant security lapse at the Kempegowda International Airport ( KIA ) in Bengaluru, 30 passengers who arrived from Colombo were mistakenly dropped at the domestic arrivals gate on Friday.The passengers, who were dropped off at the domestic arrivals bus gate instead of the international arrivals bus gate at the Bengaluru Airport, travelled on a Sri Lankan Airlines UL 173 flight, according to a spokesperson of BIAL (Bengaluru International Airport Limited)."On March 17, 30 passengers who travelled on Sri Lankan Airlines UL 173 were erroneously dropped at the domestic arrivals bus gate of BLR Airport instead of international arrivals bus gate. These passengers entered the domestic baggage claim area," the BIAL Spokesperson said.However, the terminal operations team rushed to the scene where the CISF and Immigration were alerted of the mishap."The Terminal Operations team along with CISF ( Central Industrial Security Force ) and Immigration were alerted and the passengers were immediately moved to the international arrivals for immigration. After that the passengers proceeded to the international baggage claim area," the BIAL Spokesperson added.BIAL stated further that a human error was responsible for the situation at the airport that ultimately caused the confusion. However, corrective measures are being taken.
Summary:
BENGALURU: In a significant security lapse at the Kempegowda International Airport ( KIA ) in Bengaluru, 30 passengers who arrived from Colombo were mistakenly dropped at the domestic arrivals gate on Friday.The passengers, who were dropped off at the domestic arrivals bus gate instead of the international arrivals bus gate at the Bengaluru Airport, travelled on a Sri Lankan Airlines UL 173 flight, according to a spokesperson of BIAL (Bengaluru International Airport Limited).
"On March 17, 30 passengers who travelled on Sri Lankan Airlines UL 173 were erroneously dropped at the domestic arrivals bus gate of BLR Airport instead of international arrivals bus gate.
These passengers entered the domestic baggage claim area," the BIAL Spokesperson said.However, the terminal operations team rushed to the scene where the CISF and Immigration were alerted of the mishap.
"The Terminal Operations team along with CISF ( Central Industrial Security Force ) and Immigration were alerted and the passengers were immediately moved to the international arrivals for immigration.
After that the passengers proceeded to the international baggage claim area," the BIAL Spokesperson added.BIAL stated further that a human error was responsible for the situation at the airport that ultimately caused the confusion.

Title: Harpreet: 'Dirty political game' by govts: Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on crackdown in Punjab
Article: AMRITSAR: Akal Takht officiating jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Tuesday said the state and central governments were playing a " dirty political game ", like three decades ago by the then governments.In a message, Harpreet said the government was trying to create an atmosphere of panic in the state. "Rumours are being spread due to the internet shutdown as people are not getting correct information," he said, adding that all these acts were creating instability in Punjab . "Being a border state, stability is the most important in Punjab. For that, governments have to talk to Sikhs and resolve their issues," said Harpreet.He said it was worrisome that Sikh youth as young as 16 and 17 years old were being apprehended. He added that the Punjab government should clarify its position on what was happening in the state.
Summary:
AMRITSAR: Akal Takht officiating jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Tuesday said the state and central governments were playing a " dirty political game ", like three decades ago by the then governments.In a message, Harpreet said the government was trying to create an atmosphere of panic in the state.
"Rumours are being spread due to the internet shutdown as people are not getting correct information," he said, adding that all these acts were creating instability in Punjab .
"Being a border state, stability is the most important in Punjab.
For that, governments have to talk to Sikhs and resolve their issues," said Harpreet.He said it was worrisome that Sikh youth as young as 16 and 17 years old were being apprehended.
He added that the Punjab government should clarify its position on what was happening in the state.

Article:

Meta_title: HC slams Punjab govt for failing to arrest Amritpal Singh; seeks status report from police
Meta_desc: “You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as...
Title: HC slams Punjab govt for failing to arrest Amritpal Singh; seeks status report from police
Article:
The Punjab and Haryana High Court termed the escape of radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh as intelligence failure of the state’s police

“You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as intelligence failure of the state’s police.

The court also asked Punjab police to submit a status report on the operation against radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh.

The court’s remarks came even as the police is taking action against members of Amritpal Singh’s outfit ‘Waris Punjab De’.

Also read: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Forces working against India won’t be spared, says Punjab CM

Advertisement

Amritpal Singh, however, has managed to evade an arrest do far. He gave the police a slip and was last seen speeding away on a motorcycle on Saturday evening in Jalandhar.

Punjab crackdown

The Punjab government had launched a major operation against the separatist preacher and have arrested a large number of his supporters so far.

Amritpal Singh’s uncle Harjit Singh and two other aides were flown to Assam on Tuesday. On Sunday, his other four arrested associates were also taken to Dibrugarh Central Jail. The seven men have been charged under the National Security Act (NSA), which allows the police to detain suspects in any prison across the country.

The operation was reportedly a coordinated effort between Punjab government, the Centre, and Assam government. According to various reports, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had discussed the plan to arrest Amritpal Singh with Home Minister Amit Shah in a meeting on March 2.

Home Ministry sources told NDTV that Amritpal Singh was planning to launch a state-wide procession to baptize the youth to carry out suicide attacks and was using de-addiction centres to stockpile weapons illegally sourced from Pakistan.

The centre seems to be moving in to take over the case as a terror investigation with a fresh FIR citing the Arms Act against Amritpal Singh.

Mann’s warning

Meanwhile, Bhagwant Mann said that strict action will be taken against those who have been trying to disturb peace and harmony in the state.

“Punjab’s peace and harmony, and country’s progress is our priority. We will not spare any force working against the country. People of this state want peace and progress,” Mann said, adding, “no incident of violence has been reported after the crackdown against the Khalistani leader.”

The suspension of mobile internet and SMS services will continue in parts of Punjab — Tarn Taran, Ferozepur, Moga, Sangrur and Amritsar’s Ajnala — till Thursday noon. Haryana also is on high alert.

Also read: Punjab: Mobile internet services partially restored, Amritpal’s uncle moved to Dibrugarh jail

The massive crackdown against the Khalistani leader comes a month after Amritpal Singh and his supporters broke into a police station in Ajnala with swords and guns for the release of one of his aides. Six policemen were injured in the clash.
Summary:
The Punjab and Haryana High Court termed the escape of radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh as intelligence failure of the state’s police“You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as intelligence failure of the state’s police.
The court also asked Punjab police to submit a status report on the operation against radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh.
Also read: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Forces working against India won’t be spared, says Punjab CMAdvertisementAmritpal Singh, however, has managed to evade an arrest do far.
According to various reports, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had discussed the plan to arrest Amritpal Singh with Home Minister Amit Shah in a meeting on March 2.
The centre seems to be moving in to take over the case as a terror investigation with a fresh FIR citing the Arms Act against Amritpal Singh.

Meta_title: Sarabjot Singh clinches air pistol gold in Shooting World Cup
Meta_desc: Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th... The gold-medal match was a race to 16 points and Sarabjot was simply unstoppable,...
Title: Sarabjot Singh clinches air pistol gold in Shooting World Cup
Article:
India’s Sarabjot Singh won the men’s air pistol gold in the ISSF Pistol/Rifle World Cup here to open the host country’s medal account on the first day of competitions on Wednesday.

It was double delight for India as teenage shooter Varun Tomar also bagged a bronze.

Sarabjot, the 2021 junior world champion in the team and mixed team categories, defeated Azerbaijan’s Ruslan Lunev 16-0 in the gold-medal match in the first final of the World Cup.

The 21-year-old Sarabjot was in awesome form all through as he emerged leader at the end of the qualification round with 585 points.

Sarabjot Singh of India 🇮🇳 wins Gold🥇in Men’s 10m Air Pistol on the opening day of the ISSF World Cup in Bhopal, India. #indianshooting pic.twitter.com/0F98qUKUVc — indianshooting.com (@indianshooting) March 22, 2023

Sarabjot was hitting the bulls eye every time he took aim, with his scores of 98, 97, 99, 97, 97, 97 in the six qualification series suggesting he would be hard to beat.

China’s Liu Jinyao was a close second at 584.

Six other shooters — Jason Solari (Switzerland, 583 points), Vladimir Svechinko (Uzbekistan, 582), Frederik Larsen (Denmark, 580), Zhang Jie (China, 580), Ruslan Lunev (Azerbaijan, 579) and Varun Tomar (India, 579) — completed the list of eight marksmen who made it to the ranking round.

In the ranking, or elimination round, Sarabjot continued to excel, while 19-year-old Varun, after qualifying eighth and last, began his superb recovery.

At the end of the ranking round, Sarabjot (253.2 points) and Ruslan (251.9) were first and second respectively and both of them entered the gold-medal round high on confidence, while Varun scored 250.3 to settle for bronze.

Advertisement

However, in the battle for the top podium place, the Azerbaijan shooter was no match for Sarabjot.

The gold-medal match was a race to 16 points and Sarabjot was simply unstoppable, winning 16-0.
Summary:
India’s Sarabjot Singh won the men’s air pistol gold in the ISSF Pistol/Rifle World Cup here to open the host country’s medal account on the first day of competitions on Wednesday.
Sarabjot, the 2021 junior world champion in the team and mixed team categories, defeated Azerbaijan’s Ruslan Lunev 16-0 in the gold-medal match in the first final of the World Cup.
Sarabjot Singh of India 🇮🇳 wins Gold🥇in Men’s 10m Air Pistol on the opening day of the ISSF World Cup in Bhopal, India.
#indianshooting pic.twitter.com/0F98qUKUVc — indianshooting.com (@indianshooting) March 22, 2023Sarabjot was hitting the bulls eye every time he took aim, with his scores of 98, 97, 99, 97, 97, 97 in the six qualification series suggesting he would be hard to beat.
In the ranking, or elimination round, Sarabjot continued to excel, while 19-year-old Varun, after qualifying eighth and last, began his superb recovery.

Meta_title: Attempts being made to malign Akali Dal: Punjab former CM Parkash Singh Badal in open letter
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Attempts Being Made To Malign Akali Dal: Badal In Open Letter
Article: BATHINDA: Five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal wrote an open letter to all Punjabis on Monday, alleging deep rooted conspiracy to malign the Akali Dal by registering an attempt to murder cases against him in the Kotkapura firing incident. “Everyone should stand up against such conspiracies,” he wrote.Saying that Punjabis have contributed immensely in the independence movement by making sacrifices and also made the nation self-sufficient in food grains, he said the SAD fought against PM Indira Gandhi ’s oppressive regime during the emergency.“But, when it comes to getting our rights, the yardstick is changed. We had to get the state after many struggles, but failed to get our capital and our waters were also snatched,” he wrote.“Now, I have completed 70 years in service to people and crossed the age of 95. During all this, I faced many ups and downs, faced oppression for the sake of Panth and Punjabis, spent the better part of my life in jails and also got the chance to serve Punjab as its chief minister for five terms.Tried to do justice with everyone, respected everyone despite their religion or faith and ensured peace and communal harmony in the state. Ensured many developmental works and constructed monuments including Virasat-e-Khalsa. My life is like an open book. I never even can think of conspiring against Panth or Punjab.“But I am sorry to say that during my government some ugly incidents happened. It was a serious conspiracy against peace and communal harmony in Punjab. During this period some law and order issues too came to the fore which were unfortunate.I do feel that a thorough probe should be done to get to the bottom of such happenings... earlier Congress, and now the AAP government is playing politics over it. “What could be worse than that the present Punjab government headed by Bhagwant Mann is being run by Arvind Kejriwal from Delhi and has slapped an attempt to murder case on me... it is sheer vendetta,” he wrote.
Summary:
BATHINDA: Five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal wrote an open letter to all Punjabis on Monday, alleging deep rooted conspiracy to malign the Akali Dal by registering an attempt to murder cases against him in the Kotkapura firing incident.
Ensured many developmental works and constructed monuments including Virasat-e-Khalsa.
My life is like an open book.
I never even can think of conspiring against Panth or Punjab.“But I am sorry to say that during my government some ugly incidents happened.
It was a serious conspiracy against peace and communal harmony in Punjab.

Title: Wala: Punjab Congress: Action to ensure less crowd at Moose Wala barsi
Article: MANSA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring, leader of opposition in state assembly Partap Singh Bajwa and party MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira, while attending the barsi of Sidhu Moose Wala questioned the timing of the operation to nab Waris Punjab De head Amritpal Singh."We want Amritpal to be arrested for his actions, but the timing of the action against him was chosen to sabotage the death anniversary of Moose Wala. The state government wanted to deflect attention from back-to-back interviews of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi from jail and expectation of a huge gathering at Moose Wala's 'barsi'. The government, by indulging in such tactics, cannot supress people's voice," said the Congress leaders while speaking to media.
Summary:
MANSA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring, leader of opposition in state assembly Partap Singh Bajwa and party MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira, while attending the barsi of Sidhu Moose Wala questioned the timing of the operation to nab Waris Punjab De head Amritpal Singh.
"We want Amritpal to be arrested for his actions, but the timing of the action against him was chosen to sabotage the death anniversary of Moose Wala.
The state government wanted to deflect attention from back-to-back interviews of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi from jail and expectation of a huge gathering at Moose Wala's 'barsi'.
The government, by indulging in such tactics, cannot supress people's voice," said the Congress leaders while speaking to media.

Title: Lookout issued against Amritpal Singh; earthquake shakes Afghanistan, Pakistan, North India; more
Article:
Punjab Police issued a lookout circular (LOC) against Khalistani separatist Amritpal Singh. The Punjab Police's hunt for the Waris Punjab de chief entered the fifth day on Wednesday.

Meanwhile, a major earthquake of 6.6 magnitude struck Afghanistan's Hindu Kush region on Tuesday. Strong tremors were felt in Pakistan and parts of northern India. According to the United States Geological Survey, the epicentre of the quake was in Afghanistan's Jurm at a depth of 180 kilometres.
Summary:
Punjab Police issued a lookout circular (LOC) against Khalistani separatist Amritpal Singh.
The Punjab Police's hunt for the Waris Punjab de chief entered the fifth day on Wednesday.
Meanwhile, a major earthquake of 6.6 magnitude struck Afghanistan's Hindu Kush region on Tuesday.
Strong tremors were felt in Pakistan and parts of northern India.
According to the United States Geological Survey, the epicentre of the quake was in Afghanistan's Jurm at a depth of 180 kilometres.

Meta_title: Punjab assembly to debate war on drugs today
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Punjab assembly to debate war on drugs today
Article: Chandigarh: As part of the budget session, the Punjab legislative assembly will have a two-hour debate on the state’s war on drugs on Wednesday.The treasury benches also plan to move a resolution against the Himachal government’s ordinance to impose water cess on hydro projects and seek withdrawal of the decision, said a source.The assembly session will resume after a break due to the G-20 events which had been organised in Amritsar last week, and close on the heels of the state-wide operation undertaken to crack down on Waris Punjab De and its supporters. Chief minister Bhagwant Mann will also move a resolution to request the Centre to name the upcoming international airport at Halwara in Ludhiana after freedom fighter Kartar Singh Sarabha .The Punjab government has opposed Himachal’s move to impose water cess on hydro projects on the plea that it would put an additional financial burden on the state and the decision was against the Inter State River Water Disputes Act, 1956.
Summary:
Chandigarh: As part of the budget session, the Punjab legislative assembly will have a two-hour debate on the state’s war on drugs on Wednesday.The treasury benches also plan to move a resolution against the Himachal government’s ordinance to impose water cess on hydro projects and seek withdrawal of the decision, said a source.The assembly session will resume after a break due to the G-20 events which had been organised in Amritsar last week, and close on the heels of the state-wide operation undertaken to crack down on Waris Punjab De and its supporters.
Chief minister Bhagwant Mann will also move a resolution to request the Centre to name the upcoming international airport at Halwara in Ludhiana after freedom fighter Kartar Singh Sarabha .The Punjab government has opposed Himachal’s move to impose water cess on hydro projects on the plea that it would put an additional financial burden on the state and the decision was against the Inter State River Water Disputes Act, 1956.

Meta_title: Punjab internet shutdown causes glitch in income flow, remote work, education
Meta_desc: Describing the current shutdown in Punjab as a “gross violation of civil liberties,” Raman Jit Singh Chima, Asia Pacific Policy director at Access Now,...
Title: Pb Internet Shutdown Causes Glitch In Income Flow, Remote Work, Education
Article: CHANDIGARH: It was raining in Chandigarh on Monday afternoon and Asha Pawa, a contractual employee with an online food delivery service had to return home to her two children without getting any sales because her internet wasn’t working.“There was no internet in the area so I was unable to take orders. Even yesterday, I got lost while delivering an order as the connection was disrupted. The order was delayed,” she said. Asha says she usually makes Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000 from deliveries on weekends, most of which is spent on petrol for her two-wheeler.This weekend though, she could only earn a few hundred due to the state-wide internet shutdown in Punjab, which has also affected mobile internet in Chandigarh. Asha is the sole bread winner in the family.The Punjab government has now extended the shutdown to Tuesday noon. Describing the current shutdown in Punjab as a “gross violation of civil liberties,” Raman Jit Singh Chima, Asia Pacific Policy director at Access Now, a non profit organisation dedicated to safeguarding digital civil rights of people, said, “The shutdown in Punjab is particularly troubling as the entire population has to suffer because of a person and a small group. It is the less privileged who have to suffer the most.”Restaurant businesses have also been affected due to the shutdown. While most restaurants have Wi-Fi, delivery partners can’t take bookings as they are dependent on mobile internet.Hunny, who runs a restaurant in Mohali, says usually he receives about 600-700 food orders on the weekends, but this weekend almost no orders were booked.Those whose work is dependent on mobile internet ran huge losses. A cab driver in Mohali, one of whose children is doing BDS and the other is preparing for NEET, said, “I have to spend a lot of money on the children’s education and I depend on my daily earning as a cab driver to run the house. This internet shutdown has landed me in a precarious position.”The internet shutdown took most by surprise as people were not prepared. A Mohali resident said she had to walk in the rain as she wanted to book a cab but could not.
Summary:
Even yesterday, I got lost while delivering an order as the connection was disrupted.
Asha is the sole bread winner in the family.The Punjab government has now extended the shutdown to Tuesday noon.
It is the less privileged who have to suffer the most.”Restaurant businesses have also been affected due to the shutdown.
This internet shutdown has landed me in a precarious position.”The internet shutdown took most by surprise as people were not prepared.
A Mohali resident said she had to walk in the rain as she wanted to book a cab but could not.

Meta_title: 'Dirty political game' by govts: Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on crackdown in Punjab
Meta_desc: AMRITSAR: Akal Takht officiating jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Tuesday said the state and central governments were playing a "dirty political game",...
Title: Harpreet: 'Dirty political game' by govts: Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on crackdown in Punjab
Article: AMRITSAR: Akal Takht officiating jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Tuesday said the state and central governments were playing a " dirty political game ", like three decades ago by the then governments.In a message, Harpreet said the government was trying to create an atmosphere of panic in the state. "Rumours are being spread due to the internet shutdown as people are not getting correct information," he said, adding that all these acts were creating instability in Punjab . "Being a border state, stability is the most important in Punjab. For that, governments have to talk to Sikhs and resolve their issues," said Harpreet.He said it was worrisome that Sikh youth as young as 16 and 17 years old were being apprehended. He added that the Punjab government should clarify its position on what was happening in the state.
Summary:
AMRITSAR: Akal Takht officiating jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Tuesday said the state and central governments were playing a " dirty political game ", like three decades ago by the then governments.In a message, Harpreet said the government was trying to create an atmosphere of panic in the state.
"Rumours are being spread due to the internet shutdown as people are not getting correct information," he said, adding that all these acts were creating instability in Punjab .
"Being a border state, stability is the most important in Punjab.
For that, governments have to talk to Sikhs and resolve their issues," said Harpreet.He said it was worrisome that Sikh youth as young as 16 and 17 years old were being apprehended.
He added that the Punjab government should clarify its position on what was happening in the state.
