Title: CCTV footage shows how Amritpal Singh escaped | Watch
Article:
As the hunt for pro-Khalistani fugitive Amritpal Singh enters Day 4, India Today has accessed exclusive CCTV footage that shows how the radical leader's convoy escaped in a Mercedes. His convoy had three cars.

Meanwhile, Punjab Police suspects Amritpal Singh might have crossed the state borders after his clothes and an abandoned car were found on Monday. The police said Amritpal Singh got down from a Mercedes and fled to Shahkot in a Brezza. Later, the Waris Punjab De chief changed his clothes and might have escaped from Punjab on the motorbike of one of his aides.
Summary:
As the hunt for pro-Khalistani fugitive Amritpal Singh enters Day 4, India Today has accessed exclusive CCTV footage that shows how the radical leader's convoy escaped in a Mercedes.
His convoy had three cars.
Meanwhile, Punjab Police suspects Amritpal Singh might have crossed the state borders after his clothes and an abandoned car were found on Monday.
The police said Amritpal Singh got down from a Mercedes and fled to Shahkot in a Brezza.
Later, the Waris Punjab De chief changed his clothes and might have escaped from Punjab on the motorbike of one of his aides.

Meta_title: HC slams Punjab govt for failing to arrest Amritpal Singh; seeks status report from police
Meta_desc: “You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as...
Title: HC slams Punjab govt for failing to arrest Amritpal Singh; seeks status report from police
Article:
The Punjab and Haryana High Court termed the escape of radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh as intelligence failure of the state’s police

“You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as intelligence failure of the state’s police.

The court also asked Punjab police to submit a status report on the operation against radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh.

The court’s remarks came even as the police is taking action against members of Amritpal Singh’s outfit ‘Waris Punjab De’.

Also read: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Forces working against India won’t be spared, says Punjab CM

Advertisement

Amritpal Singh, however, has managed to evade an arrest do far. He gave the police a slip and was last seen speeding away on a motorcycle on Saturday evening in Jalandhar.

Punjab crackdown

The Punjab government had launched a major operation against the separatist preacher and have arrested a large number of his supporters so far.

Amritpal Singh’s uncle Harjit Singh and two other aides were flown to Assam on Tuesday. On Sunday, his other four arrested associates were also taken to Dibrugarh Central Jail. The seven men have been charged under the National Security Act (NSA), which allows the police to detain suspects in any prison across the country.

The operation was reportedly a coordinated effort between Punjab government, the Centre, and Assam government. According to various reports, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had discussed the plan to arrest Amritpal Singh with Home Minister Amit Shah in a meeting on March 2.

Home Ministry sources told NDTV that Amritpal Singh was planning to launch a state-wide procession to baptize the youth to carry out suicide attacks and was using de-addiction centres to stockpile weapons illegally sourced from Pakistan.

The centre seems to be moving in to take over the case as a terror investigation with a fresh FIR citing the Arms Act against Amritpal Singh.

Mann’s warning

Meanwhile, Bhagwant Mann said that strict action will be taken against those who have been trying to disturb peace and harmony in the state.

“Punjab’s peace and harmony, and country’s progress is our priority. We will not spare any force working against the country. People of this state want peace and progress,” Mann said, adding, “no incident of violence has been reported after the crackdown against the Khalistani leader.”

The suspension of mobile internet and SMS services will continue in parts of Punjab — Tarn Taran, Ferozepur, Moga, Sangrur and Amritsar’s Ajnala — till Thursday noon. Haryana also is on high alert.

Also read: Punjab: Mobile internet services partially restored, Amritpal’s uncle moved to Dibrugarh jail

The massive crackdown against the Khalistani leader comes a month after Amritpal Singh and his supporters broke into a police station in Ajnala with swords and guns for the release of one of his aides. Six policemen were injured in the clash.
Summary:
The Punjab and Haryana High Court termed the escape of radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh as intelligence failure of the state’s police“You have 80,000 cops, how did Amritpal Singh escape?” the Punjab and Haryana High Court asked the Punjab government on Tuesday and termed it as intelligence failure of the state’s police.
The court also asked Punjab police to submit a status report on the operation against radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh.
Also read: Crackdown on Amritpal Singh: Forces working against India won’t be spared, says Punjab CMAdvertisementAmritpal Singh, however, has managed to evade an arrest do far.
According to various reports, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had discussed the plan to arrest Amritpal Singh with Home Minister Amit Shah in a meeting on March 2.
The centre seems to be moving in to take over the case as a terror investigation with a fresh FIR citing the Arms Act against Amritpal Singh.

Meta_title: Sarabjot Singh clinches air pistol gold in Shooting World Cup
Meta_desc: Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th... The gold-medal match was a race to 16 points and Sarabjot was simply unstoppable,...
Title: Sarabjot Singh clinches air pistol gold in Shooting World Cup
Article:
India’s Sarabjot Singh won the men’s air pistol gold in the ISSF Pistol/Rifle World Cup here to open the host country’s medal account on the first day of competitions on Wednesday.

It was double delight for India as teenage shooter Varun Tomar also bagged a bronze.

Sarabjot, the 2021 junior world champion in the team and mixed team categories, defeated Azerbaijan’s Ruslan Lunev 16-0 in the gold-medal match in the first final of the World Cup.

The 21-year-old Sarabjot was in awesome form all through as he emerged leader at the end of the qualification round with 585 points.

Sarabjot Singh of India 🇮🇳 wins Gold🥇in Men’s 10m Air Pistol on the opening day of the ISSF World Cup in Bhopal, India. #indianshooting pic.twitter.com/0F98qUKUVc — indianshooting.com (@indianshooting) March 22, 2023

Sarabjot was hitting the bulls eye every time he took aim, with his scores of 98, 97, 99, 97, 97, 97 in the six qualification series suggesting he would be hard to beat.

China’s Liu Jinyao was a close second at 584.

Six other shooters — Jason Solari (Switzerland, 583 points), Vladimir Svechinko (Uzbekistan, 582), Frederik Larsen (Denmark, 580), Zhang Jie (China, 580), Ruslan Lunev (Azerbaijan, 579) and Varun Tomar (India, 579) — completed the list of eight marksmen who made it to the ranking round.

In the ranking, or elimination round, Sarabjot continued to excel, while 19-year-old Varun, after qualifying eighth and last, began his superb recovery.

At the end of the ranking round, Sarabjot (253.2 points) and Ruslan (251.9) were first and second respectively and both of them entered the gold-medal round high on confidence, while Varun scored 250.3 to settle for bronze.

Advertisement

However, in the battle for the top podium place, the Azerbaijan shooter was no match for Sarabjot.

The gold-medal match was a race to 16 points and Sarabjot was simply unstoppable, winning 16-0.
Summary:
India’s Sarabjot Singh won the men’s air pistol gold in the ISSF Pistol/Rifle World Cup here to open the host country’s medal account on the first day of competitions on Wednesday.
Sarabjot, the 2021 junior world champion in the team and mixed team categories, defeated Azerbaijan’s Ruslan Lunev 16-0 in the gold-medal match in the first final of the World Cup.
Sarabjot Singh of India 🇮🇳 wins Gold🥇in Men’s 10m Air Pistol on the opening day of the ISSF World Cup in Bhopal, India.
#indianshooting pic.twitter.com/0F98qUKUVc — indianshooting.com (@indianshooting) March 22, 2023Sarabjot was hitting the bulls eye every time he took aim, with his scores of 98, 97, 99, 97, 97, 97 in the six qualification series suggesting he would be hard to beat.
In the ranking, or elimination round, Sarabjot continued to excel, while 19-year-old Varun, after qualifying eighth and last, began his superb recovery.

Meta_title: Manu Bhaker to lead India in ISSF World Cup
Meta_desc: Wrestlers Protest Live Updates: Bajrang Punia makes an appeal after grapp... Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence · Probing allegations against Brij...
Title: Manu Bhaker to lead India in ISSF World Cup
Article:
Star female shooter Manu Bhaker will lead a strong Indian field at the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF) World Cup Rifle/Pistol beginning on Wednesday.

It is the first ever shooting World Cup stage to be held in India outside New Delhi and the men’s and women’s 10m air pistol finals are scheduled on the opening day.

Three Indians each will be in contention for medals in both the events. While Sarabjot Singh, Varun Tomar and Sumit Raman will go first among the men, Rhythm Sangwan, Divya TS and Bhaker will be in contention among the women.

The event was officially inaugurated in a grand opening ceremony by Shivraj Singh Chauhan, Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, here at the Kushabhau Thakre International Convention Centre.

Among the dignitaries present was Luciano Rossi, President ISSF.

The men’s 10m air pistol event has a 24-strong field while the women have 19 vying for the coveted ISSF World Cup medal with both the reigning world champions Liu Jinyao (men) and Lu Kaiman of China in the fray.
Summary:
Star female shooter Manu Bhaker will lead a strong Indian field at the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF) World Cup Rifle/Pistol beginning on Wednesday.
It is the first ever shooting World Cup stage to be held in India outside New Delhi and the men’s and women’s 10m air pistol finals are scheduled on the opening day.
While Sarabjot Singh, Varun Tomar and Sumit Raman will go first among the men, Rhythm Sangwan, Divya TS and Bhaker will be in contention among the women.
The event was officially inaugurated in a grand opening ceremony by Shivraj Singh Chauhan, Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, here at the Kushabhau Thakre International Convention Centre.
The men’s 10m air pistol event has a 24-strong field while the women have 19 vying for the coveted ISSF World Cup medal with both the reigning world champions Liu Jinyao (men) and Lu Kaiman of China in the fray.

Meta_title: Attempts being made to malign Akali Dal: Punjab former CM Parkash Singh Badal in open letter
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Attempts Being Made To Malign Akali Dal: Badal In Open Letter
Article: BATHINDA: Five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal wrote an open letter to all Punjabis on Monday, alleging deep rooted conspiracy to malign the Akali Dal by registering an attempt to murder cases against him in the Kotkapura firing incident. “Everyone should stand up against such conspiracies,” he wrote.Saying that Punjabis have contributed immensely in the independence movement by making sacrifices and also made the nation self-sufficient in food grains, he said the SAD fought against PM Indira Gandhi ’s oppressive regime during the emergency.“But, when it comes to getting our rights, the yardstick is changed. We had to get the state after many struggles, but failed to get our capital and our waters were also snatched,” he wrote.“Now, I have completed 70 years in service to people and crossed the age of 95. During all this, I faced many ups and downs, faced oppression for the sake of Panth and Punjabis, spent the better part of my life in jails and also got the chance to serve Punjab as its chief minister for five terms.Tried to do justice with everyone, respected everyone despite their religion or faith and ensured peace and communal harmony in the state. Ensured many developmental works and constructed monuments including Virasat-e-Khalsa. My life is like an open book. I never even can think of conspiring against Panth or Punjab.“But I am sorry to say that during my government some ugly incidents happened. It was a serious conspiracy against peace and communal harmony in Punjab. During this period some law and order issues too came to the fore which were unfortunate.I do feel that a thorough probe should be done to get to the bottom of such happenings... earlier Congress, and now the AAP government is playing politics over it. “What could be worse than that the present Punjab government headed by Bhagwant Mann is being run by Arvind Kejriwal from Delhi and has slapped an attempt to murder case on me... it is sheer vendetta,” he wrote.
Summary:
BATHINDA: Five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal wrote an open letter to all Punjabis on Monday, alleging deep rooted conspiracy to malign the Akali Dal by registering an attempt to murder cases against him in the Kotkapura firing incident.
Ensured many developmental works and constructed monuments including Virasat-e-Khalsa.
My life is like an open book.
I never even can think of conspiring against Panth or Punjab.“But I am sorry to say that during my government some ugly incidents happened.
It was a serious conspiracy against peace and communal harmony in Punjab.

Meta_title: JD(U) appoints new presidents in 10 organisational districts in Bihar
Meta_desc: JD(U) appoints new presidents in 10 organisational districts in Bihar ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi...
Title: JD(U) appoints new presidents in 10 organisational districts in Bihar
Article: PATNA: JD(U) on Monday appointed new presidents in the remaining nine districts where organizational elections could not be held in November last year due to various reasons including gross irregularities in the election process.The party has 51 organisational districts in Bihar and it announced the election of district presidents for its 42 organisational districts on November 23 last year. The election of district presidents in the remaining nine organization districts – Madhepura , Muzaffarpur, Sheikhpura , Rohtas , Aurangabad, Muzaffarpur Nagar, Darbhanga Nagar, Katihar Nagar and Begusarai Nagar -- were postponed due to different reasons.JD(U) state president Umesh Singh Kushwaha on Monday nominated new presidents for these nine districts. While former minister Ramesh Rishideo was nominated as the party’s district president of Madhepura, former MLA Randhir Kumar Soni (Sheikhpura), former MLA Ashok Kumar Singh (Aurangabad), Ram Babu Kushwaha (Muzaffarpur), Ajay Kushwaha (Rohtas), Anupam Singh (Muzaffarpur Nagar), Madhaw Jha (Darbhanga Nagar), Mukesh Kumar (Katihar Nagar) and Sanjay Singh was nominated for Begusarai Nagar district, a press note issued by the party state president said.The JD(U) state president also nominated Mohammad Arshad as new president of Nalanda district. The post was vacant after the death of its last president Siya Sharan Thakur in January this year.JD(U)’s then state election officer Janardan Prasad Singh on Monday said the election of Muzaffarpur district president was postponed due to the ongoing by-election in Kurhani assembly constituency, while the elections in other eight organizational districts were postponed due to complaints of large-scale irregularities by the respective district election officers.He said the party had formed a three-member committee, headed by former MLC Haroon Rashid, to inquire into the complaints of irregularities in the eight organizational districts.
Summary:
PATNA: JD(U) on Monday appointed new presidents in the remaining nine districts where organizational elections could not be held in November last year due to various reasons including gross irregularities in the election process.The party has 51 organisational districts in Bihar and it announced the election of district presidents for its 42 organisational districts on November 23 last year.
The election of district presidents in the remaining nine organization districts – Madhepura , Muzaffarpur, Sheikhpura , Rohtas , Aurangabad, Muzaffarpur Nagar, Darbhanga Nagar, Katihar Nagar and Begusarai Nagar -- were postponed due to different reasons.JD(U) state president Umesh Singh Kushwaha on Monday nominated new presidents for these nine districts.
While former minister Ramesh Rishideo was nominated as the party’s district president of Madhepura, former MLA Randhir Kumar Soni (Sheikhpura), former MLA Ashok Kumar Singh (Aurangabad), Ram Babu Kushwaha (Muzaffarpur), Ajay Kushwaha (Rohtas), Anupam Singh (Muzaffarpur Nagar), Madhaw Jha (Darbhanga Nagar), Mukesh Kumar (Katihar Nagar) and Sanjay Singh was nominated for Begusarai Nagar district, a press note issued by the party state president said.The JD(U) state president also nominated Mohammad Arshad as new president of Nalanda district.
The post was vacant after the death of its last president Siya Sharan Thakur in January this year.JD(U)’s then state election officer Janardan Prasad Singh on Monday said the election of Muzaffarpur district president was postponed due to the ongoing by-election in Kurhani assembly constituency, while the elections in other eight organizational districts were postponed due to complaints of large-scale irregularities by the respective district election officers.He said the party had formed a three-member committee, headed by former MLC Haroon Rashid, to inquire into the complaints of irregularities in the eight organizational districts.

Meta_title: Lone INLD MLA barred from Haryana assembly for day
Meta_desc: CHANDIGARH: Ellenabad MLA Abhay Singh Chautala was barred from the Haryana assembly proceedings on Monday over alleged unparliamentary behaviour.
Title: Lone INLD MLA barred from Haryana assembly for day
Article: CHANDIGARH: Ellenabad MLA Abhay Singh Chautala was barred from the Haryana assembly proceedings on Monday over alleged unparliamentary behaviour. There were heated arguments between him and speaker Gian Chand Gupta during the question hour, when the lone INLD MLA sought to know whether the government had taken any steps to raise the level of groundwater in the 'dark zones' (an area where the groundwater level has fallen considerably).He asked a supplementary question, seeking details of the money spent on the upkeep of ponds and their beautification. The speaker intervened and asked him to put a separate question on the issue he was raising in his supplementary question. However, the MLA started arguing with the chair, asking whether the latter had any "takleef" (problem) with him asking the question.As the speaker asked Abhay to refrain from using unparliamentary language, chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar intervened, saying the argument with the chair was disrespectful to the entire House. Abhay retaliated by blaming the speaker instead. Gupta asked the INLA MLA to either "take back your words" or leave the House.When Abhay did not respond, the speaker said, "I name Abhay Singh Chautala, your behaviour is unparliamentary. During question hour, you can ask supplementary questions, but you cannot argue with the chair."Speaking to media persons later, Abhay alleged a calculated conspiracy by the ruling BJP-JJP government to prevent him from raising the voice of common men. He even accused the Congress of indirectly supporting the government.During the zero hour and discussion on budget, Congress MLAs launched a scathing attack on the BJP-JJP government. Former CLP leader Kiran Choudhry termed the budget as "Rahu Kaal Budget" while former minister Geeta Bhukkal said it was "a complete bundle of lies, a figure game fudged by CM Manohar Lal Khattar" .
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: Ellenabad MLA Abhay Singh Chautala was barred from the Haryana assembly proceedings on Monday over alleged unparliamentary behaviour.
The speaker intervened and asked him to put a separate question on the issue he was raising in his supplementary question.
Gupta asked the INLA MLA to either "take back your words" or leave the House.When Abhay did not respond, the speaker said, "I name Abhay Singh Chautala, your behaviour is unparliamentary.
During question hour, you can ask supplementary questions, but you cannot argue with the chair.
"Speaking to media persons later, Abhay alleged a calculated conspiracy by the ruling BJP-JJP government to prevent him from raising the voice of common men.

Meta_title: Punjab top cops to face action for 2022 breach in PM Narendra Modi’s security
Meta_desc: About the Author ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Punjab top cops to face action for 2022 breach in PM Narendra Modi’s security
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government has finally decided to initiate disciplinary proceedings for a “major penalty” against former DGP Siddharth Chattopadhyaya, then DIG (Ferozepur range) Inderbir Singh and then SSP (Ferozepur) Harmandeep Singh Hans for a breach in the security of PM Narendra Modi during his Punjab visit on January 5, 2022.In a major security lapse, the PM’s motorcade had remained stuck on a flyover on the Moga-Ferozepur highway for nearly 20 minutes as the farmers were protesting against his visit.The letter sent by the Punjab home affairs and justice department to the personnel department on Monday evening mentioned that the “chief minister has decided” to seek explanations from then ADGP (law and order) Naresh Arora, then ADGP (cyber crime) G Nageshwara Rao, then IG (Patiala range) Mukhwinder Singh Chhina, then IG (counter intelligence-cum-ASLO and nodal officer) Rakesh Agrawal, then DIG (Faridkot) Surjeet Singh, and then SSP (Moga) Charanjit Singh as to why disciplinary proceedings should not be initiated against them as recommended by the Supreme Court-constituted inquiry committee headed by retired SC judge Indu Malhotra.Since the committee had also raised questions about the role of then chief secretary Anirudh Tewari, the state government has decided to issue him a show-cause notice seeking an explanation. The committee had on August 25, 2022 submitted its report to the SC, indicting nine officers for the “colossal failure in planning and coordination”.Now, the state government will issue chargesheets to then DGP Chattopadhyaya, then DIG (Ferozepur) Inderbir and then SSP (Ferozepur) Hans, and appoint an inquiry officer to give a hearing to all officers indicted by the inquiry committee. At the time of the security breach, the then CM, Charanjit Singh Channi , had claimed that there was no security lapse.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government has finally decided to initiate disciplinary proceedings for a “major penalty” against former DGP Siddharth Chattopadhyaya, then DIG (Ferozepur range) Inderbir Singh and then SSP (Ferozepur) Harmandeep Singh Hans for a breach in the security of PM Narendra Modi during his Punjab visit on January 5, 2022.In a major security lapse, the PM’s motorcade had remained stuck on a flyover on the Moga-Ferozepur highway for nearly 20 minutes as the farmers were protesting against his visit.The letter sent by the Punjab home affairs and justice department to the personnel department on Monday evening mentioned that the “chief minister has decided” to seek explanations from then ADGP (law and order) Naresh Arora, then ADGP (cyber crime) G Nageshwara Rao, then IG (Patiala range) Mukhwinder Singh Chhina, then IG (counter intelligence-cum-ASLO and nodal officer) Rakesh Agrawal, then DIG (Faridkot) Surjeet Singh, and then SSP (Moga) Charanjit Singh as to why disciplinary proceedings should not be initiated against them as recommended by the Supreme Court-constituted inquiry committee headed by retired SC judge Indu Malhotra.Since the committee had also raised questions about the role of then chief secretary Anirudh Tewari, the state government has decided to issue him a show-cause notice seeking an explanation.
The committee had on August 25, 2022 submitted its report to the SC, indicting nine officers for the “colossal failure in planning and coordination”.Now, the state government will issue chargesheets to then DGP Chattopadhyaya, then DIG (Ferozepur) Inderbir and then SSP (Ferozepur) Hans, and appoint an inquiry officer to give a hearing to all officers indicted by the inquiry committee.
At the time of the security breach, the then CM, Charanjit Singh Channi , had claimed that there was no security lapse.

Meta_title: Constable dismissed for criminal activities
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... 10th Result 2023Same Sex MarriagePM Modi in KeralaBrij BhushanKedarnath...
Title: Constable dismissed for criminal activities
Article: Indore: A police constable was dismissed from service for carrying out criminal activities. A case was registered against him at Kshipra police station three days ago for looting a man by throwing chilly powder in his eyes. He is also a habitual offender and has ten cases against him at various police stations.Additional commissioner Manish Kapooria said that they had received a complaint against constable Jitendra from one Mukesh on Saturday that the accused had thrown chilly powder on him and made away with Rs 10,000 cash from him. Acting on the information, a case was registered against the accused constable Jitendra Rathore under section 394 of robbery.Police said that it was found that there are over 10 cases of violence and others registered against him at various police stations and had been using his power as a policeman to hurt people. Acting on increasing number of complaints and cases against him, Jitendra was dismissed from duties under section 311(2)(C) of the constitution. TNN
Summary:
Indore: A police constable was dismissed from service for carrying out criminal activities.
A case was registered against him at Kshipra police station three days ago for looting a man by throwing chilly powder in his eyes.
He is also a habitual offender and has ten cases against him at various police stations.Additional commissioner Manish Kapooria said that they had received a complaint against constable Jitendra from one Mukesh on Saturday that the accused had thrown chilly powder on him and made away with Rs 10,000 cash from him.
Acting on the information, a case was registered against the accused constable Jitendra Rathore under section 394 of robbery.Police said that it was found that there are over 10 cases of violence and others registered against him at various police stations and had been using his power as a policeman to hurt people.
Acting on increasing number of complaints and cases against him, Jitendra was dismissed from duties under section 311(2)(C) of the constitution.

Meta_title: 2 cousins on bike fall into canal in southeast Delhi, body of one found
Meta_desc: The two men were identified as Rahul (32) and Hemender Singh (30), both residents of Molarband Extension. Rahul's body was found on Monday.
Title: 2 cousins on bike fall into canal in southeast Delhi, body of one found
Article: NEW DELHI: Two men who were cousins drowned when they fell into a canal in southeast Delhi 's Molarband Extension on Sunday after their speeding motorcycle lost balance.An eyewitness who saw the duo falling into the canal said that the bike was moving at a high speed and jumped over a speed breaker and lost balance.Police, fire tenders and divers after a nearly 24-hour hunt fished out the body of one man. A hunt for the other is still on.According to police, on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, the Badarpur police station got a call that reported the possible drowning of two persons.The caller informed the cops that two men had fallen in a canal and were drowning.A team including the station house officer (SHO) and staff immediately reached the location and found a motorcycle bearing a Delhi number on the bank of the canal opposite Atal Park in the Badarpur area.The two men were identified as Rahul (32) and Hemender Singh (30), both residents of Molarband Extension. Rahul's body was found on Monday.Rajesh Deo, the deputy commissioner of police, South-East, said: "The duo were on their motorcycle and were coming from the F block side towards Atal Park. There, the motorcycle got disbalanced and they fell into the canal. Passers-by saw them drowning and tried to save them but to no avail. The crime team, disaster management team, ambulance and divers were called in."Deo added that effort was made to fish out the bodies. Around 4.30pm, the body of one of them was found."A search is under way. A fire tender, five divers from the disaster management team, an ambulance and an SHO with sufficient staff are present on the spot for the search," Deo said.Hemender was working in a private company in Noida as an assistant in HR department. He was married and had a five-month-old daughter. Rahul worked as a lab technician in the radiology department of a hospital. He is unmarried and living with his parents and brother.Omender Singh, Hemender's father, stated that his son and nephew Rahul had gone to meet a relative nearby and were returning home when the accident happened."He was my only child. He is survived by his wife and five-month-old daughter. I just want some help for them. I got to know about the incident after people reached our house after tracing the address as the bike belonged to my son. Rahul's body has been recovered but I hope they find my son's body too," Omender said.
Summary:
Rahul's body was found on Monday.Rajesh Deo, the deputy commissioner of police, South-East, said: "The duo were on their motorcycle and were coming from the F block side towards Atal Park.
There, the motorcycle got disbalanced and they fell into the canal.
The crime team, disaster management team, ambulance and divers were called in.
I got to know about the incident after people reached our house after tracing the address as the bike belonged to my son.
Rahul's body has been recovered but I hope they find my son's body too," Omender said.

Meta_title: Disproportionate assets: VB quizzes ex-MLA for 6 hours in Ludhiana
Meta_desc: LUDHIANA: The Vigilance Bureau (Ludhiana range) quizzed former Congress MLA from Gill constituency Kuldeep Singh Vaid for over six hours in the...
Title: Vaid: Disproportionate Assets: Vb Quizzes Ex-mla For 6 Hours
Article: LUDHIANA: The Vigilance Bureau (Ludhiana range) quizzed former Congress MLA from Gill constituency Kuldeep Singh Vaid for over six hours in the disproportionate assets case, at its office on Monday.A bureaucrat-turned-Congress leader, Vaid reached the VB office at 11am and he was questioned till 5.30pm. An official of Vigilance Bureau (Ludhiana range) said Vaid has been questioned related to his properties and other assets. Vaid cooperated with officials during questioning, he added.“He will be summoned again next week. He has been asked to bring documents related to his properties, investments and bank accounts. Meanwhile, the VB will get details related to Vaid’s properties from the revenue department, Ludhiana improvement trust and municipal corporation, details of which are awaited. After examining the details that we expect to receive soon from the departments and documents submitted by Vaid, the VB may reach some conclusion,” the official said.On March 13, the VB Ludhiana Range had conducted a raid at Kuldeep Vaid’s residence in posh Sarabha Nagar area. A technical team from VB headquarter had reached there for evaluation of properties and assets owned by Vaid. During this raid, the bureau team found bottles of imported liquor and liquor meant for sale in Chandigarh from his house.Though Vaid and his councillor son Harkaran Singh Vaid had two permits to possess liquor, the quantity of bottles was more than the permitted limit. Therefore, an FIR under Excise Act was lodged against Vaid.Thereafter on March 14, the VB team had conducted a raid at a commercial building owned by Vaid on Pakhowal road which is given on rent to a bank, a hotel and a restaurant and bar. During the raid, the bureau had found that the map of the building approved only two floors of the building, whereas the building has five floors. A report on the same has also been sought from the municipal corporation.The VB so far got details of nine properties owned by Vaid. Vaid’s wife has retired as a principal from a government school, while his son Harkaran Singh Vaid is Congress councillor.
Summary:
LUDHIANA: The Vigilance Bureau (Ludhiana range) quizzed former Congress MLA from Gill constituency Kuldeep Singh Vaid for over six hours in the disproportionate assets case, at its office on Monday.A bureaucrat-turned-Congress leader, Vaid reached the VB office at 11am and he was questioned till 5.30pm.
An official of Vigilance Bureau (Ludhiana range) said Vaid has been questioned related to his properties and other assets.
Meanwhile, the VB will get details related to Vaid’s properties from the revenue department, Ludhiana improvement trust and municipal corporation, details of which are awaited.
A technical team from VB headquarter had reached there for evaluation of properties and assets owned by Vaid.
A report on the same has also been sought from the municipal corporation.The VB so far got details of nine properties owned by Vaid.

Meta_title: Qaumi Insaaf Morcha digs in, pitches tents at Mohali's Sohana crossing
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi...
Title: Morcha: Morcha Digs In, Pitches Tents At Sohana Crossing
Article: MOHALI: Members of Qaumi Insaaf Morcha (QIM) refused to vacate the traffic crossing at Singh Shaheedan Gurdwara in Sohana here on the airport road on the third day of their protest in support of Khalistan sympathiser Amritpal Singh despite rainfall on Monday.The protesters pitched tents, showing their intentions to dig in for a long haul even as cops strengthened security in and around the protest site. Mohali SSP Sandeep Garg said, “We have cordoned off the site. The protest is peaceful at the moment. Diversions have been made and the protest spot declared out of bounds. Round the clock vigil is being kept on the protesters.”Traffic is being diverted around 500 metres from the crossing on both sides. The YPS crossing is already closed to public since January 7 within hundreds of morcha activists stationed at the site. For a few weeks, the dividing road of sectors 52 and 53 had remained closed for vehicular traffic before it was thrown open last week.
Summary:
Mohali SSP Sandeep Garg said, “We have cordoned off the site.
Diversions have been made and the protest spot declared out of bounds.
Round the clock vigil is being kept on the protesters.”Traffic is being diverted around 500 metres from the crossing on both sides.
The YPS crossing is already closed to public since January 7 within hundreds of morcha activists stationed at the site.
For a few weeks, the dividing road of sectors 52 and 53 had remained closed for vehicular traffic before it was thrown open last week.

Meta_title: Udaipur cops arrest over 750 criminals in raids over past 2 days
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Udaipur Raid News: Udaipur Cops Arrest Over 750 Criminals In Raids Over Past 2 Days
Article: JAIPUR: A day after the major crackdown against criminals associated with various gangs, Udaipur police arrested 408 more criminals on Monday. Senior police officers of Rajasthan police headquarters on Monday stated that the outcome of these raids will further fetch good results in crime prevention and maintaining better law and order in the state.Earlier on Sunday, massive raids were conducted at 350 places in 7 districts and 367 persons were arrested. The raids were conducted in Churu, Sriganganagar, Bikaner, Udaipur, Sirohi, Pali and Jodhpur (Rural) districts.“It has been found in the investigation that Ashish Bishnoi, aide of Lawrence Bishnoi was mainly into providing shelter to the shooters and others who had committed the crime on the behest of Bishnoi. He has also emerged as a financer of Lawrence Bishnoi,” said Om Prakash, inspector general of police (Bikaner Range).He added that another accused Hari Om Ramawat, an aide of Rohit Godara had introduced Ritik Boxer to Godara. “He was into alluring teenagers and youngsters into crime and is a close aide of Rohit Godara,” Prakash added.He further stated that interrogation of various accused arrested by the Bikaner Range was underway.Dinesh MN, additional director general (ADG), crime, said that the arrests of 367 criminals who are directly or indirectly associated with various gangs will fetch the police good results in crime prevention and maintaining better law and order.“They would be quizzed on their supply chain of arms, who is controlling them and whose orders they are following. Also, we will keep on organising similar raids across the state to break the nexus,” he added.
Summary:
JAIPUR: A day after the major crackdown against criminals associated with various gangs, Udaipur police arrested 408 more criminals on Monday.
Senior police officers of Rajasthan police headquarters on Monday stated that the outcome of these raids will further fetch good results in crime prevention and maintaining better law and order in the state.Earlier on Sunday, massive raids were conducted at 350 places in 7 districts and 367 persons were arrested.
The raids were conducted in Churu, Sriganganagar, Bikaner, Udaipur, Sirohi, Pali and Jodhpur (Rural) districts.“It has been found in the investigation that Ashish Bishnoi, aide of Lawrence Bishnoi was mainly into providing shelter to the shooters and others who had committed the crime on the behest of Bishnoi.
He has also emerged as a financer of Lawrence Bishnoi,” said Om Prakash, inspector general of police (Bikaner Range).He added that another accused Hari Om Ramawat, an aide of Rohit Godara had introduced Ritik Boxer to Godara.
Also, we will keep on organising similar raids across the state to break the nexus,” he added.

Meta_title: New Zealand Olympic runner Zane Robertson slapped with eight-year ban
Meta_desc: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence · Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th... Robertson is banned from...
Title: New Zealand Olympic runner Zane Robertson slapped with eight-year ban
Article:
New Zealand middle- and long-distance runner Zane Robertson, who competed at the Rio and Tokyo Olympics, has been banned for eight years for doping and interfering with the testing process, the Sports Tribunal of New Zealand said on Wednesday.

The 33-year-old, a bronze medallist in the 5,000 metres at the 2014 Commonwealth Games, received one four-year ban for testing positive for the banned substance erythropoietin (EPO) and another for tampering with evidence. Robertson tested positive for EPO, which stimulates red blood cell production and enhances performance in endurance events, at the Manchester Great Race in May 2022.

Advertisement · Scroll to continue

“Mr Robertson elected to have his ‘B’ sample tested and this confirmed the original result. He subsequently accepted the presence of the prohibited substance but asked to be heard in relation to sanction,” STNZ said in a media release.

“Mr Robertson filed evidence which was contested by Drug Free Sport New Zealand (DFSNZ), and which led to the allegation of tampering,” the release said.

Robertson is banned from competitive sport until September 2030, having been credited for time served under a provisional suspension put in place after his positive test last year.
Summary:
New Zealand middle- and long-distance runner Zane Robertson, who competed at the Rio and Tokyo Olympics, has been banned for eight years for doping and interfering with the testing process, the Sports Tribunal of New Zealand said on Wednesday.
The 33-year-old, a bronze medallist in the 5,000 metres at the 2014 Commonwealth Games, received one four-year ban for testing positive for the banned substance erythropoietin (EPO) and another for tampering with evidence.
Robertson tested positive for EPO, which stimulates red blood cell production and enhances performance in endurance events, at the Manchester Great Race in May 2022.

“Mr Robertson filed evidence which was contested by Drug Free Sport New Zealand (DFSNZ), and which led to the allegation of tampering,” the release said.

Meta_title: Have to make it Punjab again, not Afghanistan: Bhagwant Mann
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Have to make it Punjab again, not Afghanistan: Bhagwant Mann
Article: CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann , in a video message in Punjabi , on Friday assured that his government would not let anyone cause unrest in the state. Mann reiterated that it was his responsibility to ensure that peace and communal brotherhood is maintained, and "we want to make the state Punjab again, and not Afghanistan ".The chief minister said some self-proclaimed religious leaders who have nothing to do with the state and its people want to disturb its peace and amity, but "such evil designs will not be allowed at any cost and they will be given a befitting reply".He said, "We want to see laptops, international medals and appointment letters in the hands of our youth. They cannot be treated as raw material for factories set up in the name of religion. It is the age of learning and progress and we have to move with time."Mann said it was easy to give sermons of taking up weapons to the sons of other families, but such preachers run away when they are faced with the harsh reality. Emphasising that the sole motive of such leaders was to disturb the hard earned peace of the state through their venomous ideas, he pointed out that they were highly mistaken if they thought that they could divide people on communal lines because the peace-loving Punjabis would thwart any such attempt.Dwelling on the need to educate the coming generations to make them self-reliant, the CM said, "I want to assure the 3 crore people of the state that the state will help you in your progress." Mann added that AAP knows how to form the government and also to run the state. "I want to assure Punjabis that they should retain their faith as it gives me immense encouragement," he said.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann , in a video message in Punjabi , on Friday assured that his government would not let anyone cause unrest in the state.
They cannot be treated as raw material for factories set up in the name of religion.
"Mann said it was easy to give sermons of taking up weapons to the sons of other families, but such preachers run away when they are faced with the harsh reality.
Mann added that AAP knows how to form the government and also to run the state.
"I want to assure Punjabis that they should retain their faith as it gives me immense encouragement," he said.

Meta_title: Will rallyists be booked under NSA, asks BJP
Meta_desc: Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed...
Title: Will rallyists be booked under NSA, asks BJP
Article: Raipur: The opposition BJP in Chhattisgarh criticized chief minister Bhupesh Baghel over a protest rally taken out in support of Waris-de Punjab chief Amritpal Singh and asked whether they would be booked under the National Security Act (NSA).Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed apprehension that Congress was “conspiring to spoil the atmosphere of Chhattisgarh before the upcoming assembly elections”.He alleged that the Congress government is trying to disturb law and order in Chhattisgarh by “giving protection to Khalistanis”. He shared Randhawa's social media profile and photographs, describing his closeness with senior Congress leaders and questioned the “relationship between Randhawa and the chief minister of Chhattisgarh”.Munat said that the Congress government recently asked its collectors to book those trying to take law and order into their hands under NSA and now it must clear its stand on what he termed a “pro-Khalistan rally”.The Congress hit back at BJP for questioning CM Baghel’s stand. Congress spokesperson Dhananjay Singh Thakur said that the Union home ministry should reply on how a person, who came to India from Dubai six months ago and carried out anti-national activities, managed to escape.“As far as Chhattisgarh is concerned, the rule of law prevails here. National security is of utmost priority for Congress. The BJP at the Centre can only take action against opposition leaders,” Thakur said, adding that the state government is taking strict action in this case.
Summary:
Raipur: The opposition BJP in Chhattisgarh criticized chief minister Bhupesh Baghel over a protest rally taken out in support of Waris-de Punjab chief Amritpal Singh and asked whether they would be booked under the National Security Act (NSA).Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed apprehension that Congress was “conspiring to spoil the atmosphere of Chhattisgarh before the upcoming assembly elections”.He alleged that the Congress government is trying to disturb law and order in Chhattisgarh by “giving protection to Khalistanis”.
He shared Randhawa's social media profile and photographs, describing his closeness with senior Congress leaders and questioned the “relationship between Randhawa and the chief minister of Chhattisgarh”.Munat said that the Congress government recently asked its collectors to book those trying to take law and order into their hands under NSA and now it must clear its stand on what he termed a “pro-Khalistan rally”.The Congress hit back at BJP for questioning CM Baghel’s stand.
Congress spokesperson Dhananjay Singh Thakur said that the Union home ministry should reply on how a person, who came to India from Dubai six months ago and carried out anti-national activities, managed to escape.“As far as Chhattisgarh is concerned, the rule of law prevails here.
National security is of utmost priority for Congress.
The BJP at the Centre can only take action against opposition leaders,” Thakur said, adding that the state government is taking strict action in this case.

Meta_title: Punjab Human Rights Organisation demands investigations into arrival, rise of Amritpal Singh
Meta_desc: PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has...
Title: Amritpal Singh Khalsa News: Punjab Human Rights Organisation demands investigations into arrival, rise of Amritpal Singh
Article: AMRITSAR: While refusing the accept the police theory of Amritpal Singh "absconding" from high police security, the Punjab Human Rights Organisations (PHRO) has demanded an investigation — by a retired judge of the high court — into his sudden arrival in Punjab from Dubai, issuances of armed licences to Waris Punjab De activists, stoic silence made by police over Amritpal’s Khalistan rhetorics and his sudden rise.Also See: Amritpal Singh Live Updates PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has raised further suspicions of some "unseen forces working behind the whole incident" which should be investigated.While stating that police were showing only February 18 CCTV footage to the media, he asked, "Why did the police not procure the CCTV footage after February 18 or was it deliberately not showing for the reasons best known to the police?"Not arresting Amritpal when he went to Ajnala from his native village Jallupur Khera on February 23, and instead of arresting him from his home and launching a manhunt had raised several questions on the incompetence of Punjab police or the "hidden forces" behind the whole operation, he opined.He said if the reports of Amritpal being traced in Haryana were correct then it was a complete incompetence of Punjab police or a deliberate and planned strategy to allow him to "run" to break his aura in public eyes, especially among those who had been following him and involved him in more cases.Meanwhile, senior superintendent of police, Pathankot, Harkamal Preet Singh Khakh said that they had laid nakas on the interstate borders with Chamba and Kangra in Himachal Pradesh and Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir."Each naka has a strength of 25 police personnel who are on round-the-clock duty to keep a check on every interstate border movement," said Khakah.Being a second line of defence, he said, they had also laid eight strong nakas on the roads leading to the Indo-Pak international border in Pathankot district.Ashok Rattan, superintendent of police of Nurpur in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, said they had strengthened the security on Nurpur-Pathankot border at Kandwal and Neelwan borders and had made an extra deployment to monitor the borders round the clock.Similar security arrangements have been made by the Chamaba police near Chamba-Pathankot areas.A highly placed source in the Border Security Force (BSF) said that they had also strengthened the security on the entire belt of 553 kilometers of Indo-Pak international border in Punjab.Despite heavy security arrangements, a person inadvertently crossed the border to Pakistan from near Rattan Khurd Border out Post of BSF in the Amritsar sector on March 22 and was held by Pak Rangers near their GS Wala post.However, he was handed over to BSF on the same day.The initial investigation revealed that the inadvertent border crosser was Sailesh, resident of Ballimaran, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.
Summary:
AMRITSAR: While refusing the accept the police theory of Amritpal Singh "absconding" from high police security, the Punjab Human Rights Organisations (PHRO) has demanded an investigation — by a retired judge of the high court — into his sudden arrival in Punjab from Dubai, issuances of armed licences to Waris Punjab De activists, stoic silence made by police over Amritpal’s Khalistan rhetorics and his sudden rise.Also See: Amritpal Singh Live Updates PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has raised further suspicions of some "unseen forces working behind the whole incident" which should be investigated.While stating that police were showing only February 18 CCTV footage to the media, he asked, "Why did the police not procure the CCTV footage after February 18 or was it deliberately not showing for the reasons best known to the police?
"Not arresting Amritpal when he went to Ajnala from his native village Jallupur Khera on February 23, and instead of arresting him from his home and launching a manhunt had raised several questions on the incompetence of Punjab police or the "hidden forces" behind the whole operation, he opined.He said if the reports of Amritpal being traced in Haryana were correct then it was a complete incompetence of Punjab police or a deliberate and planned strategy to allow him to "run" to break his aura in public eyes, especially among those who had been following him and involved him in more cases.Meanwhile, senior superintendent of police, Pathankot, Harkamal Preet Singh Khakh said that they had laid nakas on the interstate borders with Chamba and Kangra in Himachal Pradesh and Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir.
"Each naka has a strength of 25 police personnel who are on round-the-clock duty to keep a check on every interstate border movement," said Khakah.Being a second line of defence, he said, they had also laid eight strong nakas on the roads leading to the Indo-Pak international border in Pathankot district.Ashok Rattan, superintendent of police of Nurpur in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, said they had strengthened the security on Nurpur-Pathankot border at Kandwal and Neelwan borders and had made an extra deployment to monitor the borders round the clock.Similar security arrangements have been made by the Chamaba police near Chamba-Pathankot areas.A highly placed source in the Border Security Force (BSF) said that they had also strengthened the security on the entire belt of 553 kilometers of Indo-Pak international border in Punjab.Despite heavy security arrangements, a person inadvertently crossed the border to Pakistan from near Rattan Khurd Border out Post of BSF in the Amritsar sector on March 22 and was held by Pak Rangers near their GS Wala post.However, he was handed over to BSF on the same day.The initial investigation revealed that the inadvertent border crosser was Sailesh, resident of Ballimaran, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.

Meta_title: NCB destroys contraband, observes Drug Disposal Day
Meta_desc: Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh...
Title: NCB destroys contraband, observes Drug Disposal Day
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Narcotics Control Bureau's Chandigarh zonal unit observed Drug Disposal Day on Friday, wherein seized narcotics were destroyed in the virtual presence of Union home minister Amit Shah.Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh unit burnt 211.75kg poppy straw/poppy husk& powder, 5880 tablets of diphenoxylate, 4.78kg of heroin & 6.1kg of charas which were seized by the NCN CZU in 9 cases of the year 2022. Today various zones of the NCB simultaneously conducted disposal of drugs throughout India namely Bangaluru, Delhi, Chandigarh, Cochin, Jodhpur, Patna & Indore zones. The Union home minister & minister of cooperation Amit Shah addressed the regional conference on drug trafficking & national security for southern states /UTs at Bengaluru, Karnataka."Others present on the occasion included, Mohinder Jit Singh, assistant director, Rajneesh DSP crime, Chandigarh police, Varinder Singh, superintendent, DRI, Chandigarh, Meera Kumari Meena, superintendent and other officials of NCB Chandigarh unit.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Narcotics Control Bureau's Chandigarh zonal unit observed Drug Disposal Day on Friday, wherein seized narcotics were destroyed in the virtual presence of Union home minister Amit Shah.Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh unit burnt 211.75kg poppy straw/poppy husk& powder, 5880 tablets of diphenoxylate, 4.78kg of heroin & 6.1kg of charas which were seized by the NCN CZU in 9 cases of the year 2022.
Today various zones of the NCB simultaneously conducted disposal of drugs throughout India namely Bangaluru, Delhi, Chandigarh, Cochin, Jodhpur, Patna & Indore zones.
The Union home minister & minister of cooperation Amit Shah addressed the regional conference on drug trafficking & national security for southern states /UTs at Bengaluru, Karnataka.
"Others present on the occasion included, Mohinder Jit Singh, assistant director, Rajneesh DSP crime, Chandigarh police, Varinder Singh, superintendent, DRI, Chandigarh, Meera Kumari Meena, superintendent and other officials of NCB Chandigarh unit.

Title: Jammu couple held over Amritpal Singh links
Article: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday detained a couple for alleged links with one of the aides of radical outfit Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh .Police said that the couple was detained from R S Pura area. " Amrik Singh and his wife Paramjit Kour were handed over to Punjab Police.They have been detained for having reported links with Papalpreet Singh, a close aide of Amritpal Singh," an official said.The couple's mobile phones have also been seized for further investigation. The matter is being investigated by Punjab Police and they will be questioning the couple, sources said.Earlier, district magistrates of Kishtwar and Ramban districts had cancelled arms licences of two bodyguards accompanying pro-Khalistan Sikh leader Amritpal. IANS
Summary:
The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday detained a couple for alleged links with one of the aides of radical outfit Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh .Police said that the couple was detained from R S Pura area. "
Amrik Singh and his wife Paramjit Kour were handed over to Punjab Police.They have been detained for having reported links with Papalpreet Singh, a close aide of Amritpal Singh," an official said.The couple's mobile phones have also been seized for further investigation.
The matter is being investigated by Punjab Police and they will be questioning the couple, sources said.Earlier, district magistrates of Kishtwar and Ramban districts had cancelled arms licences of two bodyguards accompanying pro-Khalistan Sikh leader Amritpal.

Meta_title: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup
Meta_desc: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup. City / Ramendra Singh / TNN / Updated: Mar 26, 2023, 10:54 IST.
Title: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup
Article:
Aishwary Tomar finished fourth in the men’s 50m rifle, during the ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol competition held at Madhya Pradesh Shooting Academy in Bhopal on Saturday

BHOPAL: It was a double delight for Indian pistol shooter Manu Bhaker on Saturday. She won India's sixth medal in the ISSF World Cup Bhopal stage and ended her senior international medal drought of two years. She won the last internal medal in Delhi 2021.China continued their domination with yet another gold medal, while Cairo gold medallist Aishwary Pratap Tomar had to settle on fourth position.China has won 6 gold medals so far (2 silver and 2 bronze). India are in second position with a gold (1 silver and 4 bronze), while Germany is in third position with a gold and a silver medal.On the penultimate day, the first event was a disappointment for home favourite Aishwary in the men's 50m air rifle 3P. After securing top spot in the 60-shot qualification round with a score of 591, he appeared to have lost the rhythm in the finals."I was not under any pressure but things did not go in my way," said Aishwary. In the bronze medal match, Swiss 3P specialist Jan Lochbihler edged out home Aishwary in the top eight ranking round. He finished the 40-shot round with a score of 407.4 while Aishwary, courtesy three five-shot series in the 40s in the final Standing position, finished with a score of 405.5. China's Du Linshu won the gold defeating Hungary's Peni Istavan 16-10 in the gold medal match.In the women's 25 m rapid fire pistol, Manu Bhaker (third with a score of 584) and Esha Singh (seventh with a score of 581) qualified for the ranking rounds. In the presence of packed spectators' gallery, both Esha and Manu were in the first ranking match alongwith Germany's Doreen Vennekamp and Xiong Yaxuan. Esha could not make it to the medal match as she stood third with 11-hits out of 20, while Manu with 14 hits secured place in the medal match.Manu changed her gear in the medal match as she gave a tough fight to China's Du Ziyue . "I was trying to be consistent in scoring the points," said Manu. The intense battle began after both Manu and Ziyue tied on 14-hits each. Manu (20-hits) tried to fight well and scored well but that was not enough as Ziyue (22-hits) found better than her. The Indian had to settle with a bronze. "It was a good contest. I am happy to win the medal for the country and will try to change the colour next time," said Manu. In the gold medal match, Doreen faced a tough battle against Ziyue. This could be gauged from the fact that Doreen touched the yellow metal with 30-hits out of 40 against Ziyue's 29-hits. Finals of Women's 3P and Men's Rapid Fire Pistol will be played on Sunday.
Summary:
She won India's sixth medal in the ISSF World Cup Bhopal stage and ended her senior international medal drought of two years.
In the bronze medal match, Swiss 3P specialist Jan Lochbihler edged out home Aishwary in the top eight ranking round.
Manu (20-hits) tried to fight well and scored well but that was not enough as Ziyue (22-hits) found better than her.
I am happy to win the medal for the country and will try to change the colour next time," said Manu.
In the gold medal match, Doreen faced a tough battle against Ziyue.

Meta_title: ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal: Varun-Rhythm win mixed ...
Meta_desc: IOA chief PT Usha terms wrestlers' protest as 'gross indiscipline' · Revealed: Why wrestlers have resumed their protest against WFI president Brij Bhushan Sharan...
Title: ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal: Varun-Rhythm win mixed pistol silver, Rudrankksh-Narmada claim rifle bronze
Article:
Shooting

India now has one gold, silver and two bronze medals in the competition.

China won both the gold medals on competition day two of the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF) World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal, even as India picked up a silver and bronze each at the M.P. Shooting Academy Range here in the outskirts of the city.

Reigning men’s 10m Air Rifle world champion Rudrankksh Patil and R. Narmada Nithin won bronze in the 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team competition while in the day’s second event, Varun Tomar and Rhythm Sangwan won silver to bolster India’s medal haul to one gold, one silver and two bronze medals. China on the other hand lead the standings with three gold and two bronze medals, with Azerbaijan, Germany and Hungary winning a silver medal each thus far.

Rudrankksh and Narmada win bronze in 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team event

In the day’s first medal event, the 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team, the Indian duo of Rudrankksh and Narmada shot a combined 632 in qualification to finish third and thereby qualify for the bronze medal match against China’s Zhang Qiongyue and Yu Haonan, who finished fourth in the 19-strong field with the same combined score.

In the bronze medal match however, both Rudrankksh and Narmada were in their elements, presenting a solid grouping to beat the Chinese pair 16-8 in what was a much closer match than the score line suggests.

Both the pairs did not shoot a single shot below the 10-mark in what was Shooting of the highest order. The high-point came in the sixth series when both Rudrankksh and Narmada shot perfect 10.9s.

Speaking after the match Narmada said, “There was pressure obviously, but then we had a really good match – the competition was so good and we quite enjoyed it.” Rudrankksh said there was no lack of motivation even if they did not win gold. “We were just asked to focus on our process and if we would have got Gold we would have been motivated but the bronze motivates us even more to do better next time,” he said.

Both India and China had entered two teams in the Mixed Team Air Rifle. While the second Chinese team of Huang Yuting and Sheng Lihao won gold defeating Hungarians Istvan Peni and Denes Eszter 16-2 in a one-sided final, the second Indian duo of Hriday Hazarika and Tilottoma Sen shot 628.1 in qualification to finish ninth.

Indian Sports Live Coverage on Khel Now

Varun wins his second medal in Bhopal

In the second and final medal event of the day, India’s Varun Tomar and Rhythm Sangwan went down 11-17 to China’s Qian Wei and Liu Jinyao, in the 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team gold medal encounter. It was Varun Tomar’s second medal of the tournament after his bronze winning effort in the individual Air Pistol on day one.

In the initial stages of the final, it looked as if the Chinese pair would run away with it, but the Indians made a strong comeback, going from 15-7 to 15-11 before the Chinese clinched the 15th series to seal gold. Earlier in qualification, Qian and Liu had topped the nine-team field with a score of 586, while Varun and Rhythm came second with 581.

Rhythm shared her thoughts after the match saying, “We all try our best and keep our best foot forward and silver is a medal as well. Of-course Gold would have been great but we are both happy that we got a silver medal and we will try better next time.” Varun too was philosophical on missing out on Gold saying, “We try our best and try to make ourselves better and we believe whatever happens it is for the best.”

Divya TS and Sarabjot Singh, the second Indian team in fray, missed the bronze medal match by a point, finishing fifth with a score of 574.

Competition day three

Competition day three Friday again has two finals on schedule. The 10m Air Rifle Men final begins at 11.15am, while the 10m Air Rifle Women final is slated for 1.30pm. Qualifications begin from 9.00am.

For more updates, follow Khel Now on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and join our community on Telegram.
Summary:
ShootingIndia now has one gold, silver and two bronze medals in the competition.
In the bronze medal match however, both Rudrankksh and Narmada were in their elements, presenting a solid grouping to beat the Chinese pair 16-8 in what was a much closer match than the score line suggests.
Both India and China had entered two teams in the Mixed Team Air Rifle.
It was Varun Tomar’s second medal of the tournament after his bronze winning effort in the individual Air Pistol on day one.
The 10m Air Rifle Men final begins at 11.15am, while the 10m Air Rifle Women final is slated for 1.30pm.

Meta_title: Gritty Kaur Samra clinches 50m 3P bronze as Anjum Moudgil fails to impress in shooting WC
Meta_desc: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence. Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th.
Title: Gritty Kaur Samra clinches 50m 3P bronze as Anjum Moudgil fails to impress in shooting WC
Article:
India’s upcoming shooter Sift Kaur Samra came up with an inspired performance to clinch her second senior medal at the international level, beating a tough field to win the 50m rifle 3P bronze on the penultimate day of the ISSF Rifle/Pistol World Cup here on Sunday.

On a day when China continued their domination, with Zhang Qiongyue winning gold in the event, Samra, the reigning national champion, scored a total of 403.9 points in the ranking round to finish third, even as Zhang (414.7 points) and Czech Republic’s Aneta Brabcova (411.3) entered the title round.

In the gold-medal round, Zhand defeated her Czech rival 16-8.

India are currently second on the medals table behind China with one gold, one silver and five bronze medals.

Samra added to the bronze medal she had won last year at the World Cup in Changwon, China.

All eyes were on world championships silver medallist in air rifle Anjum Moudgil in the preliminary round of the 3P event. But Samra was in a different zone on Sunday, shooting superb series in all three positions to emerge second best at the end of the qualification round with a score of 588.

Samra shot a total of 194 (99, 95) in kneeling position, a perfect 200 in prone (100, 100) and 194 in standing (97, 97), while Anjum slipped to 17th with a score of 583. The third Indian, Manini Kaushik, barley missed the eighth and last qualification spot on the count of ‘inner 10s’.

Advertisement

Samra, 21, who had some of the best scores in the trials held in New Delhi ahead of the World Cup, had three awful ‘standing’ rounds in the ranking match, which allowed Zhang and Brabcova to race away to the top.

While the Indian did well in kneeling position — 102.2 (51.7, 50.5) — and prone — 103.4 (51.8, 51.6) –, her ‘standing’ scores let her down. She came up with an average 50.4 in the first standing series but thereafter her scores went down further and she managed just 196.3 (50.4, 49.0, 49.2 and 49.7) in that position to end up with bronze.
Summary:
India are currently second on the medals table behind China with one gold, one silver and five bronze medals.
Samra added to the bronze medal she had won last year at the World Cup in Changwon, China.
All eyes were on world championships silver medallist in air rifle Anjum Moudgil in the preliminary round of the 3P event.
The third Indian, Manini Kaushik, barley missed the eighth and last qualification spot on the count of ‘inner 10s’.
While the Indian did well in kneeling position — 102.2 (51.7, 50.5) — and prone — 103.4 (51.8, 51.6) –, her ‘standing’ scores let her down.

Meta_title: Woman held from Haryana's Shahabad for 'providing shelter to Amritpal Singh, his aide'
Meta_desc: The woman has been identified as Baljit Kaur, who lived in Sidharth Colony of Shahabad-Markanda town of Kurukshetra district. SHAHABAD (...
Title: Amritpal Singh Sandhu News: Haryana woman Baljit Kaur held for 'providing shelter to Amritpal Singh, his aide'
Article:
02:19 Probe reveals Amritpal Singh, Waris Punjab De received foreign funds worth CRORES

00:56 No hard proof against Amritpal, presumptions by intel agencies: Simranjit Singh Mann

SHAHABAD (KURUKSHETRA): In a new development in connection with the case of wanted Waris Punjab De head Amritpal Singh , the Kurukshetra Police in Haryana handed over a woman of Shahabad town to Punjab police on Thursday on suspicion of providing shelter to the pro-Khalistan leader and his associate Papalpreet Singh at her residence.The woman has been identified as Baljit Kaur , who lived in Sidharth Colony of Shahabad-Markanda town of Kurukshetra district.Kurukshetra superintendent of police Surender Singh Bhoria said, "Baljit Kaur was in contact with Papalpreet Singh. It is suspected that Papalpreet and Amritpal stayed at Baljit’s house in Siddharth Colony of Shahabad for one night on March 19 (Sunday)."The SP said, "As it is a case of Punjab police, we provided all the required support and handed over the woman to Jalandhar Police for further investigation.""During preliminary investigation, Baljit (who did not know Amritpal) revealed that her contact, Papalpreet and with him Amritpal stayed at her place," said SP Bhoria.To a query about the woman's occupation, the SP said, "She is educated but is presently free at her home.""We are in constant touch with Punjab police and providing them all the inputs to assist them in their investigation. We are also obtaining the feeds of CCTV cameras," said SP Kurukshetra.Punjab police had launched a massive cordon and search operation against Amritpal Singh and his associates in Shahkot area of Jalandhar on March 18.
Summary:
It is suspected that Papalpreet and Amritpal stayed at Baljit’s house in Siddharth Colony of Shahabad for one night on March 19 (Sunday).
"The SP said, "As it is a case of Punjab police, we provided all the required support and handed over the woman to Jalandhar Police for further investigation.
""During preliminary investigation, Baljit (who did not know Amritpal) revealed that her contact, Papalpreet and with him Amritpal stayed at her place," said SP Bhoria.To a query about the woman's occupation, the SP said, "She is educated but is presently free at her home.
""We are in constant touch with Punjab police and providing them all the inputs to assist them in their investigation.
We are also obtaining the feeds of CCTV cameras," said SP Kurukshetra.Punjab police had launched a massive cordon and search operation against Amritpal Singh and his associates in Shahkot area of Jalandhar on March 18.

Meta_title: Have to make it Punjab again, not Afghanistan: Bhagwant Mann
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Have to make it Punjab again, not Afghanistan: Bhagwant Mann
Article: CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann , in a video message in Punjabi , on Friday assured that his government would not let anyone cause unrest in the state. Mann reiterated that it was his responsibility to ensure that peace and communal brotherhood is maintained, and "we want to make the state Punjab again, and not Afghanistan ".The chief minister said some self-proclaimed religious leaders who have nothing to do with the state and its people want to disturb its peace and amity, but "such evil designs will not be allowed at any cost and they will be given a befitting reply".He said, "We want to see laptops, international medals and appointment letters in the hands of our youth. They cannot be treated as raw material for factories set up in the name of religion. It is the age of learning and progress and we have to move with time."Mann said it was easy to give sermons of taking up weapons to the sons of other families, but such preachers run away when they are faced with the harsh reality. Emphasising that the sole motive of such leaders was to disturb the hard earned peace of the state through their venomous ideas, he pointed out that they were highly mistaken if they thought that they could divide people on communal lines because the peace-loving Punjabis would thwart any such attempt.Dwelling on the need to educate the coming generations to make them self-reliant, the CM said, "I want to assure the 3 crore people of the state that the state will help you in your progress." Mann added that AAP knows how to form the government and also to run the state. "I want to assure Punjabis that they should retain their faith as it gives me immense encouragement," he said.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann , in a video message in Punjabi , on Friday assured that his government would not let anyone cause unrest in the state.
They cannot be treated as raw material for factories set up in the name of religion.
"Mann said it was easy to give sermons of taking up weapons to the sons of other families, but such preachers run away when they are faced with the harsh reality.
Mann added that AAP knows how to form the government and also to run the state.
"I want to assure Punjabis that they should retain their faith as it gives me immense encouragement," he said.
