Meta_title: Will rallyists be booked under NSA, asks BJP
Meta_desc: Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed...
Title: Will rallyists be booked under NSA, asks BJP
Article: Raipur: The opposition BJP in Chhattisgarh criticized chief minister Bhupesh Baghel over a protest rally taken out in support of Waris-de Punjab chief Amritpal Singh and asked whether they would be booked under the National Security Act (NSA).Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed apprehension that Congress was “conspiring to spoil the atmosphere of Chhattisgarh before the upcoming assembly elections”.He alleged that the Congress government is trying to disturb law and order in Chhattisgarh by “giving protection to Khalistanis”. He shared Randhawa's social media profile and photographs, describing his closeness with senior Congress leaders and questioned the “relationship between Randhawa and the chief minister of Chhattisgarh”.Munat said that the Congress government recently asked its collectors to book those trying to take law and order into their hands under NSA and now it must clear its stand on what he termed a “pro-Khalistan rally”.The Congress hit back at BJP for questioning CM Baghel’s stand. Congress spokesperson Dhananjay Singh Thakur said that the Union home ministry should reply on how a person, who came to India from Dubai six months ago and carried out anti-national activities, managed to escape.“As far as Chhattisgarh is concerned, the rule of law prevails here. National security is of utmost priority for Congress. The BJP at the Centre can only take action against opposition leaders,” Thakur said, adding that the state government is taking strict action in this case.
Summary:
Raipur: The opposition BJP in Chhattisgarh criticized chief minister Bhupesh Baghel over a protest rally taken out in support of Waris-de Punjab chief Amritpal Singh and asked whether they would be booked under the National Security Act (NSA).Releasing a photo of Harpreet Singh Randhawa alias Rinku Randhawa with Congress leaders, former minister and BJP spokesperson Rajesh Munat expressed apprehension that Congress was “conspiring to spoil the atmosphere of Chhattisgarh before the upcoming assembly elections”.He alleged that the Congress government is trying to disturb law and order in Chhattisgarh by “giving protection to Khalistanis”.
He shared Randhawa's social media profile and photographs, describing his closeness with senior Congress leaders and questioned the “relationship between Randhawa and the chief minister of Chhattisgarh”.Munat said that the Congress government recently asked its collectors to book those trying to take law and order into their hands under NSA and now it must clear its stand on what he termed a “pro-Khalistan rally”.The Congress hit back at BJP for questioning CM Baghel’s stand.
Congress spokesperson Dhananjay Singh Thakur said that the Union home ministry should reply on how a person, who came to India from Dubai six months ago and carried out anti-national activities, managed to escape.“As far as Chhattisgarh is concerned, the rule of law prevails here.
National security is of utmost priority for Congress.
The BJP at the Centre can only take action against opposition leaders,” Thakur said, adding that the state government is taking strict action in this case.

Meta_title: Punjab Human Rights Organisation demands investigations into arrival, rise of Amritpal Singh
Meta_desc: PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has...
Title: Amritpal Singh Khalsa News: Punjab Human Rights Organisation demands investigations into arrival, rise of Amritpal Singh
Article: AMRITSAR: While refusing the accept the police theory of Amritpal Singh "absconding" from high police security, the Punjab Human Rights Organisations (PHRO) has demanded an investigation — by a retired judge of the high court — into his sudden arrival in Punjab from Dubai, issuances of armed licences to Waris Punjab De activists, stoic silence made by police over Amritpal’s Khalistan rhetorics and his sudden rise.Also See: Amritpal Singh Live Updates PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has raised further suspicions of some "unseen forces working behind the whole incident" which should be investigated.While stating that police were showing only February 18 CCTV footage to the media, he asked, "Why did the police not procure the CCTV footage after February 18 or was it deliberately not showing for the reasons best known to the police?"Not arresting Amritpal when he went to Ajnala from his native village Jallupur Khera on February 23, and instead of arresting him from his home and launching a manhunt had raised several questions on the incompetence of Punjab police or the "hidden forces" behind the whole operation, he opined.He said if the reports of Amritpal being traced in Haryana were correct then it was a complete incompetence of Punjab police or a deliberate and planned strategy to allow him to "run" to break his aura in public eyes, especially among those who had been following him and involved him in more cases.Meanwhile, senior superintendent of police, Pathankot, Harkamal Preet Singh Khakh said that they had laid nakas on the interstate borders with Chamba and Kangra in Himachal Pradesh and Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir."Each naka has a strength of 25 police personnel who are on round-the-clock duty to keep a check on every interstate border movement," said Khakah.Being a second line of defence, he said, they had also laid eight strong nakas on the roads leading to the Indo-Pak international border in Pathankot district.Ashok Rattan, superintendent of police of Nurpur in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, said they had strengthened the security on Nurpur-Pathankot border at Kandwal and Neelwan borders and had made an extra deployment to monitor the borders round the clock.Similar security arrangements have been made by the Chamaba police near Chamba-Pathankot areas.A highly placed source in the Border Security Force (BSF) said that they had also strengthened the security on the entire belt of 553 kilometers of Indo-Pak international border in Punjab.Despite heavy security arrangements, a person inadvertently crossed the border to Pakistan from near Rattan Khurd Border out Post of BSF in the Amritsar sector on March 22 and was held by Pak Rangers near their GS Wala post.However, he was handed over to BSF on the same day.The initial investigation revealed that the inadvertent border crosser was Sailesh, resident of Ballimaran, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.
Summary:
AMRITSAR: While refusing the accept the police theory of Amritpal Singh "absconding" from high police security, the Punjab Human Rights Organisations (PHRO) has demanded an investigation — by a retired judge of the high court — into his sudden arrival in Punjab from Dubai, issuances of armed licences to Waris Punjab De activists, stoic silence made by police over Amritpal’s Khalistan rhetorics and his sudden rise.Also See: Amritpal Singh Live Updates PHRO principal investigator Sarabjit Singh said that the whole episode appears to be a dubious one and now the unprecedented delay in the arrest of Amritpal has raised further suspicions of some "unseen forces working behind the whole incident" which should be investigated.While stating that police were showing only February 18 CCTV footage to the media, he asked, "Why did the police not procure the CCTV footage after February 18 or was it deliberately not showing for the reasons best known to the police?
"Not arresting Amritpal when he went to Ajnala from his native village Jallupur Khera on February 23, and instead of arresting him from his home and launching a manhunt had raised several questions on the incompetence of Punjab police or the "hidden forces" behind the whole operation, he opined.He said if the reports of Amritpal being traced in Haryana were correct then it was a complete incompetence of Punjab police or a deliberate and planned strategy to allow him to "run" to break his aura in public eyes, especially among those who had been following him and involved him in more cases.Meanwhile, senior superintendent of police, Pathankot, Harkamal Preet Singh Khakh said that they had laid nakas on the interstate borders with Chamba and Kangra in Himachal Pradesh and Kathua in Jammu and Kashmir.
"Each naka has a strength of 25 police personnel who are on round-the-clock duty to keep a check on every interstate border movement," said Khakah.Being a second line of defence, he said, they had also laid eight strong nakas on the roads leading to the Indo-Pak international border in Pathankot district.Ashok Rattan, superintendent of police of Nurpur in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, said they had strengthened the security on Nurpur-Pathankot border at Kandwal and Neelwan borders and had made an extra deployment to monitor the borders round the clock.Similar security arrangements have been made by the Chamaba police near Chamba-Pathankot areas.A highly placed source in the Border Security Force (BSF) said that they had also strengthened the security on the entire belt of 553 kilometers of Indo-Pak international border in Punjab.Despite heavy security arrangements, a person inadvertently crossed the border to Pakistan from near Rattan Khurd Border out Post of BSF in the Amritsar sector on March 22 and was held by Pak Rangers near their GS Wala post.However, he was handed over to BSF on the same day.The initial investigation revealed that the inadvertent border crosser was Sailesh, resident of Ballimaran, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.

Meta_title: NCB destroys contraband, observes Drug Disposal Day
Meta_desc: Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh...
Title: NCB destroys contraband, observes Drug Disposal Day
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Narcotics Control Bureau's Chandigarh zonal unit observed Drug Disposal Day on Friday, wherein seized narcotics were destroyed in the virtual presence of Union home minister Amit Shah.Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh unit burnt 211.75kg poppy straw/poppy husk& powder, 5880 tablets of diphenoxylate, 4.78kg of heroin & 6.1kg of charas which were seized by the NCN CZU in 9 cases of the year 2022. Today various zones of the NCB simultaneously conducted disposal of drugs throughout India namely Bangaluru, Delhi, Chandigarh, Cochin, Jodhpur, Patna & Indore zones. The Union home minister & minister of cooperation Amit Shah addressed the regional conference on drug trafficking & national security for southern states /UTs at Bengaluru, Karnataka."Others present on the occasion included, Mohinder Jit Singh, assistant director, Rajneesh DSP crime, Chandigarh police, Varinder Singh, superintendent, DRI, Chandigarh, Meera Kumari Meena, superintendent and other officials of NCB Chandigarh unit.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Narcotics Control Bureau's Chandigarh zonal unit observed Drug Disposal Day on Friday, wherein seized narcotics were destroyed in the virtual presence of Union home minister Amit Shah.Amanjit Singh IRS, zonal director NCB said, "The event was observed at Rainbow Environments Private Limited at Mohali & during this event NCB's Chandigarh unit burnt 211.75kg poppy straw/poppy husk& powder, 5880 tablets of diphenoxylate, 4.78kg of heroin & 6.1kg of charas which were seized by the NCN CZU in 9 cases of the year 2022.
Today various zones of the NCB simultaneously conducted disposal of drugs throughout India namely Bangaluru, Delhi, Chandigarh, Cochin, Jodhpur, Patna & Indore zones.
The Union home minister & minister of cooperation Amit Shah addressed the regional conference on drug trafficking & national security for southern states /UTs at Bengaluru, Karnataka.
"Others present on the occasion included, Mohinder Jit Singh, assistant director, Rajneesh DSP crime, Chandigarh police, Varinder Singh, superintendent, DRI, Chandigarh, Meera Kumari Meena, superintendent and other officials of NCB Chandigarh unit.

Title: Jammu couple held over Amritpal Singh links
Article: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday detained a couple for alleged links with one of the aides of radical outfit Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh .Police said that the couple was detained from R S Pura area. " Amrik Singh and his wife Paramjit Kour were handed over to Punjab Police.They have been detained for having reported links with Papalpreet Singh, a close aide of Amritpal Singh," an official said.The couple's mobile phones have also been seized for further investigation. The matter is being investigated by Punjab Police and they will be questioning the couple, sources said.Earlier, district magistrates of Kishtwar and Ramban districts had cancelled arms licences of two bodyguards accompanying pro-Khalistan Sikh leader Amritpal. IANS
Summary:
The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday detained a couple for alleged links with one of the aides of radical outfit Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh .Police said that the couple was detained from R S Pura area. "
Amrik Singh and his wife Paramjit Kour were handed over to Punjab Police.They have been detained for having reported links with Papalpreet Singh, a close aide of Amritpal Singh," an official said.The couple's mobile phones have also been seized for further investigation.
The matter is being investigated by Punjab Police and they will be questioning the couple, sources said.Earlier, district magistrates of Kishtwar and Ramban districts had cancelled arms licences of two bodyguards accompanying pro-Khalistan Sikh leader Amritpal.

Meta_title: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup
Meta_desc: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup. City / Ramendra Singh / TNN / Updated: Mar 26, 2023, 10:54 IST.
Title: Manu Bhaker ends 2-year medal drought, shoots bronze at ISSF World Cup
Article:
Aishwary Tomar finished fourth in the men’s 50m rifle, during the ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol competition held at Madhya Pradesh Shooting Academy in Bhopal on Saturday

BHOPAL: It was a double delight for Indian pistol shooter Manu Bhaker on Saturday. She won India's sixth medal in the ISSF World Cup Bhopal stage and ended her senior international medal drought of two years. She won the last internal medal in Delhi 2021.China continued their domination with yet another gold medal, while Cairo gold medallist Aishwary Pratap Tomar had to settle on fourth position.China has won 6 gold medals so far (2 silver and 2 bronze). India are in second position with a gold (1 silver and 4 bronze), while Germany is in third position with a gold and a silver medal.On the penultimate day, the first event was a disappointment for home favourite Aishwary in the men's 50m air rifle 3P. After securing top spot in the 60-shot qualification round with a score of 591, he appeared to have lost the rhythm in the finals."I was not under any pressure but things did not go in my way," said Aishwary. In the bronze medal match, Swiss 3P specialist Jan Lochbihler edged out home Aishwary in the top eight ranking round. He finished the 40-shot round with a score of 407.4 while Aishwary, courtesy three five-shot series in the 40s in the final Standing position, finished with a score of 405.5. China's Du Linshu won the gold defeating Hungary's Peni Istavan 16-10 in the gold medal match.In the women's 25 m rapid fire pistol, Manu Bhaker (third with a score of 584) and Esha Singh (seventh with a score of 581) qualified for the ranking rounds. In the presence of packed spectators' gallery, both Esha and Manu were in the first ranking match alongwith Germany's Doreen Vennekamp and Xiong Yaxuan. Esha could not make it to the medal match as she stood third with 11-hits out of 20, while Manu with 14 hits secured place in the medal match.Manu changed her gear in the medal match as she gave a tough fight to China's Du Ziyue . "I was trying to be consistent in scoring the points," said Manu. The intense battle began after both Manu and Ziyue tied on 14-hits each. Manu (20-hits) tried to fight well and scored well but that was not enough as Ziyue (22-hits) found better than her. The Indian had to settle with a bronze. "It was a good contest. I am happy to win the medal for the country and will try to change the colour next time," said Manu. In the gold medal match, Doreen faced a tough battle against Ziyue. This could be gauged from the fact that Doreen touched the yellow metal with 30-hits out of 40 against Ziyue's 29-hits. Finals of Women's 3P and Men's Rapid Fire Pistol will be played on Sunday.
Summary:
She won India's sixth medal in the ISSF World Cup Bhopal stage and ended her senior international medal drought of two years.
In the bronze medal match, Swiss 3P specialist Jan Lochbihler edged out home Aishwary in the top eight ranking round.
Manu (20-hits) tried to fight well and scored well but that was not enough as Ziyue (22-hits) found better than her.
I am happy to win the medal for the country and will try to change the colour next time," said Manu.
In the gold medal match, Doreen faced a tough battle against Ziyue.

Meta_title: ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal: Varun-Rhythm win mixed ...
Meta_desc: IOA chief PT Usha terms wrestlers' protest as 'gross indiscipline' · Revealed: Why wrestlers have resumed their protest against WFI president Brij Bhushan Sharan...
Title: ISSF World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal: Varun-Rhythm win mixed pistol silver, Rudrankksh-Narmada claim rifle bronze
Article:
Shooting

India now has one gold, silver and two bronze medals in the competition.

China won both the gold medals on competition day two of the International Shooting Sport Federation (ISSF) World Cup Rifle/Pistol Bhopal, even as India picked up a silver and bronze each at the M.P. Shooting Academy Range here in the outskirts of the city.

Reigning men’s 10m Air Rifle world champion Rudrankksh Patil and R. Narmada Nithin won bronze in the 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team competition while in the day’s second event, Varun Tomar and Rhythm Sangwan won silver to bolster India’s medal haul to one gold, one silver and two bronze medals. China on the other hand lead the standings with three gold and two bronze medals, with Azerbaijan, Germany and Hungary winning a silver medal each thus far.

Rudrankksh and Narmada win bronze in 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team event

In the day’s first medal event, the 10m Air Rifle Mixed Team, the Indian duo of Rudrankksh and Narmada shot a combined 632 in qualification to finish third and thereby qualify for the bronze medal match against China’s Zhang Qiongyue and Yu Haonan, who finished fourth in the 19-strong field with the same combined score.

In the bronze medal match however, both Rudrankksh and Narmada were in their elements, presenting a solid grouping to beat the Chinese pair 16-8 in what was a much closer match than the score line suggests.

Both the pairs did not shoot a single shot below the 10-mark in what was Shooting of the highest order. The high-point came in the sixth series when both Rudrankksh and Narmada shot perfect 10.9s.

Speaking after the match Narmada said, “There was pressure obviously, but then we had a really good match – the competition was so good and we quite enjoyed it.” Rudrankksh said there was no lack of motivation even if they did not win gold. “We were just asked to focus on our process and if we would have got Gold we would have been motivated but the bronze motivates us even more to do better next time,” he said.

Both India and China had entered two teams in the Mixed Team Air Rifle. While the second Chinese team of Huang Yuting and Sheng Lihao won gold defeating Hungarians Istvan Peni and Denes Eszter 16-2 in a one-sided final, the second Indian duo of Hriday Hazarika and Tilottoma Sen shot 628.1 in qualification to finish ninth.

Indian Sports Live Coverage on Khel Now

Varun wins his second medal in Bhopal

In the second and final medal event of the day, India’s Varun Tomar and Rhythm Sangwan went down 11-17 to China’s Qian Wei and Liu Jinyao, in the 10m Air Pistol Mixed Team gold medal encounter. It was Varun Tomar’s second medal of the tournament after his bronze winning effort in the individual Air Pistol on day one.

In the initial stages of the final, it looked as if the Chinese pair would run away with it, but the Indians made a strong comeback, going from 15-7 to 15-11 before the Chinese clinched the 15th series to seal gold. Earlier in qualification, Qian and Liu had topped the nine-team field with a score of 586, while Varun and Rhythm came second with 581.

Rhythm shared her thoughts after the match saying, “We all try our best and keep our best foot forward and silver is a medal as well. Of-course Gold would have been great but we are both happy that we got a silver medal and we will try better next time.” Varun too was philosophical on missing out on Gold saying, “We try our best and try to make ourselves better and we believe whatever happens it is for the best.”

Divya TS and Sarabjot Singh, the second Indian team in fray, missed the bronze medal match by a point, finishing fifth with a score of 574.

Competition day three

Competition day three Friday again has two finals on schedule. The 10m Air Rifle Men final begins at 11.15am, while the 10m Air Rifle Women final is slated for 1.30pm. Qualifications begin from 9.00am.

For more updates, follow Khel Now on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and join our community on Telegram.
Summary:
ShootingIndia now has one gold, silver and two bronze medals in the competition.
In the bronze medal match however, both Rudrankksh and Narmada were in their elements, presenting a solid grouping to beat the Chinese pair 16-8 in what was a much closer match than the score line suggests.
Both India and China had entered two teams in the Mixed Team Air Rifle.
It was Varun Tomar’s second medal of the tournament after his bronze winning effort in the individual Air Pistol on day one.
The 10m Air Rifle Men final begins at 11.15am, while the 10m Air Rifle Women final is slated for 1.30pm.

Meta_title: Gritty Kaur Samra clinches 50m 3P bronze as Anjum Moudgil fails to impress in shooting WC
Meta_desc: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence. Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th.
Title: Gritty Kaur Samra clinches 50m 3P bronze as Anjum Moudgil fails to impress in shooting WC
Article:
India’s upcoming shooter Sift Kaur Samra came up with an inspired performance to clinch her second senior medal at the international level, beating a tough field to win the 50m rifle 3P bronze on the penultimate day of the ISSF Rifle/Pistol World Cup here on Sunday.

On a day when China continued their domination, with Zhang Qiongyue winning gold in the event, Samra, the reigning national champion, scored a total of 403.9 points in the ranking round to finish third, even as Zhang (414.7 points) and Czech Republic’s Aneta Brabcova (411.3) entered the title round.

In the gold-medal round, Zhand defeated her Czech rival 16-8.

India are currently second on the medals table behind China with one gold, one silver and five bronze medals.

Samra added to the bronze medal she had won last year at the World Cup in Changwon, China.

All eyes were on world championships silver medallist in air rifle Anjum Moudgil in the preliminary round of the 3P event. But Samra was in a different zone on Sunday, shooting superb series in all three positions to emerge second best at the end of the qualification round with a score of 588.

Samra shot a total of 194 (99, 95) in kneeling position, a perfect 200 in prone (100, 100) and 194 in standing (97, 97), while Anjum slipped to 17th with a score of 583. The third Indian, Manini Kaushik, barley missed the eighth and last qualification spot on the count of ‘inner 10s’.

Advertisement

Samra, 21, who had some of the best scores in the trials held in New Delhi ahead of the World Cup, had three awful ‘standing’ rounds in the ranking match, which allowed Zhang and Brabcova to race away to the top.

While the Indian did well in kneeling position — 102.2 (51.7, 50.5) — and prone — 103.4 (51.8, 51.6) –, her ‘standing’ scores let her down. She came up with an average 50.4 in the first standing series but thereafter her scores went down further and she managed just 196.3 (50.4, 49.0, 49.2 and 49.7) in that position to end up with bronze.
Summary:
India are currently second on the medals table behind China with one gold, one silver and five bronze medals.
Samra added to the bronze medal she had won last year at the World Cup in Changwon, China.
All eyes were on world championships silver medallist in air rifle Anjum Moudgil in the preliminary round of the 3P event.
The third Indian, Manini Kaushik, barley missed the eighth and last qualification spot on the count of ‘inner 10s’.
While the Indian did well in kneeling position — 102.2 (51.7, 50.5) — and prone — 103.4 (51.8, 51.6) –, her ‘standing’ scores let her down.

Meta_title: Woman held from Haryana's Shahabad for 'providing shelter to Amritpal Singh, his aide'
Meta_desc: The woman has been identified as Baljit Kaur, who lived in Sidharth Colony of Shahabad-Markanda town of Kurukshetra district. SHAHABAD (...
Title: Amritpal Singh Sandhu News: Haryana woman Baljit Kaur held for 'providing shelter to Amritpal Singh, his aide'
Article:
02:19 Probe reveals Amritpal Singh, Waris Punjab De received foreign funds worth CRORES

00:56 No hard proof against Amritpal, presumptions by intel agencies: Simranjit Singh Mann

SHAHABAD (KURUKSHETRA): In a new development in connection with the case of wanted Waris Punjab De head Amritpal Singh , the Kurukshetra Police in Haryana handed over a woman of Shahabad town to Punjab police on Thursday on suspicion of providing shelter to the pro-Khalistan leader and his associate Papalpreet Singh at her residence.The woman has been identified as Baljit Kaur , who lived in Sidharth Colony of Shahabad-Markanda town of Kurukshetra district.Kurukshetra superintendent of police Surender Singh Bhoria said, "Baljit Kaur was in contact with Papalpreet Singh. It is suspected that Papalpreet and Amritpal stayed at Baljit’s house in Siddharth Colony of Shahabad for one night on March 19 (Sunday)."The SP said, "As it is a case of Punjab police, we provided all the required support and handed over the woman to Jalandhar Police for further investigation.""During preliminary investigation, Baljit (who did not know Amritpal) revealed that her contact, Papalpreet and with him Amritpal stayed at her place," said SP Bhoria.To a query about the woman's occupation, the SP said, "She is educated but is presently free at her home.""We are in constant touch with Punjab police and providing them all the inputs to assist them in their investigation. We are also obtaining the feeds of CCTV cameras," said SP Kurukshetra.Punjab police had launched a massive cordon and search operation against Amritpal Singh and his associates in Shahkot area of Jalandhar on March 18.
Summary:
It is suspected that Papalpreet and Amritpal stayed at Baljit’s house in Siddharth Colony of Shahabad for one night on March 19 (Sunday).
"The SP said, "As it is a case of Punjab police, we provided all the required support and handed over the woman to Jalandhar Police for further investigation.
""During preliminary investigation, Baljit (who did not know Amritpal) revealed that her contact, Papalpreet and with him Amritpal stayed at her place," said SP Bhoria.To a query about the woman's occupation, the SP said, "She is educated but is presently free at her home.
""We are in constant touch with Punjab police and providing them all the inputs to assist them in their investigation.
We are also obtaining the feeds of CCTV cameras," said SP Kurukshetra.Punjab police had launched a massive cordon and search operation against Amritpal Singh and his associates in Shahkot area of Jalandhar on March 18.

Meta_title: Manipur to ink deal with AIFF to set up football academy
Meta_desc: Addressing a packed Khuman Lampak stadium during the inauguration of the Tri-Nation International Tournament on Wednesday evening, chief minister N Biren Singh,...
Title: Manipur to ink deal with AIFF to set up football academy
Article: IMPHAL: In order to groom young football enthusiasts in the state and develop and promote the game further, Manipur will sign a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the All India Football Federation (AIFF) for logistics and other support to set up a football academy.Addressing a packed Khuman Lampak stadium during the inauguration of the Tri-Nation International Tournament on Wednesday evening, chief minister N Biren Singh, a former footballer himself, said, “It is indeed very fortunate for Manipur to host the Tri-Nation International Tournament and also a moment of pride that the national team consists of five to six players from the state.”Talking about the deal, Biren said it will be signed in Imphal when AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey attends the closing match of the ongoing tournament at the stadium.Expressing his gratitude to AIFF, the CM appreciated Chaubey and his team for acknowledging the potential of the players from Manipur and the love for football in the state. He also thanked the game’s national governing body for providing the state with an opportunity to host their first international football tournament. Biren appealed to the people of Manipur to attend the matches and urged them to show discipline and decency during the tournament.Taking to Facebook, Biren said, “The historic occasion of Manipur hosting the Indian football team for the first time is indeed a moment of pride. The credit for this achievement goes to the number of talented football players that the state has produced, and pure love for games and sports among the people of the state.”Despite a cloud cover, a whopping 29,341 people turned up to cheer Sunil Chhetri & Co as India won by a solitary goal against Myanmar with Anirudh Thapa scoring in the first minute of the extra time in the first half.
Summary:
IMPHAL: In order to groom young football enthusiasts in the state and develop and promote the game further, Manipur will sign a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the All India Football Federation (AIFF) for logistics and other support to set up a football academy.Addressing a packed Khuman Lampak stadium during the inauguration of the Tri-Nation International Tournament on Wednesday evening, chief minister N Biren Singh, a former footballer himself, said, “It is indeed very fortunate for Manipur to host the Tri-Nation International Tournament and also a moment of pride that the national team consists of five to six players from the state.”Talking about the deal, Biren said it will be signed in Imphal when AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey attends the closing match of the ongoing tournament at the stadium.Expressing his gratitude to AIFF, the CM appreciated Chaubey and his team for acknowledging the potential of the players from Manipur and the love for football in the state.
He also thanked the game’s national governing body for providing the state with an opportunity to host their first international football tournament.
Biren appealed to the people of Manipur to attend the matches and urged them to show discipline and decency during the tournament.Taking to Facebook, Biren said, “The historic occasion of Manipur hosting the Indian football team for the first time is indeed a moment of pride.
The credit for this achievement goes to the number of talented football players that the state has produced, and pure love for games and sports among the people of the state.”Despite a cloud cover, a whopping 29,341 people turned up to cheer Sunil Chhetri & Co as India won by a solitary goal against Myanmar with Anirudh Thapa scoring in the first minute of the extra time in the first half.

Meta_title: Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Kahttar pays tribute to martyrs at National War Memorial in Delhi
Meta_desc: The visit was to mark Martyrdom Day (Shaheed Diwas) of Shaheed Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev. GURGAON: Chief minister Manohar Lal Kahttar along with cabinet...
Title: Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Kahttar pays tribute to martyrs at National War Memorial in Delhi
Article: GURGAON: Chief minister Manohar Lal Kahttar along with cabinet minister of state, members of Parliament from Haryana and senior government officials visited National War Memorial in Delhi and paid floral tribute to the brave soldiers who laid down their lives for safeguarding the integrity of India.The visit was to mark Martyrdom Day (Shaheed Diwas) of Shaheed Bhagat Singh , Rajguru and Sukhdev. Later interacting with media persons, the chief minister said he feels proud as he got a chance to visit the National War Memorial. "We should be proud of our brave soldiers as only because of their supreme sacrifices we got freedom," Khattar said.He said that in the year 2019, under the guidance of Prime Minister, this National War Memorial was constructed. In this memorial, the martyrdom of about 26,500 soldiers of the three armed forces including Army, Navy and Air Force has been portrayed.“Out of these 26,500 soldiers, more than 2,500 soldiers belong to Haryana, this is another inspiring thing. Also, the representation of youth of the state in the armed forces is 10 percent which certainly proves the state's strength,” said Khattar. The chief minister also paid tribute and saluted the families and the mothers of these great martyrs.Appealing to the people of the state and the country, Khattar said that the citizens must visit this war memorial and take inspiration from the martyrdom of the martyrs and contribute to nation building.
Summary:
GURGAON: Chief minister Manohar Lal Kahttar along with cabinet minister of state, members of Parliament from Haryana and senior government officials visited National War Memorial in Delhi and paid floral tribute to the brave soldiers who laid down their lives for safeguarding the integrity of India.The visit was to mark Martyrdom Day (Shaheed Diwas) of Shaheed Bhagat Singh , Rajguru and Sukhdev.
Later interacting with media persons, the chief minister said he feels proud as he got a chance to visit the National War Memorial.
"We should be proud of our brave soldiers as only because of their supreme sacrifices we got freedom," Khattar said.He said that in the year 2019, under the guidance of Prime Minister, this National War Memorial was constructed.
Also, the representation of youth of the state in the armed forces is 10 percent which certainly proves the state's strength,” said Khattar.
The chief minister also paid tribute and saluted the families and the mothers of these great martyrs.Appealing to the people of the state and the country, Khattar said that the citizens must visit this war memorial and take inspiration from the martyrdom of the martyrs and contribute to nation building.

Meta_title: 4 killed, 10 critical after MUV, bus collide in Ferozepur
Meta_desc: Punjab school education minister Harjot Singh Bains has expressed profound grief over the death of three teachers and a driver in the mishap. He extended...
Title: 4 killed, 10 critical after MUV, bus collide in Ferozepur
Article: FEROZEPUR: Four people, including three teachers and the driver of their vehicle, died while 10 others were injured critically in a major road accident near Khai Feme Ki village on Ferozepur-Fazilka road on Friday morning.According to information, the Tempo Trax, carrying 14 passengers, collided head-on with a bus near Khai village in Ferozepur. According to an eye-witness, the impact of the collision was so powerful that the front part of the vehicle squeezed, killing four of the passengers on the spot while injuring ten others occupants. The injured have been taken to the hospitals and their condition is also stated to be critical. On getting information, a police team rushed to the spot and started rescue operation.As per information, the victim teachers were from Jalalabad town, who were posted at government school in Valtoha block in Taran Taran distirct. The victim teachers have been identified as Kanchan, Prince and Maninder Singh , all residents of Jalalabad town in Fazilka district.Punjab school education minister Harjot Singh Bains has expressed profound grief over the death of three teachers and a driver in the mishap. He extended heartfelt sympathies to the bereaved families.
Summary:
FEROZEPUR: Four people, including three teachers and the driver of their vehicle, died while 10 others were injured critically in a major road accident near Khai Feme Ki village on Ferozepur-Fazilka road on Friday morning.According to information, the Tempo Trax, carrying 14 passengers, collided head-on with a bus near Khai village in Ferozepur.
According to an eye-witness, the impact of the collision was so powerful that the front part of the vehicle squeezed, killing four of the passengers on the spot while injuring ten others occupants.
The injured have been taken to the hospitals and their condition is also stated to be critical.
On getting information, a police team rushed to the spot and started rescue operation.As per information, the victim teachers were from Jalalabad town, who were posted at government school in Valtoha block in Taran Taran distirct.
He extended heartfelt sympathies to the bereaved families.

Meta_title: 40-yr-old gets life term for killing brother
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: 40-yr-old gets life term for killing brother
Article: Hyderabad: A 40-year-old man who murdered his brother in Bhongir in 2017 was sentenced to life imprisonment by a local court on Thursday.The accused, N Yadagiri from Pochammawada in Bhongir town killed his brother N Parvathalu. According to police, Yadagiri was an alcoholic and his family deserted him due to his addiction. On January 17, 2017, Yadagiri picked up an argument with Parvathalu for not giving him money to buy liquor. During the argument, the accused attacked Parvathalu with a stick and killed him. After committing the murder, he set the body ablaze with kerosene. tnn
Summary:
Hyderabad: A 40-year-old man who murdered his brother in Bhongir in 2017 was sentenced to life imprisonment by a local court on Thursday.The accused, N Yadagiri from Pochammawada in Bhongir town killed his brother N Parvathalu.
According to police, Yadagiri was an alcoholic and his family deserted him due to his addiction.
On January 17, 2017, Yadagiri picked up an argument with Parvathalu for not giving him money to buy liquor.
During the argument, the accused attacked Parvathalu with a stick and killed him.
After committing the murder, he set the body ablaze with kerosene.

Meta_title: Soon, policy to promote local festivals, 'lab on wheels' service in Uttarakhand
Meta_desc: DEHRADUN: The Pushkar Singh Dhami government completed one year in office on Thursday and on the occasion, the CM made 16 announcements, which included a 50...
Title: Soon, policy to promote local festivals, 'lab on wheels' service in Uttarakhand
Article: DEHRADUN: The Pushkar Singh Dhami government completed one year in office on Thursday and on the occasion, the CM made 16 announcements, which included a 50 % discount on transportation rates to candidates appearing in competitive exams.Addressing the gathering at Rangers Ground of Dehradun, the CM said, "We will start Computer and Information Technology education in government schools from class 6. Lab on wheels - mobile laboratories - service would be started in all 13 districts to ensure the best possible education facilities for students in far-flung areas. Uttarakhand will be developed as the State Science Technology and Information Technology Corridor." He added that the state would soon bring a 'Science and Technology Innovation Policy.' To help the children of labourers get an education, CM Dhami said that the government would start mobile schools in the state. Dhami stressed the need to encourage and promote local festivals. "An integrated policy will be made to give wide recognition to the folk festivals of Uttarakhand like Uttarayani, Phooldai, Harela, Egas and Budhi Diwali and to celebrate them with full devotion and enthusiasm. This will inform the youngsters about our culture and tradition," he added. A sports university would be opened at the sports stadium in Haldwani. "We will upgrade the existing international stadium in Haldwani and develop a sports university," the CM said.Under the Mukhkya Mantri Gram Sadak Yojna, the government aims to connect villages - with a population of 250 - to main areas through roads. Besides, Dhami also announced the Chief Minister's Horticulture Scheme, Chief Minister's State Livestock Mission and Chief Minister Skill Development and Employment Scheme to benefit different sections of society.
Summary:
Lab on wheels - mobile laboratories - service would be started in all 13 districts to ensure the best possible education facilities for students in far-flung areas.
Uttarakhand will be developed as the State Science Technology and Information Technology Corridor."
He added that the state would soon bring a 'Science and Technology Innovation Policy.'
To help the children of labourers get an education, CM Dhami said that the government would start mobile schools in the state.
Besides, Dhami also announced the Chief Minister's Horticulture Scheme, Chief Minister's State Livestock Mission and Chief Minister Skill Development and Employment Scheme to benefit different sections of society.

Meta_title: It’s time for farmer fairs at Punjab Agricultural University, Gadvasu
Meta_desc: Punjab agriculture minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal will inaugurate the event, which would be presided over by PAU VC Satbir Singh Gosal and Gadvasu VC...
Title: Pau: It’s Time For Farmer Fairs At Pau, Gadvasu
Article: LUDHIANA: Campuses of Punjab Agricultural University ( PAU ) and Guru Angad Dev Veterinary and Animal Sciences University (Gadvasu) will come to life as farmers and experts from different parts of Punjab and other states are expected to throng Kisan Mela and Pashu Palan Mela , respectively, on Friday and Saturday.Punjab agriculture minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal will inaugurate the event, which would be presided over by PAU VC Satbir Singh Gosal and Gadvasu VC Inderjeet Singh.The campuses have been decked up. Various departments will put up stalls to fine tune skills and enhance agricultural knowledge of farmers through close interaction with scientists.Extending an open invitation to the agricultural community to participate in the mela, Gosal said, “The university has worked hard to uplift the socio-economic conditions of farmers by evolving cost-effective technologies for facilitating agro-based industries and generating self-employment opportunities for the youths.”Major highlights will include live demonstrations on PMH 14 variety of maize and SL 46 of sorghum, nursery raising techniques, kitchen garden model, newly released varieties of horticultural crops, mini herbal garden, vermicompost unit, integrated farming system unit, organic production technologies, sub-surface drip irrigation and fertigation.Exhibitions will be organised on protected cultivation, mushroom cultivation, beekeeping, safe use of pesticides, and insect-pest and disease management in various crops.Besides, field demonstrations will be given on processing technologies such as agro-processing complex, PAU maize dryer, turmeric processing, vegetable washing machine, onion storage structure, improved grain methods, jaggery processing, vodka production from Kufri Pukhraj, value addition of button mushroom; paddy straw management technologies like Happy Seeder, Super Straw Management System, Smart Seeder, baler and mulcher; and other machines such as lucky seed drill, drone, self-propelled rotary weeder, mechanical paddy transplanters, etc. In addition, renewable energy technologies comprising biogas generation from paddy straw, various types of biogas plants and solar cookers will be displayed.For this year’s Pashu Palan Mela, the authorities have come up with a slogan ‘To rear livestock in a congenial manner with respect to ecology and nature’.Gadvasu VC Inderjeet Singh said whereas cattle, buffalos, goats and different species including ornamental fish, will be the main attraction, country-side scenes of university will be a special attraction for the urban children. He said Pashu Palan Mela will be more useful to vocational courses students studying animal husbandry and rural culture as they will get more valuable information about the latest interventions in the field of animal husbandry, dairying, fisheries, etc.
Summary:
LUDHIANA: Campuses of Punjab Agricultural University ( PAU ) and Guru Angad Dev Veterinary and Animal Sciences University (Gadvasu) will come to life as farmers and experts from different parts of Punjab and other states are expected to throng Kisan Mela and Pashu Palan Mela , respectively, on Friday and Saturday.Punjab agriculture minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal will inaugurate the event, which would be presided over by PAU VC Satbir Singh Gosal and Gadvasu VC Inderjeet Singh.The campuses have been decked up.
Various departments will put up stalls to fine tune skills and enhance agricultural knowledge of farmers through close interaction with scientists.Extending an open invitation to the agricultural community to participate in the mela, Gosal said, “The university has worked hard to uplift the socio-economic conditions of farmers by evolving cost-effective technologies for facilitating agro-based industries and generating self-employment opportunities for the youths.”Major highlights will include live demonstrations on PMH 14 variety of maize and SL 46 of sorghum, nursery raising techniques, kitchen garden model, newly released varieties of horticultural crops, mini herbal garden, vermicompost unit, integrated farming system unit, organic production technologies, sub-surface drip irrigation and fertigation.Exhibitions will be organised on protected cultivation, mushroom cultivation, beekeeping, safe use of pesticides, and insect-pest and disease management in various crops.Besides, field demonstrations will be given on processing technologies such as agro-processing complex, PAU maize dryer, turmeric processing, vegetable washing machine, onion storage structure, improved grain methods, jaggery processing, vodka production from Kufri Pukhraj, value addition of button mushroom; paddy straw management technologies like Happy Seeder, Super Straw Management System, Smart Seeder, baler and mulcher; and other machines such as lucky seed drill, drone, self-propelled rotary weeder, mechanical paddy transplanters, etc.
In addition, renewable energy technologies comprising biogas generation from paddy straw, various types of biogas plants and solar cookers will be displayed.For this year’s Pashu Palan Mela, the authorities have come up with a slogan ‘To rear livestock in a congenial manner with respect to ecology and nature’.Gadvasu VC Inderjeet Singh said whereas cattle, buffalos, goats and different species including ornamental fish, will be the main attraction, country-side scenes of university will be a special attraction for the urban children.
He said Pashu Palan Mela will be more useful to vocational courses students studying animal husbandry and rural culture as they will get more valuable information about the latest interventions in the field of animal husbandry, dairying, fisheries, etc.

Meta_title: Ex-WWE chief Vincent McMahon pays back $17.4 million in investigation costs
Meta_desc: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence · Probing allegations against Brij Bhushan, in January, Govt had flagged th.
Title: Ex-WWE chief Vincent McMahon pays back $17.4 million in investigation costs
Article:
World Wrestling Entertainment Inc (WWE) (WWE.N) said on Friday Executive Chairman Vincent McMahon had paid $17.4 million to the company to cover costs related to an investigation into his alleged misconduct.

McMahon, credited with transforming WWE from a regional player to a global giant, retired as CEO and chairman of the company in July last year. He returned to the board in January, after the probe was wrapped up.

The Wall Street Journal had reported that he was being investigated by the board for agreements to pay $12 million over the past 16 years to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity.

WWE said in January that it would explore strategic alternatives. McMahon said he would involve himself in the company’s media rights acquisition process as it looks to capitalize on growing demand for content and live entertainment.
Summary:
World Wrestling Entertainment Inc (WWE) (WWE.N) said on Friday Executive Chairman Vincent McMahon had paid $17.4 million to the company to cover costs related to an investigation into his alleged misconduct.
McMahon, credited with transforming WWE from a regional player to a global giant, retired as CEO and chairman of the company in July last year.
He returned to the board in January, after the probe was wrapped up.
The Wall Street Journal had reported that he was being investigated by the board for agreements to pay $12 million over the past 16 years to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity.
McMahon said he would involve himself in the company’s media rights acquisition process as it looks to capitalize on growing demand for content and live entertainment.

Meta_title: Goof-up: Russian anthem played incorrectly at World Championships
Meta_desc: ... against WFI chief Brij Bhushan · Wrestlers Protest Live Updates: Wrestlers accept SC decision, announce pr... Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence.
Title: Goof-up: Russian anthem played incorrectly at World Championships
Article:
In an embarrassing moment for hosts India and boxing’s global governing body, the Russian national anthem was played incorrectly during the 70kg medal ceremony of the Women’s World Championships here on Saturday.

“We apologise for playing the wrong Russian anthem. We request you to give a huge round of applause to Demurchian Anastasiia,” the announcer said after almost all the spectators had left the KD Jadhav Indoor Hall.

Demurchian Anastasiia, who won the gold after defeating Australia’s Scott Kaye Frances, later stood on the podium alone as the correct Russian anthem was played. It is worth mentioning here that the president of the International Boxing Association (IBA), Umar Kremlev, is a Russian.

“The Local Organising Committee took the anthem from the Russian coach, checked it and handed it over to the IBA events team, who are in charge of the entire medal ceremony. There was a meeting regarding this and IBA is doing its own investigation and BFI will fully cooperate with the process,” a Boxing Federation of India (BFI) spokesperson said after the gaffe.

The members of the Russian contingent, however, cheered and applauded their compatriot after lodging their protest following the goof-up.

It is to be noted that over 10 countries including USA, Britain, Ireland and Netherlands boycotted the tournament because the International Boxing Association (IBA) allowed the Russian and Belarusian boxers to compete under their respective flags.
Summary:
In an embarrassing moment for hosts India and boxing’s global governing body, the Russian national anthem was played incorrectly during the 70kg medal ceremony of the Women’s World Championships here on Saturday.
“We apologise for playing the wrong Russian anthem.
Demurchian Anastasiia, who won the gold after defeating Australia’s Scott Kaye Frances, later stood on the podium alone as the correct Russian anthem was played.
It is worth mentioning here that the president of the International Boxing Association (IBA), Umar Kremlev, is a Russian.
The members of the Russian contingent, however, cheered and applauded their compatriot after lodging their protest following the goof-up.

Meta_title: Ravideep Singh Sahi is new chief of CRPF South Zone
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Ravideep Singh Sahi is new chief of CRPF South Zone
Article: HYDERABAD: CRPF additional director-general Ravideep Singh Sahi took over command of South Zone at Hyderabad on Thursday. Sahi joined as an assistant commandant in CRPF and during the 37 years of service, he served in J&K, Chhattisgarh and the North-East.After attack on Parliament in December 2001, Sahi was selected for deputation with LS Secretariat as joint director (Security) in 2002 and served there till 2007, upgrading security apparatus. He served as IG Srinagar Sector of CRPF for longest period from December 2016 to March 2020 and played a key role in anti-terrorist operations and handling law and order challenges pre and post Article 370 abrogation. tnn
Summary:
HYDERABAD: CRPF additional director-general Ravideep Singh Sahi took over command of South Zone at Hyderabad on Thursday.
Sahi joined as an assistant commandant in CRPF and during the 37 years of service, he served in J&K, Chhattisgarh and the North-East.After attack on Parliament in December 2001, Sahi was selected for deputation with LS Secretariat as joint director (Security) in 2002 and served there till 2007, upgrading security apparatus.
He served as IG Srinagar Sector of CRPF for longest period from December 2016 to March 2020 and played a key role in anti-terrorist operations and handling law and order challenges pre and post Article 370 abrogation.

Meta_title: Kin to make memorial for slain poet Pash
Meta_desc: About the Author ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Pash: Kin To Make Memorial For Slain Poet Pash
Article: BATHINDA: The family of poet Avtar Singh Sandhu, aka Pash, has decided to construct a memorial dedicated to him, 35 years after his murder. The family has earmarked two acres of land, which include the well where Pash was fired at, and the mango tree where he fell. Pash was killed on March 23, 1988, at Talwandi Salem village in Jalandhar district.According to sources, Pash’s father Sohan Singh and mother had desired to build a memorial when his sisters had visited India in 2019. “It would have been better had it been materialised during the lifetime of our parents (Sohan Singh died in 2013). But now the entire family, including Pash’s daughter Winkle Sandhu , wife Rajwinder Kaur , brother Onkar Singh and sister Rajinder Kaur, have unanimously decided to complete the paperwork immediately and provide the land to a trust. We would prefer that those two spots (well and mango tree) are preserved and an auditorium or a library is constructed to keep his memory alive,” said Pash’s sister Parminder Kaur.
Summary:
BATHINDA: The family of poet Avtar Singh Sandhu, aka Pash, has decided to construct a memorial dedicated to him, 35 years after his murder.
The family has earmarked two acres of land, which include the well where Pash was fired at, and the mango tree where he fell.
Pash was killed on March 23, 1988, at Talwandi Salem village in Jalandhar district.According to sources, Pash’s father Sohan Singh and mother had desired to build a memorial when his sisters had visited India in 2019.
“It would have been better had it been materialised during the lifetime of our parents (Sohan Singh died in 2013).
We would prefer that those two spots (well and mango tree) are preserved and an auditorium or a library is constructed to keep his memory alive,” said Pash’s sister Parminder Kaur.

Meta_desc: Wrestlers set May 21 deadline for WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's arrest; ... Wrestlers set May 21 deadline for WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh's...
Title: One dead as car rams into pole
Article:
Tribune News Service

Faridabad, March 28

A 25-year-old man died and two persons were injured as a car rammed into an electric pole on the Malerna road in Ballabgarh late yesterday night.

The deceased was identified as Nishant of Sector 65. He was travelling with his friends Bharat and Rupesh. The victims were pulled out from the vehicle before it caught fire. The car was completely gutted.

The body was shifted to the Civil Hospital for post-mortem. A probe has been launched.

The deceased was identified as Nishant of Sector 65.
He was travelling with his friends Bharat and Rupesh.
The victims were pulled out from the vehicle before it caught fire.
The car was completely gutted.

Meta_title: Himachal CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu: ‘This is a battle to save democracy, not Rahul Gandhi’s individual battle’
Meta_desc: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu, 59, is actively campaigning to oppose disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Parliament.
Title: Himachal CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu: ‘This is a battle to save democracy, not Rahul Gandhi’s individual battle’
Article:
Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu, 59, is actively campaigning to oppose disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Parliament. Sukhu tells Sukhbir Siwach this can weaken democracy in the country, and justifies water cess on hydropower projects in Himachal Pradesh even though Punjab and Haryana are opposing this move. Excerpts:

Do you think Rahul Gandhi’s disqualification from Parliament may lead to a change in political equations in the country?

Rahul Gandhi’s disqualification from Parliament is a political conspiracy. There is only one leader (Rahul Gandhi) in the country who is honestly voicing people’s sentiments in the public court. There is no other leader who is raising the BJP failures inside and outside the House. There is an atmosphere of fear. Us dar ko Rahul Gandhi nikalana chahte hain (Rahul Gandhi wants to get rid of this fear). This is a battle to save democracy, and this is not an individual battle of Rahul Gandhi.”

What will be the fallout of this episode?

Such politics will weaken democracy and the (Constitutional) institutions. Democracy can be alive only if the Opposition is alive.

Do you think the politics of the country may take a new turn after this episode?

At this stage, it’s not appropriate to say where we will reach before the next Lok Sabha elections. But I believe the public knows all — what is happening and where.

Can it prove counterproductive for your opponents?

Certainly, it can. Being the strongest leader of the biggest Opposition party, he (Rahul Gandhi) was disqualified to suppress his voice. But Rahul Gandhi is a leader who walks on the path of truth and he is not going to be scared.

Advertisement

Will you make efforts to unite the Opposition on Rahul’s disqualification?

Our high command will do that. All the Opposition parties have to be united to save democracy. It does not matter who becomes Prime Minister in 2024.

What do you think about water cess on hydropower projects?

Advertisement

When dams are built and electricity is produced, it leads to evaporation and fog which impacts cities. The cess will be imposed on the people of Himachal too who make dams and produce electricity. The formula of water cess was imposed in Sikkim, Uttarakhand and Jammu Kashmir much earlier but we have introduced it just now.

Will this move not impact Punjab and Haryana?

There will be no impact on Haryana and Punjab but only on those who are engaged in power generation like BBMB (Bhakra Beas Management Board). The water cess will be imposed on the electricity generated from BBMB’s dams (situated in Himachal Pradesh). Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan have shares in the power generated from these dams. The water cess will be imposed on all 172 hydro-projects, including Himachal Pradesh’s electricity board, power corporation and private projects.

Do you think there will be no financial implications for Punjab and Haryana?

There may be financial implications for these states but imposition of such a cess is a right of Himachal Pradesh. There are no such power projects of Punjab and Haryana (in Himachal Pradesh), so they should not oppose.
Summary:
Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu, 59, is actively campaigning to oppose disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Parliament.
Excerpts:Do you think Rahul Gandhi’s disqualification from Parliament may lead to a change in political equations in the country?
There is only one leader (Rahul Gandhi) in the country who is honestly voicing people’s sentiments in the public court.
Us dar ko Rahul Gandhi nikalana chahte hain (Rahul Gandhi wants to get rid of this fear).
But Rahul Gandhi is a leader who walks on the path of truth and he is not going to be scared.

Meta_title: Archana claims sprint double in Indian GP2
Meta_desc: Wrestlers Protest Live Updates: Grapplers form two committees to decide f... Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence · Probing allegations against Brij...
Title: Archana claims sprint double in Indian GP2
Article:
Tamil Nadu’s Archana Suseendran defeated Hima Das in the 100m final and made the most of the Assam sprinter’s disqualification in the 200m to claim a double gold in the AFI Indian Grand Prix 2 on Monday.

Archana won the 100m in 11.52 seconds, 0.22 seconds ahead of Hima, and the 200m in 23.21 seconds.

The 24-year-old Muhammed Ajmal clocked a sub-47 second time this season, improving on the 46.90 seconds that helped him to win the AFI National 400m Championships title earlier this month.

Despite winning the National Games crown in 46.29 seconds, he was only fifth best Indian in 2022 and will be looking to establish himself as the leading quarter miler in the Asian Games this year.

With a best of 19.76m, the left-handed Tajinderpal Singh Toor dominated the men’s shot put.

Each of his four valid efforts were better than the 19.17m that his Punjab team-mate Karanveer Singh managed to edge out Sahib Singh (Delhi) and claim the second place.

Toor, however, is still looking for his first 20m effort of the year. Commonwealth Games gold medallist Eldhose Paul (Kerala) won the men’s triple jump contest with a best effort of 16.27m.

Advertisement

Karthik Unnikrishnan and Abdulla Aboobacker ensured a podium sweep for Kerala, with the former getting his nose ahead by a mere 3 cm. Interestingly, the Commonwealth Games silver medallist Abdulla Aboobacker cleared 15.77m in his only valid try.

Muhammed Anas Yahiya won his first national-level race since returning from the Commonwealth Games last year.

He clocked 21.54 seconds to push Maldives’ Hassan Saaid to second place. Earlier, Sanjeet Singh (Haryana) edged out Amiya Kumar Mallick (Odisha) by a hundredth of a second in the men’s 100m.

Advertisement

The 2018 Asian Games 1500m gold medallist Jinson Johnson returned to the track for only his second race since he finished fifth at the World Military Games in Wuhan, China, in October 2019.

Having finished third in the Federation Cup in April last year, he tasted victory clocking 3:44.52 on Monday, leaving Delhi’s Rahul and Maharashtra’s Prakash Balu Gadade behind.

The AFI Indian Grands Prix 3 and 4 will be held in Bengaluru on April 10 and 15.
Summary:
Archana won the 100m in 11.52 seconds, 0.22 seconds ahead of Hima, and the 200m in 23.21 seconds.
Commonwealth Games gold medallist Eldhose Paul (Kerala) won the men’s triple jump contest with a best effort of 16.27m.
Interestingly, the Commonwealth Games silver medallist Abdulla Aboobacker cleared 15.77m in his only valid try.
Muhammed Anas Yahiya won his first national-level race since returning from the Commonwealth Games last year.
The AFI Indian Grands Prix 3 and 4 will be held in Bengaluru on April 10 and 15.

Meta_title: 'Getting an ass to run a horse's race...' Hardeep Singh Puri's pulls no punches commenting on Rahul Gandh
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. In India. Entire Website. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks...
Title: Rahul Gandhi: 'Getting an ass to run a horse's race...' Hardeep Singh Puri's pulls no punches commenting on Rahul Gandhi
Article: NEW DELHI: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday lashed out at Rahul Gandhi who was disqualified as Lok Sabha MP recently, and said that the Congress leader should fight the "court's action in the court " instead of speaking against Veer Savarkar ."You are getting an ass to run a horse's race...They really deserve to do some serious introspection...People of India would judge them for what they are...Fight Court's action in the Court, you are invoking Mahabharat and Savarkar," Puri said.On Friday, Rahul Gandhi was disqualified as a member of the Lok Sabha, a day after a Surat court sentenced him to two years imprisonment in a defamation case filed against him over his 'Modi surname' remark.In April 2019, he made the remark "how come all the thieves have Modi as the common surname" at a Lok Sabha election rally at Kolar in Karnataka. The court approved Rahul Gandhi's bail on a surety and stayed the sentence for 30 days to allow him to approach the higher courts.After his disqualification, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he was not Veer Savarkar and that he will not apologise.Addressing a press conference in the national capital a day after he was convicted in a defamation case and subsequently disqualified from Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi said on Saturday "My name in not Savarkar, my name is Gandhi. Gandhis don't apologise to anyone."He further stated that he is not scared of going to prison and that his disqualification from Parliament was aimed at distracting people from the Adani issue.Meanwhile, Congress MPs in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha today attended the Parliament session by wearing black clothes.Besides Rahul Gandhi's disqualification, the Congress has since the start of the Budget session of Parliament been registering their protest over the Adani-Hindbenburg issue and questioning Prime Minister Narendra Modi's relation with the Adani Group. Congress had demanded a Joint Parliamentary Committee probe into the Adani issue and staged protests in the Parliament's ongoing Budget Session.The ongoing second part of the Budget Session began on March 13 and will continue till April 6.
Summary:
NEW DELHI: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday lashed out at Rahul Gandhi who was disqualified as Lok Sabha MP recently, and said that the Congress leader should fight the "court's action in the court " instead of speaking against Veer Savarkar .
The court approved Rahul Gandhi's bail on a surety and stayed the sentence for 30 days to allow him to approach the higher courts.After his disqualification, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he was not Veer Savarkar and that he will not apologise.Addressing a press conference in the national capital a day after he was convicted in a defamation case and subsequently disqualified from Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi said on Saturday "My name in not Savarkar, my name is Gandhi.
Gandhis don't apologise to anyone.
"He further stated that he is not scared of going to prison and that his disqualification from Parliament was aimed at distracting people from the Adani issue.Meanwhile, Congress MPs in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha today attended the Parliament session by wearing black clothes.Besides Rahul Gandhi's disqualification, the Congress has since the start of the Budget session of Parliament been registering their protest over the Adani-Hindbenburg issue and questioning Prime Minister Narendra Modi's relation with the Adani Group.
Congress had demanded a Joint Parliamentary Committee probe into the Adani issue and staged protests in the Parliament's ongoing Budget Session.The ongoing second part of the Budget Session began on March 13 and will continue till April 6.

Meta_title: India and Africa face common threats like terrorism, collective experience helpful to deal with emerging
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ... How radical preacher Amritpal Singh was arrestedindia.
Title: India and Africa face common threats like terrorism, collective experience helpful to deal with emerging security threats: Army chief Pande
Article: PUNE: India and Africa face common threats like terrorism and violent extremism and the collective experience can help to prepare better to deal with emerging security challenges, Chief of Army Staff General Manoj Pande said on Tuesday.Speaking at the conclave of Army chiefs in which 31 delegates from African nations participated, including 10 Army chiefs, General Pande said 25 partner nations are participating in the current edition of the AFINDEX military exercise which concludes on Wednesday."Our collective experience can help us to better prepare for the emerging security threats," the Army chief said.He said many African armies have experience operating in difficult and challenging environments and can offer valuable insights into their tactics, techniques and procedures."We face common threats of terrorism and violent extremism that have the potential to adversely affect our development goals," General Pande said.
Summary:
PUNE: India and Africa face common threats like terrorism and violent extremism and the collective experience can help to prepare better to deal with emerging security challenges, Chief of Army Staff General Manoj Pande said on Tuesday.Speaking at the conclave of Army chiefs in which 31 delegates from African nations participated, including 10 Army chiefs, General Pande said 25 partner nations are participating in the current edition of the AFINDEX military exercise which concludes on Wednesday.
"Our collective experience can help us to better prepare for the emerging security threats," the Army chief said.He said many African armies have experience operating in difficult and challenging environments and can offer valuable insights into their tactics, techniques and procedures.
"We face common threats of terrorism and violent extremism that have the potential to adversely affect our development goals," General Pande said.

Title: Varinder Singh: FIR against Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal’s aide Varinder Singh
Article:
Mar 30, 2023, 08:22AM IST

Source: Times Now

Cops file FIR against Amritpal Singh’s aide Varinder Singh. Continuing its crackdown on the Waris Punjab De chief Amritpal Singh’s associates, earlier police arrested another close associate of the separatist leader in relation to the Ajnala violence case. The arrested accused has been identified as Varinder Singh of Johal Raju Singh Wala village, which falls under the Patti sub-division of Tarn Taran district. Following the invocation of the National Security Act (NSA), Varinder has since been sent to Assam’s Dibrugarh jail.
