Title: Bhagwant Manns: Aap Slams Reports Of Threat To Cm’s Daughter
Article: Chandigarh: Condemning reports of Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann ’s daughter receiving death threats in the US, AAP chief spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said it only showed the mindset of anti-social elements, who can stoop to any level.Expressing concerns over Punjab CM’s daughter reportedly receiving death threats in the US, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal on Friday appealed to the Indian embassy in the US to ensure her safety.Meanwhile, Punjab ministers Aman Arora and Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said they were not aware of the threats to the CM's daughter. Arora, however, added that such things would not deter Mann-led government from taking steps to maintain peace in the state.Replying to a question, Arora and Dhaliwal, who were addressing media persons about decisions taken at the cabinet meeting, said they were not aware of the issue. “Mann has not shared any such thing with us,” said Arora. tnn
Summary:
Chandigarh: Condemning reports of Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann ’s daughter receiving death threats in the US, AAP chief spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said it only showed the mindset of anti-social elements, who can stoop to any level.Expressing concerns over Punjab CM’s daughter reportedly receiving death threats in the US, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal on Friday appealed to the Indian embassy in the US to ensure her safety.Meanwhile, Punjab ministers Aman Arora and Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said they were not aware of the threats to the CM's daughter.
Arora, however, added that such things would not deter Mann-led government from taking steps to maintain peace in the state.Replying to a question, Arora and Dhaliwal, who were addressing media persons about decisions taken at the cabinet meeting, said they were not aware of the issue.
“Mann has not shared any such thing with us,” said Arora.

Meta_title: Peace, harmony Jalandhar bypoll plank: Shiromani Akali Dal
Meta_desc: The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll.
Title: Peace, Harmony Jal Bypoll Plank: Sad
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Shiromani Akali Dal SAD ) core committee on Saturday decided to contest the Jalandhar Lok Sabha bypoll on the plank of peace and communal harmony as well as to ensure justice for weaker sections of society.The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll. It was also announced that a coordination committee meeting between the SAD and its alliance partner in Punjab, the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), would be held before naming the alliance candidate.Sources in the SAD said their party believed that former chief parliamentary secretary and former MLA from Adampur Pawan Kumar Tinu would be the alliance’s best bet for the bypoll.The SAD core committee noted that efforts were on to spoil the peace in Punjab and that AAP had become “party to the conspiracy to destabilise the state”, and CM Bhagwant Mann was “solely responsible”. The SAD condemned Mann for insulting the Akal Takht jathedar and gagging the media, intelligentsia and artists. He said the party will seek justice for all innocent Sikh youth, who had been arrested on trivial charges by the AAP government.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Shiromani Akali Dal SAD ) core committee on Saturday decided to contest the Jalandhar Lok Sabha bypoll on the plank of peace and communal harmony as well as to ensure justice for weaker sections of society.The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll.
It was also announced that a coordination committee meeting between the SAD and its alliance partner in Punjab, the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), would be held before naming the alliance candidate.Sources in the SAD said their party believed that former chief parliamentary secretary and former MLA from Adampur Pawan Kumar Tinu would be the alliance’s best bet for the bypoll.The SAD core committee noted that efforts were on to spoil the peace in Punjab and that AAP had become “party to the conspiracy to destabilise the state”, and CM Bhagwant Mann was “solely responsible”.
The SAD condemned Mann for insulting the Akal Takht jathedar and gagging the media, intelligentsia and artists.
He said the party will seek justice for all innocent Sikh youth, who had been arrested on trivial charges by the AAP government.

Title: At Rajput mahapanchayat in Jaipur, Karni Sena pushes for higher EWS quota, welfare board
Article:
Months before the Assembly elections in Rajasthan, a Rajput outfit on Sunday demanded an increase in the reservation for the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) from 10 per cent to 14 per cent at a “Kesariya Mahapanchayat” in Jaipur. The Mahapanchayat was organised by the Shree Rashtriya Rajput Karni Sena (SRRKS).

“We want our rights. This gathering is not political but this Kesariya Mahapanchayat has been convened to demand from the government the rights of our youth. We demand that the EWS reservation be increased from 10 per cent to 14 per cent and that the state government constitute a Kshatriya Rajput Kalyan Board. The Central government should relax the conditions of EWS reservation in Central government recruitment,” said SRRKS national president Sukhdev Singh Gogamedi.

“We want a relaxation of five years in age and also similar relaxations in educational qualifications when it comes to the EWS category, as is available to other reserved categories. Our ancestors have always sacrificed for this country and the Hindu religion,” said Gogamedi.

Among those in attendance were BJP MP from Kaiserganj in Uttar Pradesh Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh and Raghuraj Singh, MoS in the Uttar Pradesh government.

“The government said that the Rajput men who helped the police nab the assailants of Kanhaiya Lal will be awarded government jobs. What happened to that promise? Do you want us to protest with lakhs of community members?” said Gogamedi.

The Gogamedi-led SRRKS is one of the two major Karni Senas in Rajasthan, the other being the Shree Rajput Karni Sena (SRKS). During the time of the previous BJP government, both the Karni Senas had protested against the BJP — a party traditionally supported by Rajputs — over issues such as the encounter of gangster Anandpal Singh and the sidelining of Rajput leaders such as former Union minister Jaswant Singh by former chief minister Vasundhara Raje.

At the Kesariya Mahapanchayat held on Sunday, the Karni Sena paid tribute to Rajput leader Lokendra Singh Kalvi, who died recently. The Mahapanchayat was the latest among a string of caste Mahapanchayats. Earlier, Jat and Brahmin communities had held similar events at the same venue near the Vidhyadhar Nagar stadium.

Advertisement

As the event by Karni Sena was in progress, another mahapanchayat was held in Jaipur by the Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities.
Summary:
The Mahapanchayat was organised by the Shree Rashtriya Rajput Karni Sena (SRRKS).
This gathering is not political but this Kesariya Mahapanchayat has been convened to demand from the government the rights of our youth.
The Gogamedi-led SRRKS is one of the two major Karni Senas in Rajasthan, the other being the Shree Rajput Karni Sena (SRKS).
At the Kesariya Mahapanchayat held on Sunday, the Karni Sena paid tribute to Rajput leader Lokendra Singh Kalvi, who died recently.
AdvertisementAs the event by Karni Sena was in progress, another mahapanchayat was held in Jaipur by the Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities.

Meta_title: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar releases coffee table book ‘Sikh Business Leaders of India’
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar releases coffee table book ‘Sikh Business Leaders of India’
Article: GURGAON: Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar released a coffee table book titled ‘ Sikh Business Leaders of India’, authored by Dr Prabhleen at a function organized in Delhi and urges the industrialists to set up industries in the state. He said that the state government has created a conducive environment and is providing various facilities.Addressing the gathering, the chief minister said that industrialists will not face any problem in doing business in Haryana. “The government has created a single roof system, under which all types of clearances to industries are given in 45 days. The power supply situation is also comfortable now. The state government has made four categories- A, B, C and D. If industries are set up in category C and D zones, the state government will reimburse Rs 4,000 per worker per month as incentive for the next 4 years,” said Khattar.CM said the Sikh community has made a huge contribution to the state, the country and the world as well. “This community is a working community and has worked hard with struggle to promote their business, family, country and society. They are also working to take forward and uplift the needy, who have been left behind from the mainstream due to some reason,” said Khattar.Sharing the story of the supreme sacrifice made by Guru Tegh Bahadur, the CM said that when Bhai Jaita, while going to Anandpur Sahib reached Sonipat with Guru Teg Bahadur’s head, at that time, in order to escape from the army of Mughals, Bhai Kushal Singh of village Badkhalsa, Sonipat, offered his head to Bhai Jaita ji, as his face resembled Guru’s. The Mughals took Kushal’s head and returned back thinking that it was of Guru and in this way, Guru’s head could be taken to Anandpur Sahib.Haryana Sikh Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee , president, Mahant Karamjeet Singh said that incomparable work has been done for Sikhism and Punjabi language under the leadership of chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar. “The state government has also created a separate foundation for Baba Banda Singh Bahadur ,” said Singh.
Summary:
GURGAON: Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar released a coffee table book titled ‘ Sikh Business Leaders of India’, authored by Dr Prabhleen at a function organized in Delhi and urges the industrialists to set up industries in the state.
He said that the state government has created a conducive environment and is providing various facilities.Addressing the gathering, the chief minister said that industrialists will not face any problem in doing business in Haryana.
“The government has created a single roof system, under which all types of clearances to industries are given in 45 days.
“This community is a working community and has worked hard with struggle to promote their business, family, country and society.
“The state government has also created a separate foundation for Baba Banda Singh Bahadur ,” said Singh.

Meta_title: 'Rs 48,20,69,00,00,000 corruption under Congress rule': BJP releases first episode of 'Congress Files'
Meta_desc: The government was led by Manmohan Singh, who turned a blind eye to all the corruption that kept on happening under his rule. In those days, papers were...
Title: 'Rs 48,20,69,00,00,000 corruption under Congress rule': BJP releases first episode of 'Congress Files'
Article: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Sunday released the first episode of ' Congress Files ', which highlights the corruption allegations against the party during its tenure.The official Twitter handle of BJP tweeted, "The first episode of Congress Files, see how one after the other corruption and scams took place under the Congress rule".The BJP released a video message titled "Congress means corruption" in which they claimed that the Congress party had looted a staggering Rs. 48,20,69,00,00,000 from the public during its 70 years of rule. The party further added that this massive sum of money could have been utilized for numerous areas of development and security, but instead, it was misused by the Congress."Using this much amount, 24 INS Vikrant , 300 Rafale jets , and 1000 Mangal Missions could have been made or purchased. But the country had to bear the cost of Congress' corruption, and it lagged behind in the race of progress," the video message added. BJP further attacked the Congress party and termed its tenure from 2004-2014 as a "Lost Decade".BJP further said in the video, "Keeping the whole 70 years aside, if we only look at the last tenure of 2004-14, it was a 'Lost Decade'. The government was led by Manmohan Singh, who turned a blind eye to all the corruption that kept on happening under his rule. In those days, papers were filled with the news of corruption, looking at which the heads of every Indian hung in shame. ""Coal scam of Rs 1.86 lakh crore, 2G Spectrum scam of Rs 1.76 lakh crore, MNREGA scam of Rs 10 lakh crore, Commonwealth scam of Rs 70,000 crore, a bribe of Rs 362 crores in the helicopter deal with Italy, 12 crores bribe for the Chairman of Railway Board," it further added.At the end of the video message, BJP stated, "This is only the jhanki (trailer) of Congress' corruption, the movie is still not over."
Summary:
NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Sunday released the first episode of ' Congress Files ', which highlights the corruption allegations against the party during its tenure.The official Twitter handle of BJP tweeted, "The first episode of Congress Files, see how one after the other corruption and scams took place under the Congress rule".The BJP released a video message titled "Congress means corruption" in which they claimed that the Congress party had looted a staggering Rs.
"Using this much amount, 24 INS Vikrant , 300 Rafale jets , and 1000 Mangal Missions could have been made or purchased.
But the country had to bear the cost of Congress' corruption, and it lagged behind in the race of progress," the video message added.
The government was led by Manmohan Singh, who turned a blind eye to all the corruption that kept on happening under his rule.
In those days, papers were filled with the news of corruption, looking at which the heads of every Indian hung in shame.

Meta_title: Paper leak case: Main accused BJP functionary held in Haridwar
Meta_desc: Paper leak case: Main accused BJP functionary held in Haridwar ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath...
Title: Paper leak case: Main accused BJP functionary held in Haridwar
Article: HARIDWAR: BJP member Sanjay Dhariwal , one of the main accused in the patwari and JE/AE paper leak case, which came to light in January this year, has finally been arrested by Haridwar police on Saturday.Dhariwal, whose brother had earlier been arrested in the same case, carried a reward of Rs 50,000. He allegedly had close links with Sanjeev Chaturvedi, the section officer of UKPSC arrested for leaking and selling exam papers. He also allegedly helped a coaching centre, where the leaked papers were solved, get candidates willing to pay and clear the exams. Police had recovered Rs 4 lakh cash and blank cheques from him, possibly taken from applicants who bought the leaked papers. Sanjay Dhariwal is also the head of Mohammadpur Jat village in Haridwar. He was trying to surrender before the court, but police managed to arrest him from Narsan. Haridwar SSP Ajay Singh said, "Sanjay is one of the main accused and he wanted to surrender before the court to escape police questioning, but we managed to arrest him. So far, 38 accused have been arrested, including two section officers of UKPSC, in the case. More arrests will happen soon."
Summary:
HARIDWAR: BJP member Sanjay Dhariwal , one of the main accused in the patwari and JE/AE paper leak case, which came to light in January this year, has finally been arrested by Haridwar police on Saturday.Dhariwal, whose brother had earlier been arrested in the same case, carried a reward of Rs 50,000.
He allegedly had close links with Sanjeev Chaturvedi, the section officer of UKPSC arrested for leaking and selling exam papers.
Police had recovered Rs 4 lakh cash and blank cheques from him, possibly taken from applicants who bought the leaked papers.
Haridwar SSP Ajay Singh said, "Sanjay is one of the main accused and he wanted to surrender before the court to escape police questioning, but we managed to arrest him.
So far, 38 accused have been arrested, including two section officers of UKPSC, in the case.

Meta_title: Congress will come to power again in Rajasthan: CM Ashok Gehlot
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi...
Title: Congress will come to power again in Rajasthan: CM Ashok Gehlot
Article: Ajmer: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from parliamentary politics was a "conspiratorial reaction" to the latter's forceful raising of issues related to Adani. Gehlot said Rahul Gandhi always talks about keeping the country united whereas BJP and Narendra Modi try to break the country."The country is with Rahul Gandhi as the common citizens now understand the consequences of BJP rule," said Gehlot in his address to the first division-level Congress workers' conference attended by thousands of party workers from Ajmer, Bhilwara, Nagaur and Tonk districts. As soon as Gehlot reached the programme venue at Government Jawahar Senior Secondary School at Civil Lines in Ajmer, it started pouring. "Today Lord Indra is also happy to see this Congress programme. Congress will repeat its government in the state," said the CM.Congress state in-charge Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa and PCC president Govind Singh Dotasra also addressed the programme and asked the party workers to make people aware of the welfare schemes and initiatives started for the common citizens. They urged the party workers to verify if the government's schemes were reaching the grassroot levels. They also asked people not to believe fake news circulating and urged Congress workers to bring the truth to society. tnn
Summary:
Ajmer: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from parliamentary politics was a "conspiratorial reaction" to the latter's forceful raising of issues related to Adani.
Gehlot said Rahul Gandhi always talks about keeping the country united whereas BJP and Narendra Modi try to break the country.
"Today Lord Indra is also happy to see this Congress programme.
They urged the party workers to verify if the government's schemes were reaching the grassroot levels.
They also asked people not to believe fake news circulating and urged Congress workers to bring the truth to society.

Meta_title: Sidhu Moose Wala’s dad Balkaur Singh says will highlight rising lawlessness in Punjab
Meta_desc: BATHINDA: Slain singer Sidhu Moose Wala's father Balkaur Singh on Sunday announced he would be campaigning for the May 10 Lok Sabha bypoll from Jalandhar...
Title: Walas: Moose Wala’s Dad Says Will Highlight Rising Lawlessness
Article: BATHINDA : Slain singer Sidhu Moose Wala’s father Balkaur Singh on Sunday announced he would be campaigning for the May 10 Lok Sabha bypoll from Jalandhar seat to tell people about worsening law and order in Punjab.Addressing the fans of his son at his home in Moosa village of Mansa, Balkaur said when he and his wife had protested outside Punjab legislative assembly during the budget session on March 7, they were promised a meeting with the CM, but that assurance had not been fulfilled even after a month. “Two interviews of (gangster) Lawrence Bishnoi have been aired on a news channel, but the state has not cleared how a gangster in its custody could give interview from jail. The government claims it is still investigating about the place of interviews, while my sources from Delhi said the first interview seemed to have been done in Kharar and second in Bathinda. Going by this, I will go to Jalandhar to raise my voice for justice,” he said.He said when the CM had visited him after the killing of his son, he had promised a judicial commission to look into all aspects of the killing, but that too had not been done.He also accused the state government of trying to sabotage the death anniversary of his son by starting an operation to nab fugitive radical Amritpal Singh, which should have done on the day he had stormed Ajnala police station. Balkaur added he was still getting threats in the name of Lawrence Bishnoi. “I don’t fear death, but the government must look into all this ,” he said.
Summary:
BATHINDA : Slain singer Sidhu Moose Wala’s father Balkaur Singh on Sunday announced he would be campaigning for the May 10 Lok Sabha bypoll from Jalandhar seat to tell people about worsening law and order in Punjab.Addressing the fans of his son at his home in Moosa village of Mansa, Balkaur said when he and his wife had protested outside Punjab legislative assembly during the budget session on March 7, they were promised a meeting with the CM, but that assurance had not been fulfilled even after a month.
“Two interviews of (gangster) Lawrence Bishnoi have been aired on a news channel, but the state has not cleared how a gangster in its custody could give interview from jail.
The government claims it is still investigating about the place of interviews, while my sources from Delhi said the first interview seemed to have been done in Kharar and second in Bathinda.
Balkaur added he was still getting threats in the name of Lawrence Bishnoi.
“I don’t fear death, but the government must look into all this ,” he said.

Title: sidhu: “Punjab is waiting for him…” says Media Advisor as Navjot Sidhu slated to come out of jail
Article:

Navjot Singh Sidhu’s Media Advisor Surinder Dalla on April 01 said that the whole of Punjab is waiting for Sidhu to come out of jail. People from every village are blessing Navjot Singh Sidhu today.”

Meta_title: Punjab cabinet enhances crop compensation by 25 percent at ...
Meta_desc: Why is Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh not being arrested despite POCSO Act charges: Sidhu · Kharge calls for reviving voice of workers on International Labour...
Title: Punjab cabinet enhances crop compensation by 25 percent at Rs.15000 per acre
Article:
Chandigarh: In a major pro-farmer decision aimed at safeguarding their interests during natural calamities, the Punjab Cabinet led by Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Friday gave nod for hiking the compensation due to nature’s fury by 25% per acre thereby giving a major respite to the food growers.

A decision to this effect was taken by the council of Ministers in its meeting held here at the Punjab Civil Secretariat- I under the chairmanship of the Chief Minister.

Divulging more details a spokesperson of the Chief Minister’s Office said that keeping in view the loss incurred by the farmers recently due to heavy rains, hailstorms and strong winds, the Cabinet has decided to enhance the relief amount from Rs.12,000/- per acre to Rs.15,000/- per acre for 76-100 percent for loss of crops. This measure will give a healing touch to the affected farmers who will be able to get a reasonable financial relief from the government. These relief rates will be applicable from March 1, 2023.

Nod to extend exemption of 2.25% stamp duty and fees land registration by April 30

Keeping in view the larger public interest, the Cabinet also gave its consent to extend the exemption of 2.25% stamp duty and fees to those registering their property/land by April 30. Those opting for registration of land will now be exempted from 1% Additional stamp duty, 1 % PIDB fees and 0.25 % special fees.

The Cabinet also gave approval for hiring 2574 Kisan Mitras and 108 field supervisors in the Agriculture department. These Kisan Mitras and Field Supervisors will encourage the farmers to get out of the rut of wheat/ paddy circle and cultivate less water guzzling crops like Cotton and Basmati. This step will act as a catalyst to save precious groundwater of the state by boosting crop diversification program on one hand and providing employment to the youth of the state on the other.
Summary:
Chandigarh: In a major pro-farmer decision aimed at safeguarding their interests during natural calamities, the Punjab Cabinet led by Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Friday gave nod for hiking the compensation due to nature’s fury by 25% per acre thereby giving a major respite to the food growers.
A decision to this effect was taken by the council of Ministers in its meeting held here at the Punjab Civil Secretariat- I under the chairmanship of the Chief Minister.
This measure will give a healing touch to the affected farmers who will be able to get a reasonable financial relief from the government.
Those opting for registration of land will now be exempted from 1% Additional stamp duty, 1 % PIDB fees and 0.25 % special fees.
The Cabinet also gave approval for hiring 2574 Kisan Mitras and 108 field supervisors in the Agriculture department.

Meta_title: AAP slams reports of threat to CM’s daughter
Meta_desc: AAP slams reports of threat to CM's daughter ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death...
Title: Bhagwant Manns: Aap Slams Reports Of Threat To Cm’s Daughter
Article: Chandigarh: Condemning reports of Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann ’s daughter receiving death threats in the US, AAP chief spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said it only showed the mindset of anti-social elements, who can stoop to any level.Expressing concerns over Punjab CM’s daughter reportedly receiving death threats in the US, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal on Friday appealed to the Indian embassy in the US to ensure her safety.Meanwhile, Punjab ministers Aman Arora and Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said they were not aware of the threats to the CM's daughter. Arora, however, added that such things would not deter Mann-led government from taking steps to maintain peace in the state.Replying to a question, Arora and Dhaliwal, who were addressing media persons about decisions taken at the cabinet meeting, said they were not aware of the issue. “Mann has not shared any such thing with us,” said Arora. tnn
Summary:
Chandigarh: Condemning reports of Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann ’s daughter receiving death threats in the US, AAP chief spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang said it only showed the mindset of anti-social elements, who can stoop to any level.Expressing concerns over Punjab CM’s daughter reportedly receiving death threats in the US, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal on Friday appealed to the Indian embassy in the US to ensure her safety.Meanwhile, Punjab ministers Aman Arora and Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said they were not aware of the threats to the CM's daughter.
Arora, however, added that such things would not deter Mann-led government from taking steps to maintain peace in the state.Replying to a question, Arora and Dhaliwal, who were addressing media persons about decisions taken at the cabinet meeting, said they were not aware of the issue.
“Mann has not shared any such thing with us,” said Arora.

Meta_title: Peace, harmony Jalandhar bypoll plank: Shiromani Akali Dal
Meta_desc: The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll.
Title: Peace, Harmony Jal Bypoll Plank: Sad
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Shiromani Akali Dal SAD ) core committee on Saturday decided to contest the Jalandhar Lok Sabha bypoll on the plank of peace and communal harmony as well as to ensure justice for weaker sections of society.The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll. It was also announced that a coordination committee meeting between the SAD and its alliance partner in Punjab, the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), would be held before naming the alliance candidate.Sources in the SAD said their party believed that former chief parliamentary secretary and former MLA from Adampur Pawan Kumar Tinu would be the alliance’s best bet for the bypoll.The SAD core committee noted that efforts were on to spoil the peace in Punjab and that AAP had become “party to the conspiracy to destabilise the state”, and CM Bhagwant Mann was “solely responsible”. The SAD condemned Mann for insulting the Akal Takht jathedar and gagging the media, intelligentsia and artists. He said the party will seek justice for all innocent Sikh youth, who had been arrested on trivial charges by the AAP government.
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The Shiromani Akali Dal SAD ) core committee on Saturday decided to contest the Jalandhar Lok Sabha bypoll on the plank of peace and communal harmony as well as to ensure justice for weaker sections of society.The core committee meeting, held under SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal, authorised the party president to select the candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll.
It was also announced that a coordination committee meeting between the SAD and its alliance partner in Punjab, the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), would be held before naming the alliance candidate.Sources in the SAD said their party believed that former chief parliamentary secretary and former MLA from Adampur Pawan Kumar Tinu would be the alliance’s best bet for the bypoll.The SAD core committee noted that efforts were on to spoil the peace in Punjab and that AAP had become “party to the conspiracy to destabilise the state”, and CM Bhagwant Mann was “solely responsible”.
The SAD condemned Mann for insulting the Akal Takht jathedar and gagging the media, intelligentsia and artists.
He said the party will seek justice for all innocent Sikh youth, who had been arrested on trivial charges by the AAP government.

Meta_title: ‘Regulatory frameworks will boost green hydrogen ecosystem’
Meta_desc: Bhupinder Singh Bhalla, secretary, Union ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE), said, “Creating policy mechanisms and regulatory frameworks along with...
Title: Etwg: ‘regulatory Frameworks Will Boost Green Hydrogen Ecosystem’
Article: GANDHINAGAR: Speakers at the second Energy Transition Working Group ( ETWG ) meeting of the G20, which got underway in Gandhinagar on Sunday, said that policy mechanisms, common protocol for hydrogen certification and regulatory frameworks along with collaborations between countries, could accelerate a green hydrogen ecosystem.Bhupinder Singh Bhalla , secretary, Union ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE), said, “Creating policy mechanisms and regulatory frameworks along with establishing collaborations between countries, could accelerate a green hydrogen ecosystem. Developing consensus on a common framework for hydrogen certification would be extremely critical to enable global hydrogen trade.Achieving this will be of paramount importance as part of G20 deliberations and discussions.” Delegates from Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI), International Solar Alliance (ISA) and World Resources Institute India (WRI India) along with participants from international research organizations, industry participants, regulatory bodies and other key stakeholders are attending the ETWG meeting.Giving a global perspective on green hydrogen Gauri Singh, deputy director general, IRENA (International Renewable Energy Agency), said, “At present, about 100MT of hydrogen is produced globally, and 98% of that comes from fossil fuels.”Madhav Pai , interim CEO & program executive director Sustainable Cities & Transport, WRI India, said that green hydrogen is poised to play a vital role in the cross-sectoral decarbonisation of hard-to-abate sectors and is, therefore, a crucial element for a sustainable, low-carbon future,” he said.
Summary:
GANDHINAGAR: Speakers at the second Energy Transition Working Group ( ETWG ) meeting of the G20, which got underway in Gandhinagar on Sunday, said that policy mechanisms, common protocol for hydrogen certification and regulatory frameworks along with collaborations between countries, could accelerate a green hydrogen ecosystem.Bhupinder Singh Bhalla , secretary, Union ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE), said, “Creating policy mechanisms and regulatory frameworks along with establishing collaborations between countries, could accelerate a green hydrogen ecosystem.
Developing consensus on a common framework for hydrogen certification would be extremely critical to enable global hydrogen trade.Achieving this will be of paramount importance as part of G20 deliberations and discussions.” Delegates from Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI), International Solar Alliance (ISA) and World Resources Institute India (WRI India) along with participants from international research organizations, industry participants, regulatory bodies and other key stakeholders are attending the ETWG meeting.Giving a global perspective on green hydrogen Gauri Singh, deputy director general, IRENA (International Renewable Energy Agency), said, “At present, about 100MT of hydrogen is produced globally, and 98% of that comes from fossil fuels.”Madhav Pai , interim CEO & program executive director Sustainable Cities & Transport, WRI India, said that green hydrogen is poised to play a vital role in the cross-sectoral decarbonisation of hard-to-abate sectors and is, therefore, a crucial element for a sustainable, low-carbon future,” he said.

Meta_title: BioNEST-BHU selected under UP Start-Up Policy
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR...
Title: Bionest: Bionest-bhu Selected Under Up Start-up Policy
Article: Varanasi: In its attempt to implement the UP-Start-Up Policy 2020 and create a wide network of start-up incubators in UP, the state government has selected BioNEST-BHU for financial support of Rs 1.5 crores to provide incubation support to the entrepreneurs and start-ups of Uttar Pradesh.The BioNEST-BHU was established in the Central Discovery Centre of Banaras Hindu University in 2019 with a generous support of Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), New Delhi. Under the leadership of Prof Anil Kumar Tripathi, a professor of Biotechnology and director of the Institute of Science, BioNEST-BHU has created 15 furnished rooms with two well-equipped laboratories to provide incubation support to faculty members, researchers, innovators, and start-ups working in the field of Life sciences, Biotechnology, Healthcare, Agriculture, Food Technology, Energy, Waste management, and other allied areas.Prof Tripathi said that the BioNEST-BHU helps startups/innovators in writing grant applications and pitch ideas before investors to support the development of research-based products. Currently, 8 start-ups of BioNEST-BHU are working in different fields that have the potential to become unicorns in the coming years. The ‘ Start in UP’ grant will be used to support the entrepreneurs of UP by providing them guidance, mentorship, access to research and analytical facilities in promoting bio-based entrepreneurship. With the continued efforts of the BioNEST-BHU team to promote entrepreneurship in BHU and neighboring regions, three entrepreneurs of BioNEST-BHU succeeded in getting the prestigious ‘Biotechnology Ignition Grant’ worth Rs 50 Lakhs each from the Department of Biotechnology.
Summary:
Varanasi: In its attempt to implement the UP-Start-Up Policy 2020 and create a wide network of start-up incubators in UP, the state government has selected BioNEST-BHU for financial support of Rs 1.5 crores to provide incubation support to the entrepreneurs and start-ups of Uttar Pradesh.The BioNEST-BHU was established in the Central Discovery Centre of Banaras Hindu University in 2019 with a generous support of Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC), New Delhi.
Under the leadership of Prof Anil Kumar Tripathi, a professor of Biotechnology and director of the Institute of Science, BioNEST-BHU has created 15 furnished rooms with two well-equipped laboratories to provide incubation support to faculty members, researchers, innovators, and start-ups working in the field of Life sciences, Biotechnology, Healthcare, Agriculture, Food Technology, Energy, Waste management, and other allied areas.Prof Tripathi said that the BioNEST-BHU helps startups/innovators in writing grant applications and pitch ideas before investors to support the development of research-based products.
Currently, 8 start-ups of BioNEST-BHU are working in different fields that have the potential to become unicorns in the coming years.
The ‘ Start in UP’ grant will be used to support the entrepreneurs of UP by providing them guidance, mentorship, access to research and analytical facilities in promoting bio-based entrepreneurship.
With the continued efforts of the BioNEST-BHU team to promote entrepreneurship in BHU and neighboring regions, three entrepreneurs of BioNEST-BHU succeeded in getting the prestigious ‘Biotechnology Ignition Grant’ worth Rs 50 Lakhs each from the Department of Biotechnology.

Meta_title: Driver killed, 11 hurt as 2 vehicles collide in Uttarakhand
Meta_desc: RUDRAPUR: A taxi on its way from Ramnagara Madhotanda in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, to Rudrapur, Udham Singh Nagar, collided head-on with a car near the...
Title: Driver killed, 11 hurt as 2 vehicles collide in Uttarakhand
Article: RUDRAPUR: A taxi on its way from Ramnagara Madhotanda in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, to Rudrapur, Udham Singh Nagar, collided head-on with a car near the Paheniya toll plaza in Khatima town. The impact was such that the taxi turned turtle, killing its driver, on the spot. The other occupants of the two vehicles (nine passengers of the taxi and two persons in the car) have been sent to the sub-district hospital in Khatima. Police have impounded both vehicles and sent the victim's body for post-mortem and later handed it over to his family.The dead has been identified as 46-year-old Rajeev Saxena from Punjabi Colony, Ward-10, Kichha. Ravindra Kumar, a 45-year-old Bareilly resident, and his daughter, Arshiya Anand, are also critical and have been referred to a higher centre."We are investigating the incident to determine the cause of the accident. We will take the required legal actions," said Khatima SSI Ashok Kumar .
Summary:
RUDRAPUR: A taxi on its way from Ramnagara Madhotanda in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, to Rudrapur, Udham Singh Nagar, collided head-on with a car near the Paheniya toll plaza in Khatima town.
The impact was such that the taxi turned turtle, killing its driver, on the spot.
The other occupants of the two vehicles (nine passengers of the taxi and two persons in the car) have been sent to the sub-district hospital in Khatima.
Ravindra Kumar, a 45-year-old Bareilly resident, and his daughter, Arshiya Anand, are also critical and have been referred to a higher centre.
We will take the required legal actions," said Khatima SSI Ashok Kumar .

Meta_title: Oscar Pistorius denied parole for murder of Reeva Steenkamp; parole board says he hasn’t served enough time
Meta_desc: ... against WFI chief Brij Bhushan · Wrestlers Protest Live Updates: Protesting wrestlers threaten to return m... Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh at his residence.
Title: Oscar Pistorius denied parole for murder of Reeva Steenkamp; parole board says he hasn’t served enough time
Article:
Former Olympic runner Oscar Pistorius was denied parole on Friday and will have to stay in prison at least another year and four months after it was decided that he had not served the “minimum detention period” required to be released following his murder conviction for the 2013 killing of girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

The parole board hearing Pistorius’ application ruled he would be able to apply again in August 2024, South Africa’s Department of Corrections said in a statement. The board cited a new clarification on Pistorius’ sentence that was issued by South Africa’s Supreme Court of Appeal three days ago, according to the statement.

The result was a surprise but there has been legal wrangling over when Pistorius should be eligible for parole because of the series of appeals in his case. He was initially convicted of culpable homicide, a charge comparable to manslaughter, in 2014 but the case went through a number of appeals before Pistorius was finally sentenced to 13 years and five months in prison for murder in 2017.

Serious offenders must serve at least half their sentence to be eligible for parole in South Africa and Pistorius’ lawyers had gone to court to argue that he was now eligible because he had served the required portion of time in jail from late 2014 following his culpable homicide conviction.

June Steenkamp, the mother of Reeva Steenkamp, attended Pistorius’ hearing Friday to oppose his parole. The parents of Reeva Steenkamp have said they still do not believe Pistorius’ account of their daughter’s killing.

Pistorius has always claimed he killed Steenkamp in the pre-dawn hours of Valentine’s Day 2013 after mistaking her for a dangerous intruder in his home. The Steenkamps said they think he killed her intentionally after a late-night argument and want him to stay in prison.
Summary:
The parole board hearing Pistorius’ application ruled he would be able to apply again in August 2024, South Africa’s Department of Corrections said in a statement.
The board cited a new clarification on Pistorius’ sentence that was issued by South Africa’s Supreme Court of Appeal three days ago, according to the statement.
June Steenkamp, the mother of Reeva Steenkamp, attended Pistorius’ hearing Friday to oppose his parole.
The parents of Reeva Steenkamp have said they still do not believe Pistorius’ account of their daughter’s killing.
The Steenkamps said they think he killed her intentionally after a late-night argument and want him to stay in prison.

Meta_title: Public library opened in east Delhi
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Public library opened in east Delhi
Article: NEW DELHI: A library built by local MP Gautam Gambhir in East Delhi's Priya Enclave has been opened to the public. The library, which was handed over to the MCD by the MP, is named after freedom fighter Shaheed Bhagat Singh. It will be open all days from 8am to 2pm.The roughly 1,500 sq ft library has over 2,000 books and more are being added, Gambhir said. It has a reading hall, a children's section and two computers with Wi-Fi facilities. The library has been set up at what was previously a dumpsite in Priya Enclave, he said.
Summary:
NEW DELHI: A library built by local MP Gautam Gambhir in East Delhi's Priya Enclave has been opened to the public.
The library, which was handed over to the MCD by the MP, is named after freedom fighter Shaheed Bhagat Singh.
It will be open all days from 8am to 2pm.The roughly 1,500 sq ft library has over 2,000 books and more are being added, Gambhir said.
It has a reading hall, a children's section and two computers with Wi-Fi facilities.
The library has been set up at what was previously a dumpsite in Priya Enclave, he said.

Meta_title: DG prisons among 5 senior IPS officers shunted in state

Title: Ips: Dg Prisons Among 5 Senior Ips Officers Shunted In State
Article: Lucknow: Five senior IPS officers were reshuffled after the superannuation of DS Chauhan. Special DG Law and Order, Prashant Kumar was given additional charge of Economic Offences Wing while Special DG, Crime, MK Bashal was made Special DG in UP Power Corporation.DG CB-CID Vijay Kumar was given the additional charge of Vigilance Establishment. The charge of Vigilance was until now with Chauhan. DG UP Power Corporation, SN Sabat was made DG Prisons , while DG Prisons, Anand Kumar, was shifted to Cooperation Cell.Recently, illegal meetings had taken place between SBSP MLA Abbas Ansari with his wife Nikhat at Chitrakoot jail in connivance with the jail officials.Five jail officials were also arrested in the case.Meanwhile, in Bareilly central jail, Jailer, deputy jailer along with four other jail personnel were suspended for allegedly facilitating meetings between former MLA Ashraf , brother of Atiq Ahmed , and his aides illegally in the Bareilly district jail.
Summary:
Lucknow: Five senior IPS officers were reshuffled after the superannuation of DS Chauhan.
Special DG Law and Order, Prashant Kumar was given additional charge of Economic Offences Wing while Special DG, Crime, MK Bashal was made Special DG in UP Power Corporation.DG CB-CID Vijay Kumar was given the additional charge of Vigilance Establishment.
The charge of Vigilance was until now with Chauhan.
DG UP Power Corporation, SN Sabat was made DG Prisons , while DG Prisons, Anand Kumar, was shifted to Cooperation Cell.Recently, illegal meetings had taken place between SBSP MLA Abbas Ansari with his wife Nikhat at Chitrakoot jail in connivance with the jail officials.Five jail officials were also arrested in the case.Meanwhile, in Bareilly central jail, Jailer, deputy jailer along with four other jail personnel were suspended for allegedly facilitating meetings between former MLA Ashraf , brother of Atiq Ahmed , and his aides illegally in the Bareilly district jail.

Meta_title: Now, you can monitor relaying of roads in Chennai
Meta_desc: Corporation commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi said, "We want the public to know about the roads being laid, so that there is transparency in the...
Title: Now, you can monitor relaying of roads in Chennai
Article: CHENNAI: Gone are the days when the Greater Chennai Corporation secretly laid roads at midnight. To bring in transparency and citizen participation, the corporation has begun publishing details of roads being relaid on a specific day. This will include type of relaying, name of contractor, and name of project consultant.The civic body has also published the contact details of the consultants and its own engineers for residents to reach out and check road status. On Saturday, details of 58 roads being relaid across the city were published online.Corporation commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi said, "We want the public to know about the roads being laid, so that there is transparency in the implementation process. We have also asked the contractors to relay badly laid roads. If there is transparency, the quality of work will be better."Senior officials had also been asked to inspect the roads at night he added.Chief minister M K Stalin , mayor R Priya , and chief secretary Irai Anbu have all conducted midnight inspections of road laying in the city in the last couple of months. Last year, several newly laid roads were relaid as they were not milled. Corporation officials said that with the details now in public, residents too can monitor the work and help the civic body save on relaying costs.Civic activists welcomed the move and urged residents to take part in the relaying process. Activist Dayanand Krishnan said transparency was welcome. "Contractors must ensure the roads are milled and the height is not increased," he said.Satish Galley of OMR said earlier the contractors used to put up notice boards with all the project details."This is not followed now and the corporation should ask the contractors to put up the boards again to make residents aware of the work," he said.
Summary:
CHENNAI: Gone are the days when the Greater Chennai Corporation secretly laid roads at midnight.
To bring in transparency and citizen participation, the corporation has begun publishing details of roads being relaid on a specific day.
We have also asked the contractors to relay badly laid roads.
Last year, several newly laid roads were relaid as they were not milled.
Corporation officials said that with the details now in public, residents too can monitor the work and help the civic body save on relaying costs.Civic activists welcomed the move and urged residents to take part in the relaying process.

Meta_title: Venkatesh Iyer yearns to regain his mojo at KKR in IPL 2023
Meta_desc: IPL 2023 · Shaili Singh. LATEST NEWS. Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh · Kerala Blasters · Neeraj Chopra · Mumbai Indians · Arjun tendulkar.
Title: Venkatesh Iyer yearns to regain his mojo at KKR in IPL 2023
Article:
In 2021, Venkatesh Iyer suddenly found himself in the arclight with his exploits in the purple and gold of the Kolkata Knight Riders. The side, having experimented with nine other opening combinations since 2019 without much success, finally found the answer to its batting woes in PowerPlay overs in the unheralded all-rounder from Indore.

The arrival of Iyer, right after the five-month COVID-induced hiatus, was like a whiff of fresh air. Opening alongside Shubman Gill, the 6-foot-4-inch-tall left-handed batter helped the team register back-to-back wins against Virat Kohli’s Royal Challengers Bangalore and archrival Mumbai Indians led by the exuberant Rohit Sharma. He scored 41 not out vs RCB, and 53 vs MI. In that edition, he ended up scoring 370 runs in 10 matches at an average of 41.11.

His consistent performances didn’t go unnoticed and November, 2021 was when Iyer arguably lived his best 30 days. Immediately after being fast-tracked into the Indian white-ball team for the New Zealand series, he was retained by KKR ahead of the following season. The figure was ₹8 crore, which translates to a mind-boggling 3900 per cent annual hike in his salary!

The grin says it all! 😊



A moment to cherish for @ivenkyiyer2512 as he makes his #TeamIndia debut. 👏 👏#INDvNZ@Paytmpic.twitter.com/2cZJWZBrXf — BCCI (@BCCI) November 17, 2021

All that cash, besides of course making Iyer way richer, even changed his perspective. “Life has changed in a manner where I’ve started looking at things more professionally. Obviously, when you play more cricket, you tend to bring professionalism into everything. But, that’s how life has changed my approach towards the game. I know that I have to be precise and professional when it comes to each and everything. And yeah, I’ve learned a lot... I now feel that I need to be more professional, more focused than I ever was,” he says.

The hefty investment, however, fetched modest returns in the first year. Iyer’s IPL batting average dropped to 16.54 in 2022, his top score being an unbeaten half-century against Mumbai. It was his only fifty of the season, compared to the four he had clobbered in the previous iteration of the league.

Even in India colours, he failed to make heads turn. In seven T20I innings, he scored 133. In two ODIs, he could only get 24.

The hullabaloo had suddenly died down and he was dropped from the national side. The Knights, however, have decided to go ahead with him in the upcoming edition once again and Iyer is thankful. He says, “KKR has faith in me. As a cricket franchise, they understand that you’re not going to have a good season every time. More than performances, they are looking at the attitude a player brings to the team. They look at the approach and see whether the guy is sincere and putting in the hard yards.”

A familiar face in the KKR dugout might help Iyer to quickly find his feet again. The two-time champion franchise has appointed Chandrakant Pandit, who led Madhya Pradesh to its maiden Ranji Trophy title in 2022, as head coach. “I have worked with Chandu sir (at MP) for about three years now. It’s been an amazing journey. And I’m really excited to work with him in KKR. We all know that he’s a taskmaster, a master tactician, so I’m waiting to see how he takes the stage in IPL,” Iyer tells Sportstar.

Venkatesh Iyer’s figures under the tutelage of Chandrakant Pandit at Madhya Pradesh First-Class: 1 match, 26 runs, HS: 19, Ave: 13 List-A: 11 matches, 652 runs, HS: 198, Ave: 58.88, 100s: 3, 50s: 1; 12 wickets, BBI 3/55, Eco. 5.62 T20s: 14 matches, 571 runs, HS: 88*, Ave: 63.44, 50s: 6; 13 wickets, BBI 6/20, Eco. 8.25

He added, “Coaching is not just about tactics, it’s about man management. Knowing your players, knowing your resources in and out. We do share a good chemistry and that’s going to help. Chandu sir has been so successful because of the way he man-manages at micro level (sic). The time he takes to understand people is very less. That is a skill. He knows how to get the best out of a certain player.”

While Pandit’s coming on board is good news, KKR has also been dealt a major blow. It would have to start the season in the absence of skipper Shreyas Iyer. His lower-back issue might not see the star batter return this season at all, although it is being widely reported that the 28-year-old has decided to delay his surgery and visit the National Cricket Academy (NCA) to undergo periodic treatment. In the meantime, Nitish Rana has been asked to step in.

Iyer wishes the senior Iyer well. “Let’s hope for the best. More than the IPL or anything else, we all want Shreyas to be 100 per cent fit. We all want him to play everything.”

Although Shreyas’ unavailability will botch the tactical equations to a considerable extent, the team looks forward to the season with a steely resolve. Iyer says, “We’re going to be ruthless this season as always. KKR is known for playing aggressive cricket. We have been given a clear template on how to go about our business. Chandu sir always emphasises on one thing when it comes to cricket and life - that he wants us to be very disciplined.”

Iyer himself had been struggling with injuries. Last September, he was hit on the neck by a throw from the bowler during a Duleep Trophy game. Although he made a quick recovery then, a freak accident in October saw him twist his ankle and miss four months of the domestic season. “I’ve been (unlucky). It was very unfortunate. But then again, these are parts of the game. I couldn’t control it. The only thing in my hand was to do my rehab and get back to playing. I’m really thankful to the staff in NCA, who took really good care of me and the latest update is that a few weeks ago, I was declared 100 per cent fit. I was cleared for all formats.”

Venkatesh Iyer is down in pain after being hit by a wild throw form bowler Chintan Gaja. | Photo Credit: PERIASAMY M/The Hindu

On whether he has been briefed about his role in the Knights’ club, Iyer says: “My role remains the same. I’ve spoken to the coaches on how to approach this season, especially since I’m coming back after a long injury gap. The communication has been very clear. I’ve always maintained I want to be flexible as a cricketer - be it batting, bowling or fielding. If I feel that I’m only going to open, then it might be training my mind to a comfortable position. So, I’m ready to bat anywhere in the lineup. Be it opening, middle order or finishing the innings. I’m also ready to provide four overs with the ball to my team. I have the confidence. So as and when required I will not shy away from bowling and maybe picking a few wickets for the team.”

Kolkata had been very active during the trade window.It acquired the services of Afghanistan opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz, and pacers Lockie Ferguson (New Zealand) and Shardul Thakur. During the auctions, it snapped up two proven wicketkeeper-batters in N. Jagadeesan and Litton Das (Bangladesh), while also shoring up the all-rounder department with the likes of David Wiese (Namibia) and Shakib Al Hasan (Bangladesh). Iyer was a happy man when he had a look at the team sheet. “Even before the auction, we already had a set team. We’ve made some very good purchases and overall, I’m really happy with the combination. It’s always a good headache to have multiple players for a single position. We’ve done a great job, the boys are raring to go, ready to prove a point.”

All of Iyer’s four appearances at the Eden Gardens have been in India colours. As the home-away format returns, Iyer will be looking to launch a few maximums into the stands to soak in the “ Korbo, Lorbo, Jeetbo“ cheer. He says, “It’s been my dream to play an IPL game at the Eden Gardens. To play for KKR in front of a packed crowd and hopefully, Shah Rukh (Khan) bhai cheering for us. These are all moments that I’ve seen only on TV. I wanted to live these moments.”

As the next season beckons, Iyer would be desperate to find his superpowers back again. And there can be no better stage than the IPL to witness that epic moment, for here is where the magic happens.

“I don’t play the IPL with the intention of playing in the Indian team. I just go out there and focus on the task in hand. That’s how I function. I don’t set long-term goals for myself. Right now, my priority is to represent KKR and do well. If I have to come back into the (Indian) team, it will happen if it’s meant to be. The only thing in my hand is to go out there and give my best for my team and leave the rest to God.”
Summary:
In 2021, Venkatesh Iyer suddenly found himself in the arclight with his exploits in the purple and gold of the Kolkata Knight Riders.
As a cricket franchise, they understand that you’re not going to have a good season every time.
We all know that he’s a taskmaster, a master tactician, so I’m waiting to see how he takes the stage in IPL,” Iyer tells Sportstar.
To play for KKR in front of a packed crowd and hopefully, Shah Rukh (Khan) bhai cheering for us.
I wanted to live these moments.”As the next season beckons, Iyer would be desperate to find his superpowers back again.

Meta_title: Brar appointed additional judge of Punjab and Haryana HC
Meta_desc: Brar appointed additional judge of Punjab and Haryana HC ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath...
Title: Brar: Brar Appointed Additional Judge Of Hc
Article: CHANDIGARH: The central government on Friday notified the appointment of senior advocate Harpreet Singh Brar as additional judge of the Punjab and Haryana high court. The Supreme Court collegium had recently recommended Brar’s name for appointment as judge.“In exercise of the power conferred by clause (1) of Article 224 of the Constitution, the President is pleased to appoint Harpreet Singh Brar, to be an additional judge of the Punjab and Haryana high court, for a period of two years ,” says the notification . Brar has also served as chairman of the state bar bar council of the Punjab and Haryana and president of the Punjab and Haryana high court bar. tnn
Summary:
CHANDIGARH: The central government on Friday notified the appointment of senior advocate Harpreet Singh Brar as additional judge of the Punjab and Haryana high court.
The Supreme Court collegium had recently recommended Brar’s name for appointment as judge.“In exercise of the power conferred by clause (1) of Article 224 of the Constitution, the President is pleased to appoint Harpreet Singh Brar, to be an additional judge of the Punjab and Haryana high court, for a period of two years ,” says the notification .
Brar has also served as chairman of the state bar bar council of the Punjab and Haryana and president of the Punjab and Haryana high court bar.

Meta_title: SI shoots self with service weapon after wife's suicide in Telangana's Jangaon
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: SI shoots self with service weapon after wife's suicide in Telangana's Jangaon
Article: JANGAON: The sub-inspector (SI) of Jangaon town shot himself on Thursday, after he found his wife had died by suicide.According to cops, SI K Srinivas' wife, Swaroopa (45), hanged herself in the bathroom on Thursday. When neighbours found the body, they immediately informed the husband, who rushed to the spot. Soon, the DCP of Jangaon (west zone), P Seetaram, and local police reached the SI's house to console him.The DCP enquired about the incident from the neighbours who told him that the couple had got into a heated argument the night before. "The neighbours said the couple had recently got their son married and since then, the two had been arguing frequently," a cop said.Incidentally, sensing that Srinivas was very emotionally charged and might resort to some extreme step, the DCP asked him about his service revolver as well. But Srinivas somehow dodged the query. "Under the pretext of using the washroom, he went inside his room and shot himself with the revolver. Though all the policemen present there rushed in upon hearing the sound, it was too late. The SI had died on the spot," the cop added.DCP Seetaram said a case has been registered under Section 174 (suspicious death) of the CrPc.
Summary:
JANGAON: The sub-inspector (SI) of Jangaon town shot himself on Thursday, after he found his wife had died by suicide.According to cops, SI K Srinivas' wife, Swaroopa (45), hanged herself in the bathroom on Thursday.
When neighbours found the body, they immediately informed the husband, who rushed to the spot.
"Under the pretext of using the washroom, he went inside his room and shot himself with the revolver.
Though all the policemen present there rushed in upon hearing the sound, it was too late.
The SI had died on the spot," the cop added.DCP Seetaram said a case has been registered under Section 174 (suspicious death) of the CrPc.

Meta_title: 2 arrested in Ambala with 4kg opium, 2 others with 1.5kg charas
Meta_desc: He said two residents of Barnala in Punjab, Baljinder Singh alias Lucky and Raghubir Singh alias Ramu, were arrested with 4kg opium and a car from an...
Title: Ambala: 2 Arrested In Ambala With 4kg Opium, 2 Others With 1.5kg Charas
Article: AMBALA: The crime investigation agency (CIA)-II and anti-narcotics cell (ANC) of district police arrested four persons in two separate cases with 4kg opium and 1.50 kg charas (hashish), said Ambala superintendent of police (SP) Jashandeep Singh Randhawa on Wednesday.He said two residents of Barnala in Punjab, Baljinder Singh alias Lucky and Raghubir Singh alias Ramu, were arrested with 4kg opium and a car from an overbridge near Shahpur railway crossing on the National Highway (NH)-44 on Tuesday.About the second case, the SP said two residents of Naraingarh in Ambala, Sanjeev Kumar and Vinod Kumar, were nabbed by police on Tuesday with 1.50kg charas. He said both were arrested on Raipur Rani-Naraingarh road at Dhanaura village A case was registered against both under the NDPS Act on Tuesday. He said the cops had received information that the accused sold charas in Naraingarh area after procuring the contraband from HP.
Summary:
AMBALA: The crime investigation agency (CIA)-II and anti-narcotics cell (ANC) of district police arrested four persons in two separate cases with 4kg opium and 1.50 kg charas (hashish), said Ambala superintendent of police (SP) Jashandeep Singh Randhawa on Wednesday.He said two residents of Barnala in Punjab, Baljinder Singh alias Lucky and Raghubir Singh alias Ramu, were arrested with 4kg opium and a car from an overbridge near Shahpur railway crossing on the National Highway (NH)-44 on Tuesday.About the second case, the SP said two residents of Naraingarh in Ambala, Sanjeev Kumar and Vinod Kumar, were nabbed by police on Tuesday with 1.50kg charas.
He said both were arrested on Raipur Rani-Naraingarh road at Dhanaura village A case was registered against both under the NDPS Act on Tuesday.
He said the cops had received information that the accused sold charas in Naraingarh area after procuring the contraband from HP.

Title: Major reshuffle in Police, 31 Officers transferred in J&K
Article:
Post by RK Online Desk on Friday, April 7, 2023

The Jammu and Kashmir Government on Friday ordered transfer and positing of 31 police officers with immediate effect.

As per the order issued by R.K Goyal, Additional Chief Secretary, Paramjeet Singh, Addl. SP Railways, Jammu, is transferred and posted as Addl. SP Kathua vice Shri Suresh Kumar.

Suresh Kumar, Addl. SP, Kathua, is transferred and posted as Vice Principal, PTS, Kathua, against an available vacancy.

Sandeep Bhat, Dy. Commandant, 1st Women Bn., is transferred and posted as Addl. SP Bandipora, against an available vacancy.

Imtiaz Ahmed, Dy.SP PC Sangam, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP (Ops.), Kunzer vice Aumer Iqbal. Imtiaz Ahmed shall also hold the additional charge of the post of SDPO Tangmarg, till further orders.

Aumer Iqbal, Dy.SP (Ops.), Kunzer, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP IR-10thBn., against an available vacancy.

Sunil Singh, SDPO Domana, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP IR-1st Bn., against an available vacancy.

Surinder Singh, SDPO RS Pora, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP I R - 5 Bn., against an available vacancy.

Javaid Ahmad, SDPO, Tangmarg, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP IR-11th Bn., against an available vacancy.

Mohd. Rafee Rather, Dy.SP Traffic Srinagar, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP (Hrs.) Kupwara vice Rashid Younis.

Priyanka Kumari, SDPO, Vijaypur, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP 15 Women Bn., against an available vacancy.

Shammi Kumar, Dy.SP Hrs Kathua, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP IR-24th B., against an available vacancy.

Rohit Kumar, Dy.SP PC Srinagar, is transferred and shall await orders of posting in Police Headquarters, J8K.

Manjit Singh, Dy.SP IR-14th B., is transferred and posted as Dy.SP (Hqrs.) Kathua, vice Shammi Kumar.

Chanchal Singh, Dy.SP Hqrs Rajouri, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP IR-16' Bn., against an available vacancy.

Meta_title: State govt is dedicated to uplifting women: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
Meta_desc: INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana' and said the...
Title: Chouhan: State Govt Is Dedicated To Uplifting Women: Chouhan
Article: INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana ' and said the state government is dedicated to uplift women.Chouhan carried out a 1.5km-long road show from the municipal corporation square to Indira Chowk that saw locals and party workers giving a floral welcome from the stages erected on the route. In a programme – ‘Ladli Behna Mahasammelan’ organized in Ratagarh village, the CM was presented a portrait of him made from ‘ Rakhi ’ before Chouhan took the mike and addressed the gathering as an orator while walking on a 150-square feet long ramp.Chouhan, who started his speech by singing a Bollywood movie’s song, ‘Phulo Ka Taro Ka Sabka Kehna Hain , Ek Hazaaron Mein Meri Behna Hain’, and expressed gratitude on receiving an incredible reception. He emphasized on improving the childbirth ratio while the state government’s schemes like ‘Ladli Laxmi Yojana’, ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’ and ‘Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana’ are helpful in it.The CM announced that at least 30% of posts in police department will be reserved and filled by women. As around one crore women of MP are expected to be benefitted under ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’, it will be an additional burden of Rs 12,000 crore in a year to give them financial assistance of Rs 1,000/month, Chouhan said, adding that he will manage to arrange said money to distribute among the beneficiaries.“The last date to apply under the scheme is April 30,” he said further asking the gathering of thousands of women to support him and BJP and asked them to stay alert from Congress and MPCC Chief Kamal Nath. “I am also giving you my words that I will live and die only for you,” he said.During Chouhan’s visit to Khandwa, local police arrested around 10 Congress workers including corporator for allegedly planning to stage a protest before the CM by showing him black flags over disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Lok Sabha . The enraged Congress workers claimed that they had sought time to meet the CM, but the police arrested them.
Summary:
INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana ' and said the state government is dedicated to uplift women.Chouhan carried out a 1.5km-long road show from the municipal corporation square to Indira Chowk that saw locals and party workers giving a floral welcome from the stages erected on the route.
In a programme – ‘Ladli Behna Mahasammelan’ organized in Ratagarh village, the CM was presented a portrait of him made from ‘ Rakhi ’ before Chouhan took the mike and addressed the gathering as an orator while walking on a 150-square feet long ramp.Chouhan, who started his speech by singing a Bollywood movie’s song, ‘Phulo Ka Taro Ka Sabka Kehna Hain , Ek Hazaaron Mein Meri Behna Hain’, and expressed gratitude on receiving an incredible reception.
He emphasized on improving the childbirth ratio while the state government’s schemes like ‘Ladli Laxmi Yojana’, ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’ and ‘Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana’ are helpful in it.The CM announced that at least 30% of posts in police department will be reserved and filled by women.
“I am also giving you my words that I will live and die only for you,” he said.During Chouhan’s visit to Khandwa, local police arrested around 10 Congress workers including corporator for allegedly planning to stage a protest before the CM by showing him black flags over disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Lok Sabha .
The enraged Congress workers claimed that they had sought time to meet the CM, but the police arrested them.

Meta_title: Himachal Pradesh CM invites Balika Ashram children to witness assembly session

Title: Himachal Pradesh CM invites Balika Ashram children to witness assembly session
Article: SHIMLA: Himachal Pradesh chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Tuesday invited 69 children of Balika Ashram Tutikandi, including 16 orphans, to watch the proceedings of the state assembly.The chief minister interacted with the destitute children during their visit to the assembly.Sukhu, who had lunch with them, asked them about their experience in the House.During conversations with the children, he highlighted the government’s initiatives for their welfare, including the Mukhya Mantri Sukh Aashray Scheme, and other initiatives for students.
