Meta_title: Punjab directs enhanced testing amid rising cases
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Punjab directs enhanced testing amid rising cases
Article: Chandigarh: In view of the rise in number of new Covid-19 cases, the Punjab health department on Wednesday issued directions for ramping up testing and enhancing preventive measures.Punjab has been witnessing a rise in cases from February last week and has recorded 771 fresh cases between March 1 to April 4 — 20 cases per day on average. Against the testing capacity of close to 45,000, only about 2,000 tests are being conducted on a daily basis.In a review meeting held with deputy commissioners and civil surgeons, the principal secretary health asked them to monitor testing of each district and ensure that sufficient tests are conducted on a daily basis. The officials were also advised to visit the field to monitor Covid preparedness and take corrective action where required.As the number of patients requiring hospitalisations may increase, the principal secretary health also ordered to ensure the smooth functioning of all the commissioned PSA plants in the state and to ascertain the supply of oxygen to each level-3 bed.The state has a capacity of 9,887 oxygen beds – 4,004 in government hospitals and 5,883 in private hospitals – of which 2.16% are currently occupied – 612 government and 1,180 private. It also has 1,432 ICU beds with ventilators – 481 government and 951 private.The current occupancy rate of ICU beds in the state without ventilators and with ventilators stands at 16.40% and 9.21%, respectively.
Summary:
Chandigarh: In view of the rise in number of new Covid-19 cases, the Punjab health department on Wednesday issued directions for ramping up testing and enhancing preventive measures.Punjab has been witnessing a rise in cases from February last week and has recorded 771 fresh cases between March 1 to April 4 — 20 cases per day on average.
Against the testing capacity of close to 45,000, only about 2,000 tests are being conducted on a daily basis.In a review meeting held with deputy commissioners and civil surgeons, the principal secretary health asked them to monitor testing of each district and ensure that sufficient tests are conducted on a daily basis.
The officials were also advised to visit the field to monitor Covid preparedness and take corrective action where required.As the number of patients requiring hospitalisations may increase, the principal secretary health also ordered to ensure the smooth functioning of all the commissioned PSA plants in the state and to ascertain the supply of oxygen to each level-3 bed.The state has a capacity of 9,887 oxygen beds – 4,004 in government hospitals and 5,883 in private hospitals – of which 2.16% are currently occupied – 612 government and 1,180 private.
It also has 1,432 ICU beds with ventilators – 481 government and 951 private.The current occupancy rate of ICU beds in the state without ventilators and with ventilators stands at 16.40% and 9.21%, respectively.

Meta_title: In-laws of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi’s son attacked
Meta_desc: MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh...
Title: Charanjit Singh: In-laws Of Ex-cm’s Son Attacked
Article: MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi at Amlala village in Derabassi.The accused allegedly vandalised paternal house of Channi’s daughter-in-law and injured her 80-year-old grandmother Dharam Kaur and four others. The case was registered on the complaint of Kaur. She alleged she had sent her grandson Taranveer Singh to the market to fetch some items. While he was returning home, the accused began hurling abuses at him. He narrated the incident to his father Nachattar Singh and other family members. While the family members were discussing about the wedding function of their granddaughter in the early hours of Tuesday, the accused assembled outside their house and again began hurling abuses.When a relative questioned them, the accused allegedly pelted stones, broke into the house and vandalised the property.Prabhjot Singh , one of the family members, said the accused were involved in illegal liquor trade and the family had been opposing their activity. The two arrested accused are Sahil and Gurjit Singh, said ASP Darpan Ahluwalia.A case under different Sections of the IPC was registered.
Summary:
MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi at Amlala village in Derabassi.The accused allegedly vandalised paternal house of Channi’s daughter-in-law and injured her 80-year-old grandmother Dharam Kaur and four others.
She alleged she had sent her grandson Taranveer Singh to the market to fetch some items.
While he was returning home, the accused began hurling abuses at him.
He narrated the incident to his father Nachattar Singh and other family members.
The two arrested accused are Sahil and Gurjit Singh, said ASP Darpan Ahluwalia.A case under different Sections of the IPC was registered.

Meta_title: Don't try to create panic ahead of Baisakhi: Akal Takht ...
Meta_desc: BATHINDA: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Friday accused the Punjab government of trying to create panic by increasing security in Talwandi Sabo...
Title: Don't try to create panic ahead of Baisakhi: Akal Takht jathedar to Punjab govt
Article:
03:02 Hunt on for Amritpal Singh: Akal Takht jathedar issues ultimatum to Punjab government

04:28 Amritpal Singh won’t be allowed to surrender at Akal Takht: SGPC Gen Sec Gurcharan Singh

(With PTI inputs)

BATHINDA: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Friday accused the Punjab government of trying to create panic by increasing security in Talwandi Sabo in Bathinda ahead of Baisakhi festival .The jathedar again asked radical preacher Amritpal Singh to surrender.He appealed to people to come for the Baisakhi event at Takht Sri Damdama Sahib here in large number. The jathedar asked media not to "twist" this statement to suggest that he is calling a 'sarbat khalsa' (congregation of the community) that Amritpal Singh wanted summoned.Fugitive Amritpal Singh, in his two video messages, had asked the jathedar to call a 'sarbat khalsa' on Baisakhi to discuss the issues concerning the community.However, the jathedar had earlier announced a three-day 'gurmat samagam' (religious programme) at Takht Damdama Sahib in Bathinda from April 12 to 15.Harpreet Singh called a special gathering at Takht Damdama Sahib on Friday to discuss the role of Sikh and Punjabi journalism, Sikh media contribution, and challenges the state is facing at present.The gathering comes at a time when concerns about the rise of secessionist forces in the border state are being expressed, especially in the wake of a major law and order breach in Ajnala Police Station attack led by Amritpal Singh, a radical preacher declared fugitive by police.The jathedar called for the formation of a body to track and bust "anti-Sikh phobia" or "Punjab-phobic" content in the media."Such an organisation will be formed to track and crack whatever fake news is being circulated," he said.Addressing the gathering, the jathedar of the Akal Takht, the highest temporal seat of Sikhs, said because of the tight security arrangements, only a fraction of the usual number of devotees have come here this time ahead of Baisakhi."Every year, we see a big gathering which starts from April 5 (for Baisakhi). But (at present), the number of 'sangat' is just 10 per cent. The reason is the panic created by the government," he said."I want to tell the Punjab government through this platform that this strictness has created a panic, and it should be ended," he asserted.Referring to certain media reports, the Jathedar said, "Earlier they said Amritpal Singh will surrender here. Now they will start saying that he will surrender on Baisakhi day, and an attempt will be made to create panic in his name. The government should avoid it."The jathedar said when such a situation is created, it does not affect only the image of Punjabis and Punjab, but also the government which is ruling Punjab."At least save your image," he said.The jathedar said leaves of police staff in Punjab have been cancelled and they have been asked to be present for duty."All of them have been sent to Damdama Sahib. What will happen here?" he said.According to sources, Punjab Police has cancelled the leaves of all its staff till April 14.The jathedar said 10 to 15 lakh Sikh devotees gather here on the occasion of Baisakhi. A flag march was taken out on Thursday while police personnel have been deployed in every nook and cranny, he said."An attempt was being made to project the situation as dangerous and it was very unfortunate," he said.Baisakhi, one of Punjab's biggest festivals in north India, marks the foundation day of the 'Khalsa Panth' (Sikh order) by the 10th Sikh Guru Gobind Singh. It also marks the onset of harvest season.On the day of the festival, people across Punjab offer prayers at gurdwaras.The jathedar said not even 75 commitments made to the Sikh community by successive governments at the Centre have been fulfilled in the last 75 years."Even then, we are quiet and even then, we are called secessionists and terrorists. How long will this continue? If you suppress our voice in Punjab, we will speak as Haryanvi from Haryana, as Marathas from Maharashtra, from USA and England," he said.We do not want any conflict with the central government, he said, adding only dialogue can resolve matters.Speaking to reporters, the jathedar again asked Amritpal Singh to surrender."I had earlier appealed to him. He should surrender," said the jathedar.He also directed the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, the apex religious body of the Sikhs, to file a complaint against the terming of flags of erstwhile Sikh rule as Khalistan flags by police.The jathedar lamented that the SGPC had earlier too been told to file a complaint, but it did not take any meaningful step in the matter.
Summary:
"Every year, we see a big gathering which starts from April 5 (for Baisakhi).
Now they will start saying that he will surrender on Baisakhi day, and an attempt will be made to create panic in his name.
"The jathedar said when such a situation is created, it does not affect only the image of Punjabis and Punjab, but also the government which is ruling Punjab.
"At least save your image," he said.The jathedar said leaves of police staff in Punjab have been cancelled and they have been asked to be present for duty.
he said.According to sources, Punjab Police has cancelled the leaves of all its staff till April 14.The jathedar said 10 to 15 lakh Sikh devotees gather here on the occasion of Baisakhi.

Meta_title: AAP not getting candidate for Jalandhar bypoll: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi...
Title: Warring: Aap Not Getting Candidate For Jalandhar Bypoll: Warring
Article: PATIALA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday said that the ruling AAP had failed to get a candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll whereas Congress was going to rev-up the party campaign in the next two days.Warring was in Patiala for the ‘Samvidhan Bachao Muhim’, a programme that was launched from Chandigarh with a Satyagrah on March 26. and followed by various party meetings and marches across the state. Before Patiala, the yatras were held in Amritsar and Jalandhar.However, key Congress campaigner and former PCC chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was nowhere to be seen at the event or press conference. Even at the time of Sidhu’s release on Saturday, the Patiala DCC office-bearers did not turn up to welcome him nor did Warring. Skirting queries regarding Sidhu’s absence, Warring wanted to know why the absence of other leaders was not questioned.The PCC president slammed the Centre government for trying to stifle the freedom of the fourth pillar of democracy. “By thwarting the opposition parties from raising national issues in Parliament, which is the highest forum of discussion and debate on public issues and national policy, it is disrespecting the temple of democracy to fulfil its vicious motives,” he said.Warring also accused the central government of “hoodwinking the citizens of the country” by failing to take action against Adani and “silencing the voice” of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.
Summary:
PATIALA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday said that the ruling AAP had failed to get a candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll whereas Congress was going to rev-up the party campaign in the next two days.Warring was in Patiala for the ‘Samvidhan Bachao Muhim’, a programme that was launched from Chandigarh with a Satyagrah on March 26. and followed by various party meetings and marches across the state.
Before Patiala, the yatras were held in Amritsar and Jalandhar.However, key Congress campaigner and former PCC chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was nowhere to be seen at the event or press conference.
Even at the time of Sidhu’s release on Saturday, the Patiala DCC office-bearers did not turn up to welcome him nor did Warring.
Skirting queries regarding Sidhu’s absence, Warring wanted to know why the absence of other leaders was not questioned.The PCC president slammed the Centre government for trying to stifle the freedom of the fourth pillar of democracy.
“By thwarting the opposition parties from raising national issues in Parliament, which is the highest forum of discussion and debate on public issues and national policy, it is disrespecting the temple of democracy to fulfil its vicious motives,” he said.Warring also accused the central government of “hoodwinking the citizens of the country” by failing to take action against Adani and “silencing the voice” of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

Meta_title: Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations
Meta_desc: While Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh might not be involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation, the tournaments, incidentally, are set to be held on...
Title: Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations
Article:
The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) announced on Thursday that it would conduct National Championships in the U-17 category as well as the senior Open National Ranking Wrestling Tournament from April 16 to April 18. The tournaments will be conducted at Nandini Nagar, in Gonda, Uttar Pradesh.

These will be the first tournaments conducted by the WFI since January 21, when the Indian government suspended all activities of the federation. The suspended assistant secretary Vinod Tomar cancelled all ongoing tournaments and appointed an Oversight Committee to look into the day-to-day activities of the federation, following public protests by India’s top wrestlers who made allegations of sexual harassment and financial impropriety against the WFI president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.

According to WFI general secretary VN Prasood, the WFI had resumed their day-to-day functioning earlier this week after the Oversight Committee submitted a fact-finding report into the allegations made against the WFI president.

The Oversight Committee, which was supposed to conduct the day-to-day activity of the federation was originally to have a term of four weeks to submit its fact-finding report. On 23 rd February, this term was extended to another two weeks.

It is learned that the Oversight Committee had sought the help of the WFI in matters including obtaining visas for international tournaments as well as conducting a selection trial to pick a team for the Asian Championships.

“After the Oversight Committee submitted their report to the government, they also submitted bills for legal costs that they incurred in their activities to the WFI. That meant that their role in running day-to-day activities of the federation is over,” Prasood said. The WFI is also sitting at TOPs (Target Olympic Podium) meetings. Now the Federation says it is looking to conduct tournaments as per its calendar. “When the Federation was suspended, we had to stop the National ranking series after the first day of competition. Now we are completing that tournament as well as conducting the U-17 nationals,” Prasood said.

Prasood added that with the players’ allegations primarily being made against the WFI president, there was no restriction on the WFI itself resuming its activities. “The WFI president is still not involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation,” he said.

While Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh might not be involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation, the tournaments, incidentally, are set to be held on the grounds of Nandini Nagar Mahavidyalaya, which he chairs. The college is located in Gonda which lies in the Kaiserganj Lok Sabha constituency from where Brij Bhushan has been elected multiple times as a Member of Parliament.
Summary:
These will be the first tournaments conducted by the WFI since January 21, when the Indian government suspended all activities of the federation.
The Oversight Committee, which was supposed to conduct the day-to-day activity of the federation was originally to have a term of four weeks to submit its fact-finding report.
That meant that their role in running day-to-day activities of the federation is over,” Prasood said.
“When the Federation was suspended, we had to stop the National ranking series after the first day of competition.
“The WFI president is still not involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation,” he said.

Meta_title: SI shoots self with service weapon after wife's suicide in Telangana's Jangaon
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: SI shoots self with service weapon after wife's suicide in Telangana's Jangaon
Article: JANGAON: The sub-inspector (SI) of Jangaon town shot himself on Thursday, after he found his wife had died by suicide.According to cops, SI K Srinivas' wife, Swaroopa (45), hanged herself in the bathroom on Thursday. When neighbours found the body, they immediately informed the husband, who rushed to the spot. Soon, the DCP of Jangaon (west zone), P Seetaram, and local police reached the SI's house to console him.The DCP enquired about the incident from the neighbours who told him that the couple had got into a heated argument the night before. "The neighbours said the couple had recently got their son married and since then, the two had been arguing frequently," a cop said.Incidentally, sensing that Srinivas was very emotionally charged and might resort to some extreme step, the DCP asked him about his service revolver as well. But Srinivas somehow dodged the query. "Under the pretext of using the washroom, he went inside his room and shot himself with the revolver. Though all the policemen present there rushed in upon hearing the sound, it was too late. The SI had died on the spot," the cop added.DCP Seetaram said a case has been registered under Section 174 (suspicious death) of the CrPc.
Summary:
JANGAON: The sub-inspector (SI) of Jangaon town shot himself on Thursday, after he found his wife had died by suicide.According to cops, SI K Srinivas' wife, Swaroopa (45), hanged herself in the bathroom on Thursday.
When neighbours found the body, they immediately informed the husband, who rushed to the spot.
"Under the pretext of using the washroom, he went inside his room and shot himself with the revolver.
Though all the policemen present there rushed in upon hearing the sound, it was too late.
The SI had died on the spot," the cop added.DCP Seetaram said a case has been registered under Section 174 (suspicious death) of the CrPc.

Meta_title: 2 arrested in Ambala with 4kg opium, 2 others with 1.5kg charas

Title: Ambala: 2 Arrested In Ambala With 4kg Opium, 2 Others With 1.5kg Charas
Article: AMBALA: The crime investigation agency (CIA)-II and anti-narcotics cell (ANC) of district police arrested four persons in two separate cases with 4kg opium and 1.50 kg charas (hashish), said Ambala superintendent of police (SP) Jashandeep Singh Randhawa on Wednesday.He said two residents of Barnala in Punjab, Baljinder Singh alias Lucky and Raghubir Singh alias Ramu, were arrested with 4kg opium and a car from an overbridge near Shahpur railway crossing on the National Highway (NH)-44 on Tuesday.About the second case, the SP said two residents of Naraingarh in Ambala, Sanjeev Kumar and Vinod Kumar, were nabbed by police on Tuesday with 1.50kg charas. He said both were arrested on Raipur Rani-Naraingarh road at Dhanaura village A case was registered against both under the NDPS Act on Tuesday. He said the cops had received information that the accused sold charas in Naraingarh area after procuring the contraband from HP.
Summary:
AMBALA: The crime investigation agency (CIA)-II and anti-narcotics cell (ANC) of district police arrested four persons in two separate cases with 4kg opium and 1.50 kg charas (hashish), said Ambala superintendent of police (SP) Jashandeep Singh Randhawa on Wednesday.He said two residents of Barnala in Punjab, Baljinder Singh alias Lucky and Raghubir Singh alias Ramu, were arrested with 4kg opium and a car from an overbridge near Shahpur railway crossing on the National Highway (NH)-44 on Tuesday.About the second case, the SP said two residents of Naraingarh in Ambala, Sanjeev Kumar and Vinod Kumar, were nabbed by police on Tuesday with 1.50kg charas.
He said both were arrested on Raipur Rani-Naraingarh road at Dhanaura village A case was registered against both under the NDPS Act on Tuesday.
He said the cops had received information that the accused sold charas in Naraingarh area after procuring the contraband from HP.

Title: Major reshuffle in Police, 31 Officers transferred in J&K
Article:
Post by RK Online Desk on Friday, April 7, 2023

The Jammu and Kashmir Government on Friday ordered transfer and positing of 31 police officers with immediate effect.

As per the order issued by R.K Goyal, Additional Chief Secretary, Paramjeet Singh, Addl. SP Railways, Jammu, is transferred and posted as Addl. SP Kathua vice Shri Suresh Kumar.

Suresh Kumar, Addl. SP, Kathua, is transferred and posted as Vice Principal, PTS, Kathua, against an available vacancy.

Sandeep Bhat, Dy. Commandant, 1st Women Bn., is transferred and posted as Addl. SP Bandipora, against an available vacancy.

Imtiaz Ahmed, Dy.SP PC Sangam, is transferred and posted as Dy.SP (Ops.), Kunzer vice Aumer Iqbal. Imtiaz Ahmed shall also hold the additional charge of the post of SDPO Tangmarg, till further orders.

Meta_title: State govt is dedicated to uplifting women: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
Meta_desc: INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana' and said the...
Title: Chouhan: State Govt Is Dedicated To Uplifting Women: Chouhan
Article: INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana ' and said the state government is dedicated to uplift women.Chouhan carried out a 1.5km-long road show from the municipal corporation square to Indira Chowk that saw locals and party workers giving a floral welcome from the stages erected on the route. In a programme – ‘Ladli Behna Mahasammelan’ organized in Ratagarh village, the CM was presented a portrait of him made from ‘ Rakhi ’ before Chouhan took the mike and addressed the gathering as an orator while walking on a 150-square feet long ramp.Chouhan, who started his speech by singing a Bollywood movie’s song, ‘Phulo Ka Taro Ka Sabka Kehna Hain , Ek Hazaaron Mein Meri Behna Hain’, and expressed gratitude on receiving an incredible reception. He emphasized on improving the childbirth ratio while the state government’s schemes like ‘Ladli Laxmi Yojana’, ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’ and ‘Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana’ are helpful in it.The CM announced that at least 30% of posts in police department will be reserved and filled by women. As around one crore women of MP are expected to be benefitted under ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’, it will be an additional burden of Rs 12,000 crore in a year to give them financial assistance of Rs 1,000/month, Chouhan said, adding that he will manage to arrange said money to distribute among the beneficiaries.“The last date to apply under the scheme is April 30,” he said further asking the gathering of thousands of women to support him and BJP and asked them to stay alert from Congress and MPCC Chief Kamal Nath. “I am also giving you my words that I will live and die only for you,” he said.During Chouhan’s visit to Khandwa, local police arrested around 10 Congress workers including corporator for allegedly planning to stage a protest before the CM by showing him black flags over disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Lok Sabha . The enraged Congress workers claimed that they had sought time to meet the CM, but the police arrested them.
Summary:
INDORE: Chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday addressed a gathering of thousands of women in Khandwa to promote 'Ladli Behna Yojana ' and said the state government is dedicated to uplift women.Chouhan carried out a 1.5km-long road show from the municipal corporation square to Indira Chowk that saw locals and party workers giving a floral welcome from the stages erected on the route.
In a programme – ‘Ladli Behna Mahasammelan’ organized in Ratagarh village, the CM was presented a portrait of him made from ‘ Rakhi ’ before Chouhan took the mike and addressed the gathering as an orator while walking on a 150-square feet long ramp.Chouhan, who started his speech by singing a Bollywood movie’s song, ‘Phulo Ka Taro Ka Sabka Kehna Hain , Ek Hazaaron Mein Meri Behna Hain’, and expressed gratitude on receiving an incredible reception.
He emphasized on improving the childbirth ratio while the state government’s schemes like ‘Ladli Laxmi Yojana’, ‘Ladli Behna Yojana’ and ‘Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana’ are helpful in it.The CM announced that at least 30% of posts in police department will be reserved and filled by women.
“I am also giving you my words that I will live and die only for you,” he said.During Chouhan’s visit to Khandwa, local police arrested around 10 Congress workers including corporator for allegedly planning to stage a protest before the CM by showing him black flags over disqualification of Rahul Gandhi from Lok Sabha .
The enraged Congress workers claimed that they had sought time to meet the CM, but the police arrested them.

Meta_title: Himachal Pradesh CM invites Balika Ashram children to witness assembly session

Title: Himachal Pradesh CM invites Balika Ashram children to witness assembly session
Article: SHIMLA: Himachal Pradesh chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Tuesday invited 69 children of Balika Ashram Tutikandi, including 16 orphans, to watch the proceedings of the state assembly.The chief minister interacted with the destitute children during their visit to the assembly.Sukhu, who had lunch with them, asked them about their experience in the House.During conversations with the children, he highlighted the government’s initiatives for their welfare, including the Mukhya Mantri Sukh Aashray Scheme, and other initiatives for students.

Meta_title: Punjab directs enhanced testing amid rising cases
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Punjab directs enhanced testing amid rising cases
Article: Chandigarh: In view of the rise in number of new Covid-19 cases, the Punjab health department on Wednesday issued directions for ramping up testing and enhancing preventive measures.Punjab has been witnessing a rise in cases from February last week and has recorded 771 fresh cases between March 1 to April 4 — 20 cases per day on average. Against the testing capacity of close to 45,000, only about 2,000 tests are being conducted on a daily basis.In a review meeting held with deputy commissioners and civil surgeons, the principal secretary health asked them to monitor testing of each district and ensure that sufficient tests are conducted on a daily basis. The officials were also advised to visit the field to monitor Covid preparedness and take corrective action where required.As the number of patients requiring hospitalisations may increase, the principal secretary health also ordered to ensure the smooth functioning of all the commissioned PSA plants in the state and to ascertain the supply of oxygen to each level-3 bed.The state has a capacity of 9,887 oxygen beds – 4,004 in government hospitals and 5,883 in private hospitals – of which 2.16% are currently occupied – 612 government and 1,180 private. It also has 1,432 ICU beds with ventilators – 481 government and 951 private.The current occupancy rate of ICU beds in the state without ventilators and with ventilators stands at 16.40% and 9.21%, respectively.
Summary:
Chandigarh: In view of the rise in number of new Covid-19 cases, the Punjab health department on Wednesday issued directions for ramping up testing and enhancing preventive measures.Punjab has been witnessing a rise in cases from February last week and has recorded 771 fresh cases between March 1 to April 4 — 20 cases per day on average.
Against the testing capacity of close to 45,000, only about 2,000 tests are being conducted on a daily basis.In a review meeting held with deputy commissioners and civil surgeons, the principal secretary health asked them to monitor testing of each district and ensure that sufficient tests are conducted on a daily basis.
The officials were also advised to visit the field to monitor Covid preparedness and take corrective action where required.As the number of patients requiring hospitalisations may increase, the principal secretary health also ordered to ensure the smooth functioning of all the commissioned PSA plants in the state and to ascertain the supply of oxygen to each level-3 bed.The state has a capacity of 9,887 oxygen beds – 4,004 in government hospitals and 5,883 in private hospitals – of which 2.16% are currently occupied – 612 government and 1,180 private.
It also has 1,432 ICU beds with ventilators – 481 government and 951 private.The current occupancy rate of ICU beds in the state without ventilators and with ventilators stands at 16.40% and 9.21%, respectively.

Meta_title: In-laws of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi’s son attacked
Meta_desc: MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh...
Title: Charanjit Singh: In-laws Of Ex-cm’s Son Attacked
Article: MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi at Amlala village in Derabassi.The accused allegedly vandalised paternal house of Channi’s daughter-in-law and injured her 80-year-old grandmother Dharam Kaur and four others. The case was registered on the complaint of Kaur. She alleged she had sent her grandson Taranveer Singh to the market to fetch some items. While he was returning home, the accused began hurling abuses at him. He narrated the incident to his father Nachattar Singh and other family members. While the family members were discussing about the wedding function of their granddaughter in the early hours of Tuesday, the accused assembled outside their house and again began hurling abuses.When a relative questioned them, the accused allegedly pelted stones, broke into the house and vandalised the property.Prabhjot Singh , one of the family members, said the accused were involved in illegal liquor trade and the family had been opposing their activity. The two arrested accused are Sahil and Gurjit Singh, said ASP Darpan Ahluwalia.A case under different Sections of the IPC was registered.
Summary:
MOHALI: Police have arrested two people and booked 15 others for allegedly assaulting in-laws of the son of former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi at Amlala village in Derabassi.The accused allegedly vandalised paternal house of Channi’s daughter-in-law and injured her 80-year-old grandmother Dharam Kaur and four others.
She alleged she had sent her grandson Taranveer Singh to the market to fetch some items.
While he was returning home, the accused began hurling abuses at him.
He narrated the incident to his father Nachattar Singh and other family members.
The two arrested accused are Sahil and Gurjit Singh, said ASP Darpan Ahluwalia.A case under different Sections of the IPC was registered.

Meta_title: Don't try to create panic ahead of Baisakhi: Akal Takht ...
Meta_desc: BATHINDA: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Friday accused the Punjab government of trying to create panic by increasing security in Talwandi Sabo...
Title: Don't try to create panic ahead of Baisakhi: Akal Takht jathedar to Punjab govt
Article:
03:02 Hunt on for Amritpal Singh: Akal Takht jathedar issues ultimatum to Punjab government

04:28 Amritpal Singh won’t be allowed to surrender at Akal Takht: SGPC Gen Sec Gurcharan Singh

(With PTI inputs)

BATHINDA: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Friday accused the Punjab government of trying to create panic by increasing security in Talwandi Sabo in Bathinda ahead of Baisakhi festival .The jathedar again asked radical preacher Amritpal Singh to surrender.He appealed to people to come for the Baisakhi event at Takht Sri Damdama Sahib here in large number. The jathedar asked media not to "twist" this statement to suggest that he is calling a 'sarbat khalsa' (congregation of the community) that Amritpal Singh wanted summoned.Fugitive Amritpal Singh, in his two video messages, had asked the jathedar to call a 'sarbat khalsa' on Baisakhi to discuss the issues concerning the community.However, the jathedar had earlier announced a three-day 'gurmat samagam' (religious programme) at Takht Damdama Sahib in Bathinda from April 12 to 15.Harpreet Singh called a special gathering at Takht Damdama Sahib on Friday to discuss the role of Sikh and Punjabi journalism, Sikh media contribution, and challenges the state is facing at present.The gathering comes at a time when concerns about the rise of secessionist forces in the border state are being expressed, especially in the wake of a major law and order breach in Ajnala Police Station attack led by Amritpal Singh, a radical preacher declared fugitive by police.The jathedar called for the formation of a body to track and bust "anti-Sikh phobia" or "Punjab-phobic" content in the media."Such an organisation will be formed to track and crack whatever fake news is being circulated," he said.Addressing the gathering, the jathedar of the Akal Takht, the highest temporal seat of Sikhs, said because of the tight security arrangements, only a fraction of the usual number of devotees have come here this time ahead of Baisakhi."Every year, we see a big gathering which starts from April 5 (for Baisakhi). But (at present), the number of 'sangat' is just 10 per cent. The reason is the panic created by the government," he said."I want to tell the Punjab government through this platform that this strictness has created a panic, and it should be ended," he asserted.Referring to certain media reports, the Jathedar said, "Earlier they said Amritpal Singh will surrender here. Now they will start saying that he will surrender on Baisakhi day, and an attempt will be made to create panic in his name. The government should avoid it."The jathedar said when such a situation is created, it does not affect only the image of Punjabis and Punjab, but also the government which is ruling Punjab."At least save your image," he said.The jathedar said leaves of police staff in Punjab have been cancelled and they have been asked to be present for duty."All of them have been sent to Damdama Sahib. What will happen here?" he said.According to sources, Punjab Police has cancelled the leaves of all its staff till April 14.The jathedar said 10 to 15 lakh Sikh devotees gather here on the occasion of Baisakhi. A flag march was taken out on Thursday while police personnel have been deployed in every nook and cranny, he said."An attempt was being made to project the situation as dangerous and it was very unfortunate," he said.Baisakhi, one of Punjab's biggest festivals in north India, marks the foundation day of the 'Khalsa Panth' (Sikh order) by the 10th Sikh Guru Gobind Singh. It also marks the onset of harvest season.On the day of the festival, people across Punjab offer prayers at gurdwaras.The jathedar said not even 75 commitments made to the Sikh community by successive governments at the Centre have been fulfilled in the last 75 years."Even then, we are quiet and even then, we are called secessionists and terrorists. How long will this continue? If you suppress our voice in Punjab, we will speak as Haryanvi from Haryana, as Marathas from Maharashtra, from USA and England," he said.We do not want any conflict with the central government, he said, adding only dialogue can resolve matters.Speaking to reporters, the jathedar again asked Amritpal Singh to surrender."I had earlier appealed to him. He should surrender," said the jathedar.He also directed the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, the apex religious body of the Sikhs, to file a complaint against the terming of flags of erstwhile Sikh rule as Khalistan flags by police.The jathedar lamented that the SGPC had earlier too been told to file a complaint, but it did not take any meaningful step in the matter.
Summary:
"Every year, we see a big gathering which starts from April 5 (for Baisakhi).
Now they will start saying that he will surrender on Baisakhi day, and an attempt will be made to create panic in his name.
"The jathedar said when such a situation is created, it does not affect only the image of Punjabis and Punjab, but also the government which is ruling Punjab.
"At least save your image," he said.The jathedar said leaves of police staff in Punjab have been cancelled and they have been asked to be present for duty.
he said.According to sources, Punjab Police has cancelled the leaves of all its staff till April 14.The jathedar said 10 to 15 lakh Sikh devotees gather here on the occasion of Baisakhi.

Meta_title: AAP not getting candidate for Jalandhar bypoll: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi...
Title: Warring: Aap Not Getting Candidate For Jalandhar Bypoll: Warring
Article: PATIALA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday said that the ruling AAP had failed to get a candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll whereas Congress was going to rev-up the party campaign in the next two days.Warring was in Patiala for the ‘Samvidhan Bachao Muhim’, a programme that was launched from Chandigarh with a Satyagrah on March 26. and followed by various party meetings and marches across the state. Before Patiala, the yatras were held in Amritsar and Jalandhar.However, key Congress campaigner and former PCC chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was nowhere to be seen at the event or press conference. Even at the time of Sidhu’s release on Saturday, the Patiala DCC office-bearers did not turn up to welcome him nor did Warring. Skirting queries regarding Sidhu’s absence, Warring wanted to know why the absence of other leaders was not questioned.The PCC president slammed the Centre government for trying to stifle the freedom of the fourth pillar of democracy. “By thwarting the opposition parties from raising national issues in Parliament, which is the highest forum of discussion and debate on public issues and national policy, it is disrespecting the temple of democracy to fulfil its vicious motives,” he said.Warring also accused the central government of “hoodwinking the citizens of the country” by failing to take action against Adani and “silencing the voice” of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.
Summary:
PATIALA: Punjab Congress president Amrinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday said that the ruling AAP had failed to get a candidate for the Jalandhar bypoll whereas Congress was going to rev-up the party campaign in the next two days.Warring was in Patiala for the ‘Samvidhan Bachao Muhim’, a programme that was launched from Chandigarh with a Satyagrah on March 26. and followed by various party meetings and marches across the state.
Before Patiala, the yatras were held in Amritsar and Jalandhar.However, key Congress campaigner and former PCC chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was nowhere to be seen at the event or press conference.
Even at the time of Sidhu’s release on Saturday, the Patiala DCC office-bearers did not turn up to welcome him nor did Warring.
Skirting queries regarding Sidhu’s absence, Warring wanted to know why the absence of other leaders was not questioned.The PCC president slammed the Centre government for trying to stifle the freedom of the fourth pillar of democracy.
“By thwarting the opposition parties from raising national issues in Parliament, which is the highest forum of discussion and debate on public issues and national policy, it is disrespecting the temple of democracy to fulfil its vicious motives,” he said.Warring also accused the central government of “hoodwinking the citizens of the country” by failing to take action against Adani and “silencing the voice” of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

Meta_title: Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations
Meta_desc: While Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh might not be involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation, the tournaments, incidentally, are set to be held on...
Title: Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations
Article:
The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) announced on Thursday that it would conduct National Championships in the U-17 category as well as the senior Open National Ranking Wrestling Tournament from April 16 to April 18. The tournaments will be conducted at Nandini Nagar, in Gonda, Uttar Pradesh.

These will be the first tournaments conducted by the WFI since January 21, when the Indian government suspended all activities of the federation. The suspended assistant secretary Vinod Tomar cancelled all ongoing tournaments and appointed an Oversight Committee to look into the day-to-day activities of the federation, following public protests by India’s top wrestlers who made allegations of sexual harassment and financial impropriety against the WFI president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.

According to WFI general secretary VN Prasood, the WFI had resumed their day-to-day functioning earlier this week after the Oversight Committee submitted a fact-finding report into the allegations made against the WFI president.

The Oversight Committee, which was supposed to conduct the day-to-day activity of the federation was originally to have a term of four weeks to submit its fact-finding report. On 23 rd February, this term was extended to another two weeks.

It is learned that the Oversight Committee had sought the help of the WFI in matters including obtaining visas for international tournaments as well as conducting a selection trial to pick a team for the Asian Championships.

“After the Oversight Committee submitted their report to the government, they also submitted bills for legal costs that they incurred in their activities to the WFI. That meant that their role in running day-to-day activities of the federation is over,” Prasood said. The WFI is also sitting at TOPs (Target Olympic Podium) meetings. Now the Federation says it is looking to conduct tournaments as per its calendar. “When the Federation was suspended, we had to stop the National ranking series after the first day of competition. Now we are completing that tournament as well as conducting the U-17 nationals,” Prasood said.

Prasood added that with the players’ allegations primarily being made against the WFI president, there was no restriction on the WFI itself resuming its activities. “The WFI president is still not involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation,” he said.

While Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh might not be involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation, the tournaments, incidentally, are set to be held on the grounds of Nandini Nagar Mahavidyalaya, which he chairs. The college is located in Gonda which lies in the Kaiserganj Lok Sabha constituency from where Brij Bhushan has been elected multiple times as a Member of Parliament.
Summary:
These will be the first tournaments conducted by the WFI since January 21, when the Indian government suspended all activities of the federation.
The Oversight Committee, which was supposed to conduct the day-to-day activity of the federation was originally to have a term of four weeks to submit its fact-finding report.
That meant that their role in running day-to-day activities of the federation is over,” Prasood said.
“When the Federation was suspended, we had to stop the National ranking series after the first day of competition.
“The WFI president is still not involved in the day-to-day activities of the federation,” he said.

Meta_title: Noida: Sector 99 set for power infra revamp, to get 3 transformers
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police · Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Sec 99 Set For Power Infra Revamp, To Get 3 Transformers
Article: NOIDA: Sector 99, which has been facing frequent outages for lack of adequate power infrastructure, is set to get a revamp. With the PVVNL sanctioning Rs 1.2 crore budget, the sector will soon get three new transformers of 400kVA capacity each.“Work on installing the three new transformers, along with some cables, panels and feeder boxes is expected to start by next week. It will take a little over a month to complete the work,” PVVNL executive engineer and area in-charge Rachit Khanna said.Rishipal Singh Awana , RWA president, said the demands were finally being met after a decade-long fight. “We have a single-panel box for electrical connection in the sector which has 190 plots ranging from 112sqm to 450sqm. Residents have been facing problems in obtaining electric connections in absence of adequate infrastructure,’ he said.Awana, who has been pursuing the matter with both the Noida Authority’s power department as well as the discom attributed the delay to the two authorities passing the buck over the issue.
Summary:
NOIDA: Sector 99, which has been facing frequent outages for lack of adequate power infrastructure, is set to get a revamp.
With the PVVNL sanctioning Rs 1.2 crore budget, the sector will soon get three new transformers of 400kVA capacity each.“Work on installing the three new transformers, along with some cables, panels and feeder boxes is expected to start by next week.
It will take a little over a month to complete the work,” PVVNL executive engineer and area in-charge Rachit Khanna said.Rishipal Singh Awana , RWA president, said the demands were finally being met after a decade-long fight.
“We have a single-panel box for electrical connection in the sector which has 190 plots ranging from 112sqm to 450sqm.
Residents have been facing problems in obtaining electric connections in absence of adequate infrastructure,’ he said.Awana, who has been pursuing the matter with both the Noida Authority’s power department as well as the discom attributed the delay to the two authorities passing the buck over the issue.

Meta_title: Man befriends wife of patient at hosp, rapes her at hotel
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Man befriends wife of patient at hosp, rapes her at hotel
Article: Ludhiana: Police have booked a man for raping a married woman after befriending her at a hospital in Ludhiana. The accused belonged to a village in Ludhiana district.In her complaint to the police, the woman claimed that from July 10 to 26 last year, her husband was admitted at DMC Hospital for treatment. Another patient was admitted in the same ward whose relative stayed at the hospital to take care of him. She said there she became friends with the accused and started talking to him over the phone.The complainant said on August 8 last year, the man called her to a place and asked her to take him to her house as he wanted to meet her husband. She said when she went to pick him up, the accused told her that he had some work at a hotel and they will go there first.The woman claimed that at the hotel, he gave her a cold drink which contained sedatives. As she started feeling dizzy, the accused forcibly took her to a room and had sexual relations with her. He repeated the act while threatening to expose her sexual relationship.The woman said she lodged a complaint with the police as lately, the accused had been threatening to kill her.Police have booked the accused under Sections 376 (rape) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC . Inspector Kulwinder Singh said the accused is yet to be arrested.
Summary:
Ludhiana: Police have booked a man for raping a married woman after befriending her at a hospital in Ludhiana.
The accused belonged to a village in Ludhiana district.In her complaint to the police, the woman claimed that from July 10 to 26 last year, her husband was admitted at DMC Hospital for treatment.
Another patient was admitted in the same ward whose relative stayed at the hospital to take care of him.
As she started feeling dizzy, the accused forcibly took her to a room and had sexual relations with her.
Inspector Kulwinder Singh said the accused is yet to be arrested.

Meta_title: Paper leak: Impossible to tell who's guilty, govt tells Uttarakhand HC
Meta_desc: Paper leak: Impossible to tell who's guilty, govt tells Uttarakhand HC ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi...
Title: Paper leak: Impossible to tell who's guilty, govt tells Uttarakhand HC
Article: DEHRADUN: During the hearing of a petition in Uttarakhand high court against the cancellation of recruitment to group C posts after the paper leak case surfaced, the state government stated that "it is impossible to segregate the guilty and the innocent candidates as the question paper was heavily circulated and leaked through WhatsApp." The Uttarakhand Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UKSSSC) secretary, Surendra Singh, on Monday filed the affidavit in the HC on behalf of the state government in the recruitment examination paper leak case.The HC was hearing the petition of a candidate, Jagat Singh, and others who had approached the court after the government cancelled the recruitment to 919 posts along with the result after the paper leak incident surfaced. The commission said the company that was given the contract to conduct the exam has been debarred so that "such irregularities do not happen in future". Its officials were also arrested and sent to jail.Notably, UKSSSC had conducted the exam for recruitment to group C posts in December 2021, and the result for "916 successful candidates" was declared on April 7, 2022. More than 1.5 lakh applicants had appeared in the exam. An FIR was registered on July 22, 2022.The matter is now being probed by the STF and the cyber cell. In its preliminary findings, the STF said that "114 candidates were directly involved in the question paper leak case and there is a possibility that other candidates might also be involved."
Summary:
DEHRADUN: During the hearing of a petition in Uttarakhand high court against the cancellation of recruitment to group C posts after the paper leak case surfaced, the state government stated that "it is impossible to segregate the guilty and the innocent candidates as the question paper was heavily circulated and leaked through WhatsApp."
The commission said the company that was given the contract to conduct the exam has been debarred so that "such irregularities do not happen in future".
More than 1.5 lakh applicants had appeared in the exam.
An FIR was registered on July 22, 2022.The matter is now being probed by the STF and the cyber cell.
In its preliminary findings, the STF said that "114 candidates were directly involved in the question paper leak case and there is a possibility that other candidates might also be involved."

Meta_title: Panel set up to probe jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi’s interviews
Meta_desc: Special DGP of anti-drug special task force Kuldeep Singh would head the committee, while ADGP prisons K Chandra Sekhar would be the other member.
Title: Lawrence Bishnoi: Panel Set Up To Probe Jailed Gangster’s Interviews
Article: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab government has constituted a two-member committee to inquire into the reasons behind gangster Lawrence Bishnoi , presently lodged in high security Bathinda central jail, giving two interviews to a private channel last month.Special DGP of anti-drug special task force Kuldeep Singh would head the committee, while ADGP prisons K Chandra Sekhar would be the other member. The committee has been directed to submit its report by April 12.“Two interviews of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi went viral on TV channels/social media. In the given circumstances, there was a need to hold a detailed inquiry into the matter. Therefore, an inquiry committee was set up. Previous committee has been revived as follows,” reads the order issued by chief secretary Vijay Kumar Janjua on March 29, which the government had kept under wraps.A private news channel had aired Bishnoi’s first interview on March 14 and the second on March 17 while he was inside central jail Bathinda. The Punjab government had claimed that the interviews were not conducted in any of the jails in the state but in Rajasthan , where he was taken on production warrant in a case in February. However, even the Jaipur police denied that Bishnoi could have given any interview under its tight security.
Summary:
The committee has been directed to submit its report by April 12.“Two interviews of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi went viral on TV channels/social media.
In the given circumstances, there was a need to hold a detailed inquiry into the matter.
Therefore, an inquiry committee was set up.
The Punjab government had claimed that the interviews were not conducted in any of the jails in the state but in Rajasthan , where he was taken on production warrant in a case in February.
However, even the Jaipur police denied that Bishnoi could have given any interview under its tight security.

Meta_title: Quran not recited at Karnataka temple fest as groups oppose old custom
Meta_desc: ... Covid News Live: India reports 6600 Fresh Covid cases · Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan, Supreme Court asks Delhi police...
Title: Quran not recited at Karnataka temple fest as groups oppose old custom
Article: HASSAN: The management committee of Chennakeshava temple in Karnataka's Belur said verses of the Quran were not recited during the annual Brahmarathotsava that ended on Tuesday amid tight security, following hardline groups' demand to do away with the age-old custom of a moulvi attending the event and saying portions from the holy book."After accepting cash and grains handed over by the temple committee, he only offered 'mujure' (thanksgiving prayer)," said Narayana Swamy , head of the committee. He said moulvi Sajjad Basha Khadri Saheb had issued a written confirmation that he didn't recite the Quran. The groups had earlier submitted a memorandum to register their opposition to the ritual of reciting Quranic verses during Rathotsava.
Summary:
HASSAN: The management committee of Chennakeshava temple in Karnataka's Belur said verses of the Quran were not recited during the annual Brahmarathotsava that ended on Tuesday amid tight security, following hardline groups' demand to do away with the age-old custom of a moulvi attending the event and saying portions from the holy book.
"After accepting cash and grains handed over by the temple committee, he only offered 'mujure' (thanksgiving prayer)," said Narayana Swamy , head of the committee.
He said moulvi Sajjad Basha Khadri Saheb had issued a written confirmation that he didn't recite the Quran.
The groups had earlier submitted a memorandum to register their opposition to the ritual of reciting Quranic verses during Rathotsava.

Meta_title: Goons beat up NRI, livestream act on video call
Meta_desc: 10 cops, 1 civilian killed in blast carried out by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada · Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks...
Title: Nri: Goons Beat Up Nri, Livestream Act On Video Call
Article: Ludhiana: Raikot police have booked miscreants for allegedly thrashing a New Zealand-based NRI . Eight to 10 unidentified men even live-streamed the assault for the main accused — Deepak Joshi of Patiala, presently in New Zealand — who had a grudge against the victim, Amit Sharma of Guru Teg Bahadur Colony in Sanhpur.Amit, who had come to India from New Zealand on February 11, told cops that the girl with whom Deepak has an affair lived with him in a separate room at a rented house in New Zealand. He said Deepak suspected him to be involved with his girlfriend and because of that, he had also threatened him of dire consequences. He had reported the matter to New Zealand police.The complainant said on March 13, he along with his friend Surendra Singh of Dirba had come to Raikot to buy clothes. While going towards Sangrur, they took a link road. On the way, two cars gave a chase to their vehicle. Road closure forced the duo to stop their vehicle. Soon, 8 to 10 men got down from two cars and started beating them up.While one of assaulters snatched the gold chain from his neck, another accused showed the assault to Deepak Joshi in New Zealand on a video call. He said they threatened him that if he messed up with Deepak in future, he would have to pay with his life.Amit later informed police about the incident. City Raikot police later booked the accused under Sections 379 B (snatching), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (wrongful restraint) , 506 (criminal intimidation), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapon), 149 (unlawful assembly), 120-B (criminal conspiracy) of the IPC and relevant sections of Information and Technology Act.Inspector Kulwinder Singh, investigating officer from City Raikot police station, said the accused are yet to be arrested.
Summary:
Ludhiana: Raikot police have booked miscreants for allegedly thrashing a New Zealand-based NRI .
He said Deepak suspected him to be involved with his girlfriend and because of that, he had also threatened him of dire consequences.
He had reported the matter to New Zealand police.The complainant said on March 13, he along with his friend Surendra Singh of Dirba had come to Raikot to buy clothes.
Road closure forced the duo to stop their vehicle.
He said they threatened him that if he messed up with Deepak in future, he would have to pay with his life.Amit later informed police about the incident.

Meta_title: Govt teacher wanted in RPSC paper leak nabbed from Odisha
Meta_desc: ... Anil Kumar Meena alias Sher Singh, wanted in the RPSC senior teacher ... After Saran's arrest, he fled to Odisha after spending various spells hiding in...
Title: Govt teacher wanted in RPSC paper leak nabbed from Odisha
Article: JAIPUR: Suspended government school vice-principal, Anil Kumar Meena alias Sher Singh, wanted in the RPSC senior teacher recruitment exam question paper leak, was nabbed from Odisha by a team of special operations group (SOG) of the Rajasthan police on Thursday.Rajasthan police had announced a reward of Rs 1 lakh for information on Meena leading to his arrest. A native of Kaladera in Chomu town near Jaipur, Meena is suspected to have provided the question paper to kingpins Bhupendra Saran and Suresh Dhaka before the exam, which led to the cancellation of the recruitment exam in December last year. The accused was also the vice-principal of a government school in Sirohi.Police said that Meena would be brought to Jaipur for questioning. According to sources, SOG teams have been tracking the accused for a long time. After Saran's arrest, he fled to Odisha after spending various spells hiding in various cities. Cops said that Meena had moved to the Kalahandi district and started working as a labourer.Meena first came under the scanner as the first in the chain of suspects for leaking the question paper after Saran claimed he had purchased the questions paper from him for a hefty price.Speaking to TOI, a senior police official said that Meena's arrest would help the police discover how the paper, kept under heightened security, was leaked.The exam, which was to be held on December 24, was cancelled after it was found that some students in Udaipur had received the paper before the exam. Police arrested over 50 persons, including students, and launched a manhunt to arrest Saran and Dhaka. While Saran was held in February from Bengaluru, both Dhaka and Meena were on the run.Last week, the Udaipur police arrested a woman banker from Jaipur who was allegedly in a relationship with Meena and also played a role in the paper leak."Meena's arrest is important. He can reveal to us how he first managed to get the question paper kept under heavy security," said an officer. The investigation into the case was handed over to the SOG.
Summary:
JAIPUR: Suspended government school vice-principal, Anil Kumar Meena alias Sher Singh, wanted in the RPSC senior teacher recruitment exam question paper leak, was nabbed from Odisha by a team of special operations group (SOG) of the Rajasthan police on Thursday.Rajasthan police had announced a reward of Rs 1 lakh for information on Meena leading to his arrest.
The accused was also the vice-principal of a government school in Sirohi.Police said that Meena would be brought to Jaipur for questioning.
After Saran's arrest, he fled to Odisha after spending various spells hiding in various cities.
Police arrested over 50 persons, including students, and launched a manhunt to arrest Saran and Dhaka.
He can reveal to us how he first managed to get the question paper kept under heavy security," said an officer.

Meta_title: Sanjita Chanu four-year ban | Sanjita Chanu Dope Test Fail ...
Meta_desc: Haryana Amateur Wrestling Association suspends three members for agitating against WFI Chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh: Reports.
Title: Weightlifter Sanjita Chanu handed four-year ban for failing dope test
Article:
Sanjita Chanu was banned by the International Weightlifting Federation (IWF) in 2018 after she had tested for an anabolic steroid testosterone prior to the World Championships in US (2017).

Picture Credit: Twitter

In another blow, Indian weightlifter Sanjita Chanu has been handed a four-year ban after failing a dope test last year. The National Anti Doping Agency (NADA) on Tuesday, April 4 announced this decision.



As reported by the NADA, the two-time Commonwealth Games champion was tested positive for an anabolic steroid, called Drostanolone Metabolite. This substance is among the listed prohibited materials by the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).

The concerned body further added that the 29-year-old weightlifter’s samples were collected during the National Games in Gujarat in the September-October 2022. This decision of the NADA was even confirmed by the Indian Weightlifting Federation (IWF) President Sahdev Yadav. “Yes, she has been handed a four-year ban by NADA,” he told PTI as quoted by TOI.

Sanjita to be stripped of silver medal

Seeing this development, the Indian weightlifter will be stripped off her National Games silver medal. The 29-year-old still has the option of appealing the decision made by NADA.

Notably, this is not the first time the weightlifter has been involved in a dope controversy. Sanjita Chanu was banned by the International Weightlifting Federation (IWF) in 2018 after she had tested for an anabolic steroid testosterone prior to the World Championships in US (2017).
Summary:
Picture Credit: TwitterIn another blow, Indian weightlifter Sanjita Chanu has been handed a four-year ban after failing a dope test last year.
This decision of the NADA was even confirmed by the Indian Weightlifting Federation (IWF) President Sahdev Yadav.
“Yes, she has been handed a four-year ban by NADA,” he told PTI as quoted by TOI.
Sanjita to be stripped of silver medalSeeing this development, the Indian weightlifter will be stripped off her National Games silver medal.
Notably, this is not the first time the weightlifter has been involved in a dope controversy.

Meta_title: Wrestling: Vinesh Phogat says wrestlers to consider going to court in fight against WFI chief
Meta_desc: Vinesh Phogat said that wrestlers have lost faith in the Oversight Committee which is probing the allegations against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.
Title: Wrestling: Vinesh Phogat says wrestlers to consider going to court in fight against WFI chief
Article:
India’s star wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that Indian wrestlers will have no choice but to approach courts if the findings of the Oversight Committee, which was set up to probe allegations of sexual harassment against Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, is not released.

Wrestlers, including but not limited to Phogat, Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Bajrang Punia and Rio Olympics bronze medallist Sakshi Malik organised a sit in protest in New Delhi Jantar Mantar in January to protest the functioning of the WFI.

While Brij Bhushan Singh denied the allegations, the Union Sports Ministry asked the BJP MP from Kaiserganj to step down from his role and set up an Oversight Committee to probe the allegations and set a deadline of one month to submit its findings. Phogat, Punia and Malik had expressed their disappointment in not being consulted by the Sports Ministry in the setting up of the OC.

Also read: With pending criminal cases, wrestling chief accused of sexual abuse is no stranger to controversy

“Why is there secrecy over the findings of the Oversight Committee and the details about how they went about the probe? Women wrestlers have shown the courage to speak about what they faced but it seems like their words don’t matter. We have raised a very sensitive issue which concerns the safety of women wrestlers,” Phogat, a three-time Commonwealth Games gold medallist told The Indian Express.

“We have lost faith in the committee. We received some assurances from the government but they were not fulfilled too. We do not know the status of the report filed by the committee as well. Every time we ask what is the status and finding of the Oversight Committee report, there is no response from anyone,” she added.

Phogat also said that she and Punia tried to reach out to OC member MC Mary Kom and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur but received no response.

“We are left with no other option but to approach the court in our fight for justice. Stepping back is not an option now,” Phogat said.

The 28-year-old also alleged that though the Brij Bhushan had been removed from his post of WFI chief, he still runs the day-to-day affairs of the federation. She pointed out that the Open National Senior Ranking Wrestling Tournament for Women and Greco Roman has been scheduled to be held at Nandini Nagar in Gonda from April 16 to 18.

Brij Bhushan hails from Gonda and the district is a part of his Lok Sabha constituency and is considered to be his stronghold.

Unbelievable! WFI, which has resumed functioning (why?), announces U17 Nationals 2023



When: April 16-18

Where: Nandini Nagar, Gonda



N Nagar Gonda is the area in which accused Brij Bhusan is the ruler, king and everything. How can this be possible! pic.twitter.com/sMT6SQt8EZ — Vinay Siwach (@siwachvinay) April 6, 2023

“Nandini Nagar in Gonda was chosen despite us saying what all had happened to women wrestlers earlier. How can this even happen? When I saw that the venue of the senior ranking tournament was in Gonda, I did try to reach members of the Oversight Committee. But nobody seems to have any answer,” she added.

The OC includes boxing legend and Rajya Sabha member MC Mary Kom, Olympic medalist and former wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt, former badminton player and Mission Olympic Cell member Trupti Murgunde, former CEO of the Target Olympic Podium Scheme Rajesh Rajagopalan, and former Sports Authority of India executive director (teams) Radhica Sreeman.

Later on, 2012 World Championships bronze medal-winning wrestler Babita Phogat was also added to the committee.
Summary:
Women wrestlers have shown the courage to speak about what they faced but it seems like their words don’t matter.
We have raised a very sensitive issue which concerns the safety of women wrestlers,” Phogat, a three-time Commonwealth Games gold medallist told The Indian Express.
Every time we ask what is the status and finding of the Oversight Committee report, there is no response from anyone,” she added.
The 28-year-old also alleged that though the Brij Bhushan had been removed from his post of WFI chief, he still runs the day-to-day affairs of the federation.
pic.twitter.com/sMT6SQt8EZ — Vinay Siwach (@siwachvinay) April 6, 2023“Nandini Nagar in Gonda was chosen despite us saying what all had happened to women wrestlers earlier.

Meta_title: WFI case: “Signed report with objections,” says member of Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee
Meta_desc: The member further alleged that Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh -- the six-time member of parliament and president of the Wrestling Federation of India -- against...
Title: WFI case: “Signed report with objections,” says member of Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee
Article:
A member of the Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee that probed allegations of sexual harassment and financial mismanagement levelled against the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) and its chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has raised objections to the manner in which the report was compiled and says to have signed the final report, which was submitted to the Ministry three days back, under protest.

“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry. I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member told Sportstar, on condition of anonymity.

The Sports Ministry on January 23 had appointed a six-person committee, headed by Olympic boxing bronze medallist MC Mary Kom, following public protests by several of India’s top wrestlers at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi in January this year. The other members of the committee were former CEO of Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS) Capt Rajagopalan, former SAI Executive Director (Teams) Radhika Sreeman, former badminton national champion Trupti Murgunde, Olympic bronze medallist Yogeshwar Dutt and Commonwealth wrestling champion Babita Phogat.

Also Read Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations

“I was not allowed to read the final report in full and I had objected about it. The report was submitted to the Sports Ministry on the April 5 and that morning, I realised that certain objections I had earlier raised had not been included in the report. When I asked the committee to include these points, this was not done. I signed and registering my protest,” the member said.

The member also raised concerns regarding the committee’s evidence collection method. “I wrote in my objection that no document submitted by witnesses or the Wrestling Federation or recording of witness statement was shared with the members of the committee. None of the witness deposition was signed by either the witness or by the members of the committee. We did not cross-check or verify with any of the witnesses if their testimony was right or wrong. We only recorded what was said. There were individuals who had an incentive to speak in favour of one party,” the member said.

The member further alleged that Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh -- the six-time member of parliament and president of the Wrestling Federation of India -- against whom allegations of harassment had been made, recorded his statement in the absence of a lawyer. “In matters of sexual harassment, all statements are to be taken in the presence of a third party who is a lawyer. This was done in the case of the athletes who had complained, but it was not done for the WFI president,” the member said.

The committee member said objections were raised several times prior to the finalisation of the report. “Any objection I raised during meetings of the committee was not recorded in the minutes of the meeting. When I asked why this was not recorded, I was told that the matter would be discussed later,” the member said. “In this way, my objections were ignored. Decisions were taken unilaterally. When trials to select the team for the Asian Championships were held, I had objections since this was the first time, we had trials where we called U-20 athletes, but several senior players were not able to compete,” added the committee member. Several athletes were later allowed to compete in the trials after approaching the court.

The member added that the committee has not made any suggestions on the most serious allegations raised by the protesting wrestlers. “They have not made any recommendations regarding the various allegations that had been made. I have mentioned in the report that no suggestions have been made which will either support or contradict what the athletes have said,” the member said.
Summary:
“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry.
I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member told Sportstar, on condition of anonymity.
This was done in the case of the athletes who had complained, but it was not done for the WFI president,” the member said.
The committee member said objections were raised several times prior to the finalisation of the report.
The member added that the committee has not made any suggestions on the most serious allegations raised by the protesting wrestlers.
