Title: WFI Sexual Harassment: After Committee Member's Objections, Bajrang Punia Questions Probe Report
Article:
New Delhi: Olympic and World Championships medallist Bajrang Punia, who led a protest against Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh over allegations of sexual harassment, has said now come out to question the probe into the allegations against Singh.

“A news report recently claimed that one of the members of the oversight committee, which was constituted by the sports ministry to probe the allegations, was not in agreement with its final report. It indicates something suspicious is being done either by the committee or the ministry. Someone is doing something wrong,” Punia told The News Indian Express.

On January 23, after weeks of protest by a number of prominent Indian wrestlers, the Union sports ministry constituted a six-member committee headed by Olympic medallist and boxer Mary Kom. The other members of the committee were former CEO of Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS) Capt Rajagopalan, former SAI Executive Director (Teams) Radhika Sreeman, former badminton national champion Trupti Murgunde, Olympic bronze medallist Yogeshwar Dutt and Commonwealth wrestling champion Babita Phogat. Phogat was added only after wrestlers expressed displeasure at the committee’s membership.

One of the members of the committee told Sportstar on the condition anonymity that they had objections to the way the committee’s report was drafted and so have signed it with objections.

“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry. I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member said. “I was not allowed to read the final report in full and I had objected about it. The report was submitted to the Sports Ministry on the April 5 and that morning, I realised that certain objections I had earlier raised had not been included in the report. When I asked the committee to include these points, this was not done. I signed and registering my protest.”

“I wrote in my objection that no document submitted by witnesses or the Wrestling Federation or recording of witness statement was shared with the members of the committee. None of the witness deposition was signed by either the witness or by the members of the committee. We did not cross-check or verify with any of the witnesses if their testimony was right or wrong. We only recorded what was said. There were individuals who had an incentive to speak in favour of one party,” the member continued.

Responding to this report, Punia told The New Indian Express, “Through your newspaper, I wanted to tell the people of this country that the statements given by the women wrestlers against the WFI chief should be made public so that they also know the truth. The whole process was videographed. These videos should be run on news channels. These statements should be made public to decide whether he (Singh) was guilty or not. I don’t know who wants to save him, who all are supporting him. We had faith in the government that it would give justice to us. However, the way things are going on, we don’t feel like the government will support us or go with the truth.”

Two upcoming events announced by the WFI have also come under the scanner, according to The Print, because they are being held in Singh’s stronghold – Uttar Pradesh’s Gonda. Both the U-17 National Championships on April 16 and Senior Open National Ranking Wrestling Tournament on April 18 are to be held at the Nandini Nagar Mahavidyalaya, a college that Singh helped found.

WFI general secretary V.N. Prasood told The Print that the events were being held because the investigation committee had submitted its report to the government.

Punia told The New Indian Express that it was unfair for the WFI to resume functioning without telling the complainants or the public the findings of the probe. “The WFI has resumed its activities even as the report of the oversight committee has not been made public yet. We don’t know whether the committee has submitted its report or not. We don’t have any information on it yet,” he said.
Summary:
One of the members of the committee told Sportstar on the condition anonymity that they had objections to the way the committee’s report was drafted and so have signed it with objections.
“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry.
Prasood told The Print that the events were being held because the investigation committee had submitted its report to the government.
“The WFI has resumed its activities even as the report of the oversight committee has not been made public yet.
We don’t know whether the committee has submitted its report or not.

Kolkata Knight Riders' swashbuckling batter Rinku Singh smashed five consecutive sixes to pull off a thrilling three-wicket win over Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday. Needing 29 runs off the last over, Rinku whacked left-arm pacer Yash Dayal for five maximums on the trot to register a last-ball sensational victory.For Kolkata Knight Riders' Rinku Singh, the road to success has been a long and arduous one but never did he flinch or give up, and added a glorious chapter to the IPL story by doing the unthinkable here on Sunday.The 25-year-old from Uttar Pradesh’s Aligarh blasted 48 off 21 balls to see Kolkata Knight Riders home with a three-wicket win against defending champions Gujarat Titans on Sunday. The win has propelled KKR to second in the table with four points after three matches.Rinku's 48 not out from 21 balls included six sixes and one four, with KKR nailing down a 200 plus chase in dying moments in the game.Not even the world's best batters would have backed themselves to hit five consecutive sixes with their team requiring 28 from the last five balls, but KKR's left-handed Rinku did exactly that, producing a terrific knock that will be remembered and talked about for years.Rinku’s knock set the internet ablaze with a downpour of memes and jokes hailing the finisher.

Meta_title: I believed I could do it: Rinku Singh on his sensational 5 sixes in final over for KKR vs GT
Meta_desc: They needed 29 runs in the final over against Gujarat Titans in a stunning IPL 2023 match on Sunday, April 9. However, RInku Singh, who was batting with No. 9...
Title: I believed I could do it: Rinku Singh on his sensational 5 sixes in final over for KKR vs GT
Article:
By India Today Sports Desk: The equation in the final over looked improbable for Kolkata Knight Riders. They needed 29 runs in the final over against Gujarat Titans in a stunning IPL 2023 match on Sunday, April 9. However, RInku Singh, who was batting with No. 9 batter Umesh Yadav, believed that he could pull it off.

Yash Dayal, the young Gujarat Titans bowler who impressed in his winning campaign in IPL 2022, was handed the responsibility of bowling the final over. KKR's camp looked in distress as they had nearly fluffed a good chance to win. After a 100-run stand between captain Nitish Rana and Venkatesh Iyer (83), Alazarri Joseph struck twice to remove the well-set batters.

advertisement

Then came Rashid Khan, who redeemed himself after giving away 35 runs in his first 3 overs, by picking up a hat-trick in his final over, sending back Andre Russell, Sunil Narina and Shardul Thakur.

GT v KKR, IPL 2023: Highlights

However, Rinku Singh pulled off one of the most stunning chases in the history of IPL, hitting 5 sixes in the final over. 1, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6 read the scoreboard as Rinku was punching the air in delight after breaking the hearts of thousands of Gujarat fans at the Narendra Modi Stadium. KKR pulled off a 205-run chase to clinch their second successive win in IPL 2023.

Reflecting on his stunning onslaught in the final over, Rinku Singh revealed the chat with his captain Nitish, saying the latter had told him to take the chase deep.

"I had belief that I can do this. Rana bhai said to keep belief and to bat till the end, then we will see what happens," Riku Singh said.

The left-hander, who fell short of pulling off a similar chase when KKR needed 21 runs in the final over against Lucknow Super Giants last year, said he did not think much but wanted to hit sixes in the final over.

And he did that with a lot of precision. Rinku hit Dayal, who missed his length in a difficult final over.

"I was just trying to hit sixes. (Umesh) Bhaiya was asking me not to think much and just play the ball. I was not thinking a lot, was just reacting to the ball. It kept coming out of the middle, I had belief and it came off in the end," Rinku added.

Rinku Singh was awarded the Player of the Match award for his stunning knock in a match that will be remembered for a long, long time in the IPL history.
Summary:

Meta_title: Govt: By 2047, India to get 9% of its electricity from N-sources
Meta_desc: ... its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday.
Title: Govt: By 2047, India to get 9% of its electricity from N-sources
Article: India will get 9% of its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday. This will help in getting closer to the government’s commitment of achieving ‘net zero’ emission target by 2070, he added.India also committed to reaching 500GW of non-fossil electricity capacity, generating half of all energy requirements from renewables and reducing emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.After holding a review meeting with a group of senior scientists from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) in Mumbai, the minister said that the other target laid down by the Department of Atomic Energy is achieving a 20-gigawatt capacity of nuclear power generation by the year 2030, which according to him will be a major milestone placing India as the third-largest producer of atomic energy after the US and France.During 2021-22, nuclear power reactors generated 47,112 million units of electricity, that’s about 3.15% of the country’s total power generation, Singh had recently informed Lok Sabha . The present installed nuclear power capacity is set to increase from 6,780 MW to 22,480 MW by 2031 on progressive completion of projects under construction and accorded sanction, he had said.
Summary:
India will get 9% of its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday.
This will help in getting closer to the government’s commitment of achieving ‘net zero’ emission target by 2070, he added.India also committed to reaching 500GW of non-fossil electricity capacity, generating half of all energy requirements from renewables and reducing emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.After holding a review meeting with a group of senior scientists from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) in Mumbai, the minister said that the other target laid down by the Department of Atomic Energy is achieving a 20-gigawatt capacity of nuclear power generation by the year 2030, which according to him will be a major milestone placing India as the third-largest producer of atomic energy after the US and France.During 2021-22, nuclear power reactors generated 47,112 million units of electricity, that’s about 3.15% of the country’s total power generation, Singh had recently informed Lok Sabha .
The present installed nuclear power capacity is set to increase from 6,780 MW to 22,480 MW by 2031 on progressive completion of projects under construction and accorded sanction, he had said.

Title: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri lauds TTD’s contributions to healthcare, education
Article: TIRUPATI: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) received appreciation from Union petroleum minister Hardeep Singh Puri for its contributions in the areas of healthcare and education.On the sidelines of his two-day tour to the temple city of Tirupati, Hardeep Puri offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Tuesday morning.Later the Union minister visited Sri Padmavathi Children’s Super Specialty Hospital which was recently established by the TTD in Tirupati and lauded the temple trust for establishing a state-of-the-art hospital exclusively for the children.Hardeep Puri also visited the TTD run BIRRD hospital in Tirupati on Tuesday.
Summary: TIRUPATI: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) received appreciation from Union petroleum minister Hardeep Singh Puri for its contributions in the areas of healthcare and education.On the sidelines of his two-day tour to the temple city of Tirupati, Hardeep Puri offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Tuesday morning.Later the Union minister visited Sri Padmavathi Children’s Super Specialty Hospital which was recently established by the TTD in Tirupati and lauded the temple trust for establishing a state-of-the-art hospital exclusively for the children.Hardeep Puri also visited the TTD run BIRRD hospital in Tirupati on Tuesday.

Meta_title: We aim to make Himachal most progressive: Sukhu
Meta_desc: Shimla: Chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Sunday said his government was making efforts to bring the economy of the state back on track.
Title: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu: We Aim To Make Himachal Most Progressive: Sukhu
Article: Shimla: Chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Sunday said his government was making efforts to bring the economy of the state back on track.We will work on the goal to make Himachal Pradesh one of the most progressive and prosperous states of the country in the next 10 years, the CM said while addressing the Himachali population in New Delhi.He said the budget presented by his government focused on growth of all sectors, especially uplifting the rural economy. Himachal is on its way to becoming a ‘Green State’ by 2026, Sukhu added.The CM further said the state government was sincerely chalking out strategies for the speedy development of the state. He also invited Himachalis residing outside the state to visit the state in coming years to see positive and constructive changes in the state due to the visionary policies and programmes of his government. Sukhu said his government was taking various other initiatives like connecting all districts with heliports, expansion of Kangra airport, and speeding up of work on roads. We are also promoting tourism in Kangra district and coming up with many ambitious projects to attract more tourists to the area, he said.The CM also elaborated on the initiatives taken by his government to encourage use of electric vehicles and solar energy. He also highlighted the steps taken by the state government to provide a respectable life to orphan children in the state through Mukhya Mantri Sukh-Aashray Scheme.
Summary:
Himachal is on its way to becoming a ‘Green State’ by 2026, Sukhu added.The CM further said the state government was sincerely chalking out strategies for the speedy development of the state.
He also invited Himachalis residing outside the state to visit the state in coming years to see positive and constructive changes in the state due to the visionary policies and programmes of his government.
Sukhu said his government was taking various other initiatives like connecting all districts with heliports, expansion of Kangra airport, and speeding up of work on roads.
We are also promoting tourism in Kangra district and coming up with many ambitious projects to attract more tourists to the area, he said.The CM also elaborated on the initiatives taken by his government to encourage use of electric vehicles and solar energy.
He also highlighted the steps taken by the state government to provide a respectable life to orphan children in the state through Mukhya Mantri Sukh-Aashray Scheme.

Meta_desc: Dares Mann to debate on law & order ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death threat,...
Title: Mann: Dares Mann To Debate On Law & Order
Article: Jalandhar: Alleging that the mafia’s influence had inreased in Punjab, Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was released from jail last week, on Saturday asked Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to debate with him on the issue in the presence of media. He has also dared the Punjab government to take back his remaining security cover. Speaking to media at the residence of Congress candidate Karamjit Kaur, where he had come to condole the death of her husband and late MP Santokh Singh Chaudhary, Sidhu alleged that the AAP government was running the mafia. “It is clear that mafia can’t run without patronage. It has rather doubled in the last one year and is thriving in different sectors,” he said and asked the CM to sit with him for a debate in the presence of TV cameras. He also dig at AAP fielding former Congress MLA Sushil Rinku. TNN
Summary:
Jalandhar: Alleging that the mafia’s influence had inreased in Punjab, Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was released from jail last week, on Saturday asked Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to debate with him on the issue in the presence of media.
He has also dared the Punjab government to take back his remaining security cover.
“It is clear that mafia can’t run without patronage.
It has rather doubled in the last one year and is thriving in different sectors,” he said and asked the CM to sit with him for a debate in the presence of TV cameras.
He also dig at AAP fielding former Congress MLA Sushil Rinku.

Meta_title: Congress leaders want Navjot Singh Sidhu to play a major role in Punjab politics, but others question his
Meta_desc: AMRITSAR: Noting the significance of cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu, who arrived at his Amritsar home after nearly ten months of what many...
Title: Congress leaders want Navjot Singh Sidhu to play a major role in Punjab politics, but others question his sincerity
Article: AMRITSAR: Noting the significance of cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu , who arrived at his Amritsar home after nearly ten months of what many Congressmen refer to as a "jail yatra," and the rousing welcome given to him by the Congress leaders, it is clear that he will play an important role in the Punjab Congress, especially after meeting Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi before travelling to Amritsar.Congress workers and leaders had arrived with ‘dhol’s’ to welcome Sidhu and raised high-pitched slogans upon his arrival at Golden Gate.While accepting peoples’ greetings and siropa’s Sidhu vowed that he wouldn't let anyone cause any harm to the interests of Punjab.The conspicuous absence of a few Congress leaders certainly raised a question marks on Sidhu’s acceptance among all Congress leaders of the region.Like other politicians, Sidhu, former MLA, and MP, had promised to root out corrupt practices and injustice but unfortunately, the promises remained unfulfilled and then comes a shattering blow to Congress when he was sent to jail in a road rage case.In his meeting with the Gandhis, Navjot reportedly expressed a desire to concentrate his political efforts in Punjab, according to sources in Sidhu's camp.“Using words like a mentor for Rahul, philosopher and guide for Priyanka is a classic example of Navjot’s servility to the Gandhi family as many other politicians are doing," said a political observer and analyst Dr Avtar Singh.He claimed that in the past Sidhu had failed to deliver the promises made to him and now a common man didn’t have many hopes for him.“He may be an ardent speaker but that alone is not enough,” he said.Common people long for employment, and social justice and it is natural for people to raise questions when their basic demands were not fulfilled by the politicians whom they had sent to the assembly or the parliament, Avtar Singh said.Contrary to Avtar’s observation, senior Congress leader and former MLA Sunil Dutti said Navjot Singh Sidhu had the capacity to enthuse fresh spirit among the workers and they were expecting Sidhu to play a significant role in the party.Sidhu would be paying obeisance at Golden Temple, Durgiana temple and Sri Ram Teerath on Sunday and could also hold meetings with Congress leaders to chalk out the future course of action.

Meta_title: Wrestling: Vinesh Phogat says wrestlers to consider going to court in fight against WFI chief
Meta_desc: Vinesh Phogat said that wrestlers have lost faith in the Oversight Committee which is probing the allegations against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.
Title: Wrestling: Vinesh Phogat says wrestlers to consider going to court in fight against WFI chief
Article:
India’s star wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that Indian wrestlers will have no choice but to approach courts if the findings of the Oversight Committee, which was set up to probe allegations of sexual harassment against Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, is not released.

Wrestlers, including but not limited to Phogat, Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Bajrang Punia and Rio Olympics bronze medallist Sakshi Malik organised a sit in protest in New Delhi Jantar Mantar in January to protest the functioning of the WFI.

While Brij Bhushan Singh denied the allegations, the Union Sports Ministry asked the BJP MP from Kaiserganj to step down from his role and set up an Oversight Committee to probe the allegations and set a deadline of one month to submit its findings. Phogat, Punia and Malik had expressed their disappointment in not being consulted by the Sports Ministry in the setting up of the OC.

Also read: With pending criminal cases, wrestling chief accused of sexual abuse is no stranger to controversy

“Why is there secrecy over the findings of the Oversight Committee and the details about how they went about the probe? Women wrestlers have shown the courage to speak about what they faced but it seems like their words don’t matter. We have raised a very sensitive issue which concerns the safety of women wrestlers,” Phogat, a three-time Commonwealth Games gold medallist told The Indian Express.

“We have lost faith in the committee. We received some assurances from the government but they were not fulfilled too. We do not know the status of the report filed by the committee as well. Every time we ask what is the status and finding of the Oversight Committee report, there is no response from anyone,” she added.

Phogat also said that she and Punia tried to reach out to OC member MC Mary Kom and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur but received no response.

“We are left with no other option but to approach the court in our fight for justice. Stepping back is not an option now,” Phogat said.

The 28-year-old also alleged that though the Brij Bhushan had been removed from his post of WFI chief, he still runs the day-to-day affairs of the federation. She pointed out that the Open National Senior Ranking Wrestling Tournament for Women and Greco Roman has been scheduled to be held at Nandini Nagar in Gonda from April 16 to 18.

Brij Bhushan hails from Gonda and the district is a part of his Lok Sabha constituency and is considered to be his stronghold.

Unbelievable! WFI, which has resumed functioning (why?), announces U17 Nationals 2023



When: April 16-18

Where: Nandini Nagar, Gonda



N Nagar Gonda is the area in which accused Brij Bhusan is the ruler, king and everything. How can this be possible! pic.twitter.com/sMT6SQt8EZ — Vinay Siwach (@siwachvinay) April 6, 2023

“Nandini Nagar in Gonda was chosen despite us saying what all had happened to women wrestlers earlier. How can this even happen? When I saw that the venue of the senior ranking tournament was in Gonda, I did try to reach members of the Oversight Committee. But nobody seems to have any answer,” she added.

The OC includes boxing legend and Rajya Sabha member MC Mary Kom, Olympic medalist and former wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt, former badminton player and Mission Olympic Cell member Trupti Murgunde, former CEO of the Target Olympic Podium Scheme Rajesh Rajagopalan, and former Sports Authority of India executive director (teams) Radhica Sreeman.

Later on, 2012 World Championships bronze medal-winning wrestler Babita Phogat was also added to the committee.
Summary:
Women wrestlers have shown the courage to speak about what they faced but it seems like their words don’t matter.
We have raised a very sensitive issue which concerns the safety of women wrestlers,” Phogat, a three-time Commonwealth Games gold medallist told The Indian Express.
Every time we ask what is the status and finding of the Oversight Committee report, there is no response from anyone,” she added.
The 28-year-old also alleged that though the Brij Bhushan had been removed from his post of WFI chief, he still runs the day-to-day affairs of the federation.

Meta_title: WFI case: “Signed report with objections,” says member of Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee
Meta_desc: The member further alleged that Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh -- the six-time member of parliament and president of the Wrestling Federation of India -- against...
Title: WFI case: “Signed report with objections,” says member of Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee
Article:
A member of the Sports Ministry-appointed oversight committee that probed allegations of sexual harassment and financial mismanagement levelled against the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) and its chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has raised objections to the manner in which the report was compiled and says to have signed the final report, which was submitted to the Ministry three days back, under protest.

“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry. I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member told Sportstar, on condition of anonymity.

The Sports Ministry on January 23 had appointed a six-person committee, headed by Olympic boxing bronze medallist MC Mary Kom, following public protests by several of India’s top wrestlers at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi in January this year. The other members of the committee were former CEO of Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS) Capt Rajagopalan, former SAI Executive Director (Teams) Radhika Sreeman, former badminton national champion Trupti Murgunde, Olympic bronze medallist Yogeshwar Dutt and Commonwealth wrestling champion Babita Phogat.

Also Read Wrestling federation to conduct two tournaments, the first activity since controversy over abuse allegations

“I was not allowed to read the final report in full and I had objected about it. The report was submitted to the Sports Ministry on the April 5 and that morning, I realised that certain objections I had earlier raised had not been included in the report. When I asked the committee to include these points, this was not done. I signed and registering my protest,” the member said.

The member also raised concerns regarding the committee’s evidence collection method. “I wrote in my objection that no document submitted by witnesses or the Wrestling Federation or recording of witness statement was shared with the members of the committee. None of the witness deposition was signed by either the witness or by the members of the committee. We did not cross-check or verify with any of the witnesses if their testimony was right or wrong. We only recorded what was said. There were individuals who had an incentive to speak in favour of one party,” the member said.

The member further alleged that Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh -- the six-time member of parliament and president of the Wrestling Federation of India -- against whom allegations of harassment had been made, recorded his statement in the absence of a lawyer. “In matters of sexual harassment, all statements are to be taken in the presence of a third party who is a lawyer. This was done in the case of the athletes who had complained, but it was not done for the WFI president,” the member said.

The committee member said objections were raised several times prior to the finalisation of the report. “Any objection I raised during meetings of the committee was not recorded in the minutes of the meeting. When I asked why this was not recorded, I was told that the matter would be discussed later,” the member said. “In this way, my objections were ignored. Decisions were taken unilaterally. When trials to select the team for the Asian Championships were held, I had objections since this was the first time, we had trials where we called U-20 athletes, but several senior players were not able to compete,” added the committee member. Several athletes were later allowed to compete in the trials after approaching the court.

The member added that the committee has not made any suggestions on the most serious allegations raised by the protesting wrestlers. “They have not made any recommendations regarding the various allegations that had been made. I have mentioned in the report that no suggestions have been made which will either support or contradict what the athletes have said,” the member said.
Summary:
“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry.
I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member told Sportstar, on condition of anonymity.
This was done in the case of the athletes who had complained, but it was not done for the WFI president,” the member said.
The committee member said objections were raised several times prior to the finalisation of the report.
The member added that the committee has not made any suggestions on the most serious allegations raised by the protesting wrestlers.

Meta_title: WFI Sexual Harassment: After Committee Member's Objections, Bajrang Punia Questions Probe Report
Meta_desc: New Delhi: Olympic and World Championships medallist Bajrang Punia, who led a protest against Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan...
Title: WFI Sexual Harassment: After Committee Member's Objections, Bajrang Punia Questions Probe Report
Article:
New Delhi: Olympic and World Championships medallist Bajrang Punia, who led a protest against Wrestling Federation of India president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh over allegations of sexual harassment, has said now come out to question the probe into the allegations against Singh.

“A news report recently claimed that one of the members of the oversight committee, which was constituted by the sports ministry to probe the allegations, was not in agreement with its final report. It indicates something suspicious is being done either by the committee or the ministry. Someone is doing something wrong,” Punia told The News Indian Express.

On January 23, after weeks of protest by a number of prominent Indian wrestlers, the Union sports ministry constituted a six-member committee headed by Olympic medallist and boxer Mary Kom. The other members of the committee were former CEO of Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS) Capt Rajagopalan, former SAI Executive Director (Teams) Radhika Sreeman, former badminton national champion Trupti Murgunde, Olympic bronze medallist Yogeshwar Dutt and Commonwealth wrestling champion Babita Phogat. Phogat was added only after wrestlers expressed displeasure at the committee’s membership.

One of the members of the committee told Sportstar on the condition anonymity that they had objections to the way the committee’s report was drafted and so have signed it with objections.

“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry. I wrote on the report that I will sign with objections to this report,” the member said. “I was not allowed to read the final report in full and I had objected about it. The report was submitted to the Sports Ministry on the April 5 and that morning, I realised that certain objections I had earlier raised had not been included in the report. When I asked the committee to include these points, this was not done. I signed and registering my protest.”

“I wrote in my objection that no document submitted by witnesses or the Wrestling Federation or recording of witness statement was shared with the members of the committee. None of the witness deposition was signed by either the witness or by the members of the committee. We did not cross-check or verify with any of the witnesses if their testimony was right or wrong. We only recorded what was said. There were individuals who had an incentive to speak in favour of one party,” the member continued.

Responding to this report, Punia told The New Indian Express, “Through your newspaper, I wanted to tell the people of this country that the statements given by the women wrestlers against the WFI chief should be made public so that they also know the truth. The whole process was videographed. These videos should be run on news channels. These statements should be made public to decide whether he (Singh) was guilty or not. I don’t know who wants to save him, who all are supporting him. We had faith in the government that it would give justice to us. However, the way things are going on, we don’t feel like the government will support us or go with the truth.”

Two upcoming events announced by the WFI have also come under the scanner, according to The Print, because they are being held in Singh’s stronghold – Uttar Pradesh’s Gonda. Both the U-17 National Championships on April 16 and Senior Open National Ranking Wrestling Tournament on April 18 are to be held at the Nandini Nagar Mahavidyalaya, a college that Singh helped found.

WFI general secretary V.N. Prasood told The Print that the events were being held because the investigation committee had submitted its report to the government.

Punia told The New Indian Express that it was unfair for the WFI to resume functioning without telling the complainants or the public the findings of the probe. “The WFI has resumed its activities even as the report of the oversight committee has not been made public yet. We don’t know whether the committee has submitted its report or not. We don’t have any information on it yet,” he said.
Summary:
One of the members of the committee told Sportstar on the condition anonymity that they had objections to the way the committee’s report was drafted and so have signed it with objections.
“Members of the committee had to sign the report before it was submitted to the Sports Ministry.
Prasood told The Print that the events were being held because the investigation committee had submitted its report to the government.
“The WFI has resumed its activities even as the report of the oversight committee has not been made public yet.
We don’t know whether the committee has submitted its report or not.

Meta_title: '2 mins silence for those who missed it': Rinku Singh's last over heroics bring down internet
Meta_desc: Times of India neither condones nor endorses any of the views shared in this article here. Kolkata Knight Riders' swashbuckling batter Rinku Singh smashed five...
Title: Rinku: '2 mins silence for those who missed it': Rinku Singh's last over heroics bring down internet
Article:
DISCLAIMER: This is a compilation of tweets being shared by netizens around the world. Times of India neither condones nor endorses any of the views shared in this article here.

Kolkata Knight Riders' swashbuckling batter Rinku Singh smashed five consecutive sixes to pull off a thrilling three-wicket win over Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday. Needing 29 runs off the last over, Rinku whacked left-arm pacer Yash Dayal for five maximums on the trot to register a last-ball sensational victory.For Kolkata Knight Riders' Rinku Singh, the road to success has been a long and arduous one but never did he flinch or give up, and added a glorious chapter to the IPL story by doing the unthinkable here on Sunday.The 25-year-old from Uttar Pradesh’s Aligarh blasted 48 off 21 balls to see Kolkata Knight Riders home with a three-wicket win against defending champions Gujarat Titans on Sunday. The win has propelled KKR to second in the table with four points after three matches.Rinku's 48 not out from 21 balls included six sixes and one four, with KKR nailing down a 200 plus chase in dying moments in the game.Not even the world's best batters would have backed themselves to hit five consecutive sixes with their team requiring 28 from the last five balls, but KKR's left-handed Rinku did exactly that, producing a terrific knock that will be remembered and talked about for years.Rinku’s knock set the internet ablaze with a downpour of memes and jokes hailing the finisher.
Summary:
DISCLAIMER: This is a compilation of tweets being shared by netizens around the world.
Times of India neither condones nor endorses any of the views shared in this article here.
Kolkata Knight Riders' swashbuckling batter Rinku Singh smashed five consecutive sixes to pull off a thrilling three-wicket win over Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday.
Needing 29 runs off the last over, Rinku whacked left-arm pacer Yash Dayal for five maximums on the trot to register a last-ball sensational victory.For Kolkata Knight Riders' Rinku Singh, the road to success has been a long and arduous one but never did he flinch or give up, and added a glorious chapter to the IPL story by doing the unthinkable here on Sunday.The 25-year-old from Uttar Pradesh’s Aligarh blasted 48 off 21 balls to see Kolkata Knight Riders home with a three-wicket win against defending champions Gujarat Titans on Sunday.
The win has propelled KKR to second in the table with four points after three matches.Rinku's 48 not out from 21 balls included six sixes and one four, with KKR nailing down a 200 plus chase in dying moments in the game.Not even the world's best batters would have backed themselves to hit five consecutive sixes with their team requiring 28 from the last five balls, but KKR's left-handed Rinku did exactly that, producing a terrific knock that will be remembered and talked about for years.Rinku’s knock set the internet ablaze with a downpour of memes and jokes hailing the finisher.

Meta_title: I believed I could do it: Rinku Singh on his sensational 5 sixes in final over for KKR vs GT
Meta_desc: They needed 29 runs in the final over against Gujarat Titans in a stunning IPL 2023 match on Sunday, April 9. However, RInku Singh, who was batting with No. 9...
Title: I believed I could do it: Rinku Singh on his sensational 5 sixes in final over for KKR vs GT
Article:
By India Today Sports Desk: The equation in the final over looked improbable for Kolkata Knight Riders. They needed 29 runs in the final over against Gujarat Titans in a stunning IPL 2023 match on Sunday, April 9. However, RInku Singh, who was batting with No. 9 batter Umesh Yadav, believed that he could pull it off.

Yash Dayal, the young Gujarat Titans bowler who impressed in his winning campaign in IPL 2022, was handed the responsibility of bowling the final over. KKR's camp looked in distress as they had nearly fluffed a good chance to win. After a 100-run stand between captain Nitish Rana and Venkatesh Iyer (83), Alazarri Joseph struck twice to remove the well-set batters.

advertisement

Then came Rashid Khan, who redeemed himself after giving away 35 runs in his first 3 overs, by picking up a hat-trick in his final over, sending back Andre Russell, Sunil Narina and Shardul Thakur.

GT v KKR, IPL 2023: Highlights

However, Rinku Singh pulled off one of the most stunning chases in the history of IPL, hitting 5 sixes in the final over. 1, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6 read the scoreboard as Rinku was punching the air in delight after breaking the hearts of thousands of Gujarat fans at the Narendra Modi Stadium. KKR pulled off a 205-run chase to clinch their second successive win in IPL 2023.

Reflecting on his stunning onslaught in the final over, Rinku Singh revealed the chat with his captain Nitish, saying the latter had told him to take the chase deep.

"I had belief that I can do this. Rana bhai said to keep belief and to bat till the end, then we will see what happens," Riku Singh said.

The left-hander, who fell short of pulling off a similar chase when KKR needed 21 runs in the final over against Lucknow Super Giants last year, said he did not think much but wanted to hit sixes in the final over.

And he did that with a lot of precision. Rinku hit Dayal, who missed his length in a difficult final over.

"I was just trying to hit sixes. (Umesh) Bhaiya was asking me not to think much and just play the ball. I was not thinking a lot, was just reacting to the ball. It kept coming out of the middle, I had belief and it came off in the end," Rinku added.

Rinku Singh was awarded the Player of the Match award for his stunning knock in a match that will be remembered for a long, long time in the IPL history.
Summary:
They needed 29 runs in the final over against Gujarat Titans in a stunning IPL 2023 match on Sunday, April 9.
However, RInku Singh, who was batting with No.
GT v KKR, IPL 2023: HighlightsHowever, Rinku Singh pulled off one of the most stunning chases in the history of IPL, hitting 5 sixes in the final over.
Rinku hit Dayal, who missed his length in a difficult final over.
"I was just trying to hit sixes.

Meta_title: Govt: By 2047, India to get 9% of its electricity from N-sources
Meta_desc: ... its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday.
Title: Govt: By 2047, India to get 9% of its electricity from N-sources
Article: India will get 9% of its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday. This will help in getting closer to the government’s commitment of achieving ‘net zero’ emission target by 2070, he added.India also committed to reaching 500GW of non-fossil electricity capacity, generating half of all energy requirements from renewables and reducing emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.After holding a review meeting with a group of senior scientists from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) in Mumbai, the minister said that the other target laid down by the Department of Atomic Energy is achieving a 20-gigawatt capacity of nuclear power generation by the year 2030, which according to him will be a major milestone placing India as the third-largest producer of atomic energy after the US and France.During 2021-22, nuclear power reactors generated 47,112 million units of electricity, that’s about 3.15% of the country’s total power generation, Singh had recently informed Lok Sabha . The present installed nuclear power capacity is set to increase from 6,780 MW to 22,480 MW by 2031 on progressive completion of projects under construction and accorded sanction, he had said.
Summary:
India will get 9% of its electricity from nuclear sources by 2047, when the country will celebrate 100 years of independence, Union minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday.
This will help in getting closer to the government’s commitment of achieving ‘net zero’ emission target by 2070, he added.India also committed to reaching 500GW of non-fossil electricity capacity, generating half of all energy requirements from renewables and reducing emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.After holding a review meeting with a group of senior scientists from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) in Mumbai, the minister said that the other target laid down by the Department of Atomic Energy is achieving a 20-gigawatt capacity of nuclear power generation by the year 2030, which according to him will be a major milestone placing India as the third-largest producer of atomic energy after the US and France.During 2021-22, nuclear power reactors generated 47,112 million units of electricity, that’s about 3.15% of the country’s total power generation, Singh had recently informed Lok Sabha .
The present installed nuclear power capacity is set to increase from 6,780 MW to 22,480 MW by 2031 on progressive completion of projects under construction and accorded sanction, he had said.

Meta_title: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri lauds TTD’s contributions to healthcare, education
Meta_desc: TIRUPATI: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) received appreciation from Union petroleum minister Hardeep Singh Puri for its contributions in the areas...
Title: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri lauds TTD’s contributions to healthcare, education
Article: TIRUPATI: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) received appreciation from Union petroleum minister Hardeep Singh Puri for its contributions in the areas of healthcare and education.On the sidelines of his two-day tour to the temple city of Tirupati, Hardeep Puri offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Tuesday morning.Later the Union minister visited Sri Padmavathi Children’s Super Specialty Hospital which was recently established by the TTD in Tirupati and lauded the temple trust for establishing a state-of-the-art hospital exclusively for the children.Hardeep Puri also visited the TTD run BIRRD hospital in Tirupati on Tuesday.
Summary: TIRUPATI: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) received appreciation from Union petroleum minister Hardeep Singh Puri for its contributions in the areas of healthcare and education.On the sidelines of his two-day tour to the temple city of Tirupati, Hardeep Puri offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Tuesday morning.Later the Union minister visited Sri Padmavathi Children’s Super Specialty Hospital which was recently established by the TTD in Tirupati and lauded the temple trust for establishing a state-of-the-art hospital exclusively for the children.Hardeep Puri also visited the TTD run BIRRD hospital in Tirupati on Tuesday.

Meta_title: We aim to make Himachal most progressive: Sukhu
Meta_desc: Shimla: Chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Sunday said his government was making efforts to bring the economy of the state back on track.
Title: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu: We Aim To Make Himachal Most Progressive: Sukhu
Article: Shimla: Chief minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Sunday said his government was making efforts to bring the economy of the state back on track.We will work on the goal to make Himachal Pradesh one of the most progressive and prosperous states of the country in the next 10 years, the CM said while addressing the Himachali population in New Delhi.He said the budget presented by his government focused on growth of all sectors, especially uplifting the rural economy. Himachal is on its way to becoming a ‘Green State’ by 2026, Sukhu added.The CM further said the state government was sincerely chalking out strategies for the speedy development of the state. He also invited Himachalis residing outside the state to visit the state in coming years to see positive and constructive changes in the state due to the visionary policies and programmes of his government. Sukhu said his government was taking various other initiatives like connecting all districts with heliports, expansion of Kangra airport, and speeding up of work on roads. We are also promoting tourism in Kangra district and coming up with many ambitious projects to attract more tourists to the area, he said.The CM also elaborated on the initiatives taken by his government to encourage use of electric vehicles and solar energy. He also highlighted the steps taken by the state government to provide a respectable life to orphan children in the state through Mukhya Mantri Sukh-Aashray Scheme.
Summary:
Himachal is on its way to becoming a ‘Green State’ by 2026, Sukhu added.The CM further said the state government was sincerely chalking out strategies for the speedy development of the state.
He also invited Himachalis residing outside the state to visit the state in coming years to see positive and constructive changes in the state due to the visionary policies and programmes of his government.
Sukhu said his government was taking various other initiatives like connecting all districts with heliports, expansion of Kangra airport, and speeding up of work on roads.
We are also promoting tourism in Kangra district and coming up with many ambitious projects to attract more tourists to the area, he said.The CM also elaborated on the initiatives taken by his government to encourage use of electric vehicles and solar energy.
He also highlighted the steps taken by the state government to provide a respectable life to orphan children in the state through Mukhya Mantri Sukh-Aashray Scheme.

Meta_title: Dares Mann to debate on law & order
Meta_desc: Dares Mann to debate on law & order ; Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police ; Yogi Adityanath receives death threat,...
Title: Mann: Dares Mann To Debate On Law & Order
Article: Jalandhar: Alleging that the mafia’s influence had inreased in Punjab, Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was released from jail last week, on Saturday asked Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to debate with him on the issue in the presence of media. He has also dared the Punjab government to take back his remaining security cover. Speaking to media at the residence of Congress candidate Karamjit Kaur, where he had come to condole the death of her husband and late MP Santokh Singh Chaudhary, Sidhu alleged that the AAP government was running the mafia. “It is clear that mafia can’t run without patronage. It has rather doubled in the last one year and is thriving in different sectors,” he said and asked the CM to sit with him for a debate in the presence of TV cameras. He also dig at AAP fielding former Congress MLA Sushil Rinku. TNN
Summary:
Jalandhar: Alleging that the mafia’s influence had inreased in Punjab, Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was released from jail last week, on Saturday asked Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann to debate with him on the issue in the presence of media.
He has also dared the Punjab government to take back his remaining security cover.
“It is clear that mafia can’t run without patronage.
It has rather doubled in the last one year and is thriving in different sectors,” he said and asked the CM to sit with him for a debate in the presence of TV cameras.
He also dig at AAP fielding former Congress MLA Sushil Rinku.

Meta_title: Congress leaders want Navjot Singh Sidhu to play a major role in Punjab politics, but others question his
Meta_desc: AMRITSAR: Noting the significance of cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu, who arrived at his Amritsar home after nearly ten months of what many...
Title: Congress leaders want Navjot Singh Sidhu to play a major role in Punjab politics, but others question his sincerity
Article: AMRITSAR: Noting the significance of cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu , who arrived at his Amritsar home after nearly ten months of what many Congressmen refer to as a "jail yatra," and the rousing welcome given to him by the Congress leaders, it is clear that he will play an important role in the Punjab Congress, especially after meeting Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi before travelling to Amritsar.Congress workers and leaders had arrived with ‘dhol’s’ to welcome Sidhu and raised high-pitched slogans upon his arrival at Golden Gate.While accepting peoples’ greetings and siropa’s Sidhu vowed that he wouldn't let anyone cause any harm to the interests of Punjab.The conspicuous absence of a few Congress leaders certainly raised a question marks on Sidhu’s acceptance among all Congress leaders of the region.Like other politicians, Sidhu, former MLA, and MP, had promised to root out corrupt practices and injustice but unfortunately, the promises remained unfulfilled and then comes a shattering blow to Congress when he was sent to jail in a road rage case.In his meeting with the Gandhis, Navjot reportedly expressed a desire to concentrate his political efforts in Punjab, according to sources in Sidhu's camp.“Using words like a mentor for Rahul, philosopher and guide for Priyanka is a classic example of Navjot’s servility to the Gandhi family as many other politicians are doing," said a political observer and analyst Dr Avtar Singh.He claimed that in the past Sidhu had failed to deliver the promises made to him and now a common man didn’t have many hopes for him.“He may be an ardent speaker but that alone is not enough,” he said.Common people long for employment, and social justice and it is natural for people to raise questions when their basic demands were not fulfilled by the politicians whom they had sent to the assembly or the parliament, Avtar Singh said.Contrary to Avtar’s observation, senior Congress leader and former MLA Sunil Dutti said Navjot Singh Sidhu had the capacity to enthuse fresh spirit among the workers and they were expecting Sidhu to play a significant role in the party.Sidhu would be paying obeisance at Golden Temple, Durgiana temple and Sri Ram Teerath on Sunday and could also hold meetings with Congress leaders to chalk out the future course of action.
Summary: AMRITSAR: Noting the significance of cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu , who arrived at his Amritsar home after nearly ten months of what many Congressmen refer to as a "jail yatra," and the rousing welcome given to him by the Congress leaders, it is clear that he will play an important role in the Punjab Congress, especially after meeting Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi unfulfilled and then comes a shattering blow to Congress when he was sent to jail in a road rage case.In his meeting with the Gandhis, Navjot reportedly expressed a desire to concentrate his political efforts in Punjab, according to sources in Sidhu's camp.“Using words like a mentor for Rahul, philosopher and guide for Priyanka is a classic example of Navjot’s servility to the Gandhi family as many other politicians are doing," said a political observer and analyst Dr Avtar Singh.He claimed that in the past Sidhu had failed to deliver the promises made to him and now a common man didn’t have many hopes for him.“He may be an ardent speaker but that alone is not enough,” he said.Common people long for employment, and social justice and it is natural for people to raise questions when their Meta_title: Male leopard run over by vehicle in Uttarakhand's US Nagar
Meta_desc: ... a leopard was killed in a hit-and-run accident on National Highway 74 near Maheshpura village of Bazpur in the district Udham Singh Nagar.
Title: Male leopard run over by vehicle in Uttarakhand's US Nagar
Article: RUDRAPUR: On Friday night, a leopard was killed in a hit-and-run accident on National Highway 74 near Maheshpura village of Bazpur in the district Udham Singh Nagar.The identity of the vehicle that struck the feline remains unknown.The forest officials were alerted to the scene and quickly took control of the situation, transporting the carcass of the leopard away from the busy highway.Range Officer of the Banna Khera forest, Laxman Mahtolia said that the big cat sustained head injuries and died on the spot."It was a male leopard around eight years old. All its body parts were intact and the carcass was cremated after the postmortem examination. Police were also notified of the incident and registered a case against the unknown driver responsible for the fatal accident", he added.
Summary:
RUDRAPUR: On Friday night, a leopard was killed in a hit-and-run accident on National Highway 74 near Maheshpura village of Bazpur in the district Udham Singh Nagar.The identity of the vehicle that struck the feline remains unknown.The forest officials were alerted to the scene and quickly took control of the situation, transporting the carcass of the leopard away from the busy highway.Range Officer of the Banna Khera forest, Laxman Mahtolia said that the big cat sustained head injuries and died on the spot.
"It was a male leopard around eight years old.
All its body parts were intact and the carcass was cremated after the postmortem examination.
Police were also notified of the incident and registered a case against the unknown driver responsible for the fatal accident", he added.

Meta_title: 36-yr-old mentally unstable woman strangled to death Ahmedabad
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Ctm: 36-yr-old Mentally Unstable Woman Strangled To Death
Article: AHMEDABAD: A 36-year-old mentally unstable woman from the Jashodanagar area of the city was found murdered near the CTM bridge on Saturday night. The post-mortem report of the deceased, Tulsi Makwana, revealed that she had been strangled to death.Tulsi’s brother Akha Bhati, who works as a plumber with a private firm in Vatva GIDC, said that she had married a man from Vasna named Chaman Makwana. However, following domestic disputes, they had not been living together for the past four years. Tulsi, who has two daughters aged 18 and 13, had been living with Bhati since moving out of her husband’s house.However, following the separation, she had been suffering from mental illness and would often leave the house and roam around, Bhati reportedly told the cops. He said that even Tulsi’s husband had been suffering from mental illness and he too roamed around.On Friday, at around 5pm, Tulsi came to her brother’s house but left in a few minutes. Since then, she had been missing and the family was unable to trace her.On Saturday night, Bhati’s cousin sent a picture of Tulsi’s body lying near the CTM bridge towards Express Highway. A travel firm owner, who had his office near Sahjanand residential society near where the body was found, called up the police. The body was sent for postmortem at Civil Hospital in Asarwa. The report suggested that she had been strangled to death, Bhati stated in the FIR.Ramol police registered a case of murder against an unidentified person and began an investigation.
Summary:
AHMEDABAD: A 36-year-old mentally unstable woman from the Jashodanagar area of the city was found murdered near the CTM bridge on Saturday night.
Since then, she had been missing and the family was unable to trace her.On Saturday night, Bhati’s cousin sent a picture of Tulsi’s body lying near the CTM bridge towards Express Highway.
A travel firm owner, who had his office near Sahjanand residential society near where the body was found, called up the police.
The body was sent for postmortem at Civil Hospital in Asarwa.
The report suggested that she had been strangled to death, Bhati stated in the FIR.Ramol police registered a case of murder against an unidentified person and began an investigation.

Meta_title: Army to clear snow-clogged Hemkund Sahib Yatra trek route
Meta_desc: Seva Singh, general manager of Gurdwara at Govindghat, informed that there is 8-12 feet of snow on the Atlakoti glacier ahead of the Sikh shrine.
Title: Army to clear snow-clogged Hemkund Sahib Yatra trek route
Article: DEHRADUN: A team of the Army will conduct a special operation to clear the snow-clogged trek route for the Hemkund Sahib pilgrimage site situated at an altitude of over 13500 feet in Chamoli.The work to clear the snow and make a trek route through the heap of snow will start on April 20, while the yatra to Hemkund Sahib, a revered Sikh shrine, will start on May 20 this year.On Sunday, the brigade commander of the Army's Joshimath unit, Brigadier Aman Anand , accompanied by other army officers, visited the Hemkund Sahib to take stock of the situation, according to the Hemkund Sahib Management Trust.Seva Singh , general manager of Gurdwara at Govindghat, informed that there is 8-12 feet of snow on the Atlakoti glacier ahead of the Sikh shrine. "The office bearers of the trust and other workers will start proceeding to Ghangaria Gurdwara from April 15 onwards for the yatra preparations. They will also hold a langar for the Army personnel," said Seva Singh.Besides, as many as 70 workers from the state's Public Works Department ( PWD ) are already working between Pulna and Ghangriya, according to the gurudwara trust.
Summary:
DEHRADUN: A team of the Army will conduct a special operation to clear the snow-clogged trek route for the Hemkund Sahib pilgrimage site situated at an altitude of over 13500 feet in Chamoli.The work to clear the snow and make a trek route through the heap of snow will start on April 20, while the yatra to Hemkund Sahib, a revered Sikh shrine, will start on May 20 this year.On Sunday, the brigade commander of the Army's Joshimath unit, Brigadier Aman Anand , accompanied by other army officers, visited the Hemkund Sahib to take stock of the situation, according to the Hemkund Sahib Management Trust.Seva Singh , general manager of Gurdwara at Govindghat, informed that there is 8-12 feet of snow on the Atlakoti glacier ahead of the Sikh shrine.
"The office bearers of the trust and other workers will start proceeding to Ghangaria Gurdwara from April 15 onwards for the yatra preparations.
They will also hold a langar for the Army personnel," said Seva Singh.Besides, as many as 70 workers from the state's Public Works Department ( PWD ) are already working between Pulna and Ghangriya, according to the gurudwara trust.

Meta_title: Congress digs up video of CM’s son praising Islam
Meta_desc: BHOPAL: While the war of words between chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and state Congress president Kamal Nath over communal unrest and Iftar rages on,...
Title: Congress: Congress Digs Up Video Of Cm’s Son Praising Islam
Article: BHOPAL: While the war of words between chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and state Congress president Kamal Nath over communal unrest and Iftar rages on, the Congress on Saturday dug out an old video of Kartikeya Chouhan – the eldest son of the CM – where the youngster says he salutes Muslims who love the nation and have sympathy for the poor.This week, Chouhan and Nath locked horns over a video of an Iftar party which was hosted in Chhindwara. A video of Nath at the gathering shows him saying, “BJP will destroy the country.” He is also seen speaking to Muslim community elders about communal unrest in parts of the country during Ram Navami.After this, the exchange of barbs between Chouhan and Nath got acrimonious. Chouhan accused Nath of instigating communal tension in the state and even called him “mad”. Nath retaliated by saying that Chouhan “as chief minister has destroyed an entire generation”.On Saturday, state Congress media cell chief KK Mishra posted a video on his Twitter handle, in which Kartikeya is seen addressing a public meeting in Sehore district.“Islam means peace, Islam means amity, Islam means love. I salute the religion that teaches peace, amity, love and humanity,” Kartikeya says in the video, adding: “What is the meaning of Muslim? It means Mussallam Imaan Vadaa, a person who believes in Khuda (God) and follows the rules. A person who loves his nation and country, who loves elders, orphans and poor. A person in whose heart there is sympathy for the poor and helpless. Kartikeya Chouhan salutes such Muslims.”Mishra tweeted, “Our worthy nephew Kartikeya Singh Chouhan has become promising. Therefore, the 64-year-old chief minister father should either sit at home or learn something from his son. There is no age for abilities, but now age has started dominating you. What happened to you?”
Summary:
Chouhan accused Nath of instigating communal tension in the state and even called him “mad”.
I salute the religion that teaches peace, amity, love and humanity,” Kartikeya says in the video, adding: “What is the meaning of Muslim?
It means Mussallam Imaan Vadaa, a person who believes in Khuda (God) and follows the rules.
Kartikeya Chouhan salutes such Muslims.”Mishra tweeted, “Our worthy nephew Kartikeya Singh Chouhan has become promising.
Therefore, the 64-year-old chief minister father should either sit at home or learn something from his son.

Meta_title: J&K Govt appoints 4 DySsP as Incharge Superintendents of ...
Meta_desc: Will register FIR today over complaints of wrestlers against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh: Delhi Police to SC. Previous Next.
Title: J&K Govt appoints 4 DySsP as Incharge Superintendents of Police
Article:
Post by RK Online Desk on Monday, April 10, 2023

The Jammu and Kashmir Government on Monday ordered the placement of four Deputy Superintendents of Police (Selection Grade) as Incharge Superintendents of Police.

According to an order issued by Additional Chief Secretary R.K Goyal, “Sanction is hereby accorded to the placement of the following Deputy Superintendents of Police (Selection Grade) as Incharge Superintendent of Police in their own pay and grade, with immediate effect: i) Sajad Ahmad Sheikh, KPS 16055, ii) Vishal Manhas, KPS 116201, iii) Vinod Kumar, KPS 116212, and iv) Ajay Sharma KPS 116202."

“The arrangement is purely on a Stop-Gap basis and shall not confer any right on the incumbents to claim preferential treatment for their promotion, as and when, the same is made, in accordance with the rules. Further, the placements shall be without prejudice to the outcome of Writ Petition(s)/O, if any, pending consideration before the Court(s)/Tribunal(s) of competent jurisdiction,” it reads.
Summary:
Post by RK Online Desk on Monday, April 10, 2023The Jammu and Kashmir Government on Monday ordered the placement of four Deputy Superintendents of Police (Selection Grade) as Incharge Superintendents of Police.
According to an order issued by Additional Chief Secretary R.K Goyal, “Sanction is hereby accorded to the placement of the following Deputy Superintendents of Police (Selection Grade) as Incharge Superintendent of Police in their own pay and grade, with immediate effect: i) Sajad Ahmad Sheikh, KPS 16055, ii) Vishal Manhas, KPS 116201, iii) Vinod Kumar, KPS 116212, and iv) Ajay Sharma KPS 116202."
“The arrangement is purely on a Stop-Gap basis and shall not confer any right on the incumbents to claim preferential treatment for their promotion, as and when, the same is made, in accordance with the rules.
Further, the placements shall be without prejudice to the outcome of Writ Petition(s)/O, if any, pending consideration before the Court(s)/Tribunal(s) of competent jurisdiction,” it reads.

Meta_title: Pandemic scare: 2 deaths reported
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Pandemic scare: 2 deaths reported
Article: Raipur: Amid the fear of rising Covid-19 cases, Chhattisgarh recorded one more Covid death in the capital city on Saturday. Earlier that day a 48-year-old man, who had been undergoing treatment for Covid at AIIMS Raipur and suffering from co-morbidities — kidney failure and diabetes, was reported dead. In view of rising cases, the state health authorities have taken steps to scale up testing across the state.An elderly woman, residing in Raipur, died on Saturday following suffered renal failure. After complaining of uneasiness, she was admitted to the AIIMS Raipur and was later tested positive for Covid, said the state epidemic controller Dr. Subhash Mishra.The patient was under observation but her health kept deteriorating. Her death was recorded under death with co-morbidities and was also fully vaccinated, he added.This was third death reported in April while the fourth in the year 2023. All the reported deaths this year have been of patients with co-morbidities.Later precautionary testing of the family was done and no one was tested positive.
Summary:
Raipur: Amid the fear of rising Covid-19 cases, Chhattisgarh recorded one more Covid death in the capital city on Saturday.
Earlier that day a 48-year-old man, who had been undergoing treatment for Covid at AIIMS Raipur and suffering from co-morbidities — kidney failure and diabetes, was reported dead.
After complaining of uneasiness, she was admitted to the AIIMS Raipur and was later tested positive for Covid, said the state epidemic controller Dr. Subhash Mishra.The patient was under observation but her health kept deteriorating.
Her death was recorded under death with co-morbidities and was also fully vaccinated, he added.This was third death reported in April while the fourth in the year 2023.
All the reported deaths this year have been of patients with co-morbidities.Later precautionary testing of the family was done and no one was tested positive.

Meta_title: Nihangs clash at morcha stir site, 1 almost loses his hand
Meta_desc: Trending Stories. Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Nihangs clash at morcha stir site, 1 almost loses his hand
Article: MOHALI: Two groups of nihangs clashed at the Quami Insaaf Morcha protest site here in the early hours of Sunday, leaving one of them with almost a severed hand.The two warring groups belonged to Baba Amna Singh. During the fight, one of them took a swipe at Zora Singh alias Babbar (29) with a sharp-edged weapon, nearly slashing his left hand that was left dangling from the skin. He was rushed to civil hospital, from where doctors referred him to PGI. On receiving information about the clash, cops reached the site.SSP Sandeep Garg said, “We have arrested the accused identified as Mela Singh . He is booked for attempt to murder. We have also registered a case against seven to eight unidentified persons. Search is on to arrest them. We have recovered the weapons used in the clash.” Police said the FIR was registered under Sections 307, 120-B, 148, 149 of the IPC. The arrested accused will be produced in the court on Monday.Police said an argument broke out between the two sides over some issue and escalated into a fight.On February 8, members of the Quami Insaaf Morcha had clashed with cops and vandalised police vehicles at the road dividing sectors 52 and 53, around 1-2km away from the original protest site at dolphin crossing where the group has camped since January 7 demanding the release of Sikh convicts languishing in jails despite completing their sentences.
Summary:
MOHALI: Two groups of nihangs clashed at the Quami Insaaf Morcha protest site here in the early hours of Sunday, leaving one of them with almost a severed hand.The two warring groups belonged to Baba Amna Singh.
During the fight, one of them took a swipe at Zora Singh alias Babbar (29) with a sharp-edged weapon, nearly slashing his left hand that was left dangling from the skin.
On receiving information about the clash, cops reached the site.SSP Sandeep Garg said, “We have arrested the accused identified as Mela Singh .
We have also registered a case against seven to eight unidentified persons.
We have recovered the weapons used in the clash.” Police said the FIR was registered under Sections 307, 120-B, 148, 149 of the IPC.

Meta_title: Woman found dead, saree around neck
Meta_desc: Why no FIR against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, Supreme Court asks Delhi police. Yogi Adityanath receives death threat, police register FIR.
Title: Woman found dead, saree around neck
Article: Mumbai: The partially decomposed body of a 25-year-old woman was found in her rented flat in Vasai on Sunday.The matter came to light when residents complained of a foul smell from a flat on the first floor. Manickpur police said the flat was rented out by a couple — Mumtaz Kazi and Mubin Kazi . The rent agreement stated they were ‘husband and wife’.The body of Mumtaz was lying on the bed, a saree wrapped around the neck, indicating that it could have been suicide. The police said they have launched a search for Mubin. TNN
Summary:
Mumbai: The partially decomposed body of a 25-year-old woman was found in her rented flat in Vasai on Sunday.The matter came to light when residents complained of a foul smell from a flat on the first floor.
Manickpur police said the flat was rented out by a couple — Mumtaz Kazi and Mubin Kazi .
The rent agreement stated they were ‘husband and wife’.The body of Mumtaz was lying on the bed, a saree wrapped around the neck, indicating that it could have been suicide.
The police said they have launched a search for Mubin.

Meta_title: Why Antim Panghal's rise should be cause of worry for ace ...
Meta_desc: ... against the Wrestling Federation of India's (WFI) President Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh accusing him and other coaches of sexual misconduct, harassment,...
Title: Why Antim Panghal’s rise should be cause of worry for ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat?
Article:
Wrestling

The 19-year-old competes in the same weight bracket as the veteran and recently won silver in the Asian Championships.

While Vinesh Phogat has established herself as one of the greatest female wrestlers from India, Antim Panghal is making waves and is perceived to have a bright future in the sport. Despite belonging to the same weight class, the two wrestlers have been working on distinctive goals lately. They are none other than three-time Commonwealth Games gold medalist Vinesh Phogat and rising star Antim Panghal.

Why has Vinesh Phogat been out of international events?

For Vinesh, the battle is not just about herself but even a much greater cause. Besides Vinesh, many Indian wrestlers including Tokyo Olympics bronze medalist Bajrang Punia, Rio Olympics medalist Sakshi Malik, and Sangeeta Phogat led the sit-in protest in Delhi’s Jantar Mantar on January 18, 2023, against the Wrestling Federation of India’s (WFI) President Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh accusing him and other coaches of sexual misconduct, harassment, and mental torture. Vinesh also stated that ‘at least 10 to 20 girls’ have encountered sexual harassment at the wrestling camps.

The protest led to the stepping down of WFI President Brij Bhushan till the issue was resolved. However, elite wrestlers like Vinesh, Bajrang, and Sakshi opted out from participating in international wrestling tournaments like the United World Wrestling (UWW) Ranking Series tournament until the Indian Sports Ministry’s Oversight Committee submitted their report regarding the case on Brij Bhushan.

Antim Panghal’s performance at the Asian Wrestling Championships 2023

However, Vinesh Phogat withdrawing her name from the international wrestling events implied that it was the perfect opportunity for Antim Panghal to become a standout performer in the women’s 53kg event. Antim exactly did so in the absence of her experienced compatriot.

She capitalized on all the chances with her fine performance in the National selection trials conducted under the supervision of the Oversight Committee at the Indira Gandhi Arena. She, thus, booked herself a spot in the Asian Wrestling Championships 2023.

At the Asian Wrestling Championships 2023, the 19-year-old Antim lived up to the expectations by advancing to the finals of the women’s 53kg. On her way to the final, she overcame the challenges from Aktenge Keunimjaeva in the semi-final, Li Deng in the quarter-final, and Alvina Lim during the qualifications. In the final, she faced a stiff challenge from Akari Fujinami, the reigning World champion, and eventually lost by 0-10 to end up with the silver medal.

Indian Sports Live Coverage on Khel Now

Vinesh Phogat vs Antim Panghal

Considering Antim’s rise in the sport in such a short span of time, there is no doubt that the women’s 53kg will be an anticipated clash in the coming times, especially at the national level. It is interesting to note that in the matchups held between Antim and Vinesh Phogat, the latter defeated the youngster on two occasions. During the selection trials for Commonwealth Games 2022, the two wrestlers locked horns. Although Antim was leading by 3-0 initially, Vinesh used her experience to turn the tables in her favour.

The next time the two wrestlers met at the National Selection Trials 2022 with the women’s 53kg slot up for grabs for the World Wrestling Championships 2022. Unlike last time, Vinesh was the stronger opponent right from the start as she defeated Antim 7-0 by blocking all of her attacks and striking on the counter. This came just two weeks after Antim had scripted history for India becoming the first-ever U-20 world champion.

Will Antim’s rise in the sport affect Vinesh Phogat’s chances?

Although Vinesh emerged as the better opponent in their previous encounters, Antim has shown tremendous potential in a very short period. This silver medal victory at the Asian Wrestling Championships 2023 will surely add up to her confidence. If Vinesh continues to miss out on the selection trials, Antim will be rewarded with experience through her participation at international events against some top-level wrestlers of the world.

The three-time Commonwealth Games champion Vinesh might also miss the opportunity to represent India at prestigious events like Asian Games 2022 if the Sports Ministry decides to send athletes based on their latest performance and records. As a result, she might lose out on a chance to defend her Asian Games title as she was the gold medalist in the Asian Games 2018 held in Jakarta, Indonesia.

For more updates, follow Khel Now on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and join our community on Telegram.
Summary:
They are none other than three-time Commonwealth Games gold medalist Vinesh Phogat and rising star Antim Panghal.
Why has Vinesh Phogat been out of international events?
It is interesting to note that in the matchups held between Antim and Vinesh Phogat, the latter defeated the youngster on two occasions.
This silver medal victory at the Asian Wrestling Championships 2023 will surely add up to her confidence.
As a result, she might lose out on a chance to defend her Asian Games title as she was the gold medalist in the Asian Games 2018 held in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Title: “ED said Sisodia destroyed his phones while five of them are in agency’s custody,” claims AAP
Article:
“ED said Sisodia destroyed his phones while five of them are in agency’s custody,” claims AAP

New Delhi, Apr 14 (UNI) Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday claimed that the Enforcement Directorate said that former Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia destroyed his phones while five of them are in ED's custody. The party alleged that the whole matter was fabricated.



Addressing a press conference here, AAP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh alleged “The false allegations fabricated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against Sisodia and revealed that the 14 phones that the ED had alleged were destroyed by Sisodia, were still active, with five of them in the ED’s custody itself.”
Summary:
“ED said Sisodia destroyed his phones while five of them are in agency’s custody,” claims AAPNew Delhi, Apr 14 (UNI) Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday claimed that the Enforcement Directorate said that former Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia destroyed his phones while five of them are in ED's custody.
The party alleged that the whole matter was fabricated.
Addressing a press conference here, AAP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh alleged “The false allegations fabricated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against Sisodia and revealed that the 14 phones that the ED had alleged were destroyed by Sisodia, were still active, with five of them in the ED’s custody itself.”
